title: Did You Feed The Cat?
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Now The Cat Doesn't Go Hungry!", 'author': 'Gudegude17', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We needed a way to tell if someone had fed the family cat or not. We put this on our refrigerator by her food supply, and now, with the flick of the switch, we can tell if she's been fed or not. While our cat may not like it, as she no longer gets an extra meal, it's perfect and so easy to use that we're very happy with how simple it is. My husband got a similar one that helps him keep track of whether he took his daily medication or not. Great product!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great reminder', 'author': 'Richard B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My child takes a certain medicine twice a day. This is plastic with a metal look.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cute, useful, a little janky', 'author': 'Joseph Shell', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Overall, worth it for the money. Buy your own adhesive strips, must be thicker than the ones provided to account for extruded magnets. Don't expect it to be huge, about adult hand-sized.It's a good value, fairly durable, and a nice thing to have in the home! Has some problems, though.The little switches aren't consistent, some of them are hard to move, and you will need to hold it in place, others slide effortlessly.The adhesives don't work, they are too thin to stick to the wall with the magnets protruding, but that can be solved buying your own adhesive strips that are thicker. I used Velcro for added thickness to ensure it would hold well.There are no holes for hanging with nails/screws, it's adhesives, magnets or bust.It holds together well. It dropped several times when I was still trying to get the adhesive to work, and didn't break. It was falling into carpet but the fall was like 5.5 feet.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use', 'author': 'RS', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works fine just now need to remember to set it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's proven its worth in under a week", 'author': 'Bado', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My wife and I are constantly asking each other if we fed the dog already. We could ask the dog, but he would lie and say no and trick us into another bowl full of food.I saw this device on Amazon and decided to buy it. It\'s already been fantastic and we\'ve only been using it for about 5 days.It has a nice magnet that sticks and holds to our stainless refrigerator. It does stick to the sides of the fridge too, but it\'s not as strong there and it does slide. It holds in place when we\'re sliding the daily AM/PM toggles.The toggles slide nicely. They don\'t lock into place but usually hold pretty steady. Sometimes they do glide with a little too much ease, meaning you could accidentally move one out of position, but that hasn\'t proven to be a concern.Overall, it was cheap enough, it\'s useful, and as long as you\'re using it, it will be one less thing you have to worry about.Special note: don\'t let your dog learn how to manipulate the toggles or they could try to play the "Hey I haven\'t been fed yet!" card', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 2, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So simple but helpful!', 'author': 'Great brand', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This thing is great. Definitely recommend', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Low quality build', 'author': 'Sung Hsu', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The switches are non-uniform. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Game. Changer.', 'author': 'Jess', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Price point: excellentQuality: seems goodEase of programming: I figured it out pretty quicklyCat: fed on an actual scheduleI will say I fully disassembled it to wash it when I first got it. I was feeding 3 tablespoons at 8am and 3 tablespoons at 8pm. As Iâ€™ve said, these times werenâ€™t rigid and it left my cat irritable and hangry. I have programmed this for 4 small meals (2am- 1 tablespoon, 8am- 2 tablespoons, 2pm- 1 tablespoon, 8pm- 2 tablespoons), feeding him the same amount but evenly spaced out over the course of 24hrs. I started with 2 meals at the same times I was manually feeding him, (3 portions at both 8am and 8pm) but I noticed 12hrs in between meals led to hanger and bad behavior. I think 4 meals is the max amount you can program. 1 portion on this machine is 1 tablespoon and I have not gone over 3 portions but it does go higher (I think at least up to 4). Also super affordable with digital coupons.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Buy this!', 'author': 'Sharon', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Our cat JarJar was taken to a vet as we thought she may have gigantism or a tape or something going on medically with how she screamed at us for food (even after a special prescription food) the official vet diagnosis we got was "she just likes to eat". Which ment she was very mean when she did not eat or when she thought we where withholding food from her.This feeder has made her no longer associate us with food or the lack of getting food if we deny her. Being able to program 4 feedings spread out her meals even when we are not home to keep her happy while we are at work and make her think she is getting more food throughout the day even though her daily food intake is the same.After 2 years of trying to work on getting her to not bite, tear things up, scratch us, or be rude we finally have a sweet loving cat that purrs and cuddles and plays. Its awesome shes awesome and all we needed to do was make her associate the feeder with food and not us.Its been a few months and even our clinically diagnosed food obsessed cat hasnt been able to break into the food stored in the auto feeder and is happy and sweet. Zero complaints on this product does exactly what you need and holds plenty of food.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Would have rated 5 stars except for unreliable "low battery" indicator', 'author': 'DoItURSelf', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This feeder works quite well for the size of my dog's kibble, which is probably on the larger end of the feeder's capacity. The clock keeps excellent time so the food gets delivered exactly on schedule, and portion size is consistent. My only concern is that I am using this solely on battery power and it appears that the low battery indicator light doesn't function as intended. I also suspect that the icon showing battery level is not reliable either. I concluded this because I inadvertently installed a couple of dead batteries in the first set of 3 D batteries. The display screen didn't illuminate until I plugged in the unit using the power cable. The low battery indicator light was not on, and the battery icon showed 2 bars. Even with no batteries installed, the low battery light wasn't lit and the battery icon showed 2 bars. After testing the batteries and finding the dead ones, I installed better batteries. The unit has been operating perfectly on those batteries for nearly 3 weeks, and I'm happy with its performance. But, when these batteries finally die, I might not get any advance warning. That's OK if I'm feeding the dog while I'm around the house, but it would be unfortunate if I was gone all day and the batteries failed with no warning (I never leave the dog at home if gone overnight, but for people who might have a pet sitter come visit, that could be critical if the pet sitter didn't realize no food was being dispensed for more than a day. Of course, plugging into the wall would solve that issue for longer unattended periods).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Automatic Cat Feeder, Cat Food Dispenser Battery-Operated with 180-Day Battery Life, AIR Timed Pet Feeder for Cat & Dog, 2L Auto Cat Feeder
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Compact & Easy To Use Automatic Feeder', 'author': 'J. Fancher', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We had two larger feeders, one of which was a two-bowl feeder that we used with a brother & sister bonded pair while they were young. As they got older, they grew to dislike eating right next to each other (the sister is a bit of an aggressive eater), so we needed to get a new feeder for her. We tried one of these out, and loved it so much we bought two more.They're very compact in size, but fairly stable. They're also much better at stopping our aggressive eater from trying to sneak food, as with the old ones she could paw up the shoot and get some kibble to drop out. These feeders do not keep food in every chamber (every other, 3 out of 6 chambers) so she can't get food to drop down in between feedings.They were very easy to clean and set up. We are trying them with batteries to test the longevity (the description claims up to 180 days), because it's nice that we can move them if needed during company or set them up in locations without needing an outlet.The price is awesome, and these feeders are a perfect solution for us. I highly recommend giving these a try. If longevity on battery life ends up being a problem, they still come with a proper USB Cable & Block for operation plugged in without batteries. One thing the instructions don't clearly state is if batteries are installed while it's plugged in via the USB if the batteries are only used as backup...I wish that was outlined in the directions as it just describes each individual method of powering the unit. Overall, though, you can't beat the product at this price range. Our other feeders were $80 and $120 each and these are much better quality and easier to use.Update: After 1 month of use, the only con I have with these feeders is their time software is extremely off. Three times I have reset the Clocks on all three units, right next to each other on the counter, and they initially go off exactly at the the same time. After a week or so, they're all off by almost a minute, going off 30-60 seconds out of sync. I wouldn't reduce my initial rating, and the issue doesn't even matter if you only have one unit.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good and simple to use auto feeder', 'author': 'DSea123', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Makes feeding your cat easy while away and associates meal time with the auto feeder rather than you yourselfâ€¦ my cat can be very demanding now I just tell him to go take it up with the feeder. lots of customizable options for feeding times and portion sizes. You can use it with the USB C cord or three D batteries I bought this thinking it had a rechargeable battery but that was actually a different model that was more expensive. Oh well, I donâ€™t mind using the batteries because they supposedly will last in this auto feeder for six months. It holds approximately 10 days of food for my cat before needing to be refilled. But the refill is easy to do and there is a LED indicator when food is running low.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works pretty good with limitations', 'author': 'J. Peshek', 'rating': 4, 'content': "So I didn't have too hard a time setting it up and getting it working, but it's not very intuitive to change the time on the clock. Reason I mention it is, you'll be doing that twice a year because it doesn't recognize DST. That being said, the schedule is easy to do, works reliably well, and even the pesky raccoons can't break into it. They've tried! So yes, I have this outside under a table on my deck so the local momma cat and her kittens have a reliable source of food - they live under my deck. So after some trial and error we figured out how much to give so that no food was left out at night. Well, the raccoons weren't having it, and they could smell the residue I guess. The couldn't open the cannister, so they stole the metal bowl and plastic bowl base! Couldn't find them anywhere. Sent an email to Petlibro and they sent us a link to where we could buy replacements, which was $8 each and free shipping. The nice thing about the bowl that came with it is that it hooks to the base, so cats can't get it loose. Raccoons are a different story I guess. Battery life is good, it's been about 2 1/2 months since I set it up and I haven't had to replace them yet. Overall very happy with the product, and customer service was very responsive.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars A Cat's Best Friend", 'author': 'Lori', 'rating': 5, 'content': "As easy as cat feeding gets. A bit finicky to set up, but once mastered is simple to adjust both feeding amounts and times which can be as often as six times a day and for different amounts at each feeding. We've used other feeders costing more and this one is just as good, quieter and more compact. Loading the feeder from the top is quick and a load lasts for a couple of weeks for our single kitty. It signals when the feed is low, but we've not encountered that feature yet. I think it works for must ordinary kibbles and there is also an alarm if it gets stuck since a rotating turntable delivers the grub, but ours has worked flawlessly for about six months. Dry food only. I've not seen a unit which can deliver wet food for more than a day, so if your kitty gets wet food as well, you're going to need a good neighbor to step in. This, combined with an automatic waterer makes our pet-feeding chores a breeze. It's secure, too and will not easily tip. It also holds the shallow stainless steel bowl securely. Cleaning is easy, too.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Unit with Responsive, thorough Customer Service!', 'author': 'J. Sullivan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Purchased on the advice of my daughter who had one for her cat and said it worked fine when they went on vacation for a few days. Tricky at first to program for only 4 feedings and decide if portion sizes were correct but my cat LOVED it! She would position herself in front and watch the bowl just before it dispensed or run from another room when she heard it go off. Worked perfectly for 7 months, but a few weeks ago, my cat seemed to be hungry more often, going to the cabinet where her food is. I looked at her feeder and although the display showed everything as being correct, it did not dispense food at the time it should have, and neither would it dispense when I pressed the manual button! I unplugged the feeder, took batteries out, emptied it and checked the rotor inside but could not get the feeding tray to move or be removed! I tried several ways to take it apart, following the manual instructions but finally had to email PetLibro Customer Support directly. Although the Amazon window for return had ended 4 months ago, the manual guaranteed trouble free operation for one year and true to their word, Pet Libro was quickly responsive to my emails, reuqested that I not only describe the problem but send a video of trying to operate it, did sent clear videos back about how to remove the tray. Unfortunately, even with all the help, I could not move the tray out to clean it and remove whatever particles had built up under the rubber rotor over time. THANK YOU so very much to Goolil, PetLibro's very kind and understanding customer support engineer, who agreed after much troubleshooting and arranged a new replacement unit which I received within 3-4 days! It is operating flawlessly nowand I feel confident that my cat will be safely and reliably fed when I need to travel. The battery back-up DOES operate to continue the feeding times even if the power goes off too. I truly am grateful for this well-designed device and most especially for the responsive, goodwill customer support. PetLibro cares and honors its commitment to quality!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars If you're looking for automation, look no further!", 'author': 'Dodge', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Litter box cleaning, water bowl filling, and proper food serving are all joys of having a pet cat. I'm a firm believer in technology and its ability to assist in everyday chores. I have a self cleaning litterbox, a self filling water fountain, and thanks to PETLIBRO, a self serving food dispenser. If you're looking for automation, look no further! Over the past month my cat has been able to not only eat consistent portions of meals, but also done so at a regularly scheduled timeframe that I have decided.Delivery: Overall the packaging was minimal yet arrived securely. Cleanup was fast as there was only a few protective plastics to throw away. The box was mid-sized, not weighing very much.Setup: Following the instruction booklet is easy. If you prefer a visual aid, you also can watch a how-to on YouTube! Serving sizes are calculated correctly, allowing any number of combinations you desire to feed your pet cat. Do you prefer they eat three times a day? No worries! Five? Say less. Six times but with less food per serving? You can do it! The options are endless. I use Purina pro plan for kittens which is a smaller size kibble. I was afraid the size would cause a problem with the portions this device uses, but luckily it was able to change effortlessly to an increment I desired for my pet.Features: I truly enjoy the ability to have the choice between a wireless or wired system. Having the option is great as some outlets are not conveniently located near my current food dish. The battery pack allows for a very long power duration. I am always scared about power outages at home while I am away for vacations. With the ability to go battery powered vs plug-in, it enables a backup incase the power does shutoff. I also enjoy the protective cover for the menu options. My cat loves to swat anything she sees, and having the protective cover prevents her from changing any settings I have put in place.Complaints: Overall I can't complain about much. I do know competitors offer a voice feature that allows you to use a speak a pre-recorded clip when it's time to dispense the next meal. Though this is missing, the added food dish is metal, allowing any kibble being dispensed to make a small but noticeable clanking noise when dropped. My cat has had no issues hearing her next meal being dispensed, but if it becomes a problem in the future, I will update.Final thoughts: The PETLIBRO Automatic cat feeder has been an exceptional addition to my home, allowing a simple and effective way to plan, portion, and produce timely meals for my lovely fur baby. I will continue to use this version for the next year and if all goes well, I might upgrade to the APP enabled device next!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Obsessed', 'author': 'Klaudia M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Best Amazon purchase Iâ€™ve made in a while. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Purr-fectly Amazing Smart Feeding Solution for Pets', 'author': 'jose garcia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I recently purchased the Smart Automatic Cat Feeder, and it has truly exceeded my expectations in every way. Not only does it make feeding time a breeze, but its versatility for small dogs like my Yorkie has made it an indispensable part of our daily routine.Let\'s start with the primary function â€“ dispensing pet food. I feed them at 6:00 AM and 6:00 PM. The manual has a portion guide in it to help you get started as well as the device has a manual feed if you want to do that. The food hopper is really okay for the size, and the safety straps work.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Awesome feeder! Does have some problems, though.', 'author': 'Tiana', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this feeder at the end of January because I was about to leave for a week-long trip but couldn't find a pet sitter every day so short notice for my cat. The feeder worked really well for what I needed, my boy didn't starve and I was able to keep him on his normal schedule with the normal ringtone I use to indicate when it's feeding time and it's very easy to program, clean, and open up to put more food in.BUT, I did come across a few issues with this feeder. First off, the clock on it is ever so slightly off. I bought this feeder January 27th and have used it every day to feed my boy, but my girl gets fed out of a normal bowl. He's the only one who stays behind when I go places because she gets 2x daily meds and therefore someone HAS to watch her every single day, so it just didn't make sense to buy one for her yet. If I wasn't constantly adjusting the time, it would be off by 10 minutes from what the time actually is. So, when my alarm on my phone goes off to feed my girl, my boy is running around confused on why his feeder isn't going off/why he's having to wait to eat a full minute or so after her. I would not of gotten this feeder just for this issue, quite frankly, because now I know this feeder will never be in sync with a second feeder unless I bought this exact feeder again.Second issue, THE TOP DOES NOT STAY ON WELL! title: WiFi Automatic Cat Feeders, Programmable Timed Cat Feeder, Cat Dry Food Dispenser, 4L pet Feeder with 1-10 Meals, Automatic Dog Feeder, Dual Power Supply, APP Control, 10s Voice Recorder
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works perfectly', 'author': 'Janelly', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this because my cat use to wake me up at 2am for her middle of the night meal, i wanted to be able to sleep all night without interruptions so i purchased this and have slept full nights ever since! This feeder has so far been everything I was looking for when I needed to replace my old one.- very quiet when dispensing food, loudest sound was the food hitting the bowl. I measured it out & for the food I use, 4 portions is a quarter cup. You can choose up to 12 portions per meal, & 4 meals per day, so I canâ€™t imagine it not being enough.- setting everything up was very straightforward & didnâ€™t take much to figure out. It does come with a little manual in several languages. The only thing I struggled with was getting it to do an unscheduled/manual feeding, but I think youâ€™re supposed to just press & let go of the +/- buttons & I was pressing & holding. Seems to be working fine once I figured that out.- you can choose the time of every feeding, it doesnâ€™t simply divide the day by number of feedings.Minor cons that donâ€™t really affect my overall happiness with the product:- food storage container is a bit small, it holds maybe a quarter or a third of my 15 lb. bag of food. It should still last a while, so Iâ€™m not concerned about having to refill it that often, but for reference, I am feeding just 1 medium sized cat.- the food bowl doesnâ€™t really attach securely to the feeder, it hooks in place but if you lift the feeder at all, it unhooks. I wish it would latch or clip in more securely, but I like that it does completely detach for cleaning, so Iâ€™ll take the trade off.- the LED panel is not at an angle, so you either have to tilt the feeder or get on eye level to see it. I wish the panel were tilted up so I could just see it when looking down at it, but I donâ€™t think this will be a regular annoyance since I will mostly just set it & forget it.I saw a couple reviewers saying their feeder broke down quickly, but so far it seems pretty well made & sturdy, so Iâ€™m hoping that it will last a long time & it does come with a 2 year warranty according to the manual. title: Automatic Cat Feeders - 8cup/68oz Cat Food Dispenser Easy to Use, Timed Automatic Pet Feeder with Over 180-day Battery Life, 1-6 Meals Dry Food Programmable Portion Control Also for Dogs
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Little Feeder - Easy to Use & Nice Features!', 'author': 'Hopeh1122', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got this feeder because sometimes I don\'t make it home at lunch and I want my pup to have lunch. Okay so I have three cats that all need their own specific portions: 2 female kitties that could binge until they pop and a grazer male that has learned how to make the best of a feeding schedule.My kitties are conditioned to eat in separate areas of the house at 6 am and 6pm more or less. I was specifically looking for: affordable, consistent portion control, something that can stand up to two very determined kitties and simplicity.PROS:You have the option to set up to 6 meals per day.Portion size works as follows: 1 portion is about 1/8 cup â€” this was consistent for the 10 times I tried it and will update if that changes.It deposits the food fairly timely..It is rather quiet, not a whole lot of whirring and noise, my cats were completely unbothered but mine think anything that gives them food is well worth any risk.Itâ€™s easy to set up. Love it. Love it. (Black autofeeder, no camera)', 'author': 'MrFreePress', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Read great review first then come back here.Immediate 5 star if seller can tell me how to turn off the device touch screen entirely because by day 3 my dog figured out how to unlock the feeder and then feed herself.REVIEW: Just what I needed. my 10mo old pup was having digestive issues and I wanted a way to refine her feeding schedule and amounts. More feedings in restricted smaller amounts haved helped her overcome daily purging. (ick) I\'ve never owned an automatic feeder and I bought this PetLibro version because it allows up to 10 scheduled feedings a day and all 7 days may be customized individually, though I only use the copy day feature at this time to make all days the same. What I find very valuable is that each scheduled feeding may be sized from 0-4cups of kibble(food) in 1/12 increments, so 48 different feeding sizes that I measured to be very accurate cup for cup. Understand the physics of it though because smaller the kibble(size of dry food) the more accurate the measurements. If you want to know exactly how much kibble is dispensed then (clean and dry all pieces that come in contact with food first), assemble dry parts, fill container, dispense 2-3 full cups first to ensure the internal air pockets are removed to ensure accurate measurements, then dispense and measure each of the levels from 1/12th to 12/12ths and compare it to your normal feeding size. KNOW THIS - medium to large kibble won\'t function well in this feeder. I intend to continue using the small kibble Purina Puppy Chow and I feel good about the feeder\'s size precision. At $70 the price is right as I didn\'t feel the need to spend more to add a camera to the feeder. Install and use of the mobile app was very easy and straightforward. I like option to record my own voice that plays prior to each feeding. What\'s cool is that everyone in my family may record a "Come Eat" audio and you can manually change which ones plays anytime you want from within the app. Oh, and the app may be installed on multiple phones so that everyone in the family can keep track of feedings and alerts. I did learn that the app\'s auto find of device from phone only works AFTER plugging in the PetLibro feeder. I installed the 3 \'D\' size batteries first and lights appear as does minimal functionality however Bluetooth signal is off until the device is also plugged in. Some reviews reported that they couldn\'t connect phone to feeder however I believe this was their issue. The batteries are designed for back up only when loss of power occurs - the device turns off wifi and BT to conserve energy to ensure dog gets fed. The food container holds 5 days of food for my 50# Labradoodle and the device has indicator light and an app push notification to indicate time for food refill. Food container looks to have a good tight seal to keep food fresh. Careful though, I melted one in a microwave once.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Customer Service!', 'author': 'Sandy Shore', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This feeder and its App were easy to set up. Now that function works perfectly.Although the food has always been delivered at the scheduled times and amounts, the "Feeding Successful" phone notifications are sometimes delayed. Again the Customer Service/tech help has been extremely helpful and persistent solving the issue. It is so refreshing and unusual to find such good service these days!After using the Granary for 6 weeks, I feel confident in its ability to deliver food as needed. I love that the food bowl is stainless steel. My 2 cats ate together from the previous food bowl I was using. This Granary bowl is smaller so they usually take turns. With too much water, it is too likely to become stale and accumulate germs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Much better than a fountain', 'author': 'Crazy Schnauzer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was a bit aprehensive at first because I didn't know how easy it would be to clean. There's always something floating in the bowl that was either dirt or dog food at one point and those things tend to make the water yucky. Yes dogs sniff each others butts and worse which is more the reason they should have a clean source of water. I also want the best for them because they bring me happiness and love during times when I need it the most so things like having a clean water bowl seem to be the least I can do for them. The bowl itself feels good in the hand. Not too heavy, not too light. It also comes equipped with some very functional non-skid pads on the bottom to prevent the bowl from sloshing about while in use. The resevoir can hold one gallon and is made from the same material the five gallon jugs use. The cap has a spring loaded stopper that dispenses water when it's depressed which only happens once it's fastened to the bowl. Once it's released it stops the water from flowing out even when upside down. The jug fits snugly and has two stubs on each side that line up with an opening on the ring so when it's mounted, the jug slides gently into place and locks with a small twist. The channel between the bowl and where the water flows from is narrow to keep the water from pouring into the bowl and making a mess. I can carry the whole thing, with water, from the hallway to the kitchen sink, and not spill a drop. This thing is so easy to clean, it's child's play. The fountains on the other hand, it could take me a good thirty minutes to clean a fountain and I'd still find slimy spots. They're way too much maintenance for what they're designed to do and this takes me less than five.The bowl is large enough for both dogs to drink from and they drink more water now. I've purchased a lot of pet stuff over the years and a lot of it has been a waste of money because it was either too cheaply made or didn't function the way it should've. I'm happy to say that this is not one of those purchases. In fact, I've replaced all my water bowls with these. Wish I would've known about these sooner.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect, but...', 'author': 'Shannel', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The water one works great. Once I angled it as in the photo, seems to have solved the problem (other than the cats now find more fun in making a mess). ðŸ˜†', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely love it!', 'author': 'Jennifer Reyes', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love it so small water jug it's about a gallon it's well first of all it's cute! The size is perfect it gives them enough water for the day cuz I don't like leaving water in there for a couple days it's gross they should have fresh water everyday but it's perfect to fill up in the morning and then have enough for the entire day and I have three dogs overall absolutely love it or recommend it five stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Great video and notifications', 'author': 'S. Tong', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I had a dumb auto feeder for my cat, and this, by far, is superior in every way to that.First - you can set up the feed times and quantity via your smart phone, not having to pick it up and squint at it in order to set time and feeding schedules.Secondly - there is a removeable bowl that can be easily cleaned (my previous one had a plastic bowl that needed to be jiggled loose from the feeder in order to clean it), so it\'s very easy to clean the bowl.Thirdly - I love knowing that my cat has eaten and because I\'ve set up the feeder next to the water dish and the auto litter robot, I can see if she\'s eating, drinking or using the litter box.Fourth - I love being able to hit a button on my phone and have food delivered! Since my cat eats 4x per day, and I only auto-feed 2x, sometimes I\'ll forget to feed her until I\'m sitting down, and it\'s really convenient to hit a button to feed her.There are a couple of things that could be improved upon:1) The instructions to put in the SD/TF card are a little hard to understand - but it\'s under the hopper and above the feed wheel.2) The video records continuously, so you may need to re-format the card frequently. Some of my other security cameras only record when motion is detected (and maybe a minute on either side of the motion), so a 30 GB card will last a long time. My card is roughly 1/3 used after 4 days. That being said, there were stills of motion images before I even inserted an SD card, so there must be some sort of memory of some sort.3) The top of the food hopper twists off to open or close, but it\'s hard to see which direction is open or closed, so I wrote "open" on the cover.4) The app to watch video was not very intuitive. It will take some playing around with the navigation to figure out how to watch video or cue up motion detector shorts rather than watching a continuous stream of video.Overall - this is another outstanding product from this company. Their customer service is second to none, and if you have a cat or small dog, you can\'t go wrong with this auto feeder. Buy it!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Peace of Mind for My Cats and Me', 'author': 'Beth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have had this feeder for about 2 weeks now, and so far it has worked great!The manual includes a QR code with a link to a video. I recommend watching the video and reading the manual closely.It was easy to set up WiFi with the Smart Life app, schedule feedings, record my voice, and use the app to feed spontaneously.Another great featureâ€¦If you set motion detection, it will capture a screenshot so you can see if your cat ate.My cat's kibble is fairly small. The portion size was about 1.75 tablespoons and weighed about 13.5 grams.The feeder includes a desiccant packet that should be replaced regularly, but I couldn't find any instructions on what size packet or how often to replace it.I was excited to see in the manual an offer to receive a free additional accessory as a token of their appreciation! It only took about a week to receive the additional feeder!I had a few minor issues with figuring out how to insert and use a memory card (hence the recommendation to watch the video!), but not enough to reduce a star.Now I can have peace of mind knowing my cats are fed if I'm not home, and I think my cats have more peace of mind knowing they will be fed at regularly scheduled times.Overall, a great feeder with above average customer service! title: Automatic Cat Food Dispenser for Two Cats 5L Auto Cat Feeder Dry Food Dispenser with Splitter & 2 Stainless Bowls, 10s Meal Call and Timer Setting 50 Portions 6 Meals Per Day for Cat and Dog
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better than I was expecting', 'author': 'bonnielassie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have used this product now for almost 2 months. In the beginning, I was paranoid that my babies would not be fed appropriately or that they would not know the food was in the bowl. It has fed flawlessly. Setup was much easier than I expected with the only issue being that you have to go all the way through it if you miss something. It is not that big of a deal though and once you set it, it is fairly easy to change it. My only issue with portion control is I feel like 3 portions is a bit too much and 2 portions is not quite enough. My solution is to do my morning feeding with 3 portions and my night feeding with 2 portions. This seems to weigh it out effectively. I like that you can tell if it is on battery power or electricity and you can tell how much battery is left with just a glance. The splitter is great. You do need to follow the instructions to tilt it just a little to one side to get equal distributions but it is just a tiny tilt. So far, my cats have not broken into it nor have they figured out how to make it auto dispense. The lid is very snug and even if they knocked it over, I don\'t think it would spill. The time delay on the settings button is good because the cats do not know how to hold the button. I have no issues with the cats not hearing it as it makes a decent amount of noise falling into the metal bowls. The cats anticipate it\'s food time and if they don\'t happen to be waiting on the food to fall they hear it and go flying to the feeder before I even hear it hit the bowl. They can hear the faint whirring as it starts to spin to drop the food. Overall, I am extremely pleased and feel a lot more comfortable about knowing they will get to eat (at least their dry food) even if I am late getting home or if I would need to be away overnight. It works well with Hills Rx CD food.One side note.... they were scared of it at first but within a week, they were fine. Give your pet a little time to acclimate before you give up. My boys are "fraidy cats" for sure but they adjusted fine.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I wanted', 'author': 'trout bum kenny', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This feeder is exactly what I was looking for when I was looking to buy an auto feeder. It evenly dispenses food, itâ€™s well constructed, it has an app for feeding, tracking, etc. Also one thing I really like about this feeder is how much food can be stored in it. It makes feeding time really simple. Itâ€™s also well made and fairly well thought out. For example the food hopper on top has a slot in the lid for desiccant packets to keep the food dry and fresh. The bowls are removable for cleaning. And there is an adjustable tab at the dispenser that allows you to adjust how much food goes into each bowl. We use 50/50 but you could do like 60/40 if you have a cat on a diet or something. Iâ€™d say for the price considering all the features it has, and how easy it is to use, itâ€™s well worth it, especially if you have multiple cats. (There is also a single cat feeder made by PETLIBRO)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good Info to have if considering this. Pros & Cons', 'author': 'JM', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a great feeder, but there are a few things I\'ve come across that I want to share.FOOD: TYPE: Doesn\'t work well with meow mix or special shaped/larger cat food. Works best with food like science diet, costco brand - smaller, round bits PORTION: Not consistent. One serving sometimes only throws out a few bits, and barely anything if using Meow Mix (hence comment above). This isn\'t necessarily a deal breaker because you can simply program it to dispense more. "One Serving" for my cat is actually 3 with this feeder. BLOCKAGE: No Issues with blockage.POWER: It plugs in and takes D batteries for a backup power supply. Our power has gone out several times and my settings are saved even without batteries.CAPACITY: It holds A LOT of food. One fill lasts me a couple of weeks with 2 cats.EASE-OF-USE: Extremely easy to program. You can also quickly unlock it by holding down the lock icon, and quickly change any or bypass the schedule and feed now.FINAL THOUGHTS: I Love this, but I recently bought the wifi model, which I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! The extra money it costs is nothing compared to the additional features and peace of mind it offers. For one, you can control it through the App 100%. It notifies you when the food is low, or if there\'s a blockage or any issue at all. If you\'re on vacation, you can monitor it from wherever to make sure it\'s working and that your cat is getting fed. I\'ve found the App to be extremely accurate. I use it to feed a stray cat outside since she runs away if I come near. With this, I can tap a button on my phone when I see her and the food automatically dispenses. I had it sitting outside in cold below-zero temperatures and it worked great. Every night a pack of raccoons try to break into it, but they haven\'t succeeded yet. The only thing they\'re able to do to it is to detach the front tray, which easily slips back on. Raccoons can usually tear anything up if there\'s food inside, but they haven\'t been able to do any damage to this, which says a lot!!! Granted, I\'m talking about the wifi model, but it\'s made the same as this one.You will not be disappointed with this brand! If you can afford it, upgrade to the one with wifi and app. It\'s worth it!!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Clean and expedient', 'author': 'Leila A.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The machine works perfectly. Beautiful in white. Takes a little time to program, but is not hard.This model doesn't come with Wifi for mobile app. From what I read of the other model it didn't seem to me it offered the functionality to set the mealtimes from an app, so I did not care for that.This model's instructions don't say what it considers to be a portion size. I imagine it depends on the kibble size you're using, but it could give an approximation for small or bigger size because, after all, it's marketed for cats and there isn't much difference in kibble size as for dogs. So, I waited for it to dispense a portion to see if it was enough or how many portions to program for one meal or at a set time. For my two cats I programmed two portions for their early morning first meal of the day and for late afternoon because one portion has very few kibbles. I used to measure with a cup their meals, so I expected some kind of reference.After setting the meals and watching what my cats usually eat and expect, I now see that I have to program again to add another portion for one of the meals, but I was lazy at first and just gave them a manual feed until I have the time to do the programming again.I recorded my voice to call on the cats in a normal speaking level, which they don't seem to understand if they are in the same living room, but it gets their attention. They don't hear it from farther out, but I don't want to bother the next-door apartment with a louder call. It's the sound of the kibbles dropping to the metal dish that make them go to it, naturally. The best thing is that I don't have to get up at 5 a.m. to feed them and don't have to be harassed by them until I did. They are the sweetest most well-behaved cats, but turn into hooligans if you don't feed them at 5 a.m.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I love the 21st Century!', 'author': 'Big Mike', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very easy to set up, very easy to program, very easy to walk away and not have to worry about feeding cats on a routine every day.After reading other reviews, here are my observations.The portion size is not adjustable, but there\'s a very easy and obvious fix. It\'s not going to come out at the size that *you* personally may prefer, however, you can set it such that each time it dispenses it sends out 1, 2 or 5 or 50 (or higher) portions, so you get exactly the amount you feel is right, right on schedule. The trick is to take a minute before you set it out and hit the portion button with food in the hopper. Note how much there is then keep count while hitting the button until you see as much food as you wish in both bowls. Mine is set to dispense 5 portions which perfectly satisfies my speedy fuzz cats at both scheduled feeding times.There is a small gate that you place in between the bowls. You do not set it perfectly straight to get even amounts, rather, you skew to the right. The reason is that this dispenses from a wheel type mechanism that has a bias to fill more on the right than left, simple physics. Setting the pointer so that when you\'re looking at it there is about a 1/5th bias towards the right hand side, will open up the dispensing so that more comes in on the left and less comes in on the right. It took exactly ten seconds to figure this out. Just a bit of trial and error and you should be set.The programming isn\'t intuitive at first, but follow the manual instructions and it works out fine. I do not have to think about what to press to get desired results any longer. The term we used to use back in the day is RTFM (read the "fine" manual), which turns out is great advice.The battery backup is sweet because it seems like the cats might "accidentally" pull the cord out if they\'re feeling inclined, or frisky, or just want to cause trouble. It uses 3 x C batteries, so come prepared for that as it doesn\'t ship with batteries in the box.All in all I love the feeder so far, and recommend it (again, so far). Between this, the roomba, my Worx robotic lawn mower and an incoming pet water dispenser, I\'m living the life of a proper 21st century gentleman.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 15, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works well, everyone is happier', 'author': 'KRG', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to set up. Our two cats were out of control begging for food, because someone else in the house would feed them whenever they asked. They were eating way too much, yelling at us all day and night for food, and it became quite unpleasant. I decided to try this automatic feeder because it can portion out a very small amount more frequently. This suited our situation well. The cats stopped yelling at us all the time because we are no longer part of the food equation. They had no problem whatsoever with the transition and figured it out immediately. It wasnâ€™t nearly as easy for the person who was feeding them all the timeâ€¦ I love this thing and would get it again in a heartbeat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Five design flaws that you should know before buying', 'author': 'Alex P', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I purchased this dual feeder to replace one from another brand that broke after a few years of service. These are the design flaws I discovered with this product:1. The steel bowls fit so tightly into the bowl frame you can't readily remove them from the top for cleaning.To remove bowls, you take out the tiny divider gate piece, and disconnect the bowl frame from the feeder. Then you can take the bowl frame to the sink to flip the bowls out.That could be fixed by drilling a hole in the bottom of the bowl frame. Then you can poke the bowl out from below with your finger without having to disassemble everything.2. You can't use your own bowls, and no food chute-drop.Better designed dual feeders have chutes that drop food down into the bowl. This lets you substitute your bowls. This feeder is flush-mounted, no chute-drop. You're forced to use their bowls as nothing else will fit the bowl frame.A side-effect of this flush-mount design is that there is a seam between bowl and frame that catches crumbs. The chute-drop design does not have this seam.I was hoping for a third-party dual feeder chute attachment that would let you use your own bowls, but could not find it.3. I don't get that little gate divider piece design.A minor point, but what is with this so-called feature that lets you divert more food to the right bowl vs the left (but not more food to the left bowl). Who actually wants this? <1%? This is bad design suggested by the product engineer not a result from customer feedback.Just simplify design, assembly, and instructions by making it 50-50.4. The food hopper is a narrow vertical design.With a vertical design versus horizontal, the mouth of the hopper is smaller. That makes it much more challenging to fill the hopper, especially with a large, heavy bag of food.A better design is the horizontal hopper.5. The hopper window is too narrow to see food level at a glance.When the inside the hopper is dark and you have dark cat food, it's hard to see what's going on without closer inspection. I was actually looking for a way to get a small dim LED into the hopper to compensate.They should enlarge the window. maybe make it the same width the the food exit opening.Ultimately the bowl issues were too much for me, and I moved on to something else, ipettie dual. It has none of these design issues, but we'll see if there are others. *iPettie had other issues and I moved on to PetSafe Smart Feed for the win.-----*2023-07 update: customer support reached out to me and let me know feedback was received, so I added one star back in for excellent customer service.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works well overall, but the low food warning is useless', 'author': 'Modest Moose', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Works well and easy to schedule and set up several feedings and the weird little moveable arm to help control the food split between bowls works surprisingly well. Butâ€¦ the low food warning is useless. Low food warning means no food. This is absolutely useless. Low food should go off when itâ€™s about 15-20% left notâ€¦ the next feed wonâ€™t work.You have to be on top of it or youâ€™ll get to â€œlowâ€ food and find out the last two feeds never went off even though itâ€™ll also say â€œfeed successfulâ€ even though nothing came outâ€¦ what?', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very capable cat feeder', 'author': 'P. Jardieu', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I purchased this PETLIBO cat feeder to replace one from a different manufacturer. The old one failed to feed when the plastic fins on the plastic rotor all broke off. I attempted to order a replacement rotor, the only part that I could find listed for that model feeder anywhere on the internet. The manufacturer was offshore and provided no contact information whatsoever. The replacement rotor didnâ€™t fit my machine so I returned it and started my search for a different / better machine.That original feeder served me pretty well for about 2 years of continuous outdoor service in a protected location shielded from direct rain and snow. The old one had a capacity of 7 litters, but the PETLIBO is only 5 or 5-1/2 litters. As a result of this difference, I have to refill it every 5 days instead of every 7 for the old one. I wished that it held more, but that wasnâ€™t a deal breaker for me.PETLIBO - PLEASE CONSIDER OFFERING A TALLER, HIGHER CAPACITY FOOD RESERVOIR OPTION TO FIT THIS MACHINE.My old one wasnâ€™t WiFi enabled but the PETLIBO is. The app loaded easily on my iPhone and it works surprisingly well. I didnâ€™t think that Iâ€™d use that feature all that much, but as it turns out after a few months in use, I do.The PETLIBO is intended for indoor use only but Iâ€™m feeding a large colony of feral cats so indoors wasnâ€™t an option. The feeder sits exactly where my original one did, under a picnic table with an impervious top to protect it against the rain we get here in suburban Baltimore. I have it sitting on a perforated rubber pad placed on the wooden deck below the table. The rubber pad keeps it slightly elevated so that any water on the deck wonâ€™t be able to infiltrate the bottom of the feeder.I never used the AC power cord on my original feeder, opting to run that one off the 4 batteries installed as a backup power source. Without the WiFi capability, a set of batteries in that feeder surprisingly lasted between 6 and 7 months. I initially set up this PETLIBO without plugging it in to AC power as well, but WiFi use sucked down a new set of batteries over a weekâ€™s time. AC power is really needed for this bad boy, so I plugged it in.Raccoons? Yep. We got â€˜em. I had inserted the old feeder into a wire mesh cage and then bungeed the assembly to the legs of my picnic table so they couldnâ€™t tip it over, or get to the top to break into the goodies inside it. That worked perfectly.Iâ€™m using that same wire cage and bungee anchor system with the PETLIBO, but I took the top off of the wire cage so I could easily reach in and unscrew (1/4 turn) the top on the feeder to refill it. I liked this arrangement better, since I had to unbungee the old feeder/cage assembly and remove it from under the table in order for me to open the feeder for refilling. Unfortunately the damned raccoons were smart enough to quickly figure out how to unscrew the top of the PETLIBO and rob me blind! Now I put the top back on the wire cage to stop that from happening any longer. It takes me another minute to remove that wire cage top so that I can unscrew the top of the feeder, but again, I can live with that.The PETLIBO passes a larger size kibble than anything else I could find. For 2 years i had been slightly exceeding the largest kibble size permitted by the other manufacturer, I believe that was the primary reason why the plastic rotor fins broke off. The Purina Kit & Kaboodle feed that our colony really prefers didnâ€™t feed well in that machine but the PETLIBO handles it perfectly.Itâ€™s very easy to program feeding schedules from the app. Is VERY flexible and can handle any schedule that I would ever need. Itâ€™s also very easy to change a feeding time or portion size and then change it back again tomorrow. It has a forced manual feed function where you select the portion size and then push â€œFeedâ€. Done. Instant gratification.The feeder sends â€œblocked outletâ€ messages when the feed doesnâ€™t discharge into the 2 bowls completely. One reviewer complained about all these error messages and I would have to agree that they can be a pain. Better to know than not to know in my opinion. At our house, the raccoons usually take care of any evening plugging issues.You have the option of recording a verbal message to play when feeding and even how many times you want that message to play. The old feeder REQUIRED you to enter a voice message, even if you spoke not a word. Some people that failed to do this thought their feeder was faulty and sent them back. No such problem with the PETLIBO.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Had since 7-16-22 now it is 1-19-24', 'author': 'Carly', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I love this it has made things much easier and a lot less 4 am wake up calls from our cats and no more double feedings when my cats trick me or my husband into feeding them again. My few complaints on this is the little window in the front to show levels can be rather hard to see to the point we don't use it and just open the top to see how full they are. the second complain I have is the time you set it for has a bad habit of delaying to the point the clock will read 6 pm but the clock on the cat feeders over time will read like 8 pm we have reset the times multiple times and tried to sync them together better but always seem to be different times even set at the same exact time and therefore doesn't follow the time very well and throws our cats off", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Automatic Cat Feeder, Automatic Cat Food Dispenser with Timer Interactive Voice Recorder, Auto Cat Feeder with 1-4 Meals Control Dry Food
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great', 'author': 'Lacy Rose Lackey', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It dispenses the right amount of food at the right time - helps make sure our kitty is getting the right amount of food everyday! It's relatively quiet (I did not set a voice recording), but our cat runs to the food dish when he hears the kibble falling into the dish. Good design, it looks good, relatively easy to program and use, and is working great so far. The only thing is that I wish it had more like 6-8 meals, instead of just the 4. But we feed him wet food twice a day (7 am and 5 pm) so it does a pretty good job of keeping him fed in between (we do 2 portions each at 10 am, 2 pm, and 8 pm, then 3 portions at 11 pm, for just under 1/2 cup of kibble per day). You can also manually feed pretty easily if you want with a couple buttons (you need to unlock the screen first, which is nice, since I don't worry about our cat messing up the programming). Has batteries and a plug in so I don't need to worry about the power going out. Holds quite a bit of food so feel like it will last a while. So far very happy with it!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Look no further', 'author': 'CourtneyP', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This auto feeder is great. It\'s admittedly the only one I\'ve owned but it\'s met the mark every time. It\'s reliable, looks sleek, and my cat loves it. It\'s really that simple. It works, it\'s reliable, easy to clean, easy to program, easy to load food into. I also love the quick portion button when I know kitty needs extra food.Sometimes I wish I\'d splurged for the model that has the app but after doing some research, I didn\'t feel like it was worth it for me. Programming truly is not hard, but I don\'t think it\'s necessarily intuitive. An app would make it easier to quickly switch things up when our plans change for a day. I just didn\'t like that you couldn\'t use the app when away from home. My other "would be nice" is if the kibble size was marginally bigger. We have to use Hills Science Rx dry food and the size is RIGHT on the marker for the max size. I\'m always worried the food is going to get jammed or that the portions are going to be inconsistent. When we used PrettyPlease food (from PrettyLitter) it was perfect. My only other complaint is that the button on the lid seems to be in the midst of breaking. It constantly pops out of place. My kitty knows what\'s inside, but I\'ve never seen him mess with the feeder so I think it\'s just a faulty piece.All that aside, I still love this feeder and have zero regrets buying it. I\'ve recommended it to quite a few family members. It\'s such a nice addition to our home and routine.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars I wanted to keep this but it didn't dump out enough food for my dog.", 'author': 'Bugle M Ranch', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I wanted to keep this but it didn't dump out enough food for my dog. I liked it, it was similar to a Volusa brand I bought for my cat. The problem is I had to use all 4 servings to get 2 cups of food to my dog.He is a 90lb Golden retriever and right now he gets 1 cup in the morning and 1 cup in evening. That's his diet portions. Once gets to his ideal weight I will need to up his portion some and I have this machine maxed out already. It is set to give him 2 meals in the morning, the max 9 portions, and two in the evening, max 9 portions.So I can't increase his portions in the future. If my dog were smaller and ate less food I would keep this.I bought the 6Liter size and that was enough for about 8-9 days of food (2 cups per day). It was large enough for our weeklong vacations. I use these so i don't have to rely on the neighbors, all they have to do is let him out 2-3 times a day.It was easy to program. Just remember when testing and setting the portion finger button, it is only giving 1 portion, my dog's meals were 9 portions. For testing purposes you can set the clock to go off while you are sitting there and watch it dump all the morning's food. Like I said my portions were set for 9 and it kicked out about 1/2 cup, so then I used Meal 2 about 1 minute later to give the other 1/2 cup. Then Meal3 and 4 for the evening meal.Good product, was reliable, easy to program, just doesn't dump out enough food for my dog.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Great feeder. Please read if your cat food don't come out", 'author': 'Siyu Bu', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Short answer: this feeder works great and does NOT clog cat food.Ok. Originally I rated this feeder a one star. I was dumb as in blaming the feeder's fault on clogging food. For people have similar issues: simply push down the feeder plate a bit so that it is at the same level with the outlet where the food comes out. When it is not fit well, it is taller than the bottom of the outlet causing the clog. So push the plate down and connect it tightly (which is easy and takes minimal effort).The product is very reliable in all other aspects. Great quality, great appearance, and great function. Setting the feeding time is very easy and with the main container filled, it will last for almost months (for my cat). (with the machine being connected to power source). Dispenses food timely and accurately, with preset amount. The meal call option is really cute. Cat likes it. It is a great product with reasonable price (definitely worth it) and I would definitely recommend it to anyone else.--------------------------------Below is my original review, oh how embarrassing------------------------------------The kibbles got stuck in the outlet - 50% of the time I need to use my hand to unclog. This is very disappointing and defeats the purpose of its existence, which is to automatically feed the cat when I'm traveling out for several days. Unreliable product. I will add a picture showing the clogging issue when I get time.To be fair, the other features (like setting the feeding time and portions) are pretty nice/well made. Also it is made of good material so you don't need to worry about your cat eating chemicals diffused into its food. The voice call feature is pretty sweet as well. But I have to say that because of the clogging issue, this product is not a functional product despite its price. I was thinking to return it because it's been only 10 days since it came, however I already put a lot of cat food in and don't want to go through the trouble. Be cautious when buying!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 27, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Convenient', 'author': 'thistastesliketurtles', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So far Iâ€™m happy with this auto feeder. I got it for my 3 month old Pomeranian. Sheâ€™s food motivated and is eating a lot and everything lol So itâ€™s important for me to know how much food sheâ€™s eating daily so that she doesnâ€™t develop a weight problem. I think that this is the perfect size for her. It holds an entire small bag of Royal Canin Xsmall puppy kibble. She ate from it with no hesitation. Just like the matching waterer I bought from PETLIBRO, this feeder is also very easy to clean and seems pretty hygienic. I feel like these were well thought out, all except for the cord. The cord feeds out of the bottom right just like the waterer. The waterer offers a little cubby hole in the bottom to store the extra length in the cord and the feeder does not. Cords annoy me so this is a small issue, but nothing that I canâ€™t work around. I also decided not to use the provided power block and opted to use a usb wall outlet because it just looks neater. I couldnâ€™t get the Bluetooth initial set up to work so after some frustration, I just used the app setup and that was easy enough. The app is easy to use and self explanatory so I was able to schedule feeding with no hiccups. I havenâ€™t setup any voice recording first because I hate the sound of my own voice but second, I worry that it will creep my puppy out. Maybe I will later when sheâ€™s less skittish of new noises. I see that some people have issues with their pets pushing over the unit to get food out. Iâ€™m not sure if they had an older model; the model I have has 2 latches on the top that click lock. They donâ€™t seem bullet proof but look like they could withstand being knocked over and not opening. My spunky pup hasnâ€™t tried that yet, but Iâ€™ll make sure to update my review if she does. I love that they had a matching waterer. I have these in my kitchen and itâ€™s important to me to have it match the rest of my kitchen appliances. I love that it looks modern and isnâ€™t covered in cutesy clip art of dog foot prints and obnoxious rainbow colors.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent buy for the price.', 'author': 'C', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Does itâ€™s job, easy setup and programming, super reliable so far, affordable, definitely worth the purchase!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars awesome product. so happy i bought one', 'author': 'Rob -/\\~ Collister', 'rating': 5, 'content': "i was skeptical at first purchasing this item for my cat but to my surprise it has been fantastic. the quality of the materials used to make this feeder are much better then i expected. The feeder is very easy to program with a variety of times being feed a day as well as portion sizes when it is dispensing food. The dispenser's mechanics are very quiet with really the only noise it makes is from the food hitting the bowl which my cat now knows and always comes running when she hears it, but this dispenser was quite enough for us to keep it in are bedroom for a bit of time with no disturbance to are sleep. After owning this product for i believe over a year now it has never jammed once and is very reliable for feeding. This item worked great for us when feeding a young cat while we went on vacation that had problem with portion control and would eat as much as possible from her bowl. it worked out so well it has become her main food bowl. I would defiantly recommend this product to any pet owner with a smaller dog or cat or someone looking for a great gift for a pet owner", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Easier to get up and feed the cat!', 'author': 'LAFM', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'The Pet Libro feeder looks sleek, boasts a stainless food try, and assures you that you can feed your cat while you\'re away. All of that SOUNDS good, but the truth of the matter is that this feeder is more trouble than it\'s worth, and could, potentially, be harmful to your cat. If you are already using 5G, forget about it, as the app does not work with 5G. I am not using 5G, so you\'d think I would be home-free, right? Nope.First of all, MAJOR design flaw: the push button to enable you to manually give an extra feeding is precisely at cat\'s-paw reach. My smarty-cat turned this contraption into a self-serve machine, doling out extra treats whenever this piggy-cat felt he deserved a little bit moreâ€”apparently he sees himself as VERY deserving. I looked up the manual on the Pet Libro website and there were ZERO instructions on how to disable this feature. So...I finally manually disabled it (removed the batteries) and was treated like a parcourse every morning in Pickles\' effort to get me out of bed to feed him (wasted dollar signs danced through my foggy brain as I slogged to the kitchen to do my master\'s bidding). After three days of THAT nonsense, I found out how to disable the feeder from the Amazon listing (only proving, once again, why I am NOT an Amazon hater). In reinserting the batteries, I also figured out the app my tech-savvy son-in-law had set up for me just TWO weeks ago when I inherited his beloved Pickles (my daughter is HIGHLY allergic to himâ€”the cat, not my son-in-law). Pickles is also MY beloved boy, but I would prefer the cat feeder stave off Pickles\' impression of an incessant alarm clock with no snooze button and sharp claws.Pickles was quite unhappy that the button he had mastered no longer worked like an all-you-can-eat smorgasbord. I, of course, was like the proverbial cat who had swallowed the canary in that I had successfully outsmarted the cat. He DID manage to dislodge the food trayâ€”first, the stainless insert, and then in his frustration and fury, he disengaged the white plastic tray COMPLETELY from the food canister. Another design flaw is that the lid just sits on top of the canister. I learned this the HARD way when I removed the batteries and kibble went flying all over the kitchen counter. Pickles thought Heaven was showering kibble from above and was gleefully scarfing it up until I scooped everything back into the canister. Once he started body-slamming the now-functioningâ€”but cat-disabled canisterâ€”in his effort to get the kibble to fall, I had visions of kibble all over the floor, so I put packing tape over the topâ€”which mars it\'s sleek lines (yet another, useless "feature").Today, the app said there was NO wifi connectionâ€”and the feeder DID NOT give Pickles his lunch this afternoonâ€”in spite of the fact that human, cat, phone, and wifi have not been separated in nearly a week. What use is a feeder if you can\'t depend on it to actually FEED THE CAT? I followed all of the steps to "reconnect," and I kept getting a message that cautioned me to be near the feeder. After my efforts at aiming my phone in front of the feeder whilst on the floor, didn\'t work, I placed it on the counterâ€”still nothing. Finally, I fed the poor cat with his new puzzle feeder that I bought him for treats to engage his very active and inquisitive kitty brainâ€”and slow down his proclivity for inhaling his food.It is now an hour and half after he was SUPPOSED to be fed and nothing has dropped. Thankfully, I was right beside my beloved boy and was able to stave off starvation (tongue-in-cheek). However, if you are buying this feeder to ensure your cat is being fed while you are at work or playâ€”or even out-of-town for a day or two, FORGET IT! I call kitty abuse (and wasted dollars)! Pet Libro should be ashamed of selling a product with a poorly-designed app, faulty connectivity, and so many design flaws that it could actually be harmful to your lovable fur-ball, either through OVER-feeding or not feeding AT ALL. If I can\'t reprogram the unit unless I am standing in front of itâ€”and not even thenâ€”what good is this thing for? SAVE YOUR BABY and your money. Keep shopping!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 21, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for Muliple Cats and Multiple Feeders', 'author': 'PetiteFrog', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Unfortunately we have become experts on automatic, timed pet feeders. Like most of us who the made the choice of an automatic feeder, we wanted to remove ourselves from the food situation. We have three kitties and two of them are relentless when it comes to food. As soon as we step into the kitchen, BAMM - there they were.For years we used the PetSafe automatic, timed feeders - one for each kitty. The problem with the feeders in which you set the time, some clocks run faster than others and so the food drops are not in sync. One feeder could drop 15 secs before the others. No matter how many times I adjusted the clocks, I could not get the feeders to sync. Now this wouldnâ€™t be a big deal - except our piggy Purple kitty would inhale as much food he could when the first feeder would drop food and then go to the next one that dropped food. So we really, really wanted a feeders that dropped food at the same time.The other problem with the PetSafe feeders was the design - mainly all the edges. Our kitties were able to chomp down on the edges to move the feeders in such a way that it would drop food stored in the conveyor. Once our Blue kitty was able to figure that out - he would not leave it alone. So between the timing issues and Blue not leaving the feeders alone - we eventually had no choice but to put our 3 $100+ feeders away. Meaning - we were back in the feeding process of our kitties.To save our sanity, we decided to review the automatic, timed WiFi feeders and compared this one with the PetSafe WiFi feeder. There is about $80 difference between the two. The PetSafe one does have several features the Petlibro one doesnâ€™t - Alexa enabled, certain smartphone notifications, amazon dash replenishment - but these were things that didnâ€™t justify us paying $80 more. So we ordered three of these feeders.The feeders were delivered timely. A+ on the packaging of these feeders. We downloaded the APP and set up of the feeders was a breeze. I do agree with some other reviewers who say that the APP is not 100% intuitive - most likely because the Smart Life APP is not specifically for this feeder but for all the Smart devices in your home. The feeders were immediately found - we did not have to make any changes to our WiFi speed. Entered the PW for one feeder and then the other two appeared. In order for both of us to program, we had to set up a â€œHomeâ€ account. Next, we created a â€œGroupâ€ for all the feeders so you only have to make changes to the Group - instead of each feeder separately. It is like a waterfall when they drop at the same time! Music to my ears!Also, because of the sleek design, Blue cannot chomp his teeth into the feeder or move it. This has been a battle - perhaps I finally won???Purple kitty steals Blueâ€™s food; Blue swipes GGâ€™s. So we still have to â€œbabysitâ€ when they eat. But at least we know that they will be fed while we are out. The Meal Log is a nice tool - plus, we plan to install an ARLO in the kitchen when we are away for few days - just to make sure.Some issues:*** Although programmed, one day the 12:00 pm meal did not drop for one of our feeders. This happened before we created a GROUP - so hopefully this wonâ€™t happen again.*** APP is not intuitive and User Manual does not explain all the features that APP provides. For example, we just figured out that the numbers above the FEED button represent the number of portions you want to drop when you manually FEED. Before figuring this out, we were hitting the FEED button and nothing would happen.UPDATE: 5.24.21 - 1) So Blue has been able to get the top off the feeders so we have had to use blue painters tape to keep them secured. Blue = 2; human = 0.And for some reason, the schedule under the Group kitty feeders has disappeared twice. I think they would still drop food because the feeding schedule for each individuals feeder was still there. Who do you contact about this? The APP (Smart Life) or the Petlibro? I do hope Petlibro will develop their own APP and not rely on this 3rd party app.7.6.21 - UPDATE - So far so good. The only thing I truly recommend is watching the meal log if you are going to be out for a few days. We were away for a 36 hours and one of feeders did not go off as scheduled. We could manually feed, but it would not drop as programmed. And I do recommend putting a camera where the feeder(s) are so you can monitor.Also, GROUP schedule kept disappearing, but the individual schedules are still present. We kept the GROUP so we could manually feed all at once. I did contact the company about the disappearing GROUP schedule and was advised to reset the feeders. This is not a feeder issue; it is an APP issue. So needless to say, we were not impressed with the response.I am no longer having to wake up to feed the kitties in the AM and they have stopped ambushing us every time we walk into the kitchen. Still pleased with the purchase!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 18, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Make sure you put batteries in.', 'author': 'Kathryn Bittner', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this product. My cat loves this product. A feeder doesn't need all the bells and whistles. It does exactly what it should. Feeds my overweight cat in smaller portions through the day so his metabolism keeps working. Easy to program, love that you can record your voice. Food has been ummies to my cat his whole life and when he hears it's ummy time he about leaves his skin behind he moves so fast. He did pull the cord out of the wall one day, though, and missed at least one feeding. So make sure you utilize the backup battery feature. Also measure the portions using a measuring cup before you set them up because it's recommended feeding portions are more than the actual cup size matched to.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]
