title: Automatic Cat Feeders for 2 Cats - 6L Cat Food Dispenser with Double Bowls, Programmable Timed Cat Feeder up to 6 Meals per Day with 10S Voice Recorder, Support Dual Power Supply
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Feeding time made easy.', 'author': 'FYI', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'TL/DR: 4.5/5 Great unit for keeping your petâ€™s feeding time(s) on schedule when you are home or away. I would recommend it to a friend.Since I canâ€™t give half stars, I am rounding this MolyPet automatic pet feeder up to 5/5 stars because if it fits your needs, I think it is a solid option. Please note that even though I am listing several cons, they are relatively minor issues and are being stated just so people are aware before making their decision to purchase. The pros far outweigh the cons and that is reflected in my overall ranking.Here are some of my initial pros and cons:First the cons:1/ Ease of Use - The buttons are a bit difficult to see/read as the contrast isnâ€™t very high. The time in the middle is lit up via LED and it would have been nice for the 4 buttons on the sides to use the same background lighting as well. It is difficult enough to see which button in a well lit room, impossible to see at all in the dark. That said, once this feeder is set-up, you donâ€™t really need to touch things again until the time changes.2/ Ease of Use - Power switch is on the bottom of the feeder unit. This makes it difficult to turn it off (like when you are traveling with your pet) for a period of time. The instructions say to keep the unit upright at all times and to lift lift with two hands by the base. Therefore, if you need either a third hand or be able to feel around the bottom to find the power switch while supporting the base at the same time. It is easy enough to do if you have the feeder easily accessible, but I would have preferred this switch to be on the back of the unit instead of underneath.3/ Batteries - The instructions say specifically not to use rechargeable batteries. That is unfortunate as I hate to use and toss away batteries.4/ Batteries - Although it seems like you can use the feeder using just batteries, the instructions recommend using batteries only as a backup (if/when the power goes out). I am not sure how long the batteries will last if only using them as your power source, but not everyone has a place to plug in the feeder where they feed their pet(s) and this could be the only option.5/ Color - White seems to be the only color option available. I would like to see more color options - at least a black option. I am not sure how clean and bright this product will be after some time. I would guess, based off of other white products i have owned in the past, that at some point it will yellow and start looking a bit dingy.6/ Color - Cable is black while to unit is white. Not that big a deal, but sometimes it is nice that they match.Now the Pros:1/ Ease of Use - The lid is super secure! I have tried other types of feeders, and this is one of the most secure ones i have tried. Animals will not be able to get into the food bin once secured and you will easily know if it is locked or not. I canâ€™t say the same for other brands.2/ Ease of Use - It is easy to see how full the food storage area is. When using other brands, I have run out of food without realizing it. At some point my pets are crying because they are hungry and I havenâ€™t figure it out yet. With this bin, it is super easy to see when the food levels are low so that they never run out.3/ Small Detail - Love that the cable is using a standard cable connection (USB-C). Itâ€™s a small thing but it means that if the cable breaks or stops working I am confident i can find a suitable replacement easily. It also means I can swap out the cable for a longer or shorter plug if I wanted.4/ Configuration Options - really more than I need. Probably more than you need as well. Pretty standard across similar brands with somewhat identical interfaces and settings. If you have used a similar automatic pet feeder before you will probably recognize it. If you have never used one before it is pretty easy to use once you read the manual and understand what the letters stand for (e.g. SF = Slow Feed = time between individual feedings IF you set the feeding portions to be more than one. This help slow down a fast eating pet, by delaying before deploying the next portion. The number of feeding parts per feeding is set using the F = Feed Portion = Number of portions to output each feeding with each portion being 1/10 of a cup)5/ Capacity - Food bin holds 4L6/ Ease of Use - Communicates errors though you will need the manual to figure out what they mean (E-1 = the food outlet is blocked, E-2 = abnormal feeding, check for foreign or large objects)7/ Configuration Options - You can add an audio cue to let you pets know it is feeding time though the feeder noise is loud enough that my pets are well aware when the feeder is active and often come running if they are not staring out it waiting already.8/ Cleaning - Bowl can be removed easily to wash. Food storage bin can also come apart to clean.9/ Storage - Everything (bowl, bowl holder, plug, and manual) fits nicely in food bin when packing or storing unit when not in use.10/ Freshness - Lid includes filter to keep things fresh', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars works great for dog food', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "bought this product for supplemental dog food dispenser. My dog needs to eat several small meals through the day and night, so this is working out great. I use this to dispense the dry food, while I still manually feed the canned food for his AM and PM meal. I've had it for just over a month now, and it has not jammed or missed a feeding. Our kibble is about 1/2 diameter. It's easy to clean, lids locks on very secure, and holds a good amount of food. I like the transparent white so I can see when it's getting empty. I found it a bit challenging at first to set up the program, but after working with it for a little while I figured it out. When setting it up, the '1st' feeding is not necessarily the first of the day; it's the first one beginning with the time of day you are setting it up. So for example, for me the 1st meal to schedule was his mid-afternoon snack since I was setting it up after lunch. I absolutely love that I could set it up with different controlled portions for each feeding, and it allows for up to 6 meals/snacks per day. It also has slow feed control so there can be a pause between the food that is dispensed each meal which will slow down a pet that eats too fast. My dog does not need that feature now, but when he was younger I sure could have used it. This is a great product.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Inconsistent distribution', 'author': 'Jim', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The controls are a bit complex and the amount distributed is super inconsistent. Each bowl often gets a different amount.Otherwise, it does the job and is very convenient to have in a double cat household.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love this Product', 'author': 'Patti Brashears', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have never used an automatic feeder before, so I was a little skeptical; but this product is great. It's well built and easy to use. My cats love it, especially the recorded message option I used to call them when it was time to eat. They have figured out the schedule and are waiting when time gets close.It's a life saver since we travel a lot and makes it so easy for those checking on our fur babies to manage. It has also helped one of our cats lose some weight since we don't leave the old gravity fed feeder with food out all the time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good product to feed cats when you are not home.', 'author': 'R. halford', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have had no problems with unit. I am able to fill and have cats fed and help reduce their food intake. Easy to clean. Seems to work well. Instruction pretty clear. I wish all instructions were larger typeface.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Uneven Food Distribution', 'author': 'Hannah G', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The distribution of food on either side is uneven. It stopped working one time due to food being stuck which was a pretty easy fix. Food distribution seemed even in the beginning but not anymore.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is exactly what I needed', 'author': 'Hannah McGrath', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this for my 2 cats before I went on vacation for a few days for my cats. I tested it out about 2 days ahead of time to make sure there weren't any issues and it worked flawlessly. I will say the setup was just a little bit tricky so definitely have the instructions handy. However once it's programmed, it does its own thing. I like that I can set different portions and have multiple feeding times throughout the day. The only thing I wish it had is the ability to be controlled from an app that tracks successful feedings. So that when im out of town, I know its doing what it should. I have another feeder with that feature and its nice for piece of mind.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use and reliable', 'author': 'angela.piatt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a great product! It is so easy to program with our 3 cat household. We have this one for the 2 kittens that are siblings and a single feeder for the older cat. The cats donâ€™t bother us to feed them, they now are waiting patiently on the feeder and itâ€™s glorious! We could adjust it if we needed to while we were gone during the day longer or overnight - itâ€™s really easy to change the settings and the slow feeder function is good for our over-eaters! Highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not quite 6 litres. Display panel off when plugged in.', 'author': 'Tunie C.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I bought this to feed my three outdoor cats while I was away for a week.When I returned home, I found it convenient to continue using it but I noticed that the display panel was not lit up. The directions are confusing, but there is a good video on YouTube that had me programing like a pro in just a few tries. I filled it with food and manually dropped the food several times with the different portion size feedings that you can program, to see how much food was dropped with each feeding. You can program 1 thru 6. I decided to program feeding size 6, 4 times a day. I used it for a week before I left to make sure it worked well. It did, right on time. I normally use a random size scoop to feed my cats. It is the blue scoop out of an oxy clean tub. I programed the feeder to drop four scoops a day. # 6 was one blue scoop. As I filled the feeder. I counted that it held 35 scoops. When I returned home there was a bit of food left that got dropped the next day in 2 feedings. The math says 4 scoops times 7 days=28 plus 2 more = 30. So, it fed 5 extra scoops over the week. The food was small so maybe more came out sometimes. OK. Today I decided to measure what 35 of my scoops actually equal. One litre is 8 scoops. Meaning the feeder does not hold 6 litres. It should have held 48 of my scoops. It holds a bit over 4 litres. I wish I would have measured it when before I returned it. All the above has nothing to do with why I returned it. When I returned from my trip. I noticed the display lights were out. I checked the wires and they were OK. If I tapped the unit, sometimes the lights would come on.When I unplugged it, the lights came on and stayed on. I have batteries in it. I read the directions again and it says that the lights should go out while running on the batteries. It is to save the battery power to last longer. You can push any button to turn them on.The lights should be on all the time when it is plugged in. Basically my electronics worked the opposite of what they should have. That's why tapping the front of it sometimes turned the lights on. I hit a button. That's why I returned it. I have found that when one part of an electric panel is faulty, eventually something else goes wrong. Also, there is no off/ on switch. With the battery back up, you would need to remove the batteries to turn it off which requires disassembly. But none of the cat feeders have an off switch that I have seen. The lid locks nicely. No chance of it falling off if the unit tips. I did not program the voice, but by the time I returned after a week, the cats could hear the motor engage and were there and waiting before the food fell. The food never got stuck and it always came out on time. I wish the display electronics had worked properly because everything else worked well for the month that I had it.Overall it is a nice unit.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I wished the directions were simpler to understand. title: WOPET 6L Automatic Cat Feeder, WiFi Automatic Dog Feeder with APP Control for Remote Feeding, Automatic Cat Food Dispenser with Low Food Sensor and Voice Recorder, Up to 15 Meals Per Day(White)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stopped working after 3 months!!! I really liked this feeder until this happened', 'author': 'Sam Merrill', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I had a previous version from Wopet that worked great for over 4 years, so when it died, I went to this one. Fast forward 3 months and I realize I have 4 days of alerts saying the feeder is jammed and realize my dog hasn't been getting his food. I can't seem to find out how to contact support other than going through Amazon, and the return window ended last week :( I liked this feeder enough that I have ordered another one to hopefully have a better experience and see if I can get more than 3 months. Great feeder overall", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great, easy to use, auto feeder for my kitty!', 'author': 'Amelia Rose', 'rating': 5, 'content': "UPDATE: Five months in and I wanted to give a quick update that I am still in love with this product. I have had no issues at all and couldn't recommend a better auto-feeder. The bowl clicks right out of the front for easy cleaning too. Stop searching and just buy it!ORIGINAL: My kitty previously had a bowl that allowed her to graze. Sheâ€™d always been a grazer since I adopted her, even the shelter told me she didnâ€™t have a regular schedule. Unfortunately, this led to her becoming overweight, so I decided it was time to shift to an auto feeder to help her lose some of those extra pounds.The feeder itself seems durable and overall looks nice and sleek. The setup was extremely easy, I had no issues getting it plugged in, connected to my app, and programmed. The instruction book was helpful for the few questions I had and it took me only about 20 minutes to get it set up and filled to start using. It requires three D batteries for backup in case the power goes out and theyâ€™re not included - so be aware you will also want to buy batteries with this purchase.The feeder easily dispenses my Iams brand kitty food and in the few weeks Iâ€™ve had this feeder have never experienced a jam. It dispenses perfectly on time and the correct amount of food each time. The portions vary based on what food you use so I recommend testing it a few times before finishing setup to ensure the right amount of food will be released with each feeding time. I simply dispensed different portions and put them into a measuring cup to see what was correct. The top is 6 liters so it holds plenty of food. I filled it to the top and itâ€™s been about 2-3 weeks and itâ€™s still got plenty of food in it. I like that the bowl is plastic not metal as well, so the falling food is not too noisy.As of now my kitty loves it. I didnâ€™t set it to make any noise when dispensing but as soon as she hears the food fall into the dish she takes off, so Iâ€™m happy. She already appears to be losing some weight and her fur has even become softer with a regular feeding schedule. Iâ€™m very happy with my purchase and I highly recommend this feeder.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easiest thing ever!', 'author': 'Brittany Martino', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This automatic cat feeder is amazing and a life saver! Super easy to use and set up! It did take me a second to figure out the portions but (1/3 cup = 5 portions). I love that it is able to go off on its own once setup, it tells me with a phone notification if the food is low (watch this part because it may or may not spit out food if that low) but I always check and fill up the container before we go out of town. Everything is easy to change if I need to change portions or the song it sings for my cat to know itâ€™s breakfast/dinner time (you can record your own tune/song - we did yum yum breakfast burrito from YouTube). Overall the best product. OH!! Get the double D batteries and plop those bad boys in there just in case you lose power (or your nephews unplugs the feeder and you didnâ€™t know) just helps the animals stay fed no matter what!Mine did not come with any scratches, dents or issues. The box was wrapped really well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love it! But it stopped working after 3 months', 'author': 'JeanneVB', 'rating': 4, 'content': "PROS: Our dog has BVS, which is a condition that makes her vomit up bile when her stomach is empty. Knock', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The product looks just like it is described in the listing.The cats go nuts when they hear it play the recording and will run from anywhere in the house. It is fairly quiet but the cats know what it means.The app was very easy to set up on my phone.I like the size of the food hopper. It holds a full bag of dry food. So far the cats haven't figured out any way to get the hopper open. Having the battery backup is a great addition to any feeder.A couple of things I wish I had paid more attention to:It really means it when it says you need a 2.4 GHz wifi. Just something I didn't think about.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy To Use', 'author': 'Amber', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This product is very durable, works lovely, and the app is easy to manage and havent had any problems, my puppy has a routine now thanks to this product and makes thing 10x easier. The portion sizes work perfectly and im able to split her food amounts up into 4x a day', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Fully cleanable', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I'm extremely happy that I can take it apart down to bare bones and clean each piece individually without too much effort.It does pop out food when slapped. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Eliminates some of the most painful parts of owning a cat', 'author': "Shannon Lee O'Black", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The feeder works flawlessly and effectively eliminates one of the biggest pains with having a cat. title: Automatic Cat Feeder with Camera for Two Cats, 1080P HD Video with Night Vision, 5G WiFi Pet Feeder with 2-Way Audio for Cat & Dog, Low Food & Motion & Sound Alerts, Dual Tray, Black 5L
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works and looks great, easy to use but skip if the voice recording feature is important to you', 'author': 'Maren', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'TL;DR: Works and looks great with the exception of the recorded message feature.I bought this autofeeder for my cat out of desperation. She meows incessantly for 45 minutes or more before meal times which annoys my dog into shriek howling with every meow and causes me to contemplate double murder. I\'ve only had this feeder for a couple days but so far it is working great! My cat is still learning that she must appeal to her new machine overlord for food, but she is already much better than she was. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and I will update my review if anything changes.PROS:- Easy set-up. It takes a few minutes but unless you\'re changing the schedule all the time for some reason, it\'s really not terrible. Some reviews claim you have to cycle through every time and portion to change something but that\'s not true. You can use the "+" and "-" buttons to navigate to the meal slot you want to change without starting from the beginning. Unused slots will have a time but if you set the portion to zero they will not dispense anything. This is probably obvious but it did confuse me for a second. I set mine to have 4 meals spaced 6 hours apart and it\'s been working like a charm.- No jamming problems even with larger kibble so far. The cat food I buy has larger chunks interspersed in with smaller kibble and I was worried that it might jam up the dispenser. So far it has been working just fine. It has a helpful sticker on the lid that shows you the largest kibble size it will accommodate and it seems to be accurate. I bought the 5L version which holds 4-5 lbs of food.- My devious cat has yet to figure out how to get extra kibble from it. The panel auto-locks so she can\'t press any buttons. I\'ve seen her stick her paw up the chute to dig around but she hasn\'t succeeded in any extra snacks yet as far as I can tell. It\'s only been a few days so time will tell if she will use her demon powers to beat the machine. I would suggest either putting this feeder on the floor or securing it in place because I suspect that my cat would be able to push it off a table and/or knock it over of it was empty enough. The weight D batteries alone might make it relatively stable to tipping though. I have not actually seen her move it yet but I remain wary because she is a larger cat at 14 lbs and generally a menace to society*.- It seems well-made and is very sleek and modern looking. Appearance is less important than function to me but it does look quite nice.- I like that there is a battery meter display even when plugged in. I intend to have it plugged in all the time but it will be nice to know when the back-up batteries need to be replaced.- After completing set-up, I decided to move the feeder and had not installed batteries in it yet. I was expecting to reset at least the time but was pleasantly surprised to see it did not reset at all. It was unplugged for all of 10 seconds so I can\'t attest to how long it can go without power or batteries before resetting the time. - A customer service rep from PETLIBRO messaged me before my product arrived with some helpful tips and reminder that they have customer service available 24 hours on week days if I need it and a 12 month warranty. I have not had a need to contact customer service but I thought the pro-active message was nice.CONS:- It is not clear from anywhere in the instructions what constitutes a portion. From my measurements, it seems that one portion is equivalent to approximately 1/8 cup. I am happy with this portion size but I wish it had been clear without requiring experimentation on my part.- In my opinion, the only truly poor feature about this product is the recorded message option (whether you intend to use it or not). Other reviews mention that the recording quality is very poor and I have to agree. It is very staticy and mine also makes a rhythmic rasping noise even when recording silence. I had no intention of using this feature anyway as the sound of a pin drop would probably send her scrambling from across the house if it meant food. The problem is that there doesn\'t seem to be a way to delete or turn off the recording without resetting the whole machine. I hit the record button by mistake during set-up, which is very easy to do, and I didn\'t want to start over. I "bypassed" it by hitting the record button quick succession to create as short of a recording as I possibly could. The quick blip of static when it dispenses food doesn\'t bother me but it is annoying you can\'t just turn this feature off all together. This is by no means a deal breaker to me but if having a nice recorded message is important to you, I would not recommend this feeder.- Not exactly a con but I prefer a shallow dish for feeding my cat. The bowl that comes with the feeder is deep but it is a nice bowl and I like that it has a tray that attaches to the feeder to keep it from being kicked around. Luckily her old shallow bowl fits nicely within the provided bowl and I haven\'t noticed any issues with spilling while doing this. Not a big deal but something to consider if it matters to you.*I promise that I actually love my cat very much! ðŸ˜‚ Picture attached. She\'s the best cat in the world... when she\'s not hungry.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to set up the feeder and the app', 'author': 'J. Knock', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my favorite cat feeder so far.The hopper holds a 3.5lb bag of dry food perfectly. It is fairly easy to tell when it is getting low.The cats have enough room so they can both eat with plenty of space.The camera is good enough to see the cats and make sure they are eating. I've tried the camera while I'm away from the house and it helped me not worry that the cats were getting enough food. The camera works well enough to see the cats at nighttime as well.The app was easy to set up on an iPhone. The interface seems intuitive. It has a lot of granularity on how much to dispense.The speaker on the feeder isn't very loud but as soon as it triggers the cats will come bolting from any room in the house.The only cons I have are:1) The food doesn't dispense evenly, one side always seems to get more. This isn't a problem for my cats but is worth mentioning.2) The app can be a little noisy with how many notifications it sends. It is sending notifications for sound alerts but those are usually people walking by. I'm hoping to figure out how to quiet that down without missing any cat related notifications.3) The video is grainier than the listing implied it would be. But it is still clear enough to check on the cats and the food dispensing.4) The app doesn't seem to pick up on low food warnings. It requires visually inspecting the feeder. I'm not sure if this is a bug or a lack of a feature. While it would be nice, the cats are very quick to let me know if they didn't get a meal. I double check it is full to the top before we will be away and make sure the cat sitter knows to check it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great feeder but pricey', 'author': 'YIRMASTER', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great cat feeder and entertaining good for placing kitty on diet but difficult with two cats because nothing stops the hungry kitty from eating from the other dish but if you watch and manually feed and maybe even talk to them through the speaker as you watch them eat could be useful.Can also work for security purposes to know if someone is there just seeing their feet lol..I bought as a gift for a loving kitty mom who seems entertained watching them eat, see their behavior when not home and found out her cat was sick with sneezing fits.The cats seemed to get used to it after a while learning the calls meant food but were never afraid to eat from it.Nice to have a speaker, microphone, scheduler, feed on demand, portioning feature, etc but there is no reason for such a hihh price compared to others.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good features, small problems.', 'author': 'Mitch', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I really like the portion size. Each unit is smaller than my last feeder, which allows for better portion control. What I don't like is that the machine can only give equal portions or larger portions to the bowl on the right, so if your cat who needs more food prefers the bowl on the left it's a problem. Also because there is no divider one cat can try to hog all of the food eating a little bit from both bowls, but that's a personal problem and may not be an issue with better mannered cats.I've also had problems with the low food warning. I have small, round kibble that rolls very easily, but even so, there was enough on the sides of the inside machine that even though I wasn't getting full meals delivered I wasn't getting a low food warning. The low food sensor either needs to be higher up, or the kibble needs to be better at getting dispensed evenly.My last complaint is that the USB cable provided was too short to reach the nearest wall plug.Otherwise, the camera is great. I love spying on my cats while I'm away. The portion sizes are nice and predictable with good control over total amount given. The frequency is easy to program. And most importantly I have had no issues with my cats breaking into this machine which was a big problem with my last cat feeder. I give some criticism, but this has been a good feeder, and I would recommend it for someone with two cats that need separate bowls, but not a physical divider.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect cat feeder', 'author': 'Catherine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the perfect cat feeder. I travel often and it is big enough to feed them for 6 day. Plus with the camera i cam see then while i am away. The food was getting stuck at the output because the bowl are not deep enought but i was able to fix that by reducing the amount of food per feeding and adding 1 more feeding. Also with the speaker i cam speak to them which is awesome. This feeder also work well for big pellets. I feed my cat with TD from hills and most feeder would not work with that food. I same a ton of money on pet sitting. Really worth it especially on black friday!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Check on your cats when you are away', 'author': 'Kimberly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I liked being able to see who was eating at meal time when i was away from home. When i returned, it was nice to be able to manually feed a little in the early morning to stop the cats from bugging me to feed them. now i can get more sleep and feed them properly after getting enough rest.It was a little frustrating to get connected to my WIFI, but once i moved the router closer to the feeder, it worked fine.setting the feeding amount takes a little trial and error, but you can play with the system until you get the right amount of food to dispense.The locking feature works fine, it keeps the cats out and it's easy to clean.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent purchase. Cat approved!', 'author': 'Karen M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased this for two cats (big male and small female) that need to be feed a few times a day so the big one doesnâ€™t eat all the food before the little gets a chance to eat enough. Also great if we are away overnight. Easy to use app with lots of features. Camera works well even at night. Gives me peace of mind and lots of convenience.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'Maddy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Video feature works in the day and had night vision. Before I always had to creep peak at my cats to see who's eating the most, if they're stealing eachothers food, but with the video feature and automatic recording I can review footage any time! It also has a 24/7 live feed so you can check up on your cats when you're not home. It auto detects motion and sound and you're able to control the sensitivity in the app.Only reason it's 4 stars is because of the meal call/talk option.I'm in the process of trouble shooting with support, but my meal call option doesn't sound off at meal time.The 2 way talk works alright. It doesn't pick up on my voice if I'm not talking at a normal voice level and it comes out loud on the other end to my cats. It won't pick up on kissy noises, softer singy song talk, or anything that's not at a normal voice level. But nbd when you consider the other features that work great.Portion sizes range from very small to very large. I was worried portions wouldn't be small enough bc I like to feed my cats smaller meals multiple times a day so they don't eat too fast and throw up, but it's perfect! I actually have to feed them more than the minimum. Great range here", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars PETLIBRO, SEND A FIRMWARE UPDATE TO REQUIRE LONG-PRESSING TWO BUTTONS TO LOCK/UNLOCK!', 'author': 'hollandot', 'rating': 4, 'content': "In so many ways this is a great feeder. However, as others have pointed out, it is too easy for a smart cat to figure out how to dispense the food. The first problem is that the only button that makes any sound when touched is the lock/unlock button - attracting the cat's attention. My cat just keeps touching it, probably because it beeps, then when he holds his paw on it for about a second, it's unlocked Then its a simple matter to touch the dispense button and he is rewarded with with a jackpot of food.Petlibro could have easily made it so it took touching and holding 2 buttons at one time to lock/unlock. I don't think any cat would ever figure that out.I've taped around the buttons area to add space to prevent touching. Let's see how long it lasts.Update: it didn't take long as the slightest touch sets it off. Also discovered that repeatedly touching the unlock button will eventually cause it to unlock and dispense food.Built a plexiglass shield and that seems to work. See pics.PETLIBRO, SEND A FIRMWARE UPDATE TO REQUIRE LONG-PRESSING TWO BUTTONS TO LOCK/UNLOCK!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good feeder might not be worth it over the non-camera version', 'author': 'Daniel', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently purchased the PETLIBRO Automatic Cat Feeder equipped with a 1080P HD Camera. Hereâ€™s a breakdown of my experience:Pros:Consistency: The feeder has been working as expected and I've had no major functionality issues.Voice Recording: One of the highlights is the ability to record a personal message. It's a thoughtful touch, making mealtime a bit more personal for my feline companions.Connectivity: The WiFi connection is robust. I havenâ€™t experienced any disconnects, ensuring that I always have access to the camera and feeding features.Firmware Updates: The company seems to be proactive in addressing software glitches. I noticed improvements in movement recording after a recent firmware update.Cons:Food Dispensation: There seems to be a design oversight where the food tends to accumulate on one side near the output shoot. This once triggered a warning of a blockage, which could be a concern for potential buyers.Camera Quality: The camera quality is decent, but not exceptional. It's adequate for monitoring, but if you're expecting top-tier image quality, this might not meet your expectations.Price Point: Considering the additional features, I'm not sure if the price increase for the camera version provides enough value over the non-camera version.Trust Issues: It took some time for my cats to adjust to this new gadget. One of the main reasons I got this was to ensure they didn't wake me up early in the morning for food. However, that habit hasn't changed.App Update & Cloud Storage: While I appreciate software updates, the recent one seems to emphasize their cloud storage offering. It's become somewhat inconvenient to access videos that arenâ€™t on the cloud, which feels like a nudge towards a service I'm not particularly interested in.Final Thoughts:The PETLIBRO Automatic Cat Feeder with Camera does its primary job well, which is to feed. However, potential buyers might want to weigh the benefits of the camera feature against the price difference. While some features are commendable, there are areas of improvement that can enhance the overall user experience.3 month update: Still working well. Cats are now used to the feeder. So they come running when they hear the feeding announcement.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Automatic Cat Feeders for 2 Cats,COKBER 7L Automatic Cat Food Dispenser & 2 Stainless Bowls,Auto Cat Feeder up to 6 Meals per Day, 10s Voice Recorder & Timer Setting, Dual Power Supply (29 Cup)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Meets the Needs of Me and My Cat', 'author': 'Leonard Mah', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Overall, I like the thought put into this product as they have covered everything I would want for me. Using it for my cat. She is a very sweet Abysinnian and they can have a big appetite (she is always hungry). So, this device will allow me be parcel out the exact amount of food to her every morning. Our usual routine is that she would sit on my chest while I am sleeping in the morning and start purring telling me it is feeding time. I don't mind at all as I am an early riser...just don't understand why she never does this to my wife, only me.Anyway, with the voice recording and time to dispense the food, she knows that it is feeding time. She stills sits on my chest in the morning...I guess to make sure I don't oversleep. These Abysinnians are very intelligent and perceptive cats. I would also recommend a remote home camera to monitor your pet and feeding station, just in case something goes wrong.Pros- Record you voice to tell your pet it is feeding time- Daily programmed feeding times - good if you want to leave for a short trip- Manual feeding as well- Mobile App to control the unit - monitor the unit and manual feeding- Once you train your pet, then it is good to go- The build quality looks very good, time will tell of its reliability- Has a battery backup in case of a power failure- Food trays easily removable and washableCons- Has a lot of settings and features - take your time to read the manual- Don't know about feeding two pets - my cat would eat all the food from the two trays- It does have a desiccant pack to keep the pet food dry in the dispenser which needs regular replacement.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Not for sneaky cats!!â€™', 'author': 'Trinigurl', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I forgot to take pics but the feeder was used and not cleaned. It is easy to program, but you will have to experiment a bit to get the right portion size. It will depend on how large the kibble is.You can set it up for either a single bowl or side by side bowls. The instructions mention an app and WIFI, but my unit is not WIFI capable. Perhaps there are other versions that are. It holds about 2 weeks of food for my 2 dogs. Filling the food is easy, since the lid has an easy release button on the back. And cleaning it about as easy as it gets. Highly recommend this for any pet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not bug safe, great feeder though!', 'author': 'Elgio', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The food dispenser isnâ€™t advertised as bug safe, so I am not removing stars, but would like to mention that bugs like ants will be able to get inside in case you have problems with that. I still want to manually feed my cats, so will only use this for when Iâ€™m gone all day or out for a couple days. Thankfully I read a nice life hack that mentions rubbing Vaseline all around the bottom of the feeder and bowls which will prevent ants from climbing into the feeder.The feeder itself is very easy to setup, all you have to do is insert the base and bowls. I love that there are multiple ways to give it battery in case of a power outage which is a nice precaution. The portions arenâ€™t very big so I have it set to dispense several portions at once for my two cats. The food dispenser has a nice sleek look and very easy to wash and clean. Overall, Iâ€™m pretty happy about this food dispenser and will come in handy when i will be gone for a while and will limit how much I feed my cats!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 19, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works well, BUT not enough control', 'author': 'Somerando', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I got this for a cat that has eating problems. This falls into a much lower price than those feature-rich feeders though, so if you are looking for one, and don't mind the chance of over-dispensing, this will do just fine.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 4, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Wonâ€™t work in cold weather.', 'author': 'JJCV', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'This product wonâ€™t work in cold weather.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Makes portion control and treat dispensing a breeze', 'author': 'Alex R.(Babby, Guava and friends)', 'rating': 4, 'content': "We've never owned one of these before but we've been interested in them. title: iPettie Donuts Frost 6 Meal Cordless Automatic Pet Feeder, Dry & Wet Food Automatic Cat Feeder with Two Ice Packs, Rechargeable Massive Battery, Programmable Timer, Holds 6 x Â½ lb. of Food
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great tool for when you want to go away for a night or two', 'author': 'Chella', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am currently fostering a cat, and I wanted to go away for the weekend. I am a cat person, and I've had cats before, and I know they can be left a few days by themselves with dry food - however, this cat is on medication that needs to be mixed into wet food, so I knew I needed to come up with a solution. I had heard of automatic feeders with ice packs before, and this one seemed to fit the bill quite nicely.First, I want to say this - when using this device, use common sense. You can't leave wet food in this thing for a week. Obviously it will not keep even with the ice packs, and there is even a warning in the instructions telling you not to do so. However, you can use this to portion out wet food for two-ish days, or dry food every day. Someone suggested freezing food into pucks to help the food last longer, and I do feel that helps a lot. I also purchased a separate set of ice packs so I can freeze one set while the other is being used. Still, I only portion out wet food for MAYBE 18 - 24 hours - I don't trust the food to be well enough to eat past that time. So again, use common sense.The next thing is the instructions do not use the best grammar, and so it makes it a bit confusing, specifically how to set up a feeder schedule for more that a day. Here is what I have learned - if you want the cycle to feed your pet TWICE A DAY (once at 9am and once at 9pm, for example), set the feeding times for two meal periods - one to 9am and 9pm - then don't set any more meal times, aka, leave the other four remaining times empty! (which, by the way, happens when you set those times to 12am) Then feeder will continually rotate at those two specific times - 9am and 9pm, or whatever two times you have set. The 6 meal times are for 6 specific meals out of a 24 hour period (such as if you want to feed your pet at 4am, 8am, 12pm, 4pm, 8pm, and 12am again). If you just need TWO meal periods (or three, ect), then just set two times and leave the other 4 blank. It took me a while to figure that out because the directions kinda/sorta say that, but again, the English isn't the best so actually using the machine is what helped me figure it out. I found that when setting Meal 1 to 9:30am, Meal 2 to 9:30pm, and Meal 3 to 10AM, and meal 4 to 10PM, the machine would override the separate meal periods at rotate at 9:30am and 10am on the same day. I hope this makes sense! This was the biggest stumbling block when getting this machine, but again, playing around with it helped me figure out the correct way to use it.As for the physical set up - I am not sure how people can't get this thing aligned, it's really rather straightforward, but perhaps I am missing something. I have taken it apart to clean it and put it back together a few times at this point and have had no issues with realigning it.Another tip - every time you turn on the machine, you have to reset the current time, but your meal periods will be saved. This may be annoying to some but I don't mind having to set the current time every time, it's very easy to do so. And the battery life is great, too!This thing has come on handy many times since I purchased it. title: Automatic Cat Feeder, WiFi Cat Food Dispenser Rechargeable Battery-Operated with 30-Day Life, AIR Timed Pet Feeder for Cat & Dog, 2L Auto Cat Feeder
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A High-quality Feeder without the Cord', 'author': 'j', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We don't have convenient access to power near our fur-baby's feeding spot, and most automatic feeders seem to be corded. So when we saw this rechargeable option, we were thrilled about the possibility. It has turned out to be even better than hoped for. The feeder is compact but holds plenty of food to get through several weeks. It was extremely easy to set up, and we love that the device itself requires minimal direct interaction, since all of the configuration takes place via the app.The app itself is well-designed, simple to interact with, and incredibly informative. We love the notification capabilities as well as the feeding log. We didn't trust our previous, conveyor-belt fashion feeder to dispense on time and/or the precise amount. The information and control provided by this app mean that we don't have to worry about those issues anymore. What's more, the battery seems so far to have excellent capacity. We're still at 100% after a few days of use, and so the promise of 30 days appears more than fulfillable.The final plus is that it's so very quiet! The rotary mechanism makes almost no sound when it dispenses (extremely accurate) amounts of dry food. It's so stealthy that we thought we had set it up wrong and that it wasn't dispensing food the first couple of meal times. We walked over to find her happily munching away on the current meal. Overall, we're extremely happy with the features and quality of the AIR.The one improvement we'd like to see is the ability to attach to 5 GHz WiFi network. And as long as the feeders keep working as they should and I get a few years out of them, I will be very happy!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I LOVE this feeder', 'author': 'sam', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have an adult cat and a kitten, and theyâ€™re both constantly trying to eat each otherâ€™s foods. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The cat is happy!', 'author': 'LR301', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Love this feeder! It is well built and well packaged and it DOES work. Wells', 'rating': 4, 'content': "After researching 3 feeders, I decided this one seemed the best. It was also the cheapest of the 3. We ordered this to feed our cat when we are away for long weekends. It seems very solidly constructed. The lid locks on very well â€“ there is NO WAY a cat could get the lid off if it is properly put on. Theoretically, maybe, a large dog could use their teeth to unlock it, but this seems VERY unlikely.The storage spot is huge â€“ I think it could hold enough food to feed our cat for a month.The feeding mechanism is essentially a small roulette wheel that the food drops into as it turns. Each spot is a â€œportionâ€. The portions are pretty small, large dog kibble wouldnâ€™t really work with this feeder. Itâ€™s for standard size cat kibble. The â€œtrial and errorâ€ process to find the right number of portions for your animal is not hard â€“ I guessed 6 portions, it was too much, I changed to 4, it was just right for the twice a day feeding.You can set up to 6 feedings a day. We only use two so simply turned the others to â€œOffâ€. We plug our into the wall, which means we needed to move the feeder to a spot with an accessible outlet. You can also put batteries into it and I would image them would last a long time given the minimal power usage but we're not using that option.The set-up isnâ€™t hard. title: Catstages Cat Slow Feeder Cat Bowl, Green
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Helps slow our cats eating', 'author': 'William Swett', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Got this to try and control the amount of over-eating (and then puking) one of our cats was doing, and it works great.They have to fish around for the kibble instead of just going full hungry-hungry-hippo on it.You do have to make sure you shake it around a little when you fill it, because they are rather shallow and its easy for the food to just kind of mound up on top, which defeats the purpose, but thats a pretty small issue.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars So far, it works, and the cat isn't thrilled with it. :)", 'author': 'Laughing Sal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Our female cat has earned the nickname "Hoover" as she is known to vacuum up almost any food she can get to. Potato chips, spicy corn chips, even pickle slices- if she can get to it, she will eat it, or try to eat it. Any time we give her more than a tiny handful of kibble, she will invariably devour it so fast that it comes right back up. Our much slower eating boy cat had been very tolerant of her Hoovering up his food as well as her own, so we started feeding them in different rooms so he would get more than a small portion of food before she inhaled it all.As she can\'t be given more than a teaspoon\'s amount of food at a time (any more, and you will find yourself stepping in a pile of it on the carpet a few minutes later) we decided to look for a bowl that could slow down her eating. This bowl had decent reviews and was not expensive, so we gave it a try. It appears to be well-made, and not too difficult to clean- the channels in it are big enough to get a brush into.At first, "Hoover" was not pleased with this new food receptacle. At ALL. She could smell and see all those tasty nuggets that she usually made disappear within thirty seconds, but she couldn\'t get at them easily any longer. I could see she was frustrated, so I put down a few pieces of kibble right next to the new bowl. She gulped down this small bit of food, then looked at me, wanting more. I then tapped the bowl and "showed" her the kibble sitting in the channels of the bowl.At first, she walked away from this strange thing. Maybe her "real" bowl would re-appear, and she wouldn\'t have to deal with this kibble puzzle dish. She came back and checked out the new bowl again, and managed to get a few pieces of kibble out of it. I noticed she was shoving the bowl around with her paw on the cushion-y "placemat" we have under the cats\' food and water. She got a few more pieces of kibble.She never flipped the bowl over entirely, which is what I was waiting for (and dreading.) The placemat we have keeps the bowl from moving around very much, so I can\'t attest to the bowl\'s "suction" (?) effectiveness. I just checked out the underside of the bowl, and don\'t see any suction cups or anything, but we keep their bowls on the cushy placemat anyway, so it\'s not going anywhere.She returned to the strange object that was holding her food hostage again and again, and each time managed to get out a few more pieces of kibble. I just checked the bowl, and there are about a dozen or so pieces of kibble sitting in it, which is amazing to see, as she is so strongly food-motivated.The bowl just arrived this afternoon, so I can\'t attest to its effectiveness in the long-term, but it seems to be a success so far. It has broken the feeding time cycle of giving her a tiny bit of kibble, her begging for more food, giving a tiny bit more kibble, then begging again, etc. I\'ll report back after a week or so. Hopefully, this new bowl will continue to keep our Hoover-cat on a lower setting.Edit: it\'s been about four days of her using the new bowl. As we saw that she had been leaving about half of the kibble in the bowl after eating (unheard of with a regular bowl) we increased the minimal amount of kibble we gave her to her entire morning portion. A day or so ago, if we checked the bowl after she appeared to finish eating, and there would be about seven to ten nuggets of kibble left. When she begged later, we just tapped the bowl. She got the message: if she wanted more kibble she would have to extract it from the bowl. ---- We noticed yesterday after giving her the evening\'s kibble allotment that the new bowl with its challenging channels was completely empty. She has figured out how to get all of the kibble out of her new bowl. After we fed her this morning, sure enough, she got all of the kibble out of it. But the bowl is still a success, as it has really slowed down her eating. In a way, she is now eating like a normal cat- and not like a fur-covered Dirt Devil. Very happy with our purchase, and if you have a Hoover kitty of your own, we highly recommend this bowl. :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works as intended', 'author': 'Michael', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The bowl works as intended as a slow feeder, it has stopped my cat from eating way too quickly and immediately throwing it up. He has had one incident, but that's better than every other day like before. The bowl is shallower than normal feeding bowls but makes up with how wide it is. Definitely won't work with larger kibble so be mindful when purchasing.Knocked a star off just because of how easily a cat can knock the thing around, spilling food everywhere and defeating the purpose. Using a no slip rug has helped.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars They work too well.', 'author': 'Jimmy', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I got these because one of my cats will eat so fast that she throws up. She can't get any food out of these at all and just gives up and whines for more food. The other is a food hound and will eat it, but it'll take him ages. He can only get one piece at a time. It seems a bit torturous. Sometimes he gets the bowl flipped over, but that defeats the purpose entirely. He ends up chewing on the plastic trying to get at it too which can't be good. I should have sent them back but I thought I'd give them a fair chance. I can't say they don't work. Maybe these would work for some kitties, maybe smarter kitties or cats with smaller paws. My cats are on the bigger side, 10Lbs and 15Lbs. They aren't right for mine though. Oh well, they seemed like a good idea.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A good value for the cost', 'author': 'Kristi', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This solved an issue with one of our cats, a domestic shorthair named Watson. We feed twice daily, kibble in the morning, and canned + kibble + water in the evenings. In the mornings, Watson would scarf his kibble down so quickly, he would, a short time later, harf it up on the rug. We tried feeding the wet course in the mornings, same issue. It became so frequent, his upchuck showed signs of blood due to stomach acid scarring his esophagus (confirmed by a vet exam) Free-feeding wasnâ€™t an option, because the booger has little self-control and would overeat and get tubby.This product takes a little effort and time to get the kibble out, and for us, it solved this feeding issue. It slows down the feeding time, just enough, so he keeps the food down. We provide these bowls for all our cats, and only use them for the morning (dry) meal. In this way, there is little competition; all is fair and equal.This model holds about 1/2-cup of (kitty-sized) kibble. We feed them about 1/3-cup at the morning meal. The description claims it holds up to 3/4-cup, but that amount doesnâ€™t sink into the channels far enough to slow down consumption. Theyâ€™ve been used daily for over a year, and are holding up quite well. The bowls have grippy feet on the bottom, which minimizes movement. But the boogers tend to push the bowls around, as they work the channels for food. Itâ€™s not uncommon to find a bowl across the kitchen 8-10 feet away after feeding. Sometimes, we gotta hunt them down looking under tables and chairs.The bowl is made of plastic, and frequent cleaning is needed. The cats use their little tongues (and sometimes paws) to get the food out, and as such, the bowls get kinda gross with saliva buildup after a couple of feedings. They are nicely dishwasher safe, though. Hand-washing requires brief soaking. A metal or ceramic version of this bowl would be better.Iâ€™m not a mind reader, but I see clues that our cats would prefer their kibble in a regular bowl, without the obstacles of this â€œpuzzle dish.â€ That said, they seem to tolerate it, as all the cats have an identical bowl during this feeding time. When given a choice between the regular and puzzle dish, they go to the regular, as it may be less work to feed.One last tip, after adding kibble to the bowl, we find it best to jiggle it back and forth, so the kibble settles down into the channels. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Kitty City is NOT â€œjust another cat food bowlâ€', 'author': 'Library Cat', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'When I saw these Kitty City raised food bowls, I did something I NEVER do - I ordered TWO sets of something without trying it first. I gave it a final rinse with hot water - no soap; no scrubbing - and there I was, holding a clean bowl.Iâ€™m not kidding you; it IS that easy. (Yeah, every once in a while I throw in a little detergent to knock off any stray microbes that might have wandered in, but I really donâ€™t think itâ€™s necessary.)Just put some hot water in the bowl, give it 15 minutes, then a final rinse under running water and maybe a light swipe with a paper towel. Thatâ€™s it. Really. Truly. Clean.Now what I want is a bowl for ME that I donâ€™t have to wash.....(maybe I could just borrow hers for a light snack - a little chicken salad maybe? Or some deviled ham on toast points?) Do you think that - á´á´€ÊÊ™á´‡ - she might let me share her bowl?? ðŸ˜— ðŸ‘€All kidding aside, I would give these Kitty City bowls SIX stars if I could. Maybe the material theyâ€™re made of ISNâ€™T revolutionary; maybe the technology has been out there for years and I just havenâ€™t noticed. (I donâ€™t get around much.) But thatâ€™s beside the point. These bowls are beautiful, to the eye and to the touch. And they make eating a healthier experience for your cat. So look at them again - and if you love ðŸ’• your cat, buy a set. Buy two. Thatâ€™s what I did - and I only have one cat. But I noticed today that they have a set in pastels now, and theyâ€™re gorgeous..... so Iâ€™m gonna buy a set. Do I really need six bowls for my one cat?....Maybe not....but maybe I can use a couple of them to display art objects. Maybe I can display a couple of them AS art objects....I would add a picture if I could, but my lap seems to be inhabited at the moment, and that imposes certain limits....maybe I can add one later. I didnâ€™t know I would be revisiting this site today, but Iâ€™m glad I finally got back here. They had to pull a couple of mine in the last four years when I wandered off the beaten path, offering my opinions in areas that didnâ€™t strictly conform to product review, and I can understand that. I do tend to wax enthusiastic when I find a product that is so far above what is usually considered â€œgood enough â€œ. One is a dachshund mix, the other is a poodle mix. Neither weigh over 15 pounds. Before we got the dachshund we just used an old style feeding bowl for the poodle, but after the dachshund came along, the food started disappearing a lot faster. I\'m going to tell you what I have learned about these gravity-type feeders. Before having these little two dogs, I had a full-blooded chow-chow who lived nearly 14 years. He absolutely hated these feeders. And hated the watering ones even more. He was a fairly big chow-chow, about 85 pounds, picture of health. It was pretty simple to see that his big furry head had trouble getting his face down in these types of feeders. The watering one didn\'t release enough water for him to drink. I ended up buying him a big pan to put his hard food in and a large open water bucket. I would recommend those for anyone with dogs bigger than medium size.This feeder earns its five stars. I love dogs as much as anyone does, but these two small dogs we have now are the only indoor dogs I\'ve ever had. They are both messy. I don\'t mean with potty issues or anything like that, but I mean with eating and drinking. The dachshund is especially messy. He pushes the food out of most feeder\'s bowls. He then plays with the food. Then he gets mad at the poodle for drinking "his" water and shoves the watering apparatus so it spills.This feeder stops him from doing it. We had bought a cheap feeder and watering bottle at a department store. The fault lies in the depth of the bowl. Not how deep it is or how much it holds, but the distance from the spout of the bottle to the bottom of the bowl. Then you take into consideration how wide the opening is. The cheap one we had bought allowed too much food to come out, kind of gave an avalanche impression. Dachshund had a field day with it. Not so with this one. The spout opening isn\'t near as big as other feeders I\'ve used and the bowl is far enough away from the spout that it doesn\'t allow the food to pile up.Having said that as a very positive feature, it\'s most likely why other people are having problems with the food not coming out without a nudge. If you have a dog or dogs that likes to make a mess with food, this is the perfect feeder for them. I don\'t know much about the microban, but we wash our feeder and watering bottle weekly. Not surprisingly, I paid pretty much the same price for the cheap feeder as this one. In comparison, this one is worth its price easily.
