More feedings in restricted smaller amounts haved helped her overcome daily purging. (ick) I\'ve never owned an automatic feeder and I bought this PetLibro version because it allows up to 10 scheduled feedings a day and all 7 days may be customized individually, though I only use the copy day feature at this time to make all days the same. What I find very valuable is that each scheduled feeding may be sized from 0-4cups of kibble(food) in 1/12 increments, so 48 different feeding sizes that I measured to be very accurate cup for cup. Understand the physics of it though because smaller the kibble(size of dry food) the more accurate the measurements. If you want to know exactly how much kibble is dispensed then (clean and dry all pieces that come in contact with food first), assemble dry parts, fill container, dispense 2-3 full cups first to ensure the internal air pockets are removed to ensure accurate measurements, then dispense and measure each of the levels from 1/12th to 12/12ths and compare it to your normal feeding size. KNOW THIS - medium to large kibble won\'t function well in this feeder. I intend to continue using the small kibble Purina Puppy Chow and I feel good about the feeder\'s size precision. At $70 the price is right as I didn\'t feel the need to spend more to add a camera to the feeder. Install and use of the mobile app was very easy and straightforward. I like option to record my own voice that plays prior to each feeding. What\'s cool is that everyone in my family may record a "Come Eat" audio and you can manually change which ones plays anytime you want from within the app. Oh, and the app may be installed on multiple phones so that everyone in the family can keep track of feedings and alerts. I did learn that the app\'s auto find of device from phone only works AFTER plugging in the PetLibro feeder. I installed the 3 \'D\' size batteries first and lights appear as does minimal functionality however Bluetooth signal is off until the device is also plugged in. Some reviews reported that they couldn\'t connect phone to feeder however I believe this was their issue. The batteries are designed for back up only when loss of power occurs - the device turns off wifi and BT to conserve energy to ensure dog gets fed. The food container holds 5 days of food for my 50# Labradoodle and the device has indicator light and an app push notification to indicate time for food refill. Food container looks to have a good tight seal to keep food fresh. There is also a desiccant pouch that should be replaced every week or month - though I\'ve read that desiccant\'s may be renewed in microwave or dehydrator. Careful though, I melted one in a microwave once.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Customer Service!', 'author': 'Sandy Shore', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This feeder and its App were easy to set up. Once the schedule is set, the feeder has been delivering on time every time. When the food gets very low, a red light comes on the unit and a notification appears on my phone. This failed to happen the first time, so I contacted PetLibro and received a very prompt reply with instructions (complete with pictures!!) of how to be sure I had set it up correctly. Now that function works perfectly.Although the food has always been delivered at the scheduled times and amounts, the "Feeding Successful" phone notifications are sometimes delayed. Again the Customer Service/tech help has been extremely helpful and persistent solving the issue. It is so refreshing and unusual to find such good service these days!After using the Granary for 6 weeks, I feel confident in its ability to deliver food as needed. I love that the food bowl is stainless steel. My 2 cats ate together from the previous food bowl I was using. This Granary bowl is smaller so they usually take turns. Perhaps I should have gotten the one with 2 bowls.I appreciate that the unit has battery backup. I have not used the Meal Call feature. The sound of kibble hitting the stainless bowl is enough to alert the cats.I would definitely recommend this feeder.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Multi Pet
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works and looks great, easy to use but skip if the voice recording feature is important to you', 'author': 'Maren', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'TL;DR: Works and looks great with the exception of the recorded message feature.I bought this autofeeder for my cat out of desperation. She meows incessantly for 45 minutes or more before meal times which annoys my dog into shriek howling with every meow and causes me to contemplate double murder. I\'ve only had this feeder for a couple days but so far it is working great! My cat is still learning that she must appeal to her new machine overlord for food, but she is already much better than she was. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and I will update my review if anything changes.PROS:- Easy set-up. It takes a few minutes but unless you\'re changing the schedule all the time for some reason, it\'s really not terrible. Some reviews claim you have to cycle through every time and portion to change something but that\'s not true. You can use the "+" and "-" buttons to navigate to the meal slot you want to change without starting from the beginning. Unused slots will have a time but if you set the portion to zero they will not dispense anything. This is probably obvious but it did confuse me for a second. I set mine to have 4 meals spaced 6 hours apart and it\'s been working like a charm.- No jamming problems even with larger kibble so far. The cat food I buy has larger chunks interspersed in with smaller kibble and I was worried that it might jam up the dispenser. So far it has been working just fine. It has a helpful sticker on the lid that shows you the largest kibble size it will accommodate and it seems to be accurate. I bought the 5L version which holds 4-5 lbs of food.- My devious cat has yet to figure out how to get extra kibble from it. The panel auto-locks so she can\'t press any buttons. I\'ve seen her stick her paw up the chute to dig around but she hasn\'t succeeded in any extra snacks yet as far as I can tell. It\'s only been a few days so time will tell if she will use her demon powers to beat the machine. I would suggest either putting this feeder on the floor or securing it in place because I suspect that my cat would be able to push it off a table and/or knock it over of it was empty enough. The weight D batteries alone might make it relatively stable to tipping though. I have not actually seen her move it yet but I remain wary because she is a larger cat at 14 lbs and generally a menace to society*.- It seems well-made and is very sleek and modern looking. Appearance is less important than function to me but it does look quite nice.- I like that there is a battery meter display even when plugged in. I intend to have it plugged in all the time but it will be nice to know when the back-up batteries need to be replaced.- After completing set-up, I decided to move the feeder and had not installed batteries in it yet. I was expecting to reset at least the time but was pleasantly surprised to see it did not reset at all. It was unplugged for all of 10 seconds so I can\'t attest to how long it can go without power or batteries before resetting the time. - A customer service rep from PETLIBRO messaged me before my product arrived with some helpful tips and reminder that they have customer service available 24 hours on week days if I need it and a 12 month warranty. I have not had a need to contact customer service but I thought the pro-active message was nice.CONS:- It is not clear from anywhere in the instructions what constitutes a portion. From my measurements, it seems that one portion is equivalent to approximately 1/8 cup. I am happy with this portion size but I wish it had been clear without requiring experimentation on my part.- In my opinion, the only truly poor feature about this product is the recorded message option (whether you intend to use it or not). Other reviews mention that the recording quality is very poor and I have to agree. It is very staticy and mine also makes a rhythmic rasping noise even when recording silence. I had no intention of using this feature anyway as the sound of a pin drop would probably send her scrambling from across the house if it meant food. The problem is that there doesn\'t seem to be a way to delete or turn off the recording without resetting the whole machine. I hit the record button by mistake during set-up, which is very easy to do, and I didn\'t want to start over. I "bypassed" it by hitting the record button quick succession to create as short of a recording as I possibly could. The quick blip of static when it dispenses food doesn\'t bother me but it is annoying you can\'t just turn this feature off all together. This is by no means a deal breaker to me but if having a nice recorded message is important to you, I would not recommend this feeder.- Not exactly a con but I prefer a shallow dish for feeding my cat. The bowl that comes with the feeder is deep but it is a nice bowl and I like that it has a tray that attaches to the feeder to keep it from being kicked around. Luckily her old shallow bowl fits nicely within the provided bowl and I haven\'t noticed any issues with spilling while doing this. Not a big deal but something to consider if it matters to you.*I promise that I actually love my cat very much! ðŸ˜‚ Picture attached. She\'s the best cat in the world... when she\'s not hungry.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 17, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to set up the feeder and the app', 'author': 'J. Knock', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is my favorite cat feeder so far.The hopper holds a 3.5lb bag of dry food perfectly. It is fairly easy to tell when it is getting low.The cats have enough room so they can both eat with plenty of space.The camera is good enough to see the cats and make sure they are eating. I've tried the camera while I'm away from the house and it helped me not worry that the cats were getting enough food. The camera works well enough to see the cats at nighttime as well.The app was easy to set up on an iPhone. The interface seems intuitive. It has a lot of granularity on how much to dispense.The speaker on the feeder isn't very loud but as soon as it triggers the cats will come bolting from any room in the house.The only cons I have are:1) The food doesn't dispense evenly, one side always seems to get more. This isn't a problem for my cats but is worth mentioning.2) The app can be a little noisy with how many notifications it sends. It is sending notifications for sound alerts but those are usually people walking by. I'm hoping to figure out how to quiet that down without missing any cat related notifications.3) The video is grainier than the listing implied it would be. But it is still clear enough to check on the cats and the food dispensing.4) The app doesn't seem to pick up on low food warnings. It requires visually inspecting the feeder. I'm not sure if this is a bug or a lack of a feature. While it would be nice, the cats are very quick to let me know if they didn't get a meal. I double check it is full to the top before we will be away and make sure the cat sitter knows to check it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great feeder but pricey', 'author': 'YIRMASTER', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Great cat feeder and entertaining good for placing kitty on diet but difficult with two cats because nothing stops the hungry kitty from eating from the other dish but if you watch and manually feed and maybe even talk to them through the speaker as you watch them eat could be useful.Can also work for security purposes to know if someone is there just seeing their feet lol..I bought as a gift for a loving kitty mom who seems entertained watching them eat, see their behavior when not home and found out her cat was sick with sneezing fits.The cats seemed to get used to it after a while learning the calls meant food but were never afraid to eat from it.Nice to have a speaker, microphone, scheduler, feed on demand, portioning feature, etc but there is no reason for such a hihh price compared to others.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good features, small problems.', 'author': 'Mitch', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I really like the portion size. Each unit is smaller than my last feeder, which allows for better portion control. What I don't like is that the machine can only give equal portions or larger portions to the bowl on the right, so if your cat who needs more food prefers the bowl on the left it's a problem. Also because there is no divider one cat can try to hog all of the food eating a little bit from both bowls, but that's a personal problem and may not be an issue with better mannered cats.I've also had problems with the low food warning. I have small, round kibble that rolls very easily, but even so, there was enough on the sides of the inside machine that even though I wasn't getting full meals delivered I wasn't getting a low food warning. The low food sensor either needs to be higher up, or the kibble needs to be better at getting dispensed evenly.My last complaint is that the USB cable provided was too short to reach the nearest wall plug.Otherwise, the camera is great. I love spying on my cats while I'm away. The portion sizes are nice and predictable with good control over total amount given. The frequency is easy to program. And most importantly I have had no issues with my cats breaking into this machine which was a big problem with my last cat feeder. I give some criticism, but this has been a good feeder, and I would recommend it for someone with two cats that need separate bowls, but not a physical divider.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The perfect cat feeder', 'author': 'Catherine', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the perfect cat feeder. I travel often and it is big enough to feed them for 6 day. Plus with the camera i cam see then while i am away. The food was getting stuck at the output because the bowl are not deep enought but i was able to fix that by reducing the amount of food per feeding and adding 1 more feeding. Also with the speaker i cam speak to them which is awesome. This feeder also work well for big pellets. I feed my cat with TD from hills and most feeder would not work with that food. I same a ton of money on pet sitting. Really worth it especially on black friday!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Check on your cats when you are away', 'author': 'Kimberly', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I liked being able to see who was eating at meal time when i was away from home. When i returned, it was nice to be able to manually feed a little in the early morning to stop the cats from bugging me to feed them. now i can get more sleep and feed them properly after getting enough rest.It was a little frustrating to get connected to my WIFI, but once i moved the router closer to the feeder, it worked fine.setting the feeding amount takes a little trial and error, but you can play with the system until you get the right amount of food to dispense.The locking feature works fine, it keeps the cats out and it's easy to clean.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent purchase. Cat approved!', 'author': 'Karen M', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchased this for two cats (big male and small female) that need to be feed a few times a day so the big one doesnâ€™t eat all the food before the little gets a chance to eat enough. Also great if we are away overnight. Easy to use app with lots of features. Camera works well even at night. Gives me peace of mind and lots of convenience.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'Maddy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Video feature works in the day and had night vision. Before I always had to creep peak at my cats to see who's eating the most, if they're stealing eachothers food, but with the video feature and automatic recording I can review footage any time! It also has a 24/7 live feed so you can check up on your cats when you're not home. It auto detects motion and sound and you're able to control the sensitivity in the app.Only reason it's 4 stars is because of the meal call/talk option.I'm in the process of trouble shooting with support, but my meal call option doesn't sound off at meal time.The 2 way talk works alright. It doesn't pick up on my voice if I'm not talking at a normal voice level and it comes out loud on the other end to my cats. It won't pick up on kissy noises, softer singy song talk, or anything that's not at a normal voice level. But nbd when you consider the other features that work great.Portion sizes range from very small to very large. I was worried portions wouldn't be small enough bc I like to feed my cats smaller meals multiple times a day so they don't eat too fast and throw up, but it's perfect! I actually have to feed them more than the minimum. Great range here", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars PETLIBRO, SEND A FIRMWARE UPDATE TO REQUIRE LONG-PRESSING TWO BUTTONS TO LOCK/UNLOCK!', 'author': 'hollandot', 'rating': 4, 'content': "In so many ways this is a great feeder. However, as others have pointed out, it is too easy for a smart cat to figure out how to dispense the food. The first problem is that the only button that makes any sound when touched is the lock/unlock button - attracting the cat's attention. My cat just keeps touching it, probably because it beeps, then when he holds his paw on it for about a second, it's unlocked Then its a simple matter to touch the dispense button and he is rewarded with with a jackpot of food.Petlibro could have easily made it so it took touching and holding 2 buttons at one time to lock/unlock. I don't think any cat would ever figure that out.I've taped around the buttons area to add space to prevent touching. Let's see how long it lasts.Update: it didn't take long as the slightest touch sets it off. Also discovered that repeatedly touching the unlock button will eventually cause it to unlock and dispense food.Built a plexiglass shield and that seems to work. See pics.PETLIBRO, SEND A FIRMWARE UPDATE TO REQUIRE LONG-PRESSING TWO BUTTONS TO LOCK/UNLOCK!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good feeder might not be worth it over the non-camera version', 'author': 'Daniel', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I recently purchased the PETLIBRO Automatic Cat Feeder equipped with a 1080P HD Camera. Hereâ€™s a breakdown of my experience:Pros:Consistency: The feeder has been working as expected and I've had no major functionality issues.Voice Recording: One of the highlights is the ability to record a personal message. It's a thoughtful touch, making mealtime a bit more personal for my feline companions.Connectivity: The WiFi connection is robust. I havenâ€™t experienced any disconnects, ensuring that I always have access to the camera and feeding features.Firmware Updates: The company seems to be proactive in addressing software glitches. I noticed improvements in movement recording after a recent firmware update.Cons:Food Dispensation: There seems to be a design oversight where the food tends to accumulate on one side near the output shoot. This once triggered a warning of a blockage, which could be a concern for potential buyers.Camera Quality: The camera quality is decent, but not exceptional. It's adequate for monitoring, but if you're expecting top-tier image quality, this might not meet your expectations.Price Point: Considering the additional features, I'm not sure if the price increase for the camera version provides enough value over the non-camera version.Trust Issues: It took some time for my cats to adjust to this new gadget. One of the main reasons I got this was to ensure they didn't wake me up early in the morning for food. However, that habit hasn't changed.App Update & Cloud Storage: While I appreciate software updates, the recent one seems to emphasize their cloud storage offering. It's become somewhat inconvenient to access videos that arenâ€™t on the cloud, which feels like a nudge towards a service I'm not particularly interested in.Final Thoughts:The PETLIBRO Automatic Cat Feeder with Camera does its primary job well, which is to feed. However, potential buyers might want to weigh the benefits of the camera feature against the price difference. While some features are commendable, there are areas of improvement that can enhance the overall user experience.3 month update: Still working well. Cats are now used to the feeder. So they come running when they hear the feeding announcement.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: 5G Wifi Feeder
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really easy to use, good capacity and feeds well', 'author': 'JeffKirby', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The App is great, easy to setup and set schedule. Lid seals on really nicely, even if knocked over it doesn't spill its food. Very easy to fill, clean etc with it all coming apart.Takes a little longer to 'feed' out the servings, but they seem the same size when finished. We serve 2 in the morning, 1 at lunch and 1 in the afternoon and cat seems to like it (she's a grazer). Comes running when she hears it in the morning.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works well so far, no unnecessary features', 'author': 'OJ', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We feed our cat dry food in the AM, and wanted an auto-feeder so she wouldnâ€™t associate us with breakfast and wake us up with meowing. We didnâ€™t need wifi, cameras, or anything else that could break or malfunction or complicate things - just a feeder where we could set the time and the portion size, so this fit the bill.Pros:â€¢ It was easy to set up the clock and set schedules and portion sizes while following along with the manual.â€¢ I also like that pretty much every piece that touches the food can be washed including the container and the silo that pushes the food out. You have to wipe out the chute manually since itâ€™s attached to the electronic part which is no big deal.â€¢ It runs without the batteries in, but I like the battery option for going away just in case the power ever went out when we werenâ€™t home.â€¢ I unplugged it once to add a longer power cord and thought I would have to reset the whole program, but after about 20-30 seconds it automatically maintained what I had already set, which is nice.â€¢ Our cat isnâ€™t a food fiend so hasnâ€™t tried to break into it, but the twist lock on the top seems like it would prevent that pretty well.â€¢ One portion is about 1/8 cup of our kibble. The small 3L size holds a surprising amount of food and using the smallest portion size 2x per day, should last at least a monthâ€™s worth or more.â€¢ Weâ€™re transitioning our cat from the dry food she had at the shelter to one thatâ€™s a bit more high quality and using this has made it a breeze to transition slowly over the month - I simply added her old food at the bottom, a mix of the two in the middle, and the new food on top, so each day a little bit more of the new food gets mixed in.Cons:â€¢ Itâ€™s a little rough to take the container off the base, and twist the silo part off as well - I split a nail in the process! Someone with mobility issues or neuropathy would likely have a tough time.â€¢ Wish the cord was a little longer. Itâ€™s a bit under 5ft and I needed 6 to secure it along the wall and make it look nice where I wanted to place it, so I had to buy a longer one. Itâ€™s also a USB-C to USB-A cable which makes it bulkier where I need to plug it in.â€¢ Wish it had a â€œskipâ€ or â€œholdâ€ option. While learning our catâ€™s habits I sometimes manually dispensed a portion but would forget that the timed one was still coming, so sheâ€™d get extra.Misc/Overall:Didnâ€™t use or need the recording feature, since our goal was to not have her associate us with food, so canâ€™t speak to that. I bought a pack of desiccant packets from another brand which Iâ€™ll plan on swapping out once per month. Iâ€™d also recommend manually dispensing a portion or two the first time you fill it/whenever you refill it until the food comes out, because the first one came out empty - the food needs to make its way down the chute, and then it works fine. Overall weâ€™ve only had this feeder for a short time but it seems to be functioning just fine.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars PetLibro Upgraded WIFI Pet Feeder', 'author': 'Jinglepaws', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I purchased this feeder back in October. Initially, I had some issues with this unit. The battery compartment in the original base had springs that were the wrong size rendering the battery backup function unusable. But PetLibro stood behind its product and replaced the faulty base. Problem solved. I just had another issue with the notification function in the app not working properly and, although I had to go through two different customer service representatives, I finally got that issue fixed as well. The fact that PetLibro stands behind its products and follows up on active customer service cases is a huge plus in its favor, huge. You just don't see actual customer service much anymore. Although I had a rocky start, I now wouldn't hesitate to purchase another PetLibro product in the future.The unit, which is now fully functional, is great. My kitty is all about food and cannot self regulate her eating. I already had gotten a PetLibro non WIFI feeder back in the spring. I decided to upgrade in order be able to virtually monitor the feeder functions from my tablet. This newer WIFI has a low food warning, so you don't have to manually check the food reservoir frequently, a tighter, better closing lid (better to keep critters out), the ability to provide snacks and change meal times/sizes remotely without having to touch the physical unit itself (which is much easier and less of a hassle) and it also enables you to increase/ decrease the volume on announcements. The food reservoir has a nice large capacity. I've had zero issues with kibble jamming up the despenser mechanism. The app itself is a little rough around the edges and does need some improvements. The interface is somewhat clunky and primitive both in appearance and layout but I get the impression that the company is working on that. The one thing I really think needs to be improved on the feeder is the design of the food bowl. It doesn't lock into place and is too easily nudged out of position sometimes causing food to be dispensed on the floor rather than in the bowl. But, overall, it's a very good WIFI enabled feeder. It's owner and kitty ðŸˆ approved.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Extremely happy!', 'author': 'Sarah RM Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this to replace another smart feeder from a different brand that we had for about 6 years that finally stopped working. Let me just say I love this one so much more, wow! The footprint is small and compact and it actually looks really nice. It also isn't super loud when the food comes out. AND it's much cheaper than that other brand...as long as this feeder lasts us a good handful of years I'll be ecstatic.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Life changing for older cat.', 'author': 'Cheryl S. Newman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My cat is 13 and recently started frequently vomiting after eating. Apparently this is common in older cats. We tried a raised sloped bowl with no improvement. The vet suggested 5-6 small meals a day instead of twice a day. I bought this, set it up to feed him 1 portion every 3 hours from 6 am until 9 pm. It has solved his problem. Great product. Easy to set up. Easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable feeder', 'author': 'edwin matsuda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We bought this product to feed our dog while we were going on a trip. We feed her twice a day and had someone checking in on her but wanted her morning feeding to be automated.Thus fit the need perfectly.When we switched to feeding our dog from once a day to twice a day, she got trained to expecting her food at that time or even earlier. She started barking at us from 5 am. Not so bad on a work day but on the weekends it got old fast. By switching to this automated feeder she has not begged us for her morning feeding.We feed her a Hillâ€™s ID prescription food which comes in a non round / uniform shape, about 12-14 mm wide. I was a bit concerned that it would plug in the feeder but it has not plugged yet. Sometimes you can hear it struggling a bit as it turns and kibbles readjust. Turns and provides a consistent amount of food. For our food we set it at 6 and it measures out just under one cup of food. Their 7 setting gives just over one cup. Considering that the sizes Iâ€™d say it is fairly accurate and consistent in measurement of food.I have it plugged into our block rocker usb so not running off batteries. If the power goes off there is enough power to keep it running. It has the option to put batteries in but I opted out cause I can envision not checking these and having them corrode.The build quality is good. If I were to an add anything I would say to add loops or other provision for straps. It is light so my dog can knock it over. I have seen others strap it down and loops incorporated into the sleek design would make it perfect. Iâ€™d say design it to strap to a 25 lb Olympic plate or two 20 lb plates would be nice. It stores about 15-16 cups of food. So far we have not had any ant issues.There is an upgraded unit with sealed food compartment but the reviews are not as good on that one. I have had this unit running about two months without any issues.Reliable features I like:Clock has stayed on time.Feeder does not jam.Able to provide a consistent amount of food', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far, so good.', 'author': 'T.O. Joe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The best thing so far about this feeder is the set up. Seamless connection to my 2.4/ 5ghz mesh network. Super easy. The app is also really easy to navigate. I like the see-through window to see how much food is left. I like the "meal call" feature. I haven\'t had any problems yet with food jamming or "ghost" notifications like low food levels or low battery like other reviews had mentioned. I haven\'t really needed the lock feature quite yet. My cat is smart, but not that smart. I also do really like the backup battery power. We lose our power quite a lot. It\'s good to know at least our cat will be fed for at least as long as the batteries last before we get home.I think the only thing that I\'m gonna regret is not buying the one with the camera. We are out of the house traveling a lot. Our last one (Antblocker) had a camera and it was nice to have live video confirmation of our pet actually being fed rather than just relying on the app to tell us. I usually set up an auxiliary camera anyway. So maybe it won\'t be an issue.I am noticing that portion size may be a tiny bit inaccurate. My pictures show the lowest possible amount to be dispensed 1/12 cup. Seems it may be more towards an 1/8 C or more. Our cat has been used to 3 small portions of dry food throughout the day (including 1/3 can of wet twice a day). I wish there was a smaller portion size. We may have to drop to twice a day. And, the desiccant pouch in the lid is a nice touch but may be overkill. I don\'t plan on buying desiccant packs for a pet feeder.Overall and so far, it seems it\'s gonna be a good product. I\'m gonna give it 5 stars but, wish there was a 4 1/2. I will update review if I run into any problems.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Tamper proof for persistent kitty', 'author': 'Alyssa', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Okay so I have three cats that all need their own specific portions: 2 female kitties that could binge until they pop and a grazer male that has learned how to make the best of a feeding schedule.My kitties are conditioned to eat in separate areas of the house at 6 am and 6pm more or less. However, a new job for my partner and I has left us not being able to get home for their 6pm feedings on time.I had considered automatic feeders for awhile but as I have said, with 3 cats.. 3 feeders is expensive and I didnâ€™t want to invest in anything ridiculously overpriced or something that wouldnâ€™t work consistently.I did not need an app or any of that nonsense really. I already have cameras in my house so I didnâ€™t need the extra gizmos and gadgets. I was specifically looking for: affordable, consistent portion control, something that can stand up to two very determined kitties and simplicity.PROS:You have the option to set up to 6 meals per day.Portion size works as follows: 1 portion is about 1/8 cup â€” this was consistent for the 10 times I tried it and will update if that changes.It deposits the food fairly timely..It is rather quiet, not a whole lot of whirring and noise, my cats were completely unbothered but mine think anything that gives them food is well worth any risk.Itâ€™s easy to set up. I like this feature cause Iâ€™m not willing to buy a ten pack of D batteries every few months no thank you. She is VERY familiar with puzzle bowls and to her this was no exception.. however, much to her dismay she has been unable to pry it apart. Thank GOODNESSYou can probably use other bowls for this if you slightly elevate the tank. Literally put a dictionary under it and slide a maze bowl underneath. You may as well use a can tied to a string to get your message across.The user interface aka â€œthe buttonsâ€ â€” this was annoying because itâ€™s like setting an old digital alarm clock in that you have to cycle through ALL SIX FEEDING TIMES whether youâ€™re using them or not to get to your clock/time whatever. This was mainly an issue for me while setting the time cause I accidentally set it to AM instead of PM, oops, silly me, thatâ€™ll be a quick fixâ€” OH NVM I have to cycle allllll the way back through to switch that, if you click too fast then you gotta cycle again. How fun.This was the only reason I docked a star but past that, itâ€™s fine.You can manually give 1 portion, I donâ€™t think thereâ€™s a way to make it more than that, also it will still give their designated feeding portion even if you give a manual one so keep that in mind.I will continue experimenting with this and update if I find anything new or fun to talk about, enjoy the video of my kitty being very disappointed.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love it. Love it. Love it. (Black autofeeder, no camera)', 'author': 'MrFreePress', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Read great review first then come back here.Immediate 5 star if seller can tell me how to turn off the device touch screen entirely because by day 3 my dog figured out how to unlock the feeder and then feed herself.REVIEW: Just what I needed. my 10mo old pup was having digestive issues and I wanted a way to refine her feeding schedule and amounts. More feedings in restricted smaller amounts haved helped her overcome daily purging. (ick) I\'ve never owned an automatic feeder and I bought this PetLibro version because it allows up to 10 scheduled feedings a day and all 7 days may be customized individually, though I only use the copy day feature at this time to make all days the same. What I find very valuable is that each scheduled feeding may be sized from 0-4cups of kibble(food) in 1/12 increments, so 48 different feeding sizes that I measured to be very accurate cup for cup. Understand the physics of it though because smaller the kibble(size of dry food) the more accurate the measurements. If you want to know exactly how much kibble is dispensed then (clean and dry all pieces that come in contact with food first), assemble dry parts, fill container, dispense 2-3 full cups first to ensure the internal air pockets are removed to ensure accurate measurements, then dispense and measure each of the levels from 1/12th to 12/12ths and compare it to your normal feeding size. KNOW THIS - medium to large kibble won\'t function well in this feeder. I intend to continue using the small kibble Purina Puppy Chow and I feel good about the feeder\'s size precision. At $70 the price is right as I didn\'t feel the need to spend more to add a camera to the feeder. Install and use of the mobile app was very easy and straightforward. I like option to record my own voice that plays prior to each feeding. What\'s cool is that everyone in my family may record a "Come Eat" audio and you can manually change which ones plays anytime you want from within the app. Oh, and the app may be installed on multiple phones so that everyone in the family can keep track of feedings and alerts. I did learn that the app\'s auto find of device from phone only works AFTER plugging in the PetLibro feeder. I installed the 3 \'D\' size batteries first and lights appear as does minimal functionality however Bluetooth signal is off until the device is also plugged in. Some reviews reported that they couldn\'t connect phone to feeder however I believe this was their issue. The batteries are designed for back up only when loss of power occurs - the device turns off wifi and BT to conserve energy to ensure dog gets fed. The food container holds 5 days of food for my 50# Labradoodle and the device has indicator light and an app push notification to indicate time for food refill. Food container looks to have a good tight seal to keep food fresh. There is also a desiccant pouch that should be replaced every week or month - though I\'ve read that desiccant\'s may be renewed in microwave or dehydrator. Careful though, I melted one in a microwave once.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great Customer Service!', 'author': 'Sandy Shore', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This feeder and its App were easy to set up. Once the schedule is set, the feeder has been delivering on time every time. When the food gets very low, a red light comes on the unit and a notification appears on my phone. This failed to happen the first time, so I contacted PetLibro and received a very prompt reply with instructions (complete with pictures!!) of how to be sure I had set it up correctly. Now that function works perfectly.Although the food has always been delivered at the scheduled times and amounts, the "Feeding Successful" phone notifications are sometimes delayed. Again the Customer Service/tech help has been extremely helpful and persistent solving the issue. It is so refreshing and unusual to find such good service these days!After using the Granary for 6 weeks, I feel confident in its ability to deliver food as needed. I love that the food bowl is stainless steel. My 2 cats ate together from the previous food bowl I was using. This Granary bowl is smaller so they usually take turns. Perhaps I should have gotten the one with 2 bowls.I appreciate that the unit has battery backup. I have not used the Meal Call feature. The sound of kibble hitting the stainless bowl is enough to alert the cats.I would definitely recommend this feeder.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I thought I would only use this feeder when we went away like I did the perpetual feeder, but this has been so wonderful, it is our new permanent daily feeding station. But, after running away for a couple of seconds then approaching cautiously the first 2 or 3 dispenses, her kibble addiction overrode her fear. By day 3, this girl already learned the schedule. Would definitely recommend this product!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cats love it', 'author': 'Johnny Beals', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Since we have a busy schedule itâ€™s nice to have an automated feeding system that allows us to feed the cats when weâ€™re busy and not home', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Feed the Cats/Dogs on a Normal Schedule', 'author': 'John J.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We are avid campers, and as such, we are often gone for 3 or 4 day weekends. Since we don't take our cats with us, we normally just dump a mega bowl full of dry food for them just before we leave out. The problem with cats is they will try and eat all the food as quickly as possible, something to do with their primal instincts I think. So when I saw this Veehoo Automatic Cat Feeder, I knew I wanted to test it out. Set-up was a breeze and you can even record your voice telling the kitties to come get their food! There are multiple timers either manual ones or preset ones, all easy to use. We now use this non-stop and really enjoy knowing the cats get feed at regular intervals! There was only one little thing I did not like, and it's just my preference, but I wanted the feeder to have some more weight in the bottom so the cats would have a hard time knocking the whole thing over. They play really hard in the feeding area, and I know it just a matter of time before one hits and knocks the feeder over. Other than that, I think you will really like this auto feeder, we sure do.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Feeding the cats just got so easy!', 'author': 'Jen Kubeck', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We have two cats. They're very active, and seem to CONSTANTLY be hungry! We're getting older and it's not easy for us to be jumping up to feed the cats all day.This dry food dispenser changed everything in half a day! First, the product was very well packaged - securely set into neat layers in the box, wrapped in protective plastic and with thin sheets of soft foam between the layers. The manual was right on top, easy to find.I like that the power cord is a fabric braid cover, I feel that they're more durable and less attractive to pets for chewing on. It has a USB plug, but unlike so many companies these days, the wall plug was included in the package!Set up is easy, just follow the instructions, and don't be afraid to try. Pressing a wrong button won't do anything worse than make you start over. Keep going, you'll get it. There are settings for feeding time (NOTE: the time is a 24-hour clock, not 12. PM hours should be designated as 13 - 24), number of portions (1-9), and to record a 10-second message to call your pets to the bowl.My final note: Read the manual carefully. There are some funny translation and grammar variations from standard American English. Match what you read to the buttons as you set it up, and you'll be fine.My cats now get fed automatically four times a day. They have already become more relaxed and playful, not always demanding to be fed RIGHT NOW. title: Slow Feeder Cat Bowl, Cute Tilted Elevated Bowls and Dishes for Cats & Small Dogs, Anti Vomiting Raised Pet Bowl for Dry and Wet Food, 3.5'' High, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The cat likes it', 'author': 'The Stah', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The bowl is sturdy easy to put together and cleans easily. Our kitty seems to have a better time eating from the raised bowl than the low bowl we had before overall, we are very pleased with it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No more inhaling food', 'author': 'RoRo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I occasionally pet sit for my mom. She lives over an hour away so itâ€™s easier if the cats stay at my house. Plus, they get more attention (that they act like they donâ€™t want, but actually do). The problem is, they are picky about their stuff, so we used to bring their stuff to my house, but that was becoming a burden. So, I am getting new stuff at my place for them to use. We must acclimatize them to the new feeder so they will use it when they are at my place. Once they do, this will work well for one of the cats who is like a vacuum and inhales his food. Most cats eat neatly and politely. This cat unhinges his jaw and sucks it all in. Then he regurgitates it on the floor, five minutes later. The food is still whole. No idea why he does it. They both have food, and the other cat never goes near his food. My mom got him a slow feeder for her house, and it has worked well. This one is similar in size, so it will work well too. The feeder is 3.5â€ high 2â€ deep. 5â€ in width and length. It seems to be good quality. There are no imperfections that I can see, which means it was manufactured well. It seems sturdy and will stay in place. It looks very nice. Buffy approves and so do I.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stylish and durable pet food or water dish!!', 'author': 'Mamakathy1966', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Beautiful heavy-weight plastic (food-grade polymer resin) elevated, slightly tilted food dish with six barrier walls inside the dish to help your pet eat or drink slower. I think it\'s a good collection to our cat dishes and hope this is the one to end our search for cat-feeder perfection.I do like this material over ceramic/porcelain, stainless or plastic/acrylic. Very nice.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "2.0 out of 5 stars Would be great if it wasn't plastic", 'author': 'Madeleine CRAIG', 'rating': 2, 'content': "I didn't read the title of this item carefully enough. I saw the word porcelain and was excited to find a slow feeder that wasn't plastic. Except that's exactly what it is. Plastic. It just uses a bunch of confusing language about that. I can't use plastic feeding bowls because it irritates my cat's nose. Also, the fact that it's plastic undermines the sturdiness of the feeder. It's two pieces - the slow feeding bowl which then fits on top of the base. Nothing securely attaches, and because it's plastic and lightweight, the top feeding bowl is very easily knocked off the base, making a food mess on the floor. If this thing were actually porcelain, it would resolve all those problems, but it's not. It's just plastic.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars DNOYEUS Tilted Raised Slow Feeder review', 'author': 'Water Bottle Incident', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'My problem with this slow feeder bowl is that the trenches in the bottom where the food rests are too deep - at least for my 5 month old kitten who is an eating machine - so she just doesn\'t even try to get the food out of there anymore. I also want to know exactly what "Food Grade Porcelain Imitated Material" is.It\'s cute and fits together well but it just didn\'t work for my cat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Needs non-slip bottom', 'author': 'tfordyce', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This dish is good quality, heavy-duty plastic. The base of the dish was pretty scuffed up during shipping, unfortunately, but the top of the dish fared just fine.As a slow feeder, the dish works reasonably well. It doesn't help a whole lot with the first half of the meal, as the dish collects all the food in the center, but my cat definitely has to slow down during the second half.I picked this up as a tandem product with an auto-feeder. The auto-feeder comes with a basic shallow bowl, and my cat always inhales his food from it. While he's trying to get at the second half of his food, he slides his dish halfway around the room. This really needs a no-skid bottom on it to prevent this from happening. I'm thinking about getting some spiked plastic - like might go under an office chair for carpet - and hot-gluing that to the bottom to put this on a rug and see if that would fix the issue.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice design but deep', 'author': 'K.A.J', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I like how this bowl is designed. I set up her feeding schedule in the App and it dispensed perfectly. Although the dry food must be smaller than a certain size in order to go through the dispenser, the size requirement is much bigger than most dry food on the market so I don't see that's an issue. The bowl is stainless steel which is better than plastic because plastic sometimes causes feline acne.I mainly use the monitor function because my cat is a picky eater and she only has one kidney. I need to know when and how much she eats and how much she drinks. The camera detects the cat very accurately and moves with her to make sure she's in the camera so that I can see her. Even when she's not in the camera, I can move the camera angel in the App to see my room. My cat is also very needy. The camera has a laser light that can be turned on on the App. That being said, I can play with her even at work.The App gives me a detailed diary of her daily activities such as eating time, playing time, and many other activities. And I can watch the activities replay on demand. I can also watch her live, talk to her, and hear the sound in my room on the App.Overall, I'm very glad I got the device before her surgery so I can monitor her these days. She likes it too because it gives her something to do while I'm not at home.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Its cool, not too pricey given its capacilities', 'author': 'Vance M.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "It's a neat tool that allows you to minimally track how much your pets are eating and allows you to automate feeding for about 3- 4 weeks for our two cats. Is it for everyone, no. Is it for us, I don't know. We got it on sale so I'm sure that's helped validate keeping it beyond its return date. I wanted one that tracks and prevents feeding, however, they are limited in what they do beyond opening and closing doors based on the proximity of a tag placed on the collar; not to mention, that the good ones cost way more than this tower. 4 star sits right for me.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Multifuctional Robot For Cats and Humans', 'author': 'Rob', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'HHOLOVE seems to be very customer and pet oriented. Any questions I have had have been answered in a timely manner.The packing in genius. Once you are done unboxing, you can turn the box into a little cat house.The device needs to be connected to power and Wi-Fi in order to fully work, but a AA battery option is available. This will only keep the feeding schedule going. (No other functionality will not be available.)O Sitter has light animations next to the camera that show the status of the device. See Manual and website for more details. I like this functionality because it gives you an idea of what is going on with the device.With in the app, you can manually control the camera, laser and feeding times. the app can also recommend and schedule specific times for feeding based on your cats breed, age, and weight.From the app you can also record and take pictures of your pet form anywhere.O Sitter does include a do not disturb mode where the camera will not record or track. During this time the camera will turn to face the back of the device.Prosâ€¢ This is a great multifunctional device specially for the price, especially if you got it for $109 during the Kickstarter campaign.â€¢ Having a backup battery keeps your feeding schedule going in the event of a power outage.â€¢ You can add home surveillance and keep track of your pets when you are out.â€¢ The laser is a great for play time and a good distraction for your pets when you are in meetings if you work from home.â€¢ HHOLOVE is dedictaed to keeping personal date protected.Con kinda.â€¢ The battery backup does not give you full capabilities, it will keep the feeding schedule going though.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Automatic Cat Food Dispenser: Programmable Timed Feeding Pet Dry Food Feeder 3L Dual Power Supply Design 1-4 Meals a Day with Stainless Steel Bowl
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super easy to use!', 'author': 'Amber', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got one on Friday to test it out, and it works so well that Iâ€™m ordering 2 more 48 hours later so all three of my cats have one!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Soothes the savage beastâ€¦', 'author': 'susan murphy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works so well I can now sleep late in the mornings. I donâ€™t miss the caterwauling of a starved cat. Abit difficult to set, directions could be clearer for non intuitive people. Lid difficult to lift off with my arthritic hands. A handle would be wonderful.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars So far, we are loving this feeder for our cat!', 'author': 'Betricia', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'So far, we like this cat feeder. It is the first one we have tried. After reading reviews for other feeders, I wish I had purchased one that had 6 feeding times instead of this one that only has 4 feeding times. However, we have worked with this one and it is working great so far! It does have a nice large bin to hold the food, so it should last several weeks at a time. It uses 3 "D" batteries as a backup and has a USB plug with an adapter that plugs into the wall. The batteries seem to only be as a backup in case the electricity goes out so the feedings will continue using the battery power. The timer setup was pretty easy and straight forward. It uses military time instead of 12-hour time, but that wasn\'t a problem. It automatically locks after you set it up so your animal can\'t press any of the buttons to feed themselves at off-times!When we first set it up and the first food came down the shoot and hit the bowl, our cat jumped and ran away! She was afraid of it! I brought her over to the feeder to show her what the noise had been and show her the food in the bowl and she ate it. The next time the food came down, she didn\'t jump but I had to show her that her food was there again. The third time the food came down and hit the bowl, our cat ran like lightening to the bowl to get her food! She knew exactly what the noise was. She can hear it from anywhere in our house and now when she hears it, she\'s off like a shot!Our cat is overweight so it is nice to be able to split up her feedings into smaller feedings so she doesn\'t eat so much or eat so fast. She only gets 7 tablespoons a day (a little less than half-cup), so I have her being fed 2 tablespoons at 6:00 a.m., 2 tablespoons at 10 a.m., 2 tablespoons at 4:00 p.m. and just one tablespoon at 9:00 p.m. We had to adjust the times to try to find the correct ones for her body. These are the times that seem to be working great for her. She doesn\'t beg us in between feedings because she\'s hungry anymore, which is great!If you think your animal needs an extra portion anytime, you can just unlock it and press on the up and down buttons at the same time to dispense one portion into the bowl. If you do that, it says that it doesn\'t affect the regular feeding schedule. You would just be giving your pet a little bit extra that day.I haven\'t tried to clean this machine yet, but it looks like it cannot be taken apart. It says to just wipe it out with a damp rag. Some of the other feeders I looked at after I ordered this one say that they come apart for easy cleaning. I think that would probably be a lot better than just wiping it out with a damp rag. I\'m sure our next feeder (if we ever need to buy one because this one wears out) will be one that we can take apart to clean. Other than that, this feeder does a great job at feeding our cat!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It works well', 'author': 'Jerbeth', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have a wonderful rescue girl who thinks she needs to eat all the time. The timed and measured portion feeder is great and will help control how much she eats. She is on a combination wet and dry diet and this feeder helps me in spacing meals out even when I am not at home.It took me a little bit to figure out the setting process when came as no surprise. I measured the amount coming out and it is exactly one tablespoon leading me to feel it will be a great addition to Sukiâ€™s equipment.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent customer service on issues', 'author': 'Sally Ann Smith-Hooks', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We purchased this Auto Pet Feeder in May of 2023. We truly loved that it fed our kitty up to 4 meals a day. On 2 occasions this month we found the feeder had dumped the entire contents of the food. I sent an email to help@imipaw.com, on Feb, 6th, and received a prompt reply the same day, apologizing, and explained that it was a product failure, and that they would send me a new feeder. I received a new feeder 4 days later. I would not hesitate to do business with this company again. Excellent customer satisfaction and service.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very good for timed meals and easy to set up!', 'author': 'ryanwebster', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This product was exactly what I was looking for! Now if feed them on command if necessary since I look at the home camera to see if theyâ€™ve eaten and if theyâ€™re still hungry.The one thing is wish this product would do is give an alert that the bin is empty or will soon be empty as twice itâ€™s happened that the scheduled feeding goes off only nothing comes out so my dog will not eat until I get home which is sad for me to think I canâ€™t get home fast enough!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Good product', 'author': 'Applesauce', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My cats have a love hate relationship with these. Mainly for the fact that they canâ€™t get the food all the time. They app is nice so if you want to put another portion to come out you just click a button. I bought two one for each of my cats and both shoot out food at the correct time. It holds quite a bit of food so youâ€™re not filling it up too often and great if Iâ€™m gone overnight! Itâ€™s also keeping my cats from getting overweight as well', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "3.0 out of 5 stars Too inconsistent for my cat's needs", 'author': 'element2011', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'My cat is on a very controlled diet because he has a propensity to gain weight. So I\'ve been using a kitchen scale to measure his meals.Sadly, I will have to return the IMIPAW pet feeder. The company did a great job packing the product and the unboxing experience was terrific. The app was easy to figure out with just one small translation problem. The words "feed number" is their translation for the number of portions the device will deliver with that meal. In other words, its the number of times the rotating gear will turn to release another bunch of food. The rotating gear seems to be a flexible plastic or silicone.The reason I might have to return the product is inconsistent weights and occasional jams. I used my kitchen scale to measure how much food it was delivering with each portion. So basically I loaded the machine with food, and for about an hour I kept pressing the manual feed button and took the weights of the food, over and over. It varied between 4.21g and 9.32g per delivery.I like my guy to have 6g per meal consistently, so I\'m a little concerned with the overly large portions that come out sometimes. That\'s one and a half times what I\'m intending him to eat per meal.What scared me though is three times during my hour of testing, the machine completely jammed and no food was delivered, but the app sent the message that it was a successful delivery. The machine did not clear itself, so then the next meal also failed, and the one after that, and the one after that. Opening the top and manually stirring up the kibble successfully cleared the jam.Two other things to mention. My cat walked up to the feeder and immediately started eating from it, so there\'s no worries there. It\'s nice and quiet, too. Also my cat\'s dry food are Y-shaped kibbles. Maybe that is why the machine jammed or isn\'t delivering food evenly. If he had round kibbles, maybe the machine would be more successful. I have not seen any other reviewer mention jams or inconsistent weights, so I think maybe the problem is partly due to his brand of food, which I\'m not willing to change.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent item', 'author': 'Twincitiesopie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Like the schedule and portions you can set up. Easy to use and set up. Great way to make fat cats mad.I recommend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Easy to put together and the removable bowls are great for easy cleaning.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PET PROOF!!!!!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My cat dragged this thing across the kitchen trying to break in and got nothing!!!! Thanks!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Automatic pet feeders for multiple pets', 'author': 'Liz', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Set up was not as easy as suggested in reviews. Our 4 cats will eat all the food available immediately so we needed small portions provided frequently. We ordered two pair of the feeders and will provide each kitty with his own feeder in different areas of the house when weâ€™re away.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Very hard to set up multiple feeders', 'author': 'ValGS', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I did not have very high expectations knowing that it's a basic inexpensive feeder. My goal was to have something that would not let my cats die while I am taking a short trip. I will start from cons. I have three cats, everyone who has three cats knows that they should get their food at the same time; otherwise, they'd all start eating from the same plate. My cats are also on a diet, they are fat and always hungry, so not only would they eat from the same plate, they would also fight. My idea was to set up the same time on all three feeders and then set the same schedule. Easy? Good luck with that. I thought setting up the time should not be an issue, you just unlock all three feeders, enter the time and then click a set button on all three simultaneously. Obviously, that's not how it works. You set up the time on the first one, then you try to set up the second one, and by the time you are ready, the first one locks itself and rolls back to the original settings. Also, you have to set the time and go through the entire scheduling exercise before it saves new settings. You do it on one, then you set the later time on the second one and wait for the first one to synch, then quickly go through the schedule and save your settings. Then you do the same thing on the third feeder. Needless to say, they do not dispose the food exactly at the same time, but after a bunch of attempts I was able to make them work within a few seconds. Don't ask me how frustrated I was at the end.Issue number two: they are small and not very stable. Three cats on a diet spend all their free time trying to figure out how to get the food out of the feeders. Here I have to compliment the manufacturer, my cats can't open the feeders or pull the food out through the opening. They can however, knock the feeders very easily. I wish there were suction cups on the bottom so I could stick the feeders to the tile or hardwood floor. I hope one day my cats will figure out that knocking the feeders does not help, but who knows, cats are weird and persistent in their weirdness.Now the pros: these are inexpensive and nice looking feeders that have a surprisingly good quality of the materials for this price. The dish is made from metal, and the first time the food fell out, it scared a hell out of my cats, but they quickly realized that this sound means their diet is over for a little while. The schedule works pretty well so far. I had an issue once when all of the sudden all three feeders stopped working for no reason. I went through the schedule without making any changes, and it fixed the problem. Hope it was a one time glitch maybe due to a power spike at night. I have to install the batteries, so it would not happen in the future. The portion control is also pretty good. I had to play with the size for a few days, but now when everything is set, I think my cats are getting a correct amount of food. Now I have to figure out how to handle one of the cats that inhales all the food like a vacuum cleaner and tries to steal from others, but I guess I can only do it with a fancy feeder that has a face control.Overall rating: three solid stars meaning it is satisfactory. Not very good, not excellent, but it does what it should do, and if I was not so mad setting them up, or at least if the instructions were more detailed and explained how to set up multiple feeders, I would have given four stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Utensilios electrÃ³nicos gatos', 'author': 'Maria', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Excelente', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great but inaccurate', 'author': 'Patricia', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We have 2 cats on 2 different foods. We had to figure it out on our own.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Like it, but canâ€™t figure out how to do portions.', 'author': 'Suzanne E.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Like it, but canâ€™t figure out how to do portions.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]
