The automatic dispenser often jams, causing frustration during feeding times. Additionally, the water dispenser leaks, creating messes. Overall, it's not the convenient solution I anticipated and I wouldn't recommend it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Keeps Water in its Place', 'author': 'S. Heilwagen', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My big Siamese loves to drag around the bowls at night and it was a constant worry with our hardwood floors, even with the bowls sitting on a boot mat. This feeder/water dispenser is heavy enough that I haven't seen him even attempt to drag it around. It was easy to put together and works as advertised. I still have it sitting in the boot mat, but I haven't noticed any water outside of the bowl because it doesn't allow too much up at a time. I do wish the grate the covers the water bowl would pop off to make cleaning easier when kibble gets in there between full clean outs. Maybe it does, but it is there snug and I was worried I'd break it if it wasn't meant to come out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Automatic Cat Feeders, 6L WiFi Timed Cat Feeder with 10s Dining Call, Cat Food Dispenser with Custom Schedule up to 12 Portions 10 Meals Per Day, APP Control (White-6L)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great feeder', 'author': 'Gabriel', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the Automatic Cat Feeder with 6L capacity and WiFi connectivity, and I couldn't be happier with my decision. The 10-second dining call feature ensures my cat never misses a meal, and the customizable schedule allows me to cater to my cat's feeding needs perfectly. With the ability to program up to 12 portions across 10 meals per day, this feeder offers unparalleled flexibility. The convenience of controlling it through the app makes my life so much easier. Overall, it's a fantastic investment for any cat owner looking to streamline feeding routines while keeping their furry friend happy and healthy. Highly recommended!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Stopped working after 3.5 months of use!!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I have had this product for only 4 months (only 3 months after the warranty expired) and it stopped working two weeks ago for no apparent reason.About 2 weeks after receiving the feeder, I set it up for my two kittens. It worked perfectly for 3.5 months with two regular feedings a day. Two weeks ago it stopped working, as in the white turbine inside stopped spinning but the app would still say "feed success".I tried many different avenues to try to get any action out of it; factory reset, re-downloading the app, reconnecting wifi, unplugging from wall and device, app feed, manual feed, I even took to a new house to a new wifi to see if that was it and nothing worked. It\'s important to also note that there are no indicators that there is a malfunction, the green light is on and solid and the red light shows like it\'s dispensing food, then goes away like normal, but it doesn\'t sound like it\'s even attempting to dispense.I expected to still be in warranty considering the price I paid for the product, but was severely disappointed that not only was it expired, but it had been for more than 3 months. There was no damage to the unit, it came in normal packaging without any visible mishandling, my cats weren\'t damaging it in any way(I have indoor cameras, I checked when it stopped working to see if this was the issue), there has been no power outages at my house and no wifi outages either. I even have back up batteries in the device in the event of a power outage.I sometimes travel for more than 3 nights away from my house so this feeder made it convenient to accommodate my cats while I was away. My biggest concern was it seemed to start malfunctioning while away. Since I wad given no notification that the device wasn\'t dispensing food like normal, I\'m only left to speculate how long my fur babies were without food.Overall, I was pleased with the product while it was functional but would not consider purchasing a feeder from this company again unless their warranty was extended. I feel that this warranty is not only unreasonable but lacks compassion. Considering that some people depend on products like this to keep their animals fed while they are on vacation, or work, or whatever would prevent the owner from missing a normal feeding.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars We Love It!', 'author': 'Sarina', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's perfect for busy fur parents. The app is very easy to use and set up feeding times with the portion size you want.For my little pup I give her half cup portions and I refill it every 2 weeks. I was surprised it holds up to 8 cups.Not recommended for large pets that require more than half cup portions or large sized nuggets.Definitely worth my time and money.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works great!', 'author': 'Meriel', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This device is really easy to set up! The app works wonderful. I like that they include a adapter and a silicon gel packet!The only thing to keep in mind is the kibble container is easy to fall off when you try to lift it up to move around. I recommend lifting from the bottom white part.Also the portion size is pretty small. For my small cat I have to do 7 portions/meal. I recommend you test out the portion size before using it.Overall, I am happy with this purchase', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars easy set up and usage from phone', 'author': 'Ariel colter', 'rating': 5, 'content': "great product for the price i have one for each cat all over the house, the cats haven't been able to break into it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Donâ€™t do it', 'author': 'Leah Sams', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Originally I was a fan. It was easy to set up and connect to the app. However it only worked for 2 weeks. Good thing I was paying attention or my poor cat would have gone hungry. In the app it said offline. Ok, I can deal with that and will recconect. I read the manual which didnâ€™t match to the feederâ€™s buttons at all. It said to turn off. There is no on/off switch. It said to push and hold the pairing button. Also nonexistent. I tried the 3 buttons it did have, set, microphone and feed to no avail. Gave up and returned.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No issues', 'author': 'J', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Have had this for 4 months now and never once a issue with feeding or connection. I do wish it had something to alert me when container is low. But holds a lot of food', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Not for persistent cats', 'author': 'Danielle D.', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'I wouldnâ€™t say my cat is food crazy or SUPER persistent, but he manages to rock this thing until more food comes out. He has also managed to remove the lid, because it is very easy to open, which my dog then chewed up. The app is also completely out of whack says the next feeding time is scheduled for â€œ9/10/2023â€ which was a month ago, and itâ€™s set to feed my cats twice every day. The thing is now completely useless unless I could buy a replacement lid (which I donâ€™t think I can) and if I can get the app to start working again. For the first 2 weeks of having it, it actually worked well, but again now itâ€™s useless', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Best budget feeder', 'author': 'Parker', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This feeder is better than one we bought for $40. Half the price and it comes with an app is super nice to have. I am not sure about longevity of this product but for the $20 I paid I am super happy with the portion size and my cat is well fed due to it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Itâ€™s perfect', 'author': 'Jody', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My cats love it. I can put the exact time to drop the food and you can even record a sound for when the food drops', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: FUKUMARU Automatic Cat Feeder, WiFi Automatic Dog Feeder with Freshness Preservation, 5L Timed Cat Food Dispenser with Elevated Bowls, Up to 10 Meals Per Day, Granary Pet Feeder for Cats/Dogs
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great!', 'author': 'Mariahw', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works good so far. Easy to put together and the app was easy to set everything up. It dispenses right on time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Quality Cat Feeder', 'author': 'Rob', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Functionality: This cat feeder works really well. It was easy to set up, and while it may be annoying to have to have another app on your phone for just one specific use, but at least it is easy to set up and use and you won't have to go to it often once you have a schedule set. I am a little disappointed because based on the pictures, I was under the impression this came with a single big bowl or the divided two bowls that you could swap out. But mine at least only had the two divided bowls. Unless there is some way to convert that to the single bowl that isn't obvious and doesn't come with instructions for. Regardless, it still functions fine to split the food into two bowls.Quality: Seems very high quality. Skeptical at first, as with most things with a funky brand name, but was not disappointed. Works as advertised and is a huge boost to convenience to not have to worry about feeding other than refilling the container.Value: Very good. Price seems high, but for what you are getting in a functional automatic cat feeder that could save you on pet sitter visits or having to rush home, it is worth it.Would I Buy? Yes, and I would recommend to others I know who have cats.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to set up', 'author': 'Crystal', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This thing is well-made and easy to clean. It was easy to set up the app and make a feeding schedule as well as do instant one-touch quick feedings. I took off a star because the amount it dispenses is VERY small. My cats usually get their daily food rationed into two feedings (morning and night) and are not used to grazing all day. I had to set it up to dispense food every minute for 5 minutes for one of their measured "servings". and then again for their nighttime feeding. The app only lets you do a total of 10 programmed feedings. so Ultimately I won\'t be using this on a regular basis but only for when i go out of town. If your cat likes a few crunchies here and there this might be a better option for you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Setup is a little weird, but it's great overall!", 'author': 'Ocean', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The feeder comes with the split/double bowl as well as detached legs to elevate the bowl and the feeder. The instructions made putting together the feeder pretty easy. I opted to elevate the feeder (I've been testing several different types of elevated bowls with my cats) and the legs were easy to slide onto the feeder and the bowl. It does still slide around a little on my hardwood floor, so I put it on a silicone mat which helped a lot.One downside is that the bowl does not 'snap' to fit into the feeder. There is a little rectangle cutout on the feeder and a protrusion on the bowl that lines up with it to fit the two together, but it doesn't lock into place. One of my cats pulls on the bowls and has misaligned the bowl with the feeder a few times.The app is simple once you have it set up. I was not able to get it set up with Wifi alone; I had to have Bluetooth active on my phone also, but once setup was done I was able to shut that off. I like that the feeder has both an outlet power option and a battery backup for if the power goes out.You can set the feeder to dispense multiple times a day. One thing I was confused about - it wasn't in the instructions and the app is not clear at all - was what the 'feed number' meant in the app. Reading the product description, I *think* what this means is the number of 'servings' of food the feeder dispenses. I thought it was literally the 'number' of the feed (example, I had 1 Feed at 4:00 AM, 2 at 12:00, 3 at 4:00 PM) when actually what I was doing was dispensing more and more food as the day went on. Oops!I have been pretty pleased with it so far. The steel bowls have some marks on them - my cat is a messy eater and has dribbled water into the bowl, which left water stains. My cats also haven't figured out how to get into the feeder (whether through the lid or by putting their paw into the dispenser chute) which is a huge relief, since one of them is capable of opening the food storage bin.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent cat feeder', 'author': 'K. Thornton', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got this for my cat and I've been very happy. I like to mix up several varieties of kibble and I store it in large plastic cannisters and this is more than big enough for one large cannister.Connecting it to the SmartLife app was very easy and setting up a schedule was a breeze.I've been using this for a bit over a month now and I've not had any problems with it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice elevated dual feeder', 'author': 'BossCat', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This feeder has an attractive and simple design where you can easily see the remaining kibbles easily through the diffused container. The feeder dispenses, and the divider separates the portion into the two bowls. Depending on the type of kibbles, for the most part, statistic average should have the divider separate the portion fairly evenly.The setup is easy to connect to app. As long as youâ€™ve had experienced connecting to smart devices, this is really a walk in the park. Make sure that your Bluetooth is working, and the initial setup would be establishing connecting from your phone to the feeder, as thatâ€™s how itâ€™ll receive the WiFi configuration from your app connection.After setting up the app, youâ€™ll have the full capability of the feeder including setting up scheduling to control portions.The feeder can be powered through the provided cable, or through 3x D batteries. The D batteries are very hefty, so even on battery power (which could serve as backup power) it should easily last half a year to a year. Note that this is my estimate for the battery power based on testing many feeders.The steel bowls are easily removable for washing, and I really like the fact that itâ€™s stainless bowls. This means that for more sensitive cats that may be prone to feline acne can use this feeder + bowl without having to worry about outbreak. And the elevated legs is very welcoming, as there arenâ€™t many feeders in the market that offer elevated bowls.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars No portion control', 'author': 'Lindsey', 'rating': 1, 'content': "This automatic feeder does not dispense a consistent amount of kibble. Even two weeks into using it, I was constantly measuring how much kibble came out and it was always different. Not to mention the plastic divider to separate the kibble into two bowls does not evenly distribute it...at all. My cats eat 1/4 cup of dry food twice per day (with a small snack at 4:30 am to keep them at bay) and when I finally found what I thought was the right amount, I had to set the feeder to go off once, and then a second time 5 minutes later...if I didn't separate the feeding by 5 mins, all the kibble gets stuck up at the top.It's also quite loud. I'm a light sleeper in general but their food setup is in another room, so I still think that's too loud. The setup was easy and the app works great but unfortunately I would not recommend this.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Unstable', 'author': 'TS8466', 'rating': 2, 'content': "This is similar to others - and the legs are not whole; they are unstable. I can't comment on the features because I returned knowing it was a disappointment. I cannot recommend unless you plan to modify the legs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Almost perfect', 'author': 'Valerie P.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I'd give it 5 stars if I could set it without the app. Other than that, I really like this feeder. It was easy to assemble. The app was easy to set up. It dispenses a good portion. It can hold up to 5lbs of food. The plastic is very sturdy and should last.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars An alright automatic cat feeder', 'author': 'Alison Williams', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I had no problems assembling this feeder or connecting to the app. I like that it has 2 separate bowls for my 2 cats and that you can set an extremely customizable feeding schedule. I do dislike, however, that with each feeding the feeder seems to only dispense a spoonful or 2 of kibble at a time. This may be because of the shape of the brand I use (Purina sensitive skin). I have solved this by just programming multiple small feeds throughout the day which the cats seem to be okay with.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Impressed! Effective feeder.', 'author': 'Melissa Rosado', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So I purchased this after another one of my Surefeed feeders malfunctioned. Also, the collar does breakaway.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, I donâ€™t have to be the food police anymore', 'author': 'Deven LoSchiavo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was hesitant to buy this due to some of the negative reviews, but for me it works exactly as advertised. I bought two to stop my adult cat from eating my kittenâ€™s food and vice versa.The tag size complaints are somewhat overblown, yes theyâ€™re a little big but theyâ€™re very lightweight. Even my 5 month old kitten was used to it within a day. The feeders were easy to set up in the app and Iâ€™ve had no issues with either cat getting into the wrong feeder (and believe me theyâ€™ve tried).One minor issue, the section of the app that is supposed to track the number of times the cat eats in a day doesnâ€™t seem to work for me. Also, I do wish there was a setting to keep the lid open unless the cat with the wrong tag tries to eat from it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Works great, but the RFID tag is the downfall', 'author': 'Monny', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'The product works as described, it\'s great in that you can control how much you feed your pet, and monitor which pet is eating and for how long. You can modify the open/close speed to allow your pet time to get used to the movements of the lid and also can modify how long the lid stays open when they are no longer within the RFID range. Another small detail I enjoy is that you can record a mealtime message in the app, so whenever you have the auto-feeder setup you can have the device say "dinner time" or whatever you want in your own voice while it feeds your pet.There are two downsides for me though that really make this not a complete product:First, it would be really nice if they had a live camera/microhpone built in. This would help a lot during the training phase to see how your pet is reacting when going near it, it also would help when you are out of town and want to monitor/speak to your pet.Second, the RFID chip is massive! The picture in the product listingmade me believe that you could slide it on another collar and that\'s not the case. The only way to attach it to the non-original collar is to use a ring (which is included in the box). However, the chip swings around freely and is absolutely massive for a cat. I could see this being a negligible point for a medium-sized and above dog. However, we have a very skittish cat and the RFID chip is bothering her too much throughout the day to make it worthwhile. If they could either decrease the size of the chip, allow pet microchips to be synced or maybe even have some kind of fabric pocket that slides on the collar rather than dangling down, it would greatly improve this product and allow for use even with the most skittish of pets.Overall if those downsides aren\'t the end of the world for you or your pet, then this product is really great! It was packaged nicely, easy to put together, and made with high quality materials. It seems to be a reasonable price compared to like-products on the market and Petlibro has always had great products from the few I\'ve purchased (we also have several of their water fountains, which are amazing).Update: After about a week of use, this product is getting worse. It has issues dispensing food. If the bowl isn\'t virtually empty it will cause a backup and won\'t dispense more food. My cat for whatever reason prefers to eat from the front and sides of the bowl first. This leaves any remaining food at the rear of the bowl . This device registers this as the bowl being full and doesn\'t allow more to be dispensed. Other issues I can forgive, but when the sole purpose of the device is to feed your pets and the device has a flaw that prevents it from doing this, that\'s just a bad product. Do NOT buy these feeder until they fix things.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Randomly dispenses food outside of scheduled time', 'author': 'TTFN999', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I bought two because our older cat decided her "little sister" shouldn\'t get to eat (she was eating all her food and the leftover food from the younger cat). My biggest concern was that my cats weren\'t going to figure out how to use it, but they did. Cool features in the app even allow you to schedule food to be dispensed periodically throughout the day, so we set up four small feedings (20 g, 10g, 10g and 20g) to be dispensed for breakfast, lunch, snack and supper. The feeders are kept in separate rooms.After I set up feeding schedules for both feeders in the app, each feeder has now randomly dispensed a full day\'s worth of food (all four feedings) between scheduled feedings. The first feeder did it the same day we set them up. We encouraged the cats to hang around so they could see the food being dispensed. Neither of them were near the dispenser at the time (several feet away). It only happened one time for that one feeder, so we chalked it up to a technology glitch (maybe I didn\'t set it up right, didn\'t save something, etc.) That was on Friday, (a day or two after we got it), and it worked as expected over the weekend, dispensing breakfast, lunch, snack and supper portions at the scheduled times.Yesterday (Tuesday), the same thing happened with the second feeder. Both cats were several rooms away from the feeder, asleep on our bed about an hour after the third feeding time (which they slept through) when a full day\'s worth of food was dispensed - in four consecutive portions, just like what happened with the first feeder a few days before. It still dispensed the last scheduled feeding at the right time afterward.I\'m at a loss. These were not inexpensive. My vet recommended getting something like it so our older cat could eat only her food (and not eat her sister\'s food) - she needs to lose the extra weight. I\'m lucky she doesn\'t "wolf" everything in her bowl (or at least she hasn\'t yet), but I should be able to rely on them only getting one day\'s food servings in 1 day.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars RFID tag is bulky, feeder is too sensitive to chip proximity. Make this work with implanted chips!', 'author': 'Elisabeth B.', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Update: Like another reviewer, the feeder is seemingly dropping food at random, not on the schedule set within the app (we have a non-RFID feeder from this company that doesn't have this problem). It seems to be dropping at 10 minutes after the hour at random. I sent an email to Petlibro's support team, so we'll see what they say - but I'm leaning towards this expensive feeder getting returned.First, if this feeder operated from my cat's implanted microchip, it would be amazing. The large, bulky tag that must be worn bothers my cat, and he's constantly trying to remove it from his neck, so I'm unsure if this feeder will work for us. If the tag were smaller, it could possibly work - but I'd really love to not have to have my cat wear a collar at all.The feeder is also much too 'sensitive' to the microchip tag - so if my cat is sitting near / next to his feeder, the door will stay open - allowing his brother to sneak in and eat as much as he wants, or grab a mouth full of food and run off with it. We have one overweight cat who eats all of his brother's food, so this sort of defeats the purpose of having a feeder like this. I'm unsure if this is something that could be fixed via a firmware update, but it definitely has an impact on the functionality.The positives? The hopper is airtight and holds a lot of food, the feeder is beautifully designed, and it was extremely easy to connect to the app (I already have another Petlibro feeder and water fountain). I also love being able to customize it with my pet's name or a message.I'm unsure if we will be able to keep the feeder - we'll likely give it a few days to see if my cat will keep the bulky tag on. The option to use an implanted microchip and having a slightly less sensitive sensor to said chip would easily make this a 5 out of 5, and I'd buy another one for my other cat. We love Petlibro products and this one could be so much better with these small changes.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly want i need!', 'author': 'Alejandro Hernandez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Petlibro has done it once again with another great product! Ive read other reviews but decided to found out the truth for myself. I have not had a single issue so far and have done exaclty what i need to stop my bigger cat from eating my smaller cats food. The RFID tag is not huge but it also isnt small. My cats dont seem bother by the size of the tag. The app works really well and i enjoy seeing the data of how often my cats eat as well as when they eat. Over all i was scared from the other peoples reactions to this product but petlibro has made another amazing product for a great price compared to other competitors.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars RFID Reader Interference', 'author': 'TataTot', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was so excited to receive this. The app is user friendly and intuitive. I second that the tag is quite large and I was take aback, but this doesnâ€™t seem to bother my cat.The main issue Iâ€™ve encountered is the RFID reader was not reading the tag unless it is practically touching it. Even while my cat was standing on the reader, the lid would close while she was eating.It turns out that you cannot place the feeder on a metal surface. This can cause the reading distance to be significantly reduced. I moved the feeder onto a different surface and it works great.Iâ€™ll follow up later with my thoughts after having for a while.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This feeder made a complicated situation way less complicated', 'author': 'fruitxcup', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I went out on a limb and bought this feeder. One of my cats was diagnosed with IBD and has to eat prescription food. Now this guy is like a little vacuum if there is food he will find it and eat it. Both of my cats were used to food being out all the time. So my guy on the non prescription food was getting upset that his food couldnâ€™t be out all the time. Meanwhile, the one on prescription food would play cat games and inevitably get to the non prescription food. Enter this feeder.The good:I love that it simply does its job. It only allows my nonprescription food boy to get his food anytime he wants it. I can set food times and the lid keeps his food fresh.The Meh:If your cat isnâ€™t used to wearing a collar or tag I could see how they may have trouble with the tag. My guys have always worn collars since before I adopted them. The sensor tag for the feeder isnâ€™t much bigger than a normal pet tag and is a little lighter. It is about the size of a quarter at the biggest point. My guy doesnâ€™t have any issue but I could see how it could be one.My guy was very picky about standing on the sensor area. He wouldnâ€™t stand on it until I put a dish drying mat over it.The ugly:My guy normally eats all the food from the front of the bowl so there are frequent blockages like twice a day. Itâ€™s not a huge deal since I can easily access the bowl, but still annoying.I would still recommend buying this. It has made life so much easier. I donâ€™t have to worry about my little guyâ€™s health as much. There are a couple things that arenâ€™t perfect with this product but at its price point and the amount of weight it has lifted off my shoulders I would buy it again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars This could have been something great', 'author': 'April Rastaetter', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I recently purchased the Petlibro One RFID Feeder for my two cats, and while there are aspects I appreciate, there are notable areas that could be improved to enhance its functionality. I hope this review helps if you have cats like mine!For reference, I have one orange cat who is food obsessed (Gene). I have another tabby cat who is a grazer (Frank). At the moment I use the SureFeed microchip feeder but there are no doors and no automatic feeding option so I was really hoping the PetLibro one would fill that gap.What I Find Challenging:Bulky RFID Collar:The RFID collar provided is bulky and distracting, particularly for smaller cats. Comparatively, the SureFeed Microchip feeder's microchip reader seems more responsive and less obtrusive. A downsized RFID tag would be so much better here. My cat is so petite!Door Closing Speed:Despite confirming with Petlibro support that the feeder is functioning correctly, the door's closing speed on the fastest setting (1 second) is too slow. My food-motivated cat like Gene, can grab food before the door fully closes when my other cat walks away.Slow Food Dispensing:The slow dispensing of food - if I say my cat needs 2 portions it will spin out 2 portions pretty slowly. For a cat like Frank, who eats modestly throughout the day, the multiple drops required for one feeding can lead to waiting time ,which lets Gene anticipate and interfere with the process.Bowl Design Issues:The round-rectangle bowl shape is not great. Food gets stuck in the corners and it deff causes whisker fatigue. It needs to be raised or not so deep in the corners.What I Like:Auto-Feeder Concept:The automatic feeder with a door is a positive feature, particularly for households with less food-motivated cats on different diets.Monitoring Features:The ability to monitor the cat's eating habits on the app is really cool.Aesthetically Pleasing Design:The clean and sleek appearance of the Petlibro One RFID Feeder is commendable. Some even mistook it for a printer which I thought was funny but a call to its sleek look.Side Bumpers:The side bumpers are effective in keeping food thieves at bay while Frank was actively at the dish.Suggestions for Improvement:Microchip or RFID Tag Options:Offering a choice between microchip and RFID tags, with a downsized and more comfortable tag for cats with microchips, could address the issue of collar bulkiness.Faster Door Closing Mechanism:Enhancing the motor to close the door even faster could prevent food theft and improve the overall efficiency of the feeder.Revise Bowl Design:Rethinking the bowl design, perhaps elevating or changing its shape to prevent food accumulation in the corners, would be beneficial.If it was faster opening and closing as well as putting out food, had a better opening system (microchip or smaller RFID), and a better bowl would be perfect. It just didn't work in our household so instead I bought upgrades for my SureFeed Microchip feeder.Thanks!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

It dispenses food, is easy to program, and comes with ice packs you can freeze. Just to note for wet food, the dispenser will only open the canister if it is plugged in. It will not open if it is running on D-cell batteries, so this isn't a truly portable system. We tried multiple programming settings and the wet food canisters only opened with the system plugged in. This is why we docked a star. If the wet canisters would open without the system being plugged in, we'd happily give a star back.Additionally, since the canister can only be programmed for one meal, you can't feed your cat with wet food twice a day unless you swap the canister from one side to the other side. You have to buy the extra canister attachment if you want to do this.Overall good system. It replaced our PetLibro.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Needs Wi-Fi', 'author': 'Sparke', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have a cat with no teeth and have been search for a reliable option for wet feeds while away. So far I like the unit, but it is difficult and tedious to program and doesnâ€™t have wifi. I would much prefer a Wi-Fi unit that is easier to program and monitor. My cats are currently hesitant of the bowl as it is counter sunk into the unit and the hit their ears and whisker trying to eat - an oblong or bigger bowl (or better chute) would fix this.It only comes with one wet feeder and notes that more can be ordered on the website, but there is no website - I cannot find anywhere to order replacement parts or additional wet units. There isnâ€™t even a manufacturer website; no contact information in the instruction manual.I would love to see a chilled, wet feeder only from this company with 2 trays that is on Wi-Fi.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Unique and functional pet feeder', 'author': 'Kazuki the Bengal', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. They both are accustomed to getting dry food in the morning and wet food at night so now when we are away for the night, we donâ€™t have to leave a large bowl out worrying about over feeding or someone missing a meal! The ice pack keeps the wet food cold until evening feeding time so we donâ€™t even have to change up our normal feeding routine. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars She likes to eat out of this and it slows her down', 'author': 'mo rris', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Not only does it slow her down, she will also be more likely to eat food off off this plate in the first place; she likes it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great slower feeder bowls', 'author': 'Robin A Stursa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. My rescue kittens were very food insecure so they gobbled there food. Perfect!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars 3 1/2 stars. They need to have an edge around the outside.', 'author': 'LAF', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I really liked this bowl. In fact I bought a half dozen of them, and then I realized there was a problem. For some reason it didn't show up initially. There is no outside edge around the bowl. It is sloped downward to direct the food toward the center of the bowl, but my cat pushed the food up the slope & off of the side of the bowl. Big mess. I'm not sure why it didn't happen at first, but the problem didn't start until several weeks later.I really loved these bowls. They're cleverly made with protruding fishes that act to slow a cat's eating as they work to get the food from between them. This is one of the few bowls I saw formulated just for cats & there are many positives to the way it's made. The fish are a big deal at slowing the rate of eating. I also think that because the bowl is made of hard material, it was easier for my cat to eat, by using the hard surface of the fish to get a good grip on the piece of food she was trying to eat. She pushed the food up against the fish, where it was stopped by the hard surface, allowing her to then get it in her mouth.But that ended up being the reason for the problem too. She pushed the food around the bowl, and partially because the surface was hard & slippery, the food that didn't get wedged up against a fish, eventually got pushed right off of the bowl. I was sad when I had to pack up all of the bowls I'd bought & return them because I also thought they were pretty cute. But the long time went on, the worse the pushing of food from the bowl got to be, so they weren't helpful anymore. If the manufacturers would put a raised edge around the outside edge of the bowl, that would prevent food from getting pushed off of it. I liked these so much...until I didn't. In spite of my experience, I'd still recommend others give them a try. Your pet may not do what my cat did & they may be a perfect success story for you. To the manufacturers I'd recommend that you consider putting an edge around the bowl. Even if someone else's cat doesn't push the food off of the bowl, it would be a preventative measure so that it couldn't happen. If you did that, then I would love your bowl again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great for kittens!', 'author': 'isabella', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This slow feeder has worked great for my kitten! And has little rubber grips to help keep it from sliding around too much. Itis easy to clean and can be put into the dishwasher.The feeder is not raised and sits low on the ground. title: iPettie Donuts Frost WiFi 6 Meal Automatic Cat Food Dispenser with App Control, Dry & Wet Food Automatic Cat Feeder, Smart Dog Feeder with Two Ice Packs, Programmable Timer, Holds 6 x Â½ lb. of Food
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome!', 'author': 'Beth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've only had it about a week, but so far, this feeder is great! I have a little blind cat who gorges his food, and this allows me to divide his food into smaller meals that are dispensed throughout the day. It only took him about 2 days to recognize the beeps and the turn of the motor when food is dispensed. Now he hears the first beep and runs for the feeder!Set up was easy, and it's great to be able to schedule feedings through the app and also to push a button on the app to feed spontaneously.I highly recommend this item!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars sleek product but simple. Easy setup and use', 'author': 'R & J', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My senior cat eats only wet food now, but that makes going away even for a weekend super tough. This product is definitely the first step to helping me out without having to get a cat sitter-- I didn\'t know there was automatic wet food feeders, and iPettie doesn\'t disappoint.The container itself works like a charm. When it transitions, it\'s nice and quiet--love it! And so far it\'s cat proof enough that my desperate kitty hasn\'t been able to tip it over, crack it open, or wiggle her paw into it, while it\'s really easy for me (as a human) to open it, add food, and clean it. The smooth circular shape is ingenious this way. It does take a a good chunk of floor space, in case that matters (I use a large cat kennel at lot to separate my cats, and it is a little cramped.)The holders are a good size. I can put in a 3oz can of food in there with no issue, it maybe maxes out around one 5.5 oz can before you\'re probably breaching too close to the outer cover that\'s covering it.The app is easy enough. it\'s called "Smart Life" (must be some generic smart device controller app developed in China) and they can even send firmware updates through it (which is pretty slick). When it connects to my feeder, it\'s pretty simple to add when I want the feeder to rotate (the hardest part was getting the name of the app from the youtube video tutorial, so you\'re welcome). I do wish there was an "every day" option, instead of scheduling it again and again each day, but minor stuff. Also minor, the log has the AM/PMs switched (so a planned 8 PM is showing as an 8 AM, and vice versa) but that\'s easy to ignore.The hardest part is the food storage logistics so really not like any problem with the product. The ice packs are great and keep the food cold, but realistically can only keep it cold for...12 hours at most. I refrigerate or freeze some food so it will stay cold longer, but I think it\'s really should be a max 48 hours thing. How it works for me (on a 2 a day feeding schedule):1) rotate out the ice packs (so one in the freezer, refreezing, while one is in the holder)2) only use 4 of the slots, with 3 slots of food on standby over 1 ice pack (the pack can be placed on the rear, it doesn\'t have to only be on the left or right side as pictured)3) for extra longevity, use frozen food that\'s on standby for >24 hrs (the 2 later slots).I think this is a fairly food safe method but we shall see...just thought I\'d put it out there since really that was the hardest part for me, trying to figure out what works for me and my cat. iPettie really made a great tool that makes it possible!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I can sleep through the night', 'author': 'M. J. Burak', 'rating': 4, 'content': "One of the hallmarks of feline kidney disease is poor absorption of nutrients. This manifests as the cat being hungry all the time. I can feed him as much as he wants during the day, but he would often wake me in the middle of the night begging for food. I bought this device to feed him a couple of times while I sleep.He's really picky, and won't eat wet food that's been out for more than an hour, no matter how hungry he gets. I was worried he wouldn't eat the food after it's been sitting in the device most of the night, but the ice packs and the seal around the food compartments did their jobs.The app is for ALL of the products this company makes, so it's really basic. Set-up was easy, first using Bluetooth to connect to the device, then adding wi-fi to it so it knows what time it is. Setting the schedule is a breeze. You just move the virtual wheels to the time, then save. And, the app sends a notification when the tray has rotated for a feeding.The only complaint I have so far is that food compartments need to be at least 50% wider. My cat doesn't like squashing his whiskers to get food that got pushed to the sides (whisker fatigue), so he's only eating about half of what I give him. (Of course I'm going to increase the amount, but that means more waste.)Overall, I'm really happy with this device.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality and easy to use cat food dispenser with wifi', 'author': 'TigerFish', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This automatic cat food dispenser is great quality with awesome features and wifi connectivity. It has two removable ice packs that will keep wet food cold for up to 6 hours once the packs are totally frozen in the freezer. They are obviously not needed if only using dry food in the feeder. The storage tray has six large areas for wet and dry food and is also removable from the unit for easy cleaning and is dishwasher safe. The tinted cover locks down into place and will expose one food tray opening per feeding session that can be programmed by using the wifi SmartLife app which can be downloaded to a phone or iPad. Only five of the food openings can be programmed since the sixth one will already be open. The wifi network frequency 2.4Ghz is needed to connect and operate this feeder, which is the same frequency needed to operate most other wifi connected devices in my house such as LED floor lamps. There is a touch control display on the center of the feeder which will display the wifi status and also if there are any other issues. The feeder is powered with a cable that has a USB plug which can be connected to the included wall charger if needed, and the other end is plugged into the bottom of the feeder. The power switch is also located on the bottom of the feeder. There are 4 rubber foot pads on the bottom for better stability of the feeder on hard flooring and to keep it from sliding around. I ordered this cat feeder for use mainly when I am away from the house for one or more days since I have no one to feed my cat when I am gone. I have had several multiple day hospital visits in the past and was always worried about feeding Wolfie. I used to have to leave large bowls of dry food out for him that would end up getting stale after a few days. With this feeder the dry food will stay fresh since the lid fits tight against the base. I can also put his treats in one of the tray openings for him. I recommend this automatic pet feeder to all cat owners who live alone or for those who are always away from their home for any extended time frame.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Purrrfect for senior kitties!', 'author': 'TheVoiceOfUs', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a GENIUS device!! It\'s great for cats or even small dogs. It holds a generous amount of food and the double ice pack does actually keep it fresh!It\'s simple to use and with the app, it makes it even easier! You\'ll be able to remember and track feedings plus plan for future feedings!**After 2 weeks of use with Wet Cat food**It took my senior cat, who just turned 15, several days before he finally came over to check this out. Since then, we\'ve had great success every day! My cat is a bit cenile and often forgets where his food is and when he\'s eaten last, of course, so this has helped him in many ways outside of simply giving food. When he sees us in the kitchen, he automatically assumes its time to eat! Now that he\'s used to the food dispenser "feedings", he no longer gets confused when he sees me walk in the kitchen. So this has really helped break this common behavior which is seen in most pets but most senior pets especially. (If you know, you know!)10/10!!! I would absolutely recommend this product for your beloved fur babies!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pet feeder', 'author': 'Adam', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great feeder, especially if you have a cat that overeats. You can distribute the portion sizes and schedule them to be available. I like that this is WiFi connected, and you can change the schedule through the app wherever you are. The feeder connected to the app very easily and the app control is intuitive. I wouldn't put wet food in the last tray, unless you expect to get to it within a few hours. It's nice that it comes with ice packs to keep the food fresh for about a workday. I'll probably use it for wet food every once in a while. For now, I'm just using it to put out a portion of dry food once a day. You can get notifications for when it has cycled too. probably helpful for someone serving multiple portions a day. Overall I like this thing, and it's very easy to tell if the food trays have run out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for feeding wet food', 'author': 'cat', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is perfect for keeping canned pet feeding on schedule & fresh. Set-up was easy, with the wifi connected on the first attempt. Defining up the schedule in the app was intuitive.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works Well, But Only For One Cat Households', 'author': 'Tyler', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got the iPettie automatic cat feeder and it does the job. It's great that I can feed my kitty using my phone, especially when I'm out for a bit. The ice packs are smart for keeping wet food fresh for a while.That said, I've just been using it for dry food, and honestly, those old-school gravity feeders or newer dispensing type feeders work better for that. My cat quickly became accustomed to eating from this, but it's not ideal. For me, this feeder's best for wet food. Also, they should really make the tray stainless steel. Plastic isn't the best for cats health-wise, and mine gets chin acne sometimes.Bottom Line: Good if you mainly feed wet food and have one cat. For dry food, there might be better options.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Basic app-connected non-refrigerated timed feeder that works well', 'author': 'Red Green', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've been running this for a week on 3 feedings per day. It has worked perfectly during that time. The WiFi SmartLife app, which is used by many products and manufacturers, is easy to use and pretty much goof-proof. I receive notifications of feedings on time and always (which I can turn off).This is not for multiple-day use unless you use dry kibble or dehydrated food with it because the ice packs last no more than 6 to 7 hours.The only issue: I got this specifically for my one cat that refuses to eat kibble, but she's scared of the motor noise (or maybe the beep, the movement, or a combination?). I have a timed gravity-fed feeder for bagged food for the other cat.Hopefully, Miss Scaredy-cat will start to use it. Right now, it's just spinning without food as I test it for Vine.Be careful putting the top back on, which takes some effort... I pinched my finger pretty well on one occasion.My rating system:5 Stars = Knocks it out of the park. A great value!4 Stars = Excellent product. A solid buy.3 Stars = It provides some value, but perhaps not as advertised.2 Stars = A little dubious, so do your research. Read the critical reviews!1 Star = Avoid this product and look elsewhere.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love this feeder', 'author': 'Elizabeth R.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I love this feeder, itâ€™s the perfect size, and the individual slots are perfect (perfect width and not too deep). I love that I can use the app to schedule a feeding, and I love that itâ€™s easy to open, yet easy to secure closed as well. The only thing that would make this feeder better would be if it had a refrigerated function so you wouldnâ€™t have to worry about the ice packs thawing and having to refreeze them each time. Overall, I do love this feeder though.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No more scattered dry food?', 'author': 'MT', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have a 18 year old SMALL cat. The bowls are really nice white ceramic and the wooden frame is smooth, no splinters and appears to have a stained finished. I\'m hoping the size of the bowls are not too small. Perfect for dry food and bisque, but my cat drinks a lot of water. I figure I can use the bisque bowl for additional water when I leave for work. I\'m really pleased, considering ordering one for a good neighbor. No separate bowls are scattered across the floor for me to step on later.Assembly was simple. 4 screws to attach the base and it's done.And the elevation allows them to eat comfortably without getting sick.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My cat seems to love it', 'author': 'Kelly Walker', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered this because we recently acquired a cat and I needed something other than plastic bowls to put her food and water in. Set up was very easy and it took less than 5 minutes for this to be useful. The stand itself if a good height and my cat doesn't have any trouble with it. The incline is helpful for digestion needs, but I found I can't fill the water bowl more than about halfway because it might spill. I have food, water and a treat bowl set up and she knows right where to go. The bowls aren't large, so I refill a couple times a day. It's easy to clean and just wipes off. I haven't washed anything in the dishwasher, but I don't see where that would be a problem. so farm this has worked wonderfully and it looks nice against the wall in my kitchen. I haven't had any spills (other than water, but my fault) and she seems to like it just fine.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble but ultimately it's my cat's opinion that mattered.", 'author': 'Mousie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "So to properly test this set of bowls, I set it out next to my cat's existing bowls, which include a floor level food dish on the auto feeder, a raised but flat (not tilted like this bowl) bowl which contained her water, and then put food and water into the 3 bowls, 2 water 1 food. First I put the new bowls as her first choice, then later moved it further away from the other bowls so she'd had to choose go to it if she wanted to use it. The results: She preferred this dish for eating. But for water she completely avoided this bowl unless the flat bowl was empty. She would walk past it to drink from her flat bowl, and when it was further away still went immediately to her flat raised bowl. So what does this tell us? Really just my cat's preferences. Yours may have different opinions. While the bowls come with no assembly instructions, you really don't need them as there's only 2 pieces to attach and common sense will tell you how they attach. But for some inexplicable reason, they chose to use an allen wrench as opposed to a screwdriver. My only guess it that you'd need a really short handled screwdriver to attach the legs. It does include the obnoxious tool that is the allen wrench and in this case it's not as bad as most furniture that has allen screws. That said, it lost a star simply because of my cat's preferences. Yours may want to drink and eat from this bowl, or hate it entirely But overall it's a good set of cat bowls that are easy to clean.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cats like it!', 'author': 'Melody', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I was worried my cats wouldn't like this because some can be picky, but they took right to it. I have 2 that are getting older, 12 and 10, and they just look miserable scrunched over their old food bowls, so I wanted to try these. They seem to enjoy them. It was easy to put together too, which for me was great.I took off 1 star because A. the bowls are very small and small bowls aren't good for kitties and B. the tilt of the tray is a little weird and it makes it hard for my smaller one to eat since all the food slides to one side. She is only 10 lbs and stubby, lol. I replaced the small bowls with their regular bowls and it works fine.Overall, my cats enjoy it and that's what matters. There are more expensive ones out there, but I feel like this is just as good quality wise tbh. Don't spend that extra money if you don't have too!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

The colors are cute, look nice in our house.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 18, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars OHGO Silicone Cat Feeding Mat:', 'author': 'Sarah Isaacson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My cats love this mat! title: 4L Automatic Cat Feeder with WiFi App Control, Anti-Clog Design, and Dual Power Supply for Cats and Small Dogs - Up to 10 Meals per Day
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic!', 'author': 'AndreaK', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Iâ€™ve been looking at automatic feeders for ages and never wanted to pull the trigger. Theyâ€™re usually very expensive and have reviews that are all over the place. This one is not expensive at all. It paid for itself in one work trip because I saved on pet sitting. It is fantastic!! The voice feature allows you to quickly get your pet acclimated. My cat responded to my voice from the very first try, and was instantly trained. I read someoneâ€™s review that said they use it sometimes when theyâ€™re laying in bed and donâ€™t feel like getting up and trust me, itâ€™s a dream come true! I travel for work and when Iâ€™m away, itâ€™s fantastic. And it gives me feedback so I know it worked. Itâ€™s great because I can feed her manually with the app or set the timer. Itâ€™s a little larger than I think I needed but itâ€™s fine. I also like that plugged in, but has backup batteries. I bought the one without the stainless steel tray at first, but returned it and got the one with the tray. Itâ€™s much better to take that part in and out for cleaning, than removing the underneath tray.And stainless is better than the plastic. It is definitely worth buying!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Well Worth the Investment', 'author': 'Don', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After reading a few reviews on several auto feeders I crossed my fingers bought this one. So far I havenâ€™t been disappointed! What The most important feature I was looking for was the smart technology so I would be able to control the feeder via app. The app is simple but not entirely intuitive, but I made it around those obstacles.The unit appears to be of good to excellent quality. The measured portions are small but with the app, youâ€™re able to dispense 20 servings at a time. That would likely overfill the bowl. The motor is extremely quiet. You really canâ€™t hear the motor over the kibble spilling into the stainless bowl. I read that some people had issues with the app. I have an iPhone 13 max and the app has worked flawlessly for me.The lid on the food storage bin locks securely, which is an important feature if you have a tenacious cat like mine! ðŸ˜¹The only drawback that Iâ€™ve found so far is that the food storage bin is not removable so I can see that I wonâ€™t be cleaning the unit as much as Iâ€™d like to as it should be cleaned.Overall, I would definitely recommend this feeder for itâ€™s features and quality build and materials!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy setup and lots of portion control.', 'author': 'Micah Okazaki', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I bought this pet feeder for my 3 year old fat cat. Because she needs to lose weight and we have a hard time controlling who feeds her when. It was very easy to setup and the app is clean and concise. Portions are highly adjustable. Very easy customizable scheduled feedings of pportions.Only gave 4 stars cuz fat cat figured out how to stick her paw in and turn the mechanism to give her 2-3 pieces of kibble at a time. Wish the mechanism locked down a bit better as to stop her from sneaking food.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just get it!', 'author': 'Julie Pintor', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I decided to get one of these for my cat and Iâ€™m so glad I did it works well. I love that I can control it from my phone.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A little difficult to figure out but great so far!', 'author': 'Lily', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It took me a bit to understand the app, but I figured it out :) it also seems to be pretty sturdy.I love that you can control portions, also our cat doesnâ€™t wake us up at 5am anymore (thank god!)PSA: When it says feed number, I thought it meant the number of times they've been fed that day i.e feed 1, feed 2 etc but itâ€™s actually the portion control. each portion is around 1/16 of a cup so 3 feeds is a normal amount if you feed them twice a day :)I would buy again", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Be very cautious!', 'author': 'Kevin Freeman', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I am an IT professional. Ordered this even though I was hesitant and I should have listened to my gut. I am fairly confident that this company is a security risk for your data.The â€œAppâ€ privacy terms/conditions are all in Mandarin even though the app is in English. The app requires you to manually enter your WiFi password (red flag), enable precise location tracking (red flag), and have Bluetooth enabled. I have yet to find any reason that a company needs to track your location in order for their cat feeder to work.The app also does not allow you to disable data sharing. Itâ€™s conveniently designed to not be able to uncheck it.Proceed with caution if you purchase this. You are likely putting your personal data at risk.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Works well, with a few flaws', 'author': 'Lee', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Overall I like the product, but a few disclaimers for those thinking of buying this product:1) Portion sizes are really small. 1 portion is like 4 kibble. I also think this is dependent on the size of the kibble. The smaller the pieces, the more that comes out. The maximum portion is 12, so I recommend estimating a normal feed is at the bare minimum a 4 or 5.2) The chute where the food is dispensed is wide open, and my little demon has figured out she can fit her paw up there to fish out more food. I'm concerned she's gonna end up breaking the mechanism, so I taped a piece of cardboard over it. It's secured at the top, so when the food dispenses it acts a like a hinge. So far so good, but we'll see how long that lasts. I also recommend using the lock setting if your cat is smart. Otherwise it WILL learn how to press the feed button on the front.3) Getting it connected to the wifi was a bit of a frustrating experience. I recommend having it almost on top of your router when you first try to connect it. But once I got it to connect, no issues.Overall, this is a fairly convenient auto feeder. I do wish it had a feature that warns you when the feeder is getting low, but it's not a necessary feature. If/when it breaks, I'd buy it again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Able to sleep in on a Sunday', 'author': 'Patricia Peralta', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Oh my goodness getting up at 4:30 am on a Sunday was a pain in the neck. This has allowed us to sleep in on Sundays it works and the small dog has adapted', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars DO NOT USE THE QR CODE IN THE MANUAL!!!!', 'author': 'S. Toomey', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I scanned the QR code from the manual that came with the unit and it was a SCAM! They charge you every time you use the unit. $3.18 a day. I immediately deleted that app, changed my PayPal to not automatically give them money. I have the free app now.Otherwise Iâ€™m very happy with the unit. Every appliance I own is mainly run from an app. Although I didnâ€™t think it worked as I didnâ€™t see the food when I came downstairs but that was because my cat tricked me into feeding her TWICE! lol', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Need 2.4g WiFi to use it., otherwise ok', 'author': 'Grammie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The dispenser works fine, the app leaves much to be desired. I think it dispenses about 1/8 cup per serving and the cat has no problem with using it. He eats too much and then throws up so having frequent small feedings with this feeder solved that problem. The food cannister doesn't come off for cleaning. There is not a separate bowl in the area it dispenses to so you have to lift the feeder to take out the bowl to clean it. At first, I couldn't figure out why it wouldn't connect to my WiFi until I finally realized that it can only use a 2.4G WiFi connection. This is not clearly stated anywhere and will be a problem for many people to change. Luckily I could change it in WiFi settings on my phone and it connected easily once I changed it. The directions could be much more complete, not much info. The timer is on a 24 hour clock which is confusing. I set up feeding times then found that I needed to change them. I found that you can change a feeding by clicking on it to change the time. You can only add 10 feedings which isnâ€™t enough for my needs. I am going to give this as a gift to the owner of the cat I am caring for so I want the WiFi and settings to be easier. I will likely return it for one that has more of the features I want for the recipient.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Automatic Dog Feeder with Adjustable Camera, 5G WiFi 6L Smart Cat Food Dispenser, 1080P HD Video with Night Vision, Pet Feeder with 2-Way Audio for Cats & Dogs, Food Blockage & Motion Alerts
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally! Smaller portion size for cats!!!', 'author': 'PorcupineMom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Our biggest complaint about automatic pet feeders in the past is that the portion sizes are too big. With our older cat having a sensitive stomach, this has led to a lot of overeating and vomiting. This feeder has SOLVED that problem for us. We took out our scale and weighed out the portions between our old feeder and the Roilpet feeder. The Roilpet feeder came in about 2 grams less per serving! Yay! (And yes, our old boy has noticed.) As the video will tell you, we generally love everything about this feeder. When you initially set it up, do it closer to your router, but after that you can move it to a different location and it works perfectly. We love the fact that we control all of the settings from our phone. One of our biggest frustrations in the past was learning the button combinations to program other feeders. No more! This one is so easy! Our only feedback is we wish it had the capability to record video automatically every time they come to the feeder (you can manually record), but it does have a great feature where it will notify you on your phone when it senses motion at the feeder. For us this is important so we know that they are healthy and eating when we are not home. Weâ€™ve been using the feeder for over a week now and it has worked perfectly. I do like the fact that it has an alert system to not only let you know that the feeder executed the feeding function successfully but apparently it will also let you know if the feeder is jammed. title: PETKIT Automatic Pet Feeder with Camera, 1080P HD Video with Night Vision, 2.4G WiFi Cat Dog Feeder with 2-Way Audio,Smart App Control Pet Dry Food Dispenser for Cats and Dogs with Non-Stick Food Bowl.
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Honestly? I'm Shocked How Good It Is!", 'author': 'Ryan A. Leemhuis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A little background first. We had previously used the Crown Majestic feeder for our cat. It worked fairly well although it was a bit ugly, would occasionally jam and the portion sizes were very hit and miss. We used it until its power connection internally broke and it would only run off batteries which was difficult to keep up with.So that led me on my search for a replacement. There are a lot more options now than there used to be. My main features I was looking for were wifi control and reliability.I found it difficult to narrow down my choice as I found varying reviews and some claimed that a model was terrible and some said it was amazing. I eventually settled on the Petkit mini feeder from a cost and design perspective. First of all, it looks great. I love the thought that went into the design from the magnetically attached bowl to the jumper that allows the DC adapter to easily disconnect from the wall should you need. I was a little nervous about how much food could be stored but upon seeing the compartment this is a good amount for a cat. I find we need to fill it once every 2 weeks or so.That brings us to the worst part of the product. Lets just be clear here...the app is decent...but there are some language oddities and the setup did not go according to design. I am a techy and I initially tried pairing the feeder with my phone. It got fairly far into the setup but kept failing out during the wifi pairing process. I then tried my wife\'s phone and it did the same. I then happened to notice that the feeder was already showing on the app\'s dashboard and sure enough it had been paired even though the app claimed it had failed. I don\'t know why this occurred but be prepared for some setup issues.Once setup, however, the app is great. The food portion sizes are accurate and on demand feeds occur nearly immediately. The schedule is easy to setup and food is distributed on time. We use prescription "disc-shaped" food and other feeders claimed they weren\'t compatible. We have had ZERO issues with this machine getting jammed or having any issue with our food. It is actually very fun to watch the little door open on the machine and then the food dump out.For the cost, this feeder is a steal. It is so much better than our previous feeder it makes me wonder why I didn\'t upgrade earlier. My only suggestions for improvement would be to further improve the app and instructions translations. There are some real English oddities (which you can see in the product\'s amazon page as well. In addition, the setup process obviously needs some improvement too as it failed twice for me and some how magically appeared on my apps dashboard after this fail. Other than that, the feeder is perfect. It feels very high quality and the mechanics seem sound. HIGHLY recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PetKit Mini - Small Pet Feeder - Review', 'author': 'AirplaneCatBlue', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The PetKit Mini feeder is attractively and elegantly designed. It looks like it belongs in an art museum.The PetKit Mini feeder is the ideal automatic feeder for my needs. What I like best is that it precisely delivers very small meals (as little as 1/20 of a cup or 5 grams) to my overweight cat up to 10 times per day. In my case I had been feeding my cat 20 grams of cat kibbles twice per day... or 40 grams. My cat was waking me up at 4 AM begging for more food. The PetKit Mini stopped the begging behavior! With the PetKit Mini I was able to schedule 8 feedings of 5 grams each... for a total of 40 grams per day... but spread out over the course of the day and night. This way my cat gets precisely fed her reduced ration and eliminates my tendency to give her a little extra when she begs.The PetKit Mini has improved my cat's relationship with me. She no longer relies on me for food. With the PetKit Mini she visits me often and regularly because she wants my company... not because she wants food. And it has improved my relationship with my cat since I am no longer irritated by her pestering behaviors at 4 AM when she gets hungry.The engineers who designed the PetKit Mini payed very close attention to critical details that separate this feeder from the pack. I studied them all before I made my purchase decision. The silicone rubber paddles that meter the kibbles into the rotary dosing cups are designed to flex so the kibbles donâ€™t jam in the mechanism.The engineers used silicone rubber gaskets to seal out moisture at the feeding door and food reservoir lid. Then they provide a replaceable desiccant pack (those little packs that you often find in a box of new shoes) that absorb any moisture that might otherwise accumulate in your dried food. You can imagine that if your kibbles absorbed moisture from the air and swelled up like a sponge that they wouldnâ€™t feed well in the mechanism. It also keeps the food fresher and prevents mold growth I would think.I found the PetKit Mini was easy to set up. It did help that I had an $8 electronic scale so I could better measure in grams how much I had been feeding my cat. I had been using a very small measuring cup. It was a lot easier to weigh the kibbles than to try to measure the volume of food.I measured the amount of food the PetKit Mini delivered with each feeding.
