Unboxing and putting everything together is easy, and so far the feeder has been reliable. That said, I think the app is a lot more complex than it needs to be, and while that can be updated and changed over time, it's important to know what you're getting into.When you go through setup of the feeder and app for the first time, I think the experience is a bit all over the place. There are instruction stickers on the feeder itself, there is a booklet of instructions, there are QR codes and links within the booklet to scan to get to videos that you have to watch for further steps, and then there's setup within the app itself... etc. I think it's just a few too many layers of info and could be pared down significantly. Once everything is setup and you're trying to actually use the app, those same issues of unnecessary layers/ complications continue. The app tries to get you to schedule meals based on feeding recommendations for your pet, so you have to setup a profile for each of your pets first. This sounds minor, but it's quite detailed, and includes a whole lot of information that isn't truly necessary just to make a recommendation for feeding quantity. In the end, a truly informed recommendation would really require nutrition information about your pet food itself, so the whole exercise is a bit silly. I was left feeling a bit unsure of how much of this information I *really* needed or wanted to complete. Once you have been asked about various details for your pet, then you need to schedule fixed meals for each, and again I do appreciate that they tried to include a lot of options for customization, but it's just too much. For one, how do they propose that you make sure the right pet eats the right meal, etc? I think it would be much easier to remove those options, or hide them behind an advanced mode, and just let you set a very simple schedule with set times and quantities. K.I.S.S. you know? Given that the app doesn't interface with bluetooth trackers or smart catboxes or anything like that, I'm not sure I see any need for the pet profiles at all! It just adds complexity for no discernible reason.Beyond the actual cumbersome data entry requirements, I found the interface to be not very intuitive. I had difficulty finding the settings that I actually wanted to look for and find out more about, such as the Alexa integration, and kept getting lost in layers of social media integrations and gamification... which, why? I was looking into trying out the Smart Home integration options, but do I need a community and messaging platform for my smart feeder? Maybe this is more of a cultural thing, I believe the company is based in China, but I just don't need this kind of fluff cluttering up the basic functions of the app. I'd really enjoy it more if they could pull back on these added features, or again, maybe just hide them all in one area of the app called 'Social' or similar, but they seemed to be behind every corner. For me, again it just took away from the experience of feeling like I could find the basic information and functions quickly and easily. Thankfully, apps can be can be improved and refined over time, so I feel that most of those concerns are somewhat secondary. If you plan to use it in a way where you can sit down and get through it, then basically 'set it and forget it', I think it will work well for you. But if you would plan to regularly make any tweaks to your meal plans, I think it would be a not-minor annoyance. I'll also mention that this is something my partner and I considered setting up for aging parents, just as a little convenience item to make their lives easier. After working with it, I don't know if I can comfortably go that direction. I definitely don't feel confident that they would have gotten through any of the initial setup themselves, but I also don't think they could make any on-the-fly changes to the configuration even if the initial steps were done for them. My advice to the developers would be: pare down to the basics and make sure they are quick and intuitive. THEN add extras, but remember they are extras and not your primary functions.Ok, so it seems like I'm coming down kind of harsh. All that said, I do think this product will work just fine for use in my own home. The feeder itself is sturdy and has so far been reliable. While I don't have direct experience with a lot of competing products, I had been taking note of some other design issues I'd noted in some of those competitors and waited to try something that seemed to address them. For one, I don't just appreciate the option for plug-in power and battery backup, for me that's an absolute requirement on something like this. The food storage compartment also seems secure, which was a concern I had because I have one cat that will get into ANYTHING edible that is left out. I'm impressed because he hasn't even tried with this, which also tells me the seals are probably decent and he's not being tempted by the smell of kibble. That also leads me to believe that bugs shouldn't be an issue, though time will tell. I also appreciate that the actual food bowl portion is easily removable, as it just snaps into place with a magnet. Being plastic based, it's important to clean something like that regularly and you and I both know that won't happen if it's a pain point. Ideally, I would really like to see this component and the food storage bin being made out of stainless steel, but maybe that's something that could be incorporated in a future revision as well.Let's wrap this up...On the whole, if you are patient and technologically competent enough to get through the configuration of the app itself, it's a good product that I think you'll be happy with.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The PetKit app is nearly useless for this feeder! Unfortunately, Petkit and Amazon failed to disclose that the app isn't ready for the hardware. I consider this failure to be a bait and switch scam and I'd return it but I already tossed the package because the delivery person left it in the rain without a plastic wrap for protection.Linking the app and feeder was easy. Connecting to my home router/wifi was easy. It even ran an automatic software upgrade so I know I have the latest, greatest app software. So far so good.Next task is to program my two cats into the Feeding Calculator. Entering the name is easy. Enter the weight? The app reverts to a default weight of 6.8 pounds every time. So it fails to update the cats's weights. FAIL! There isn't any obvious way to edit the cat information either. So another FAIL! Interesting is that I have the PetKit Puramax automatic litter box with my cats' weights entered correctly. The feeder links to the info but changes the weights without any input from me. Another FAIL?Next it asks me to enter their cat food. I feed Purina Indoor Cat Food, a very common dry cat food pellet available in any American grocery store. Instead of a simple-to-use barcode reader that searches online and enters the food analysis for me, I have to enter the analysis manually. Okay, needlessly complicated but okay.The app lets me program the feeding schedule but I'm unable to vary the portion size. I ran a few trials and the portion size isn't consistent. That's a definite FAIL!!I have two PetKit water dispensors that work very well. The Petkit Pure Max Litter box works well. I really want the food dispenser to work just as well but for now the software is a FAIL!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars accurate, precise, feeder. We used to go out to eat and hang out with friends until late at night all the time and we always worried about making our cat wait for dinner until we got home, but now (once we can finally go out again) we can just use our phone to give our cat some dinner as soon as we realize we won\'t be getting home until late.Another thing I like about this feeder is that the build quality is really nice. title: PETKIT Automatic Cat Feeder with Camera,1080P HD Video with Night Vision,Double Hopper Pet Feeder for Cats and Dogs with 2-Way Audio,Smart App Control Cat Food Dispenser,2.4G WiFi/Anti-Stick Bowl.
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Honestly? I'm Shocked How Good It Is!", 'author': 'Ryan A. Leemhuis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A little background first. We had previously used the Crown Majestic feeder for our cat. It worked fairly well although it was a bit ugly, would occasionally jam and the portion sizes were very hit and miss. We used it until its power connection internally broke and it would only run off batteries which was difficult to keep up with.So that led me on my search for a replacement. There are a lot more options now than there used to be. My main features I was looking for were wifi control and reliability.I found it difficult to narrow down my choice as I found varying reviews and some claimed that a model was terrible and some said it was amazing. I eventually settled on the Petkit mini feeder from a cost and design perspective. First of all, it looks great. I love the thought that went into the design from the magnetically attached bowl to the jumper that allows the DC adapter to easily disconnect from the wall should you need. I was a little nervous about how much food could be stored but upon seeing the compartment this is a good amount for a cat. I find we need to fill it once every 2 weeks or so.That brings us to the worst part of the product. Lets just be clear here...the app is decent...but there are some language oddities and the setup did not go according to design. I am a techy and I initially tried pairing the feeder with my phone. It got fairly far into the setup but kept failing out during the wifi pairing process. I then tried my wife\'s phone and it did the same. I then happened to notice that the feeder was already showing on the app\'s dashboard and sure enough it had been paired even though the app claimed it had failed. I don\'t know why this occurred but be prepared for some setup issues.Once setup, however, the app is great. The food portion sizes are accurate and on demand feeds occur nearly immediately. The schedule is easy to setup and food is distributed on time. We use prescription "disc-shaped" food and other feeders claimed they weren\'t compatible. We have had ZERO issues with this machine getting jammed or having any issue with our food. It is actually very fun to watch the little door open on the machine and then the food dump out.For the cost, this feeder is a steal. It is so much better than our previous feeder it makes me wonder why I didn\'t upgrade earlier. My only suggestions for improvement would be to further improve the app and instructions translations. There are some real English oddities (which you can see in the product\'s amazon page as well. In addition, the setup process obviously needs some improvement too as it failed twice for me and some how magically appeared on my apps dashboard after this fail. Other than that, the feeder is perfect. It feels very high quality and the mechanics seem sound. HIGHLY recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PetKit Mini - Small Pet Feeder - Review', 'author': 'AirplaneCatBlue', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The PetKit Mini feeder is attractively and elegantly designed. With the PetKit Mini I was able to schedule 8 feedings of 5 grams each... for a total of 40 grams per day... but spread out over the course of the day and night. This way my cat gets precisely fed her reduced ration and eliminates my tendency to give her a little extra when she begs.The PetKit Mini has improved my cat's relationship with me. She no longer relies on me for food. With the PetKit Mini she visits me often and regularly because she wants my company... not because she wants food. And it has improved my relationship with my cat since I am no longer irritated by her pestering behaviors at 4 AM when she gets hungry.The engineers who designed the PetKit Mini payed very close attention to critical details that separate this feeder from the pack. I studied them all before I made my purchase decision. The silicone rubber paddles that meter the kibbles into the rotary dosing cups are designed to flex so the kibbles donâ€™t jam in the mechanism.The engineers used silicone rubber gaskets to seal out moisture at the feeding door and food reservoir lid. Then they provide a replaceable desiccant pack (those little packs that you often find in a box of new shoes) that absorb any moisture that might otherwise accumulate in your dried food. You can imagine that if your kibbles absorbed moisture from the air and swelled up like a sponge that they wouldnâ€™t feed well in the mechanism. It also keeps the food fresher and prevents mold growth I would think.I found the PetKit Mini was easy to set up. title: Join Prime to buy this item at $59.99
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better Than Competitors', 'author': 'Matthew Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Without naming any names (cough cough rhymes with BetWibro), we had purchased a couple of their automatic feeders (not WiFi enabled), one for our first cat, then about a year and a half later we bought the second. One was fast, the other was slow, so over the course of a week, we would have a gulf of about 2 1/2 minutes which resulted in hurt feelings and competition. Cue the third cat and we tried a different brand. That one kept time a little better, but we were still struggling with clocks that would never be synchronized and it was a chore to always update 3 feeders every few days just to ensure the cats were fed at their respective stations at the same time and no one had an opportunity to eat theirs and steal another's in the time it took for food to be dispensed.I had my eye on this, as it's WiFi enabled, and we already have the automatic litter box, so we were familiar with the brand. So, we purchased a third, and will purchase a fourth and fifth once the kittens are a bit bigger.Setting up the feeding plan is a breeze and refilling couldn't be easier. It was very easy to connect as the device was easily recognized and firmware updates took moments without any failures. The app works great with virtually no delays in input - want to give them a little snack? Tap the snack button, select your serving size and it dispenses as soon as you make your choice.For the price and the features, it's a no brainer. There's simply no reason reason to pay more for less with competitors, at least those who are respectable names in this market, and not just a random brand that has popped up trying to offer a cheap alternative with a janky app.5/5 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super happy I risked this feeder!!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE**: still 5stars. Updating bc I donâ€™t want people to overlook this feeder bc of a few reviews that donâ€™t always apply.So this feeder only had 8 reviews when I ordered it which is way low for my usual trust with a new brand. however, MY CATS LOVE THIS FEEDER. They werenâ€™t intimidated by the size or layout. Very intuitive for my cats to use. I needed this bc I wasnâ€™t sure how much to give my kitties after them being on an open bowl meal (but got too chunky hence the feeder & I am a student and not always home etc).Only Pros at this Point. If I end up buying another automatic feeder (for both cats versus them just sharing this one), I will buy this brand and exact model again. Honestly one of my favorite Amazon purchases of all time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works as expected, so far (edit: mostly)', 'author': 'Christa N.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After reading the reviews, I think I was prepared for some kind of nightmare with this, but so far I\'ve been pleasantly suprised. I\'ll update if it stops working or something. The app isn\'t super sleek and displays my feeding history partially in Chinese, but it\'s not too confusing either, and the feeder quickly connected to my iPhone on a 2.4G network. Set up was really easy, 2-3 minutes, and mostly I just use the "extra feeding" button, although the recommended meal plan seemed appropriate if all my cat ate was dry food, and was easy to edit. However, he often refuses to eat his wet food, especially prescription food, before I leave for work. I also somewhat frequently receive notifications that the feeder is jammed or low on food when it is not (maybe twice a month). The feeder has only actually jammed once. So pretty good, still looks great, but not 100% reliable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sleek and modern design', 'author': 'Penny Lane', 'rating': 5, 'content': "â­â­â­â­â­The PETKIT Automatic WiFi Cat Feeder has been a lifesaver for me and my furry friend over the past year! Five stars all the way!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Overall great!', 'author': 'Andy & Cora Ray', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought two of these feeders for our two cats to keep them on a consistent feeding schedule when we are out of the house or have left town. Weâ€™ve been using them for about 2 weeks and so far theyâ€™ve worked great. Initially the feeding schedules in the app were difficult to set up, but the app offered an update within the settings which changed the configuration slightly and is super simple after the update. The feeders are easy to connect to wifi but will not allow 5G, as an FYI. Once they are connected the app will load data regarding what has been dispensed. I can confirm the feeder does work even if your phone is not connected to Wi-Fi/data and will stay on the same schedule even if your phone changes time zones. Overall a great product! Our cats have even tried sticking their paws up into the chamber and have been unsuccessful in getting food out without a scheduled dispensation.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Frustrating as Hell', 'author': 'tomsvl', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'First, I am fairly literate with electronics. After unpacking and getting the dispenser on (which is not easy as noted), scan the qr code and somehow was able to get the app. No instructions on how to connect, just fumbling around. I don\'t know why companies don\'t sit regular people down with their product and say "set this up" it might help. After getting connected, started a meal plan. I did not have to do a pet profile as some others reported. If I did, I would have stopped.Smallest portion is 1/10 cup. I usually feed her less as she gobbles and then throws it up, but I tried it.So I set up 4 feeds a day. This is tedious with scrolling wheels for times for each feeding. After that you are to hit "start plan". I get message "request incorrect". what\'s that mean? If you go back a page it erases your plan and you have to start over.Start over. Same thing. 4 times 16 entries. I guess I wasn\'t smart enough to just try one time! Finally I figured out it had lost internet connection. App will show "Petkit is running" which means you are connected to the machine but not the internet? Reconnected, and it save the next plan I put in. On the settings page it will show "online", why not have it on the home page??? Why not notify you lost connection??. The hopper was half full, but kept getting empty message till I turned that off.So now waiting for morning to check feeding. First time is 6:15. Times are military, so I know I\'m doing "am" morning. Get up at 5:30 and there is food in the bowl. Go to app and it dispensed 2 feedings already. 7 hours ahead of scedule which means it\'s on GMT. There is nowhere to set local time that I can find. Now waiting for the next feeding to see. 9am should be my 4pm feeding. Easy UPDATE: My 4pm feeding happened at 9am 7 hours ahead. Am I supposed to adjust my times to coincide to the time zone the app is using???All I needed was a timer to work 4 times a day to dispense food. Just like an analog lamp timer you pull the tabs for it to work. BTW there is a website for the 8 most common problems, Nice.This is going back today.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Set it & forget it', 'author': 'DIA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This made everything so much easier!You donâ€™t have to measure anymore; just set the serving size in the app. This is so helpful when your pet is still small and cat eat a full can/scoop of food just yet. Just be sure to double check and measure it yourself as well. It gave my cat more that it was supposed to for 2/3 cup measurement and I had to break it down into multiple smaller portions to get it to be the right amount of foodDonâ€™t have to wake up super early; if I want to sleep in I donâ€™t have to worry about if the cat will starve. Just set up a dispense time in the app.Donâ€™t have to call your pet for food; it essentially Pavlovâ€™s them with a beep indicator when food is coming out. lol - daylight savings was hard to get through when he knows itâ€™s food time but didnâ€™t get a beep yet. I just ended up moving the time by an hour to match his instincts.The app is finicky sometimes. But it always alerts when itâ€™s time to refill or when to change the desiccant. Also alerts when youâ€™re away from home if the food was dispensed. You can even set reminders for other things like changing the litter box, changing the water filter, nail clipping time, etc.The cat likes it as a stepping stool to the window lol', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price', 'author': 'J. Town', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for a colony of about a dozen feral cats (all but a couple TNR\'d) that live in the woods near my house. I set them up some beds and a big food bowl in a shed but raccoons and possums were stealing the food. (And I was tired if going out in the rain to fill the bowl.) So I got this feeder and set it up in the shed. So far, this has held up well. The raccoons and possums can only steal 1/2 cup at a time. The raccoons get pretty aggressive when the bowl is empty but they haven\'t managed to get the lid off the new feeder. I\'ve seen them tossing it around on the security camera but the feeder\'s held up fine. I eventually attached it to the floor of the shed.I haven\'t set up a schedule because feral cats are terrible at telling time. If it\'s empty when I check the security camera, I hit "Extra feeding" on my phone and dump 1/2 cup in the bowl. It took the cats about 2 days to figure out that the noise means food. Sometimes I\'ll see 3 or 4 of them sitting in a semi-circle around the bowl waiting for me to hit the button.I\'ve run several brands of cat food thru it (whatever\'s on sale in bulk) and it\'s pretty consistent with the portion despite the different sizes and shapes of the kibble. I\'ve never had it get stuck with food left in the hopper. It gets down to the last few pieces every time.It would be nice if it was easier to clean. You have to take out 4 screws to take the dispenser chamber off and really get in there with a brush to get the rotating part clean. If the chamber was a twist-lock and the rotating part came out easily, it\'d be much better.My only other real complaint is the AAA batteries. They should be AA. There\'s plenty of room, they hold twice the energy, and most stores charge the same amount for AAA and AA. There\'s really no reason for the small batteries.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Feeder dispenses only an APPROXIMATE amount of the portion of food you select', 'author': 'SoCalMissy', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I wish I had seen JESSICAâ€™S review from one of PETKITS other feeders prior to my purchase of the ELEMENT SOLO. Iâ€™ve spent an incredible amount of time researching Cat Feeders ever since 2020 when PetNet (feeders) went out of business. They were the best in the industry, hands-down! and now Iâ€™m stuck with TWO of their $150 paper weights, essentially. Iâ€™ve searched far and wide for replacements. So on Amazon Prime Day, July 12, I pulled the trigger on a deal for this ELEMENT SOLO feeder. Iâ€™ll be returning it promptly before my 30 day money-back guarantee runs out.1st - the amount of information that you MUST input just to set up a feeding schedule is by far very un necessary. You have to create a profile for your animal, you have to enter their height, their weight, their age their type, then you need to input their food brand, THEN verify if it fits in the feeder, and THEN enter the ingredients and what %percentage of moisture and ash etc. etc. None of that is necessary when youâ€™re using a measurement you already know and what type or amount of food youâ€™re going to dispense. You just want to set up a schedule to have it done. BTW the plug is quite large, so I youâ€™ll waste the space beside it, and above it, which is very unfortunate.2nd -my cat is on a strict food diet. His dry food portion of his diet he receives 1/4 (ONE QUARTER) cup of dry kibble (IAMS) TWICE a day to totaling 1/2 (ONE HALF) cup of food per day.By the third day, this feeder gave me issues, dispensing the incorrect amount of food. Sometimes it dispensed 16 kibbles. Sometimes it gave 48 kibbles. Sometimes it gave 62 kibbles. None of those equaled 1/4 cup as I tested it out for EACH of their dispensing measurements PRIOR to using it. The closest I could get to 1/4 cup of their measurements was 3/10 so I used that and set up a feeding plan per their requirements to automatically feed two times a day every 12 hours using the 3/10 dispensed amount. They use FIFTHS (1/5) measurements so itâ€™s a little confusing trying to find what worked for 1/4 cup dispensing amounts. Then within that problem lies another one thatâ€™s even bigger. After posting a question about an accurate amounts, dispensed, and then reaching out to their support team, I found an answer. This feeder will only feed an APPROXIMATE amount of their dispensed portion (of 3/10 cup). Let that soak in for a minute. Give it a second. Really let it soak in.Now, let me give you a scenario. â€¦ Dr tells you, based on your weight, height and the food intake you can eat (lets use RICE) 1 cup of Rice per meal for a total of 3 cups rice per day. Ok Doc, great. I can do that.So, on your first meal, I hand you â€¦ oh, letâ€™s say maybe 2/3 cup, and on your second meal, I hand you letâ€™s say maybe 3/4, on your third meal, I hand you oh maybe 7/8th. Youâ€™re an adult, a senior even, so you â€œunderstandâ€ what youâ€™re allowed to have per meal and your rice is right there, in that square thing that makes a noise and gives you your rice but itâ€™s not giving you what youâ€™re allowed to have each meal. Would you be happy? Or full? or satisfied? Or always thinking about food and how to get it out of that thing. Because if itâ€™s edible (& sometimes even if itâ€™s not edible) youâ€™ll attempt to get it and eat it. Because all you do is EAT, SLEEP, POOP/PEE, PLAY & PURRTo finish, I would like to quote the review of another Amazon verified purchase user, Jessica (3 years ago! man I SHOULDâ€™VE dug deeper)â€œ Jessica4.0 out of 5 starsVerified PurchaseBasic features work well, unnecessarily complex app makes setup a painReviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020I think my title basically says it all, but I'm not really a brief person so here goes...On the whole, I'm very pleased with the quality of the build of this product, and the ease of filling and cleaning, which are really paramount concerns for something like this. Unboxing and putting everything together is easy, and so far the feeder has been reliable.That said, I think the app is a lot more complex than it needs to be, and while that can be updated and changed over time, it's important to know what you're getting into.When you go through setup of the feeder and app for the first time, I think the experience is a bit all over the place. There are instruction stickers on the feeder itself, there is a booklet of instructions, there are QR codes and links within the booklet to scan to get to videos that you have to watch for further steps, and then there's setup within the app itself... etc. I think it's just a few too many layers of info and could be pared down significantly. Once everything is setup and you're trying to actually use the app, those same issues of unnecessary layers/ complications continue. The app tries to get you to schedule meals based on feeding recommendations for your pet, so you have to setup a profile for each of your pets first. This sounds minor, but it's quite detailed, and includes a whole lot of information that isn't truly necessary just to make a recommendation for feeding quantity. In the end, a truly informed recommendation would really require nutrition information about your pet food itself, so the whole exercise is a bit silly. I was left feeling a bit unsure of how much of this information I *really* needed or wanted to complete. Once you have been asked about various details for your pet, then you need to schedule fixed meals for each, and again I do appreciate that they tried to include a lot of options for customization, but it's just too much. For one, how do they propose that you make sure the right pet eats the right meal, etc? I think it would be much easier to remove those options, or hide them behind an advanced mode, and just let you set a very simple schedule with set times and quantities. K.I.S.S. you know? Given that the app doesn't interface with bluetooth trackers or smart catboxes or anything like that, I'm not sure I see any need for the pet profiles at all! It just adds complexity for no discernible reason.Beyond the actual cumbersome data entry requirements, I found the interface to be not very intuitive. I had difficulty finding the settings that I actually wanted to look for and find out more about, such as the Alexa integration, and kept getting lost in layers of social media integrations and gamification... which, why? I was looking into trying out the Smart Home integration options, but do I need a community and messaging platform for my smart feeder? Maybe this is more of a cultural thing, I believe the company is based in China, but I just don't need this kind of fluff cluttering up the basic functions of the app. I'd really enjoy it more if they could pull back on these added features, or again, maybe just hide them all in one area of the app called 'Social' or similar, but they seemed to be behind every corner. For me, again it just took away from the experience of feeling like I could find the basic information and functions quickly and easily. Thankfully, apps can be can be improved and refined over time, so I feel that most of those concerns are somewhat secondary. If you plan to use it in a way where you can sit down and get through it, then basically 'set it and forget it', I think it will work well for you. But if you would plan to regularly make any tweaks to your meal plans, I think it would be a not-minor annoyance. I'll also mention that this is something my partner and I considered setting up for aging parents, just as a little convenience item to make their lives easier. After working with it, I don't know if I can comfortably go that direction. I definitely don't feel confident that they would have gotten through any of the initial setup themselves, but I also don't think they could make any on-the-fly changes to the configuration even if the initial steps were done for them. My advice to the developers would be: pare down to the basics and make sure they are quick and intuitive. THEN add extras, but remember they are extras and not your primary functions.Ok, so it seems like I'm coming down kind of harsh. All that said, I do think this product will work just fine for use in my own home. The feeder itself is sturdy and has so far been reliable. While I don't have direct experience with a lot of competing products, I had been taking note of some other design issues I'd noted in some of those competitors and waited to try something that seemed to address them. For one, I don't just appreciate the option for plug-in power and battery backup, for me that's an absolute requirement on something like this. The food storage compartment also seems secure, which was a concern I had because I have one cat that will get into ANYTHING edible that is left out. I'm impressed because he hasn't even tried with this, which also tells me the seals are probably decent and he's not being tempted by the smell of kibble. That also leads me to believe that bugs shouldn't be an issue, though time will tell. I also appreciate that the actual food bowl portion is easily removable, as it just snaps into place with a magnet. Being plastic based, it's important to clean something like that regularly and you and I both know that won't happen if it's a pain point. Ideally, I would really like to see this component and the food storage bin being made out of stainless steel, but maybe that's something that could be incorporated in a future revision as well.Let's wrap this up...On the whole, if you are patient and technologically competent enough to get through the configuration of the app itself, it's a good product that I think you'll be happy with.9 people found this helpfulâ€â€ â€¦â€", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Must use your cellphone.', 'author': 'Connie M. Bush', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Just got the feeder; recommended by the vet; not much information in manual, just how to put together. That wasn't difficult. Still having problems making changes to the feeding schedule. The cat now gets breakfast 2 times one at 5:30 am and one at 6:30 am. Couldn't figure out how to delete one of them. Feeding the cat 5 times a day, 1/10 of a cup at a time for a total of 1/2 cup a day. What the vet recommended (not necessarily 5 times). If cat eats 1/4 cup 2 times a day, he is back before supper time. This helps a lot. I ignore the cat and I am trying to each a cat that I will not feed him, he must wait for the feeder. Ask me in a couple of weeks.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

It has a USB plug, but unlike so many companies these days, the wall plug was included in the package!Set up is easy, just follow the instructions, and don't be afraid to try. reviews: [{'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Unique bowl, durable quality', 'author': 'Adam', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This bowl is made of durable rubber of vivid color. I opted to get this bowl for the poor beast after my daughter finally agreed that she would try it. Luna has used it all week since we got it and Luna has had normal sized feedings without throwing up or constantly burping. I love the flexible removable silicone bowl that firmly sits in the sturdy base. It moves a little bit on the floor, but her dog hasn't had to chase it around like other bowls we have used on the bare floor or in a silicone pet feeding mat. title: Automatic Cat Feeder WiFi - Automatic Cat Food Dispenser with APP Feeding Control, 4L Auto Pet Feeder for Dry Food, Dual Power Supply, Desiccant Bag, 10s Voice Recorder
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very helpful', 'author': 'Ashlee Stuckey', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got these mainly because they were on sale even though I've been wanting some. At the risk of being overly dramatic: this feeder has literally changed our lives. Whenever we go away, which certain times of year is somewhat frequently, I have someone who comes to feed Kitty her wet food (I have also had an automatic water fountain for several years) and check on her once a day. Because I cannot get someone in more than once a day, I would leave a perpetual feeder full of dry food that would be available to Kitty 24/7. But my tiny-frame, 15 lb kitty is a glutton. Also, I do wish there was a setting to keep the lid open unless the cat with the wrong tag tries to eat from it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Works great, but the RFID tag is the downfall', 'author': 'Monny', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'The product works as described, it\'s great in that you can control how much you feed your pet, and monitor which pet is eating and for how long. You can modify the open/close speed to allow your pet time to get used to the movements of the lid and also can modify how long the lid stays open when they are no longer within the RFID range. Another small detail I enjoy is that you can record a mealtime message in the app, so whenever you have the auto-feeder setup you can have the device say "dinner time" or whatever you want in your own voice while it feeds your pet.There are two downsides for me though that really make this not a complete product:First, it would be really nice if they had a live camera/microhpone built in. This would help a lot during the training phase to see how your pet is reacting when going near it, it also would help when you are out of town and want to monitor/speak to your pet.Second, the RFID chip is massive! The picture in the product listingmade me believe that you could slide it on another collar and that\'s not the case. The only way to attach it to the non-original collar is to use a ring (which is included in the box). However, the chip swings around freely and is absolutely massive for a cat. I could see this being a negligible point for a medium-sized and above dog. However, we have a very skittish cat and the RFID chip is bothering her too much throughout the day to make it worthwhile. If they could either decrease the size of the chip, allow pet microchips to be synced or maybe even have some kind of fabric pocket that slides on the collar rather than dangling down, it would greatly improve this product and allow for use even with the most skittish of pets.Overall if those downsides aren\'t the end of the world for you or your pet, then this product is really great! It was packaged nicely, easy to put together, and made with high quality materials. It seems to be a reasonable price compared to like-products on the market and Petlibro has always had great products from the few I\'ve purchased (we also have several of their water fountains, which are amazing).Update: After about a week of use, this product is getting worse. It has issues dispensing food. If the bowl isn\'t virtually empty it will cause a backup and won\'t dispense more food. My cat for whatever reason prefers to eat from the front and sides of the bowl first. This leaves any remaining food at the rear of the bowl . This device registers this as the bowl being full and doesn\'t allow more to be dispensed. Other issues I can forgive, but when the sole purpose of the device is to feed your pets and the device has a flaw that prevents it from doing this, that\'s just a bad product. Do NOT buy these feeder until they fix things.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Randomly dispenses food outside of scheduled time', 'author': 'TTFN999', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I bought two because our older cat decided her "little sister" shouldn\'t get to eat (she was eating all her food and the leftover food from the younger cat). My biggest concern was that my cats weren\'t going to figure out how to use it, but they did. Cool features in the app even allow you to schedule food to be dispensed periodically throughout the day, so we set up four small feedings (20 g, 10g, 10g and 20g) to be dispensed for breakfast, lunch, snack and supper. The feeders are kept in separate rooms.After I set up feeding schedules for both feeders in the app, each feeder has now randomly dispensed a full day\'s worth of food (all four feedings) between scheduled feedings. The first feeder did it the same day we set them up. We encouraged the cats to hang around so they could see the food being dispensed. Neither of them were near the dispenser at the time (several feet away). It only happened one time for that one feeder, so we chalked it up to a technology glitch (maybe I didn\'t set it up right, didn\'t save something, etc.) That was on Friday, (a day or two after we got it), and it worked as expected over the weekend, dispensing breakfast, lunch, snack and supper portions at the scheduled times.Yesterday (Tuesday), the same thing happened with the second feeder. Both cats were several rooms away from the feeder, asleep on our bed about an hour after the third feeding time (which they slept through) when a full day\'s worth of food was dispensed - in four consecutive portions, just like what happened with the first feeder a few days before. It still dispensed the last scheduled feeding at the right time afterward.I\'m at a loss. These were not inexpensive. My vet recommended getting something like it so our older cat could eat only her food (and not eat her sister\'s food) - she needs to lose the extra weight. I\'m lucky she doesn\'t "wolf" everything in her bowl (or at least she hasn\'t yet), but I should be able to rely on them only getting one day\'s food servings in 1 day.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars RFID tag is bulky, feeder is too sensitive to chip proximity. Make this work with implanted chips!', 'author': 'Elisabeth B.', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Update: Like another reviewer, the feeder is seemingly dropping food at random, not on the schedule set within the app (we have a non-RFID feeder from this company that doesn't have this problem). It seems to be dropping at 10 minutes after the hour at random. I sent an email to Petlibro's support team, so we'll see what they say - but I'm leaning towards this expensive feeder getting returned.First, if this feeder operated from my cat's implanted microchip, it would be amazing. The large, bulky tag that must be worn bothers my cat, and he's constantly trying to remove it from his neck, so I'm unsure if this feeder will work for us. If the tag were smaller, it could possibly work - but I'd really love to not have to have my cat wear a collar at all.The feeder is also much too 'sensitive' to the microchip tag - so if my cat is sitting near / next to his feeder, the door will stay open - allowing his brother to sneak in and eat as much as he wants, or grab a mouth full of food and run off with it. We have one overweight cat who eats all of his brother's food, so this sort of defeats the purpose of having a feeder like this. I'm unsure if this is something that could be fixed via a firmware update, but it definitely has an impact on the functionality.The positives? The hopper is airtight and holds a lot of food, the feeder is beautifully designed, and it was extremely easy to connect to the app (I already have another Petlibro feeder and water fountain). I also love being able to customize it with my pet's name or a message.I'm unsure if we will be able to keep the feeder - we'll likely give it a few days to see if my cat will keep the bulky tag on. The option to use an implanted microchip and having a slightly less sensitive sensor to said chip would easily make this a 5 out of 5, and I'd buy another one for my other cat. We love Petlibro products and this one could be so much better with these small changes.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly want i need!', 'author': 'Alejandro Hernandez', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Petlibro has done it once again with another great product! Ive read other reviews but decided to found out the truth for myself. I have not had a single issue so far and have done exaclty what i need to stop my bigger cat from eating my smaller cats food. The RFID tag is not huge but it also isnt small. My cats dont seem bother by the size of the tag. The app works really well and i enjoy seeing the data of how often my cats eat as well as when they eat. Over all i was scared from the other peoples reactions to this product but petlibro has made another amazing product for a great price compared to other competitors.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars RFID Reader Interference', 'author': 'TataTot', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I was so excited to receive this. The app is user friendly and intuitive. I second that the tag is quite large and I was take aback, but this doesnâ€™t seem to bother my cat.The main issue Iâ€™ve encountered is the RFID reader was not reading the tag unless it is practically touching it. Even while my cat was standing on the reader, the lid would close while she was eating.It turns out that you cannot place the feeder on a metal surface. This can cause the reading distance to be significantly reduced. I moved the feeder onto a different surface and it works great.Iâ€™ll follow up later with my thoughts after having for a while.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars This feeder made a complicated situation way less complicated', 'author': 'fruitxcup', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I went out on a limb and bought this feeder. One of my cats was diagnosed with IBD and has to eat prescription food. Now this guy is like a little vacuum if there is food he will find it and eat it. Both of my cats were used to food being out all the time. So my guy on the non prescription food was getting upset that his food couldnâ€™t be out all the time. Meanwhile, the one on prescription food would play cat games and inevitably get to the non prescription food. Enter this feeder.The good:I love that it simply does its job. It only allows my nonprescription food boy to get his food anytime he wants it. I can set food times and the lid keeps his food fresh.The Meh:If your cat isnâ€™t used to wearing a collar or tag I could see how they may have trouble with the tag. My guys have always worn collars since before I adopted them. The sensor tag for the feeder isnâ€™t much bigger than a normal pet tag and is a little lighter. It is about the size of a quarter at the biggest point. My guy doesnâ€™t have any issue but I could see how it could be one.My guy was very picky about standing on the sensor area. He wouldnâ€™t stand on it until I put a dish drying mat over it.The ugly:My guy normally eats all the food from the front of the bowl so there are frequent blockages like twice a day. Itâ€™s not a huge deal since I can easily access the bowl, but still annoying.I would still recommend buying this. It has made life so much easier. I donâ€™t have to worry about my little guyâ€™s health as much. There are a couple things that arenâ€™t perfect with this product but at its price point and the amount of weight it has lifted off my shoulders I would buy it again.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars This could have been something great', 'author': 'April Rastaetter', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I recently purchased the Petlibro One RFID Feeder for my two cats, and while there are aspects I appreciate, there are notable areas that could be improved to enhance its functionality. I hope this review helps if you have cats like mine!For reference, I have one orange cat who is food obsessed (Gene). I have another tabby cat who is a grazer (Frank). At the moment I use the SureFeed microchip feeder but there are no doors and no automatic feeding option so I was really hoping the PetLibro one would fill that gap.What I Find Challenging:Bulky RFID Collar:The RFID collar provided is bulky and distracting, particularly for smaller cats. Comparatively, the SureFeed Microchip feeder's microchip reader seems more responsive and less obtrusive. A downsized RFID tag would be so much better here. My cat is so petite!Door Closing Speed:Despite confirming with Petlibro support that the feeder is functioning correctly, the door's closing speed on the fastest setting (1 second) is too slow. My food-motivated cat like Gene, can grab food before the door fully closes when my other cat walks away.Slow Food Dispensing:The slow dispensing of food - if I say my cat needs 2 portions it will spin out 2 portions pretty slowly. For a cat like Frank, who eats modestly throughout the day, the multiple drops required for one feeding can lead to waiting time ,which lets Gene anticipate and interfere with the process.Bowl Design Issues:The round-rectangle bowl shape is not great. Food gets stuck in the corners and it deff causes whisker fatigue. It needs to be raised or not so deep in the corners.What I Like:Auto-Feeder Concept:The automatic feeder with a door is a positive feature, particularly for households with less food-motivated cats on different diets.Monitoring Features:The ability to monitor the cat's eating habits on the app is really cool.Aesthetically Pleasing Design:The clean and sleek appearance of the Petlibro One RFID Feeder is commendable. Some even mistook it for a printer which I thought was funny but a call to its sleek look.Side Bumpers:The side bumpers are effective in keeping food thieves at bay while Frank was actively at the dish.Suggestions for Improvement:Microchip or RFID Tag Options:Offering a choice between microchip and RFID tags, with a downsized and more comfortable tag for cats with microchips, could address the issue of collar bulkiness.Faster Door Closing Mechanism:Enhancing the motor to close the door even faster could prevent food theft and improve the overall efficiency of the feeder.Revise Bowl Design:Rethinking the bowl design, perhaps elevating or changing its shape to prevent food accumulation in the corners, would be beneficial.If it was faster opening and closing as well as putting out food, had a better opening system (microchip or smaller RFID), and a better bowl would be perfect. It just didn't work in our household so instead I bought upgrades for my SureFeed Microchip feeder.Thanks!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: WOPET 7L Automatic Dog Feeder with Camera, 5G WiFi Automatic Cat Food Dispenser, Automatic Cat Feeder with Timer Programmable, HD Camera for Voice and Video Recording
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Extremely helpful for so many reasons!', 'author': 'BlueMoonMom&Dad', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I bought this because I have 3 cats and apparently I've been over feeding. Took my cats to the vet and they are over weight, so he asked me to measure and focus on portion control. I used to use one of the 1/2 gallon like jugs that just hang upside down, and my cats were eating all the time whenever they wanted. I'm gone a lot, vets not happy, and I want my cats to be healthy. So I started searching and doing my homework.This feeder is working great for me and my fur babies! It has many ways of controlling the portion. You can set the exact amount of grams to be fed, 6 times daily. So on the app you choose how much you want it to dispense, title of feeding (ex. Breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack), and you can add a pre-recorded personalized voice message to play when it dispenses their meals.You can choose different recordings for each individual feeding time, or use the same recording for all feedings. I'm only using the one recording I made (ex. Nola, Oreo, Casper, it's time to eat! HERE KITTY KITTY KITTY! It plays the recording 3 times in a row while dispensing the food. Which is nice because if they don't hear it the first time, they definitely do by the third making sure they don't miss a meal.Within the first few days they became trained to the feeder. They can be in REM sleep, hear the recording, then immediately jump up to run and eat! It's actually really funny!The app sends a notification to your phone for every feeding, which prompts me to go in app and check the camera, to make sure all 3 are getting to eat. I can also hear them to make sure they aren't growling at each other, which thank goodness they eat together fine. But if they didn't you can also talk to them in real time from the app.I really like how the app is set up so you can see the camera on the top half of the screen, and the bottom of half you can choose to take a photo, record, listen, or talk. Or you can click the full screen to enlarge the full picture.The only thing I really think could have used improvement is the camera angle seems a bit high, for when they have their heads up close and in the bowl. I can only see the top of their heads. However, I don't know though, because if it were lower it would be too close and if it were higher you wouldn't see them at all. Because when they aren't face down in the bowl I can see them just fine. As a matter of fact I think it has a wide lens because I can see my entire kitchen! Which is a pretty neat bonus feature. I have found the app to be very easy to understand, operate and navigate. It does freeze when in camera view sometimes when I forget to close out the app after using, and leave inactive for too long. But it's easy to close and re-open the app.Overall I have found this to not only meet the needs of fine tuned portion control, but also many other neat features that have made feeding my cats so convenient and most of all FUN! Not only am I feeding them more responsibly to prevent over feeding, but I'm actually enjoying being able to interact with them when I'm not home, checking to make sure they are okay. And it holds alot of food so it's never a chore to feed. I really like this and now that I'm utilizing all of these fun and needed features, I could never go back to my jug feeder. This records every feeding, time, amount fed in grams etc. and stores it in the app. Now I can take this to the vet in a few more weeks to make sure that everything is right for my cats diet, and then he can give me accurate feedback. I hope this helps those who are needing a solution like I did. This would also be great for anyone like me who isn't home a lot or maybe has an unexpected hospital stay, or even use if you have a vacation to go on. This is also nice for those times you can't find a pet sitter on short notice. You can feed, see, talk to, and interact with your fur baby. Holds a lot of food for days when you can't be home which can reduce anxiety in emergency situations. Make sure to place batteries in the compartment in case of power outage. Because if the power goes out while your gone, the feeder will still work as long as you've put the batteries in it. I personally feel this is a great addition to any home with pets for a variety of reasons and therefore would highly recommend!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 11, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Handy automatic pet feeder with desirable features', 'author': 'Lyn H.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought two of these units for our two former feral cats who are still skittish when encountering unusual noises and unfamilar objects. May not have been necessary but I took my time to gradually introduce them to the feeders, bowls and associated noise.Set up both feeders with small scoop option (nice feature) and placed them on the floor, side by side. Cats, being cats, carefully checked them out. The first few times I lightly placed (lightly dropping) kibble in the bowls; when the cats were comfortable woth the noise and eating from the bowls, I then moved on to manually trigger the feeders so the cats would become accustomed to the noise of the pellets being released (gentle motor whine and kibble hitting the plastic dish) while I was in the room. They were concerned initially with the noise (quieter feline version of coins dropping from a slot machine but their payout was in edible bits.) Once they were comfortable with one mechanical feeding a day, they were settled down enough to eat from the attached bowls without constantly looking around. Now they are somewhat attuned to feeding times and often wait in the room for the units to disperse their kibble.Both cats are enthusiastic eaters but the larger one uses his size to take over what he feels is unclaimed food. It was necessary to synchronize the distribution time and portions so both cats would be fed. Next time Iâ€™ll save time by using the power strip method mentioned by another owner; however, I was able to sync them close enough that feeding times are not battles with one winner and one loser. The mechanical mechanisms have worked fine so far. Portions are fairly consistent since both units are set the same setting. Nice to have up to 4 feedings a day and control over the portion sizes per feeding. After checking portion quantity often, I now feel confident that both cats receive the desired quantity per day.Initially, I thought the voice recording would not be necessary since the descending pellets are noisy. Iâ€™ve set up the voice recording on one of the units only. Itâ€™s a short message which repeats 3 times. This feature has been a useful alert and use it daily.The units are powered by USB cords. Weâ€™ve experienced one power outage since the units were set up. Back up batteries were installed; the units were not affected in the least. Again - nice feature.Being able to see the quantity of kibble in the container is a plus. The clear top is secure from opening by pet paws but convenient and handy with fingers.Neither cat has knocked over a unit but have turned them slightly in search of one or two pieces of kibble that bounced out of the bowl. Easy to realign when needed however.Our cats are comfortable with these units. We are very happy with them. Two months in use, they fit our needs now and envision they will continue to do so, hopefully for some time.A few surprises:The directions to replace the large size food rotator with the small size was confusing. Once I figured out one does not need to take the whole unit apart to replace this piece, it all made sense. Replacement in our second unit was quick.Seemed odd to use a 24 hour clock to set feeding times. It works but odd.Would be nice to be able to control the number of times the voice recording is activated. Ours repeats 3 times, more than necessary.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great feeder, not accurate on amount I think.', 'author': 'Brooke Ross', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have had this feeder for almost 4 years (Dec 2019) and have loved it! It always works, is right on time, and has kept my cat off my back. A few pros and cons though to consider:Pro's:-can set the food times, and up to 4 meals. Very easy to customize.-sturdy and difficult to break into. Believe me, my cat has tried. He likes to drag and throw this across the room in the middle of the night sometimes. Quite the scene.-easy to clean and take a part bottom.-easy to fill, and dispenses my cat food fine (Purina is the brand).Cons:- extremely loud when dispensing food- not accurate on the grams it claims to give (more in that below)- cat can start to CHEW on the cord. Additionally the cord disconnects from the back very easily. We have had to tape it down so the cat can't disconnect it.-like everyone mentioned though programming itself is easy, the buttons are super difficult to move/change and if you go over you have to loop back around to get it set correctly.More on the not accurate amount. I have been to the vet several times over the last four years and in the last two years my cat has gained quite a lot of weight. He is a hefty boy. I have always listened to my vets reccomend amount of food he should get, and based off of his type of food, and the feeder I thought I was always giving him the right amount. We have come to discover that he is somehow getting more food than he should have been from this feeder and I need to now scale it back (we all know how cat diets go...). Not thrilled with that and am considering up grading or getting a feeder that uses some sort of weight system when it dispenses the food. I don't have anything special, just Purina weight management but the amount he gets is important.All that is to say that I've had this for almost 4 years and that is pretty dang good for a feeder for the job that it has set out to do.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Worked fine for 3 months, then stopped... And received refund from manufacturer', 'author': 'Charles W. Hartley', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'UPDATE (22 Nov 2019):After this review I was contacted by the manufacturer and offered a replacement or refund. Since I had already purchased a different unit that has worked well so far (fingers-crossed), I took them up on the refund. And true to word, I received notice from Amazon that a refund is in process by the manufacturer.So, while the unit did eventually fail, for the period of time it worked, this unit worked very well and made life better for my cat while I was at work and for short trips out of town. In short, sometimes you get a bad unit, and my experience with the unit while it worked was great, and the response from the manufacturer has been above board.============================I bought this in late August and it has worked great until now. I had to change out the portion size unit since this is for a cat with small kibble, but that was not a problem. The electronics are a little primitive to set up the feedings, but once set the unit worked fine. I would occasionally use the "manual" button to dispense a bonus sometimes. Push and hold the button for a second, and it dispenses 1 portion. Great!However, I discovered some ants had found there way in and were checking out my cat\'s food. So, I tossed the food outside and emptied the food from the hopper into gallon ziploc bags and then stored in my VittleVault (which I haven\'t needed to use in years). The I washed the food tray and the hopper to wash out any other critters. Obviously I didn\'t wash the housing with the electronics! So, I don\'t use it for a few days and feed my cat manually away from the location where the ants were. I let the unit run according to schedule, there\'s no food in it, but no problem (I have the backup batteries installed). So, when I go to use it again after taking care of the ant problem, something is screwy. Previously, when the unit was working, the motor would do its full crank and dispense the food as its supposed to, then there would be one or two short cranks of the motor. I figured it is an alignment thing or something, cause it worked fine. Now, after several tests, all I get are the small cranks and no full crank according to the number of portions programmed. I\'ve removed the batteries, unplugged for a few minutes, plugged in and reset the clock to do a test feeding, or even just tried a manual test, and same thing, no full cranks of the motor. Well, I *think* it did work once, but that was it. And I don\'t think I did anything differently, the motor just worked and then didn\'t again. I\'m at a total loss...Now, reading some of the bad reviews, it seems like the motor dying after only a few months does happen, although not that often based on the product\'s overall rating. In the meantime, I\'ve ordered a different product which will barely arrive in time for a short trip I have this weekend... finger crossed!!!!I\'m going to keep trying to get the unit to work, and if it does, I\'ll have two (assuming the new one is still working; the electronics on these things seem of poor quality, Chinese made), maybe one as a back up, or I\'ll donate it to a shelter.TL;DRThe unit worked great for several months and now the motor doesn\'t seem to be cranking correctly to portion out the food. Haven\'t called customer support yet, but will update when I have more news.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 6, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Tried two others before this one', 'author': 'CC Florida', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I wanted a feeder that would handle three cats so I searched for options that had two bowls. First I purchased the HoneyGuardian 4.5L feeder (link below). It was OK. The price was right but a definite learning curve with the programming. The dispensing of food was fine but IT WAS SO LOUD. The first time it went off, the cats and I nearly had heart attacks. We suffered similar reactions every time. I grew up in NYC, across the street from a fire station and had learned to sleep through the fire truck sirens in the middle of the night. But this thing going off at 10pm jangled my nerves. Sent it back.Next I purchased the Rellorus 5L feeder. Not as modern looking as the HoneyGuardian, cheap price and about the same to program as the HoneyGuardian. It was quieter than the HoneyGuardian so despite being bulkier and more boring looking, it was already a better choice. Then, three weeks in it just stopped working.Which brought me to the Wopet 7L feeder. I impressed myself with a spreadsheet comparing capacity, # of feeding bowls, # of meals, battery backup and price which allowed me to choose wisely.This unit did not have a dual feeder but honestly, at this point I didn't care anymore. It cost more money but you know how they say you get what you pay for? Well so far this unit has been worth every penny. Easy to program, very sleek looking, and pretty silent dispensing. The feeding dish is generously sized and those genius cats figured out they can take turns eating.I did not use the voice memo feature on any of these because I am fairly confident that my disembodied voice would just freak the cat out. Cuz it's creepy. Highly recommend this unit - get it!Previously purchased models:Automatic Cat Feeder, HoneyGuaridan 4.5L Pet Feeder for 2 Cats Dogs Food Dispenser Auto Cat Feeder â€“ 6 Meal Portion Control, Distribution Alarm, Programmable Timer Feeder, 10s Voice Recorder (White)Rellorus Automatic Cat Feeders, 5L/21Cups Pet Food Dispenser for Two Cats, Timed Cat Feeder with Double Bowls, 48 Portions 6 Meals Per Day for Cat and Dog, 10s Meal Call", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Kitty is happy and so am I - UPDATED 2X', 'author': "Will's Mom", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE 4/1:Wopet customer service responded to my message within 12 hours and within 24 hours let me know a replacement was on its way! I did not expect this at all but am so impressed by their quick action. A++ for customer service and satisfaction. Kitty will be happy to have her feeder back up and running.UPDATE 3/30/21:Well almost two years to the date of purchase, the feeder no longer works. Kitty was acting strange for days and we realized the feeder wasn\'t feeding properly. Tried to reset clock and feeding times - no luck, time just kept flashing but couldn\'t be set. Tried factory reset using their instructions - nothing. Unplugged and took batteries out and turned switch off hoping it would reset itself - nope. We have the basic version (not wifi, nothing fancy) and it just quit. Tried reaching out to manufacturer this morning but haven\'t heard back. Going to the store to buy a gravity feeder so my cat doesn\'t starve. It was great while it lasted.Original review:Works like a charm! This Wopet feeder replaced a "smartfeeder" made by another manufacturer that turned out to be a NOT SO smartfeeder! Without any warning or notifications, it stopped feeding my cat last week. How did I figure out that it wasn\'t working? Getting woken up at 3:00am by an angry and starving cat! Multiple attempts to get help went unanswered so I gave up on that company and decided it was time to try a new feeder.I decided it was more important to have an automatic feeder that actually feeds my cat reliably than have the "smart" feature so that narrowed down my search. This one was most recommended on various sites/reviews so I figured I\'d give it a go. It happened to be on sale and offered free returns so I had nothing to lose.Received it the other day, programmed it with ease and it has been working like a charm! Kitty is happy to have food coming out and I\'m happy it was so easy to set up. I did have one question when setting up the feeder so I emailed customer service. They responded quickly and were extremely helpful. The new feeder is sleek and takes up little space. There is an inner sleeve that holds the food and is easy to remove to clean which is nice. The dish is plastic but not strange odors or anything. It can be plugged in or run on batteries which work as a back up in case the power goes out - comforting to know in case it happens when we are away.All in all, a great experience. Fingers crossed, this one will keep on dispensing the food and my cat will let me sleep through the night again!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful product', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'There are things that can be improved like the quality of audio, it would also be nice to have motion triggered video recording. But overall this is a wonderful product which allowed us to be away for a month and being sure that our cats are OK by observing them when they come to eat during feeding times. We have actually installed it outside in a sheltered environment and it works fine.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Maybe if it cost less it would be worth it, but I would not waste $ on this.', 'author': 'R.W.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I bought this a year ago to watch over my senior dog, and feed her if I can\'t make it in time from work for her dinner.Anyways, the set up process was super annoying because it only can be set up on a certain Wifi signal (the feeder does not support 5Ghz Wi-Fi networks, only 2.4Ghz networks) which in 2022 is just plain dumb. In my case where I have a mesh Wifi system, and it sends both signals and you can\'t chose which one to connect to (by default 2.4 will connect to 2.4 and 5 will connect to 5) so when the feeder connects automatically to the 2.4 and my phone automatically to 5, Wopet will not allow you to set up. Both the feeder and phone had to be on the 2.4 signal. So what did I have to do? I took a 100\' extension cord and walked around my property when I finally was able to go so far from my house that my phone switched from 5 to 2.4. And so I am sitting in my driveway like an idiot near traffic with this feeder trying to set it up. Much more wasted time before this little trick.Great. finally set up, right? NoMost issues happen when I am not home, when the app and the feeder is most useful. When I am home it\'s all fine. But that defeats the purpose of having it.In the last year I have gotten many messages on the app, where on the event list it has multiple warnings where it "dispensed excessive food" at scheduled times. At times it showed that message as well, and I can\'t tell you how many because the app seems to delete old events after a while. So I only have the ones from this past month.At times, I think there was a message that no food was dispensed, but I came home to see traces of food like my dog ate. So then I didn\'t know if and how much my dog ate, and whether I\'ll be overfeeding it or not if I give it more food.Sometimes last minute I know I wasn\'t going to be home, it wasn\'t allowing me to schedule a feed time.And the most annoying of all, more than 3/4 of the time, when I am outside of my Wifi network, the camera won\'t connect. I just get the spinny wheel of death. Which is the main reason why I bought this, so I can watch my dog eat and check in on her because of her age.So at this point its just an expensive dog food storage bin.If you want a camera to watch your pet, just get a real indoor camera from Google or another maker. And maybe figure something else out for the feeding. When I bought it with tax and shipping it was probably around $150, and you can get an indoor Nest cam for $100.If I could I\'d give this back.EDIT: I have decided to edit the review from previous 3 to 1 star because after I posted this review, the company contacted me on the side and offered me return money or another product ONLY if I agree to remove this review. Also, reporting this to Amazon.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable quality for your fur baby', 'author': 'Tania DeVoe', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We purchased this product prior to a long weekend away from our kitten for the first time. We purchased this product for some of the features it offered that would make us feel at ease while we were away and the product did not disappoint. The product has a battery back up in case your power goes out. The power cord was nice and long to accommodate the product being on the floor and reaching our plug by the counter top. The product stays connected to our WIFI with no interruptions. We have tested the measurement proportions numerous time to ensure that the device was properly delivering the right amount to our kitten twice daily. Each time we measured the device amount distributed, it was accurate. It is right on time too for scheduled feedings, we can watch our clock and the second the time hits the food comes out and our fur baby goes running. We used the camera option when we were out of town and the picture was clear. This put us at ease even more so while being away. I would recommend this product to others who are looking for a reliable product to trust to feed their animals timely and accurately. The only thing you need to worry about is making sure the large holding container is full of food and that it does not go empty.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nearly the #1 perfect feeder for cats', 'author': 'Gen', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I was looking for a feeder for my cats that I could rely on to feed them when I am away for a few days. With it's large capacity it should be able to do the job. Here are some of my pros and cons, you'll notice there are overwhelming pros.Pros:7L of storageWide and shallow bowl to reduce whisker fatigue in catsSupports 5 mealsSupports batteries as a backup in case of power lossButtons are under the lidThe inner pail and dish can be removed for cleaningCons:No food window. That little black line on the front is strictly decorative and not transparent, so you cannot see from afar how much food is left. There is also no light or signal to let you know the food has run out.The bowl is very difficult to remove and will definitely break soonA single portion is 9 grams. I tested this twice. I wish it was half of that. 9 grams or ~1/8c is a lot of food for a cat when adjusting for weight loss or weight gain. They will notice when you lower it by a single portion.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]
