title: iPettie Donuts Frost WiFi 6 Meal Automatic Cat Food Dispenser with App Control, Dry & Wet Food Automatic Cat Feeder, Smart Dog Feeder with Two Ice Packs, Programmable Timer, Holds 6 x Â½ lb. of Food
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome!', 'author': 'Beth', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've only had it about a week, but so far, this feeder is great! I have a little blind cat who gorges his food, and this allows me to divide his food into smaller meals that are dispensed throughout the day. It only took him about 2 days to recognize the beeps and the turn of the motor when food is dispensed. Now he hears the first beep and runs for the feeder!Set up was easy, and it's great to be able to schedule feedings through the app and also to push a button on the app to feed spontaneously.I highly recommend this item!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars sleek product but simple. Easy setup and use', 'author': 'R & J', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My senior cat eats only wet food now, but that makes going away even for a weekend super tough. This product is definitely the first step to helping me out without having to get a cat sitter-- I didn\'t know there was automatic wet food feeders, and iPettie doesn\'t disappoint.The container itself works like a charm. When it transitions, it\'s nice and quiet--love it! And so far it\'s cat proof enough that my desperate kitty hasn\'t been able to tip it over, crack it open, or wiggle her paw into it, while it\'s really easy for me (as a human) to open it, add food, and clean it. The smooth circular shape is ingenious this way. It does take a a good chunk of floor space, in case that matters (I use a large cat kennel at lot to separate my cats, and it is a little cramped.)The holders are a good size. I can put in a 3oz can of food in there with no issue, it maybe maxes out around one 5.5 oz can before you\'re probably breaching too close to the outer cover that\'s covering it.The app is easy enough. it\'s called "Smart Life" (must be some generic smart device controller app developed in China) and they can even send firmware updates through it (which is pretty slick). When it connects to my feeder, it\'s pretty simple to add when I want the feeder to rotate (the hardest part was getting the name of the app from the youtube video tutorial, so you\'re welcome). I do wish there was an "every day" option, instead of scheduling it again and again each day, but minor stuff. Also minor, the log has the AM/PMs switched (so a planned 8 PM is showing as an 8 AM, and vice versa) but that\'s easy to ignore.The hardest part is the food storage logistics so really not like any problem with the product. The ice packs are great and keep the food cold, but realistically can only keep it cold for...12 hours at most. I refrigerate or freeze some food so it will stay cold longer, but I think it\'s really should be a max 48 hours thing. How it works for me (on a 2 a day feeding schedule):1) rotate out the ice packs (so one in the freezer, refreezing, while one is in the holder)2) only use 4 of the slots, with 3 slots of food on standby over 1 ice pack (the pack can be placed on the rear, it doesn\'t have to only be on the left or right side as pictured)3) for extra longevity, use frozen food that\'s on standby for >24 hrs (the 2 later slots).I think this is a fairly food safe method but we shall see...just thought I\'d put it out there since really that was the hardest part for me, trying to figure out what works for me and my cat. iPettie really made a great tool that makes it possible!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars I can sleep through the night', 'author': 'M. J. Burak', 'rating': 4, 'content': "One of the hallmarks of feline kidney disease is poor absorption of nutrients. This manifests as the cat being hungry all the time. I can feed him as much as he wants during the day, but he would often wake me in the middle of the night begging for food. I bought this device to feed him a couple of times while I sleep.He's really picky, and won't eat wet food that's been out for more than an hour, no matter how hungry he gets. I was worried he wouldn't eat the food after it's been sitting in the device most of the night, but the ice packs and the seal around the food compartments did their jobs.The app is for ALL of the products this company makes, so it's really basic. Set-up was easy, first using Bluetooth to connect to the device, then adding wi-fi to it so it knows what time it is. Setting the schedule is a breeze. You just move the virtual wheels to the time, then save. And, the app sends a notification when the tray has rotated for a feeding.The only complaint I have so far is that food compartments need to be at least 50% wider. My cat doesn't like squashing his whiskers to get food that got pushed to the sides (whisker fatigue), so he's only eating about half of what I give him. (Of course I'm going to increase the amount, but that means more waste.)Overall, I'm really happy with this device.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great quality and easy to use cat food dispenser with wifi', 'author': 'TigerFish', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This automatic cat food dispenser is great quality with awesome features and wifi connectivity. It has two removable ice packs that will keep wet food cold for up to 6 hours once the packs are totally frozen in the freezer. They are obviously not needed if only using dry food in the feeder. The storage tray has six large areas for wet and dry food and is also removable from the unit for easy cleaning and is dishwasher safe. The tinted cover locks down into place and will expose one food tray opening per feeding session that can be programmed by using the wifi SmartLife app which can be downloaded to a phone or iPad. Only five of the food openings can be programmed since the sixth one will already be open. The wifi network frequency 2.4Ghz is needed to connect and operate this feeder, which is the same frequency needed to operate most other wifi connected devices in my house such as LED floor lamps. There is a touch control display on the center of the feeder which will display the wifi status and also if there are any other issues. The feeder is powered with a cable that has a USB plug which can be connected to the included wall charger if needed, and the other end is plugged into the bottom of the feeder. The power switch is also located on the bottom of the feeder. There are 4 rubber foot pads on the bottom for better stability of the feeder on hard flooring and to keep it from sliding around. I ordered this cat feeder for use mainly when I am away from the house for one or more days since I have no one to feed my cat when I am gone. I have had several multiple day hospital visits in the past and was always worried about feeding Wolfie. I used to have to leave large bowls of dry food out for him that would end up getting stale after a few days. With this feeder the dry food will stay fresh since the lid fits tight against the base. I can also put his treats in one of the tray openings for him. I recommend this automatic pet feeder to all cat owners who live alone or for those who are always away from their home for any extended time frame.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Purrrfect for senior kitties!', 'author': 'TheVoiceOfUs', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a GENIUS device!! It\'s great for cats or even small dogs. It holds a generous amount of food and the double ice pack does actually keep it fresh!It\'s simple to use and with the app, it makes it even easier! You\'ll be able to remember and track feedings plus plan for future feedings!**After 2 weeks of use with Wet Cat food**It took my senior cat, who just turned 15, several days before he finally came over to check this out. Since then, we\'ve had great success every day! My cat is a bit cenile and often forgets where his food is and when he\'s eaten last, of course, so this has helped him in many ways outside of simply giving food. When he sees us in the kitchen, he automatically assumes its time to eat! Now that he\'s used to the food dispenser "feedings", he no longer gets confused when he sees me walk in the kitchen. So this has really helped break this common behavior which is seen in most pets but most senior pets especially. (If you know, you know!)10/10!!! I would absolutely recommend this product for your beloved fur babies!!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pet feeder', 'author': 'Adam', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is a great feeder, especially if you have a cat that overeats. You can distribute the portion sizes and schedule them to be available. I like that this is WiFi connected, and you can change the schedule through the app wherever you are. The feeder connected to the app very easily and the app control is intuitive. I wouldn't put wet food in the last tray, unless you expect to get to it within a few hours. It's nice that it comes with ice packs to keep the food fresh for about a workday. I'll probably use it for wet food every once in a while. For now, I'm just using it to put out a portion of dry food once a day. You can get notifications for when it has cycled too. probably helpful for someone serving multiple portions a day. Overall I like this thing, and it's very easy to tell if the food trays have run out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for feeding wet food', 'author': 'cat', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is perfect for keeping canned pet feeding on schedule & fresh. Set-up was easy, with the wifi connected on the first attempt. Defining up the schedule in the app was intuitive.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works Well, But Only For One Cat Households', 'author': 'Tyler', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got the iPettie automatic cat feeder and it does the job. It's great that I can feed my kitty using my phone, especially when I'm out for a bit. The ice packs are smart for keeping wet food fresh for a while.That said, I've just been using it for dry food, and honestly, those old-school gravity feeders or newer dispensing type feeders work better for that. My cat quickly became accustomed to eating from this, but it's not ideal. For me, this feeder's best for wet food. Also, they should really make the tray stainless steel. Plastic isn't the best for cats health-wise, and mine gets chin acne sometimes.Bottom Line: Good if you mainly feed wet food and have one cat. For dry food, there might be better options.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Basic app-connected non-refrigerated timed feeder that works well', 'author': 'Red Green', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I've been running this for a week on 3 feedings per day. It has worked perfectly during that time. The WiFi SmartLife app, which is used by many products and manufacturers, is easy to use and pretty much goof-proof. I receive notifications of feedings on time and always (which I can turn off).This is not for multiple-day use unless you use dry kibble or dehydrated food with it because the ice packs last no more than 6 to 7 hours.The only issue: I got this specifically for my one cat that refuses to eat kibble, but she's scared of the motor noise (or maybe the beep, the movement, or a combination?). I have a timed gravity-fed feeder for bagged food for the other cat.Hopefully, Miss Scaredy-cat will start to use it. Right now, it's just spinning without food as I test it for Vine.Be careful putting the top back on, which takes some effort... I pinched my finger pretty well on one occasion.My rating system:5 Stars = Knocks it out of the park. A great value!4 Stars = Excellent product. A solid buy.3 Stars = It provides some value, but perhaps not as advertised.2 Stars = A little dubious, so do your research. Read the critical reviews!1 Star = Avoid this product and look elsewhere.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love this feeder', 'author': 'Elizabeth R.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I love this feeder, itâ€™s the perfect size, and the individual slots are perfect (perfect width and not too deep). I love that I can use the app to schedule a feeding, and I love that itâ€™s easy to open, yet easy to secure closed as well. The only thing that would make this feeder better would be if it had a refrigerated function so you wouldnâ€™t have to worry about the ice packs thawing and having to refreeze them each time. Overall, I do love this feeder though.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Automatic Cat Feeders for 2 Cats, 2.4G WiFi Automatic Cat Feeder with Double Hoppers for 2-18mm Kibble, 1-10 Meals & 30s Voice Record for Small Medium Cat Dog Pet
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Satisfied So Far', 'author': 'Megan', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I spent a lot of time comparing the mid-priced automatic feeders available on Amazon and this is the one that I finally settled on. It seems like you get what you pay for and I am hella broke, but really needed something to help me with feeding my own cat while operating a pet care business and traveling without dumping my pet's needs on my roommates or hiring someone of my own to drop in and feed.My priorities for a feeder were dual power sources, controllable portion sizes, multiple feedings (up to 6), functionality of build, removable feeding tray for easy wash, functionality of app, and a securely fastening lid. Every feeder had a few negative reviews and it seems statistical that a malfunction could occur considering the moving parts and reliance on wifi so it was really a game of chance. I do not utilize the voice feature because my cat couldn't care less about a feeding time and grazes all day (hence the desire for multiple smaller-portioned feedings).The feeder was easy to wash, physically set up, and get connected to the wifi. The app was also easy to figure out and I had feedings scheduled within minutes of it being connected to my wifi. I checked the bag of cat food to figure out how many grams a day my cat should be eating and then I measured out 1 feeding portion a few times to check the consistency of the feeder. It came out at 8-9g every time and my cat needs up to 110g a day of her current food, so I broke that down into 14 portions and scheduled them across 5 feeding times to start. She doesn't like when her bowl is empty so I may adjust this, but so far it seems to be working out well. I haven't had any problems with it dispensing food (mechanical or technical) THAT I'M AWARE OF. I wish it had a camera, but that's a feature for a higher price point. I will be monitoring the feeder over the next few days to make sure the schedule works for my cat and that it operates without fail. I'll happily update my review after a few months to see if it's still functioning at 100%.EDIT 11/13/23:My only complaint at the moment is that I can't figure out how to erase the accidental recording I made that plays every time I dispense food. I don't want to make any sound, but the only option seems to be to record over it. Hmm....", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far so great!', 'author': 'K. Everson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Added it easily to the smart life app which I already had installed using other devices. Set up and use is very easy. It seems like the wifi is not very strong as sometimes it takes a bit to connect but it always connects and works fine for manual feedings. I love the dual chambers too. We actually dont keep any food in the second chamber so if our new kitty starts crying during the night we can just do a manual feeding on chamber 2 and the voice recording will still play and distract her. The only complaint is that one of the reasons I purchased this model is that it worked with the Smart Life app. All the other devices I have using the Smart Life app also work with Google Assistant so I can control that way. This unit works with SL of course but is not able to be controlled by Google. Not a deal breaker but would have been that much nicer. I love being able to see the battery level in the app so i can monitor and change if needed so in case of a power outage my cats still get fed if i'm not home. Cant believe the price for a feeder that has this many working features. Highly recommend", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best feeder ever', 'author': 'Elle Steven', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This feeder is excellent! The feeder is easy to assemble and has a nice appearance, you must buy it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great', 'author': 'Sammie', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Definitely worth getting.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Amazingly easy to schedule and keep track!', 'author': 'Momma K', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This cat feeder is super easy to setup, change the schedule, and track their eating/meals. title: Automatic Cat Feeder, HoneyGuaridan 6L Pet Feeder for 2 Cats & Dogs, Auto Cat Dry Food Dispenser with Desiccant Bag, Timer Feeder Portion Control 1-6 Meals per Day, Dual Power Supply, Voice Recorder
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the money', 'author': 'Hannah locke', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Itâ€™s nice! It was really easy to set up. From the time I opened the box to when it was fully set with feeding schedules and complete was maybe 20 minutes. Itâ€™s not super loud and should be really helpful for when weâ€™re not home for a day or so. ðŸ‘', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very easy to set up', 'author': 'Charlee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Very easy to set up and very effective.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for multiple cats!', 'author': 'Elizabeth', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Far superior to the spinning feeders!We have been using the automatic spinning feeders every time we go out of town even though we always have a sitter. It's just a little safety net in case something happens that keeps the sitter away for longer than planned.The spinning feeders are cool and all but the openings are small and they can only be timed in a way that only keeps them going for 2-3 days. It could be 5 days each one but only if there is only one feeding per day and then we'd definitely need 4 feeders instead of the 2 we have.We bought this nice, big programmable feeder and it is a godsend. I love that we can adjust how much food comes out each time and can do so many feedings in a day. We have 4 cats so it's nice to be able to do lots of small feedings throughout the day so no matter what, each cat will likely get to nibble. We setup a camera and they do all take turns being first to the bowls and after they realized that it will keep providing food throughout the day, they stopped being so excited about it and stopped gobbling all the food all at once. Now they just eat what they need and leave the rest for another kitty.Even while not traveling, we have it setup to do 1 feed at about 3am. That way they get a snack and don't wake us up for it.The food container is huge! For a large dog it might seem a little small but for 4 spoiled kitties it can easily keep them fed for 2 weeks with lots of feedings each day. That should be plenty of time for us to get home if something happens to our sitter.It's also really nice that it can be battery powered or plugged in. Two of our cats love to chew on cords so anything that avoids cords while we are out of town is a huge bonus.The reason I knocked 1 star off is because the instructions aren't super clear and you have to push the same button soooo many times to get the desired setting and if you accidentally push it one too many times you have to cycle through all the numbers again. Would be nice if there was a keypad or even simply up/down arrows. But overall I'd probably give it 4.5 stars but I can't do half stars.Still considering getting a 2nd one so all 4 can eat at once but I'm not sure it's really necessary unless maybe we plan a really long trip.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for cats', 'author': 'GA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Have a cat or dog that loves to annoy you way too early in the morning because they want to eat. Get this! Feedings can be scheduled and even a voice recording ! If you like to take weekend trip and donâ€™t want to put your pet in an animal hotel get this. So easy', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable', 'author': 'James Kindt', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A must to have for a busy person. Works great.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great purchase!', 'author': 'Paige Baldwin', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'i have 2 cats and this is very easy to use on a daily basis or for going out of town a couple days', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Dispenses Cat Food Well', 'author': 'Placeholder', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Itâ€™s convenient but the timer keeps falling behind. Had to keep resetting the clock to keep up with the other cat feeders.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars READ THIS POST BEFORE BUYING (YOU WILL THANK ME)', 'author': 'ANGEL', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First of all, I would like to save all of you money and tell you not to buy the WIFI version. The normal version is essentially the same because the Wi-Fi version which is no longer supported by the app that it claims to use to make it WIFI/smart. It used to work but they updated the app and prostituted it to ads and charging a premium which is a scam (the feeder no longer is supported. It use to pop up as a device but no longer is. Essentially, you are paying 20 dollars more for a tiny little WI-FI symbol at this point. Not worth it.The regular and Wi-Fi version is the same. They both feed six times and have different portion settings. Ok simple break down to show you how easy it is to set up because no one does a good job at explaining this. You have three buttons on the left, one in the middle and three on the right.1. To adjust the time simply click the first button on the right-hand side (time icon) that has the clock icon. Then use the second button below the first button located on the right to set the hours, and the third to set up the minutes. It is set up in the 24-hour format.2. To cycle through the servings do the same thing as step one except a tiny different. First click the "time icon" located on the right on the right and then the "power/meal button" on the left-hand side. This will allow you to cycle through the six portions (the meal button only cycles you through the portions).3. While cycling through the six cycle servings, you can add the size of the portions while on said cycle by clicking the second button on the left-hand side that has a "small bowl" logo (the one below the power/meal button which cycles you through the 6 servings). The bowl button determines the size servings. One is the smallest portion, and two is significantly more than the "one" portion (tinker around to see what fits your pet\'s needs). When on the first, second, third, etc... You use the hour and minute buttons on the right-hand side to set the time you feed.4.The middle button just lets you feed an extra "one" size portion. However, I have found that the longer you hold it the more it will release on the "one" portion.5. Finally, the last button that we have not covered is the third button on the left-hand side. It is the record button with a "microphone" icon. Hold it for about 5 seconds, until it turns red and keep it held. While red record a message you want your pets to hear.Caution: the reset button will reset all your setting and is NOW USELESS for the Wi-Fi version.AGAIN, the WI-FI version is now useless. It used to work, but now it does not after the app update. I bought a second one on 12/22/2023 so I could feed my cats, one who has a condition and is restricted to eating in tiny portions to now she will be going from 6 feed per day to 12 feed per day except smaller. This means I have to fill these feeders much less than I use to. The first one I bought in 1/1/2023 (don\'t remember exact date) and the app is useless.In conclusion, the feeder is great, but paying, an extra 20 dollars is now pointless. I will be calling for a partial refund because it is now gone from convenient to scam. However, this was not enough for me to give these feeders anything lower than 4 stars. I just wouldn\'t feel right doing it.I hope this saved you all time, money, and frustration. Since the manual doesn\'t explain how to function it. They use to provide a great manual but no longer do. I suspect because the app no longer supports the Feeders.Thank you all,Enjoy the awesome feeder.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Convenient when I have to be away for a few days', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Love this automatic feeder for my 3 barn cats. I set it up to drop food six times during the day so that no matter which cat is around I know they will always have food. It last last 6 days before I have to fill it. Only reason I didnâ€™t give it five stars is because when it gets down to the last third, it doesnâ€™t feed the cat food down very well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 31, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Very solid food dispenser HOWEVER', 'author': 'Aaron & Vanessa Lovato', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Have had this for a few weeks and it was a very good investment. Easy to set up with a host of options and a solid tank to hold lots of kibble.Iâ€™ve deducted ONE star because as you can see in the photo, a persistent 6-ish pound morkie can apparently tip it over and the lid pops open with ease. Sheâ€™s been working on tipping it over since day one, so itâ€™s withstood her assaults since then, but I was disappointed that it fell over AND popped open.Still a good product though. Would recommend for cats and small dogs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Elevated Cat Ceramic Bowls, Large DIY 15Â° Tilted cat Food Bowl Set Raised for Indoor Cats Orthopedic Pet Carbonized Wooden Stand, Anti Vomiting 3 Bowl Cat Feeder Easy to Clean and Fill
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No more scattered dry food?', 'author': 'MT', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have a 18 year old SMALL cat. My biggest concern about the eating station was she wouldn\'t like the height of it. I just was putting it down in the normal spot when she came by looking for her bisque. First thing she did was drink the fresh water I had just put in the 1st bowl. No problemo! Great! Had the dry food already in the 2nd bowl, just needed to add her bisque to the 3rd bowl while she was still drinking. She\'s rather skidish so she did not attempt to go for the bisque until I walked away. Bingo she licked up her normal mouthful and walked away. I think this may work. My cat every so often will spit her dry food back up, when I read that the eating position might have something to do with it I thought let\'s give this a try. Really nice looking setup. 1-2-3 to put together. Everything was securely pkg. Allen wrench included to install the legs. Even included little rubber squares to put on the "feet" to protect & prevent the eating station from moving around. I also had another reason for getting this particular item. My robot vacuum cleaner has a bad habit of trying to climb the tray that I have my little ones\' food on. This should certainly eliminate the climbing. It should even beable to clean under the eating station. Found a lot of dry kibble under the tray when I removed. Just a bit embarrassed. The bowls are really nice white ceramic and the wooden frame is smooth, no splinters and appears to have a stained finished. I\'m hoping the size of the bowls are not too small. Perfect for dry food and bisque, but my cat drinks a lot of water. I figure I can use the bisque bowl for additional water when I leave for work. I\'m really pleased, considering ordering one for a good neighbor. She has 2 cats.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice!', 'author': 'Lance & Mandy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'So glad I got these bowls for my cat. It comes pretty much put together. You do have to screw on the legs but it honestly only takes seconds! I highly recommend ceramic when picking out bowls for your pets, itâ€™s the most hygienic option because it doesnâ€™t hold on to germs and is very easy to clean.This one came with three bowls, you donâ€™t have to use them all but we do. I have 5 kitties so we use all the bowls for hard food and we have water in a separate area. Being these are ceramic they are breakable, you definitely need to be careful when using handling them.Itâ€™s a beautiful set for the price. The whole thing can be hand washed. I would only recommend hand washing to prolong the life of the food dish. It is extremely durable and should last you a very long time as long as you take care of the', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Itâ€™s the right height', 'author': 'Sheila M.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The three bowls are perfect for my cat, dry food, wet wood, and water. Itâ€™s seams to be the right height for her too. Due to the slight angle, I have to be careful about filling the water bowl to avoid spilling. She has gotten a few pieces of dry and wet food under the lip of the bowls. Easy to clean up.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fairly attractive raised cat food dish stand', 'author': 'NC', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Unit went together quickly and easily. I really liked that the screws that hold the legs go into sockets that have been placed into the wooden bowl self. Having recently had to assemble some small shelves that required wood screws be driven into the wood shelves (that arrived with just tiny starter holes), I can tell you that this unit was much easier to put together. Very nice!Using these for cats, and works well. Good height, tilted, and reasonable size ceramic bowls. We consider this relatively attractive compared to many raised cat feeders since the wood is nice. Also nice that food that cats push out of the dishes doesn't end up on the floor, though wet food will be somewhat of an issue if it keeps getting into the tray areas and onto the wood.We will have to see about the durability of the ceramic bowls, since I don't see any way to replace any that might eventually get broken. None of our existing metal or ceramic cat dishes fit into the holes in this self (either too wide or too narrow). I just know from experience, that eventually one of these will get dropped and broken, and not sure what we will do then.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 3, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for her!', 'author': 'Naomi C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is so much better for her to eat! She looked so uncomfortable with the other set she had. This is great for her. I use one for hard, soft and other for treats. Easy to clean with hot water and mild soap. Very easy to put together as well. It took me 5 mins or so. Thank you, I appreciate this!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars The more the merrier!', 'author': 'Lisa Putman', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My favorite thing about this bowl (or feeding station) are the deep bowl placements.The bowls are ceramic, really nice, and they go deep enough into the pockets so that if there's a spill there won't be food on the floor.I have 9 cats, 3 are brothers that rush in like a freight train when I open the front door in the morning and this allows them to eat 2 or even 3 at a time if I pull it away from the wall. No separate bowls are scattered across the floor for me to step on later.Assembly was simple. 4 screws to attach the base and it's done.And the elevation allows them to eat comfortably without getting sick.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My cat seems to love it', 'author': 'Kelly Walker', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I ordered this because we recently acquired a cat and I needed something other than plastic bowls to put her food and water in. Set up was very easy and it took less than 5 minutes for this to be useful. The stand itself if a good height and my cat doesn't have any trouble with it. The incline is helpful for digestion needs, but I found I can't fill the water bowl more than about halfway because it might spill. I have food, water and a treat bowl set up and she knows right where to go. The bowls aren't large, so I refill a couple times a day. It's easy to clean and just wipes off. I haven't washed anything in the dishwasher, but I don't see where that would be a problem. so farm this has worked wonderfully and it looks nice against the wall in my kitchen. I haven't had any spills (other than water, but my fault) and she seems to like it just fine.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to assemble but ultimately it's my cat's opinion that mattered.", 'author': 'Mousie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "So to properly test this set of bowls, I set it out next to my cat's existing bowls, which include a floor level food dish on the auto feeder, a raised but flat (not tilted like this bowl) bowl which contained her water, and then put food and water into the 3 bowls, 2 water 1 food. First I put the new bowls as her first choice, then later moved it further away from the other bowls so she'd had to choose go to it if she wanted to use it. The results: She preferred this dish for eating. But for water she completely avoided this bowl unless the flat bowl was empty. She would walk past it to drink from her flat bowl, and when it was further away still went immediately to her flat raised bowl. So what does this tell us? Really just my cat's preferences. Yours may have different opinions. While the bowls come with no assembly instructions, you really don't need them as there's only 2 pieces to attach and common sense will tell you how they attach. But for some inexplicable reason, they chose to use an allen wrench as opposed to a screwdriver. My only guess it that you'd need a really short handled screwdriver to attach the legs. It does include the obnoxious tool that is the allen wrench and in this case it's not as bad as most furniture that has allen screws. That said, it lost a star simply because of my cat's preferences. Yours may want to drink and eat from this bowl, or hate it entirely But overall it's a good set of cat bowls that are easy to clean.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cats like it!', 'author': 'Melody', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I was worried my cats wouldn't like this because some can be picky, but they took right to it. I have 2 that are getting older, 12 and 10, and they just look miserable scrunched over their old food bowls, so I wanted to try these. They seem to enjoy them. It was easy to put together too, which for me was great.I took off 1 star because A. the bowls are very small and small bowls aren't good for kitties and B. the tilt of the tray is a little weird and it makes it hard for my smaller one to eat since all the food slides to one side. She is only 10 lbs and stubby, lol. I replaced the small bowls with their regular bowls and it works fine.Overall, my cats enjoy it and that's what matters. There are more expensive ones out there, but I feel like this is just as good quality wise tbh. Don't spend that extra money if you don't have too!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Automatic Dog Feeder with Adjustable Camera, 5G WiFi 6L Smart Cat Food Dispenser, 1080P HD Video with Night Vision, Pet Feeder with 2-Way Audio for Cats & Dogs, Food Blockage & Motion Alerts
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally! Smaller portion size for cats!!!', 'author': 'PorcupineMom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Our biggest complaint about automatic pet feeders in the past is that the portion sizes are too big. With our older cat having a sensitive stomach, this has led to a lot of overeating and vomiting. This feeder has SOLVED that problem for us. We took out our scale and weighed out the portions between our old feeder and the Roilpet feeder. The Roilpet feeder came in about 2 grams less per serving! Yay! (And yes, our old boy has noticed.) As the video will tell you, we generally love everything about this feeder. When you initially set it up, do it closer to your router, but after that you can move it to a different location and it works perfectly. We love the fact that we control all of the settings from our phone. One of our biggest frustrations in the past was learning the button combinations to program other feeders. No more! This one is so easy! Our only feedback is we wish it had the capability to record video automatically every time they come to the feeder (you can manually record), but it does have a great feature where it will notify you on your phone when it senses motion at the feeder. For us this is important so we know that they are healthy and eating when we are not home. Weâ€™ve been using the feeder for over a week now and it has worked perfectly. I do like the fact that it has an alert system to not only let you know that the feeder executed the feeding function successfully but apparently it will also let you know if the feeder is jammed. We havenâ€™t had a problem with that and use pretty small diameter food, but itâ€™s nice to know the feature is there.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect.', 'author': 'Ariana', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It was easy to set up and is perfect if I'm not able to make it home for my pups dinner time. Works well, and the camera is a cool feature to make sure my dog has eaten. Just a great product", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It is a well made feeder.', 'author': 'Chris Bukovsky', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I find this product to be well made, easy to use and convenient. I like that it has a camera and not only can you talk to your pet you can hear them as well. I feel having these features will be nice while on vacation since Iâ€™ll be able to see, hear and talk to my cats while Iâ€™m away.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars only works with WPA-2', 'author': 'Nzplatt', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'sadly this only works with WPA-2. once my settings were fixed the feeder worked fine it is the only one i have found that had an adjustable camera. i have a finicky pet so dont want to feed her unless iâ€™m sure she eats. this one allows you to see the actual food bowl.the WPa issue was a problem for me but the seller worked hard and was responsive to getting it resolved', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excelente,', 'author': 'Eva', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Puedo dejar a mi perro una semana sin pagar a alguien para que lo cuide', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Works well as a feeder but...', 'author': 'crazytekkie', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The video quality is nothing like they show in the description. Even with decent network speed and signal it pixelates and distorts quite a bit. I use the camera just to see how much food is left in the dish but not that great of quality. The app however is reasonably self explanatory and it connects fairly quick. Allowing others to have access to it does not work tho. There may be better feeders out there for same price or close.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great way to feed and watch your fur baby', 'author': 'GA Patriot', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to set up and love the camera and other helpful features in the app. Holds an entire 3 lb bag of cat food, which my previous feeder could not. The camera is a great angle to see your animal throughout the lower half of the room and has an awesome night mode. There is a way to make a message to your pet when the food is dispensed, but it was not intuitive to me â€” luckily the food hitting the metal bowl is loud enough so my cat knows when to eat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars What a fantastic idea', 'author': 'Tissues and Rainbows', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I work shift schedules and live alone. It is hard for me to keep my dog fed at the same time each night. I usually hire a dog sitter to come over and feed him dinner to keep his schedule. I ordered the automatic dog feeder from #Roilpet to see if this would help keep my dog on a schedule. It turned out to be a great solution. I can feed my dog the right amount of feed at the same time every night. The added bonus is from my phone I get to watch him face level to ensure he is eating. I can even speak to him. When I know he is done, I can go home during my short break to let him outside.It is really a great solution for when I am not at home. I highly recommend this product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works well. Pops apart a little too easily.', 'author': 'Boymom', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I got this for my small dogs' feeder. It works pretty well. It does seem to struggle if his food is in very large pieces. The auger compartments aren't very large.The bin snaps onto the base. I dint trike the way it snaps on. It's not very secure. My son bumped it with his leg one day and the entire bin popped up and let all the food fall out all over the floor. Then m, because the food was under the edges, it had to all be dumped, taken apart and cleaned our before it could be used again.The app it uses is the Tuya app, which I already used for other items. It was easy to set up and the settings are easy to adjust.The camera works fine. This unit will only feed when the power is on. If the power goes out, there's no way for your pet to get food. If only the internet goes out, it will continue to feed on the last settings.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Every pet owner needs this Super Smart feeding station!', 'author': 'Emma Langford', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the first automatic pet feeder I have had and I am converted. Itâ€™s fantastic. The camera on this is high resolution and even comes with night vision. I can see and hear my pets day and night.I can talk to my pet, interact with it and even take photos. Is there anything it cant do!? If you download the app you can program it even further to do schedule feeding. I am still very new to this and just started to get used to all the alerts I get when it detects my pet-and will also de get any blockage within the feeder and it will alert me. I mean this is beyond smart! Iâ€™m excited to use this over the next few days and really get up to speed with all the controls and programs but so far itâ€™s amazing. Comes with a stainless steel bowl. Absolutely love this. Itâ€™s one of those things that you never knew you needed until you get it. Now I cant imagine not having one. Highly recommend. Worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

title: FUKUMARU Automatic Cat Feeder, WiFi Automatic Dog Feeder with Freshness Preservation, 5L Timed Cat Food Dispenser with Elevated Bowls, Up to 10 Meals Per Day, Granary Pet Feeder for Cats/Dogs
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great!', 'author': 'Mariahw', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works good so far. Easy to put together and the app was easy to set everything up. I am a little disappointed because based on the pictures, I was under the impression this came with a single big bowl or the divided two bowls that you could swap out. Regardless, it still functions fine to split the food into two bowls.Quality: Seems very high quality. Skeptical at first, as with most things with a funky brand name, but was not disappointed. Works as advertised and is a huge boost to convenience to not have to worry about feeding other than refilling the container.Value: Very good. Yes, and I would recommend to others I know who have cats.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to set up', 'author': 'Crystal', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This thing is well-made and easy to clean. It was easy to set up the app and make a feeding schedule as well as do instant one-touch quick feedings. I took off a star because the amount it dispenses is VERY small. My cats usually get their daily food rationed into two feedings (morning and night) and are not used to grazing all day. I had to set it up to dispense food every minute for 5 minutes for one of their measured "servings". and then again for their nighttime feeding. The app only lets you do a total of 10 programmed feedings. so Ultimately I won\'t be using this on a regular basis but only for when i go out of town. If your cat likes a few crunchies here and there this might be a better option for you.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Setup is a little weird, but it's great overall!", 'author': 'Ocean', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The feeder comes with the split/double bowl as well as detached legs to elevate the bowl and the feeder. The instructions made putting together the feeder pretty easy. I opted to elevate the feeder (I've been testing several different types of elevated bowls with my cats) and the legs were easy to slide onto the feeder and the bowl. It does still slide around a little on my hardwood floor, so I put it on a silicone mat which helped a lot.One downside is that the bowl does not 'snap' to fit into the feeder. There is a little rectangle cutout on the feeder and a protrusion on the bowl that lines up with it to fit the two together, but it doesn't lock into place. One of my cats pulls on the bowls and has misaligned the bowl with the feeder a few times.The app is simple once you have it set up. I was not able to get it set up with Wifi alone; I had to have Bluetooth active on my phone also, but once setup was done I was able to shut that off. I like that the feeder has both an outlet power option and a battery backup for if the power goes out.You can set the feeder to dispense multiple times a day. One thing I was confused about - it wasn't in the instructions and the app is not clear at all - was what the 'feed number' meant in the app. Reading the product description, I *think* what this means is the number of 'servings' of food the feeder dispenses. I thought it was literally the 'number' of the feed (example, I had 1 Feed at 4:00 AM, 2 at 12:00, 3 at 4:00 PM) when actually what I was doing was dispensing more and more food as the day went on. Oops!I have been pretty pleased with it so far. The steel bowls have some marks on them - my cat is a messy eater and has dribbled water into the bowl, which left water stains. My cats also haven't figured out how to get into the feeder (whether through the lid or by putting their paw into the dispenser chute) which is a huge relief, since one of them is capable of opening the food storage bin.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent cat feeder', 'author': 'K. Thornton', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got this for my cat and I've been very happy. I like to mix up several varieties of kibble and I store it in large plastic cannisters and this is more than big enough for one large cannister.Connecting it to the SmartLife app was very easy and setting up a schedule was a breeze.I've been using this for a bit over a month now and I've not had any problems with it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice elevated dual feeder', 'author': 'BossCat', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This feeder has an attractive and simple design where you can easily see the remaining kibbles easily through the diffused container. The feeder dispenses, and the divider separates the portion into the two bowls. Depending on the type of kibbles, for the most part, statistic average should have the divider separate the portion fairly evenly.The setup is easy to connect to app. As long as youâ€™ve had experienced connecting to smart devices, this is really a walk in the park. Make sure that your Bluetooth is working, and the initial setup would be establishing connecting from your phone to the feeder, as thatâ€™s how itâ€™ll receive the WiFi configuration from your app connection.After setting up the app, youâ€™ll have the full capability of the feeder including setting up scheduling to control portions.The feeder can be powered through the provided cable, or through 3x D batteries. The D batteries are very hefty, so even on battery power (which could serve as backup power) it should easily last half a year to a year. Note that this is my estimate for the battery power based on testing many feeders.The steel bowls are easily removable for washing, and I really like the fact that itâ€™s stainless bowls. This means that for more sensitive cats that may be prone to feline acne can use this feeder + bowl without having to worry about outbreak. And the elevated legs is very welcoming, as there arenâ€™t many feeders in the market that offer elevated bowls.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 30, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars No portion control', 'author': 'Lindsey', 'rating': 1, 'content': "This automatic feeder does not dispense a consistent amount of kibble. Even two weeks into using it, I was constantly measuring how much kibble came out and it was always different. Not to mention the plastic divider to separate the kibble into two bowls does not evenly distribute it...at all. My cats eat 1/4 cup of dry food twice per day (with a small snack at 4:30 am to keep them at bay) and when I finally found what I thought was the right amount, I had to set the feeder to go off once, and then a second time 5 minutes later...if I didn't separate the feeding by 5 mins, all the kibble gets stuck up at the top.It's also quite loud. I'm a light sleeper in general but their food setup is in another room, so I still think that's too loud. The setup was easy and the app works great but unfortunately I would not recommend this.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Unstable', 'author': 'TS8466', 'rating': 2, 'content': "This is similar to others - and the legs are not whole; they are unstable. I can't comment on the features because I returned knowing it was a disappointment. I cannot recommend unless you plan to modify the legs.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Almost perfect', 'author': 'Valerie P.', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I'd give it 5 stars if I could set it without the app. Other than that, I really like this feeder. It was easy to assemble. The app was easy to set up. It dispenses a good portion. It can hold up to 5lbs of food. The plastic is very sturdy and should last.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars An alright automatic cat feeder', 'author': 'Alison Williams', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I had no problems assembling this feeder or connecting to the app. I like that it has 2 separate bowls for my 2 cats and that you can set an extremely customizable feeding schedule. I have solved this by just programming multiple small feeds throughout the day which the cats seem to be okay with.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Started having issues after a few months - UPDATE!', 'author': 'MKarabiber', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This feeder started out well but after a few months, now it's working half the time. Overall a great auto feeder with alot of features at a great price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Could work well for some people', 'author': 'EALong19', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First, I want to reiterate what some of the other reviews are saying about the potentially confusing setup process. The first time I set it up (on not a so strong 2.4 ghz WiFi) it spun and spun. I finally hit the back button and it showed that it was already connected. So thereâ€™s some glitch there (but it DID connect). Additionally, when I connected it to the 5ghz network it didnâ€™t do that. So who knows. Just watch for it when youâ€™re trying to add it and if it seems like it wonâ€™t pair.This would have been our second feeder so Iâ€™m familiar with the concept. I actually had to turn it off because it scared me and the cats (and would have woken us up to my shrill â€œkittyâ€¦ come here kitty â€¦. Time to eatâ€¦. Smooch smooch smoochâ€. ðŸ˜–)Also, it was a little wobbly and felt cheaply made. I wound up trying it with none of the legs though as my cats like to plop like loaves on the floor when they eat. We use freeze dried chicken that I cut up and it wasnâ€™t steep enough for the chicken to actually come out of the shoot. I tried it with actual kibble (which my cats wouldnâ€™t eat- they donâ€™t like kibble) and it worked like a charm. But with the lighter, oddly shaped freeze dried chicken bits, it just wasnâ€™t a match. (I know it CAN work from the previous dispenser which is finally getting old after 3 years).I think if you use kibble, you donâ€™t work from home (so youâ€™re not being scared by your voice and you think your cat will enjoy it), and you have carpet or a way to help with the potential wobble of the legs, this could be a really great dispenser. You can also set how many portions it will feed at one time. The portions do seem kind of small but the app lets you do a bunch. The only down side about it is that the motor doesnâ€™t seem to be super strong. Weâ€™ve had it for a few months now and have to add food constantly because it wonâ€™t hold too much food. The weight of filling it up to the top seems to make the motor stop. We also had to get them smaller size kibble since the bigger one seemed to get caught on occasion. As long as you have small kibble and fill it up about halfway, it works wonders.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars CLOG CENTRAL', 'author': 'Jay Horrocks', 'rating': 2, 'content': "To start, we purchased this because we of course were going out of town, but not only that, while I work from home, I get really tired of getting up to feed my cats multiple times a day or listening to the hungry hippo cry for food whenever I am in the middle of something and can't take a break. Either way, we dumped it all, stopped putting the larger food in and after a couple of days, it once again jammed. I have dumped this feeder at least 3-4 times now, shaken the heck out of it, put my fingers up the dispensing area to also try to fix it but nothing works.All in all, while I love the camera, the portion sizes, and the scheduling, the way this dispenses food, is a real problem and the chute and dispenser area need to be redesigned. title: Four Paws Healthy Promise Easy Feeder Pet Feeding Syringe 2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great feeder!', 'author': 'Stefanie C', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I used for my Guinea pig when trying to feed him critico care. Easy to handle, easy to wash and it had the perfect size for his mouth. I would say you can use it with other animals since the size can be adjust it but clipping it with a scissor. After usage I was able to wash it and placed it away!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Helpful for Assist Feeding Ill Cats', 'author': 'Kelly G', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was referred to these easy feeding syringes by a friend. My cat had to be assist fed for about 1 week and these were a life saver, literally! I did have to cut the tip off one of the feeders but after that everything went smoothly. When my cat is stressed out by being assist fed and I'm stressed out by feeling bad for her I'm thankful for how easy these are to use.Note- always put the tip of the syringe in the side of your cat's mouth so your cat doesn't aspirate the food into his/her lungs. Push small amounts at a time.I love that the 'food' syringe lists both ml (same as cc) and teaspoon amounts!***Update, August 2013-I have had to (unfortunately) use the food syringe of this set 3-4x/day every day for the last 8 days. I never throw it in the dishwasher or wash with regular soaps. The most I do is put it in nearly boiling water, sometimes with a drop of white vinegar (kills bacteria from cat's mouths) and let sit until the water cools. The numbers and markings are beginning to lightly rub off but so far, so good. I'm posting a picture of the comparison between the syringe I've been using and the brand new one I got today.Sometimes the blue plunger sticks slightly which I thought was the food in the syringe but after testing my brand new syringe I realize it's actually the wearing of the syringe/plunger. I've read that you can use a tiny bit of oil (olive, coconut, etc) to lubricate the plunger.Also, if feeding exact increments of food is important know that there will be some food (if feeding pureed/mixed cat food) left on the 'bottom' of the blue plunger; I'd say it's about 0.5ml- 1ml of food. Also, there will be about 1ml of food left in the syringe tip that you can't possibly feed. So, in total you MAY lose roughly 2ml of food/meds when using these syringes.For now I'm leaving my review with 5 stars but depending on how worn the syringe becomes in the next few weeks I may have to downgrade to 4 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for very small pets', 'author': 'J. de la C', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Four Paws Pet Easy Feeder set was particularly helpful in feeding medicine to my ailing dog. As others have noted, using a tiny amount of olive oil to lubricate the stopper was helpful in providing smooth administration. I did find that using the syringes alone was very time consuming when attempting to feed my 9 pound dog. The syringes only hold a small amount, and refilling provided just enough distraction for my fragile dog to lose interest in his food. Thus, I ended up using the Lixit Feeding Syringe to administer food, and the Four Paws Syringe for medications. Still, a quality product!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Terrible Quality, Waste of Money', 'author': 'C.G.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'There is no rubber on the plunger at all, itâ€™s completely made of plastic so air and liquid are able to bypass the plunger. What a mess. The plastic is poor quality and the printed numbers are not lined up properly and blurred. I ordered these because I thought these style tips to be used for liquid dog dewormer would be helpful. If the syringes were better quality, they might get a better review. Iâ€™d be returning these to get my money back but I had to use one to then find out how poorly they work. My opinion: buy better syringes (which arenâ€™t expensive).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed...', 'author': 'Kimberly', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The syringes are well made plastic and a good size, but there is no rubber gasket like normal syringes to seal the plunger. It is just plastic, and the liquid (and even thicker substance) leaks up above the base of the plunger when you push it in instead of keeping it contained in the syringe. I already tried to use it, so I sadly can't return it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cut to the serving amount needed', 'author': 'Jenita Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this to try pulling my cat. I tried crushing the pills and mixing it with baby food. It worked well but I ended up using a different method I ordered. You can clip the plastic to adjust for the type of meal your giving.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best hand syringe feeder for small animals, smooth one-handed operation, cleans up quickly.', 'author': 'Just a Corner of My Mind', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have recently purchased several syringe/feeder items here at amazon. I've got to say that this is the best for assisted feeding of a small pet. All of the other require brute force to push the plunger and while that may be okay for nasal tube or surgically inserted tube it's not very good for attempting to syringe feed by mouth as you cannot hold the animal still with one hand and maintain enough pressure to push the plunger with the other hand.Not only that, but the rubber or silicone seems to start to degrade in those other syringes within a week with bits breaking off and the point is health, not adding something into the system that may possibly cause trouble.This syringe has been easy to use one handed while gently holding my cat's head still with the other. Although you have to re-fill it to complete the feeding it is well worth it since it's a smooth operation and less stress and distress on the animal parent and the animal being fed. Depending on how long I will need to hand feed her I am contemplating ordering another set(s) so I can pre-load a couple and really cut down on the time it takes to feed, the small mess, and the delays that seem to signal to her that feeding time may be over.Because there are no extra parts it's a breeze to clean, swish-swish in hot soapy water, rinse and in the utensil drainer until next time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So easy to use', 'author': 'Dodi Freel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After multiple failures with an ordinary syringe. This was so easy to get medicine into stubborn Taffy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Very hard to dispense, clogs', 'author': 'k buy', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Needed these to administer food and medicine to my sick cat.Two stars are given because the nipple tip worked ok. However the tapered tip dispenser was horrible and if it was the only thing in the package I would have given a one star review. The tapered one was very difficult to use. It was hard to push through all the way even without anything in it. The food would not come out. Like other reviewers said this does not work with a cat !!! Thought I was doing something wrong until I went back and saw the lower rated reviews and the video. The reviewers are correct. I was wondering why some people rated it so hightly.I ended up cutting the narrow tip, thinking maybe I just needed the wider part (The 2nd part of the tube that is a little wider than the tip). Alas, I did not have anything to properly cut into the wider part so I ended up with a stump of the narrower tip. :-( However in doing this I did discover something. Where the narrow tip and the middle part of the dispenser join, there was a small piece of plastic partially blocking the hole. One would be unable to see this if it had not have been cut. We took a piece of metal and pushed it through to get rid of that small piece of plastic and make the hole a little wider. This helped a lot and we were able to dispense the food, albeit it was still messy as the plunger part is difficult to push at times.Additionally, the nipple tip dispenser had the writing coming off when I opened it. Did someone return this and the seller repackaged it to the next unsuspecting Amazon buyer?My disappointment is this: Where is quality control in the manufacturing of these? Are they selling this to us "sucker" Amazon buyers who cannot see what we are getting? Are sellers getting defective products cheaper and then selling them on Amazon? Once upon a time defective products would not be sold or if something was wrong it would be identified as that and sold for cheaper price. Or be trashed, never leaving the facility.It seems not everyone got a defective product, but many of us did unfortunately. If you are lucky and get a good one that works then great. I was not so fortunate.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It does the job but is not very air tight.', 'author': 'A Mozon consumer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like that there are two sizes included.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Catstages Fishie Fun Feed Mat - Slow Feeder Cat Bowl
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally found what I was looking for!', 'author': 'Stacie A Pierce', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the third slow-feeder I've purchased and it's exactly what I needed. Excellent product!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Slows down my eating machine cat!', 'author': 'Carol W.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have a cat that inhales his food and is a real jerk. I first tried a few different slow feeders, but he literally threw a tantrum because he doesn't want to work for his food. So, I purchased this in hopes that it would be a good compromise - fairly easy access but has to work a little bit for the food - and it's perfect! I've had it for over 2 months and I couldn't be happier with the purchase.First, I love the orange color! title: Automatic Cat Feeder, 4L, White, Plastic and Stainless Steel, Dispenses Up to 20 Portions, 6 Meals Per Day, with Distribution Alarms for Small to Medium Cats and Dogs
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This auto feeder keeps the ENTIRE family sane!', 'author': 'Kaycee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a godsend for our family with a cat who cannot control her appetite with a gravity feeder.Even if I portioned out 1 weekâ€™s worth of dry food in the gravity feeder, it would usually be gone within 4 daysâ€¦leaving her mewing all day long for 3 days (And no, she is NOT food deprived.)LOVE:--Stainless steel bowl (slightly angled)--Securely sealed food compartment with locking top and hopper--Substantial quantity of food storage--Desiccant pack (provided) safely stored in lid for food freshness--Easy to assemble and easy to clean parts--Control buttons are not susceptible to her standing on them and messing up settings (Yes, it happened frequently with another automatic feeder)--Instructions are somewhat easy to setup--Ability to easily dispense extra food at the touch of a button--Allows for 6 feedings per day and portion options from 1 to 20 at each feeding. (See NOTE below)--Ability to record a 10 second personal message--Power cord (included) is micro-USB into outlet with optional battery backup (3 D batteries)--Attractive looking and a GREAT price!NOTES:--You will need to measure what each portion number is equivalent to if controlling the amount of food your pet receives each day. I found that P-05 is roughly equal to 1/4 cup dry food, and P-20 equals approximately 1-1/2 cups of dry food.--The clock is only setup as a 24 hour clockâ€¦7:00am reads â€œ7:00â€ and 7:00pm reads â€œ19:00â€.--Recorded message will play a few times while food is being dispensed. This may become tiresome if you are dispensing 1 cup of food as the rotation cycle will take awhile.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Does a good job', 'author': 'User', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It is easy to use once you figure it out', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A serving size is 1 Tb (1/16 cup)', 'author': 'pandeane', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It took a few to figure out initially, but once I got the hang of it, I realized itâ€™s actually very simple and logical. I think Iâ€™ll be able to make adjustments easily going forward, without needing the manual. The bowl is thin and could dent easily, so be careful there. The unit is pretty light but seems stable and with a few locking, seemingly airtight parts - plus a desiccant tray. There are other thoughtful designs like the option to turn off the LED indicator so youâ€™re not drawing vampire energy.I might be experiencing a glitch here or with the low battery indicator. There are indicator lights for low battery and low food. According to the manual, a red indicator light goes on (even if youâ€™ve turned the LED indictor off) if both these things are happening. Iâ€™m experiencing it staying on when food is low, but I donâ€™t get any low battery warning. Once I add food, the light goes off. Iâ€™ve turned the indicator light on and off to see if I then get a low battery warning, but nope, so Iâ€™m not sure whatâ€™s happening here. Anyway, it keeps happening and isnâ€™t a critical feature, so Iâ€™ll live with it.Moving on. You can use AC, USB, or D batteries, and the batteries can serve as backup. You can record your own voice, and more. This is really handy to have if youâ€™re away from home or if your schedule just doesnâ€™t line up with your catâ€™s. This is currently $59.28 with an additional $10 off coupon today, but for some reason, the 5.6L is less and the 6L is just a little more. If I had the choice, I would get the 6L.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solid product. Even bought a second.', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bought one to feed breakfast one of our cats that roams area of house where we sleep and he stopped waking us at 5 am to eat. Worked so well for this cat we bought another for our other cat that stay locked in another area at night. Now when we travel, only need someone to check on them and feed wet foot at night so feeding routine remains same.Have to test with food when programming portions, but able to get exactly what our cats need to maintain weight. Takes some patience to learn to program. Can be a little cumbersome to clean and get rid of stale crumbs if you care, but seems well designed to make it as easy it can to wipe down.One of our cats helps cleaning by sticking his paw up dispenser to get crumbs, but other than that, main bin is well sealed, and our cats leave feeder alone. Your cat behavior may vary.We run of wall oulet but have battery in for backup.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars That it takes care of the feeding', 'author': 'Sharon M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It was difficult at first to understand how to set up the times, I looked it up on YouTube and I didnâ€™t think it was very clear. But somehow I figured it out. Instructions are on a very small booklet. But once I figured it out it was a breeze. My cat hears the voice recording and runs to the feeder. He loves it! And I love it. It holds a good amount of food. I also like the black container so my cat canâ€™t see in. It is so convenient! Plus there is no mess. The only change I would make is the way the bowl is shaped. The inside should be more slanted so that the food goes directly to the middle of the bowl as my cat has a little bit of a hard time getting his food. Other than that it perfect.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 23, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cheaper than paying a neighbor', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Bought for when we were going on vacation. Plugged it into the wall outlet outside in a place that doesn't get rained on put a heavy board on top in case of really bad wind and left it. We were able to be gone for a week and not worry if our cat would have enough food. The food easily could have feed the cat for 2 weeks. Buying this was cheaper and easier than paying a neighborhood kid to come feed the cat and we can reuse it whenever we are out of town. Great purchase. It's very easy to program and you can add your voice to it so the animals still associate you with food.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Terrible', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'No puedo ensamblar este producto y aparte de eso no me lo emplaza y no reembolsable y que hago pierdo mi dinero por producto mal hecho', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not bad, at first impression', 'author': 'Anonymous Reviewer King', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Got this unit at a pretty decent sale, only $23 for the 4 litre version. It's been a day but I like what I see.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Programing directions vague', 'author': 'Floyd Pink', 'rating': 4, 'content': "We have to work out of town for a week to 10 days sometimes, so this is perfect for our cat. Nagy', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I already have a Big Brand automated feeder for one of my cats, and it has worked well for years, but it was $expensive$. I saw this, and at a price that's half of the cheapest comparable automated Big Brand feeder, I was absolutely willing to try it out.It's easy to assemble, has a whole lot of portion size and frequency settings (more than the expensive brand one that I have), has quite a small footprint for its capacity (the hopper looks much smaller than it is, but it does hold as much as the bulky Big Brand feeder we have, which is also 6L), and is more aesthetically pleasing. That last point isn't really important to me, but it may be important to others.I'll note that we managed to spill liquid on and destroy the manual, so we had to figure stuff like programming and portion sizes out without instructions, and it was doable if a little complicated.One other thing worth noting is that it seems to dispense much more consistent amounts at higher portion sizes than smaller ones, but I expect some of that is due to the shape of the hopper feeder and the size and shape of the kibble itself. For example, on the smallest portion size it will dispense anywhere from about 10-20 kibbles at once. title: Automatic Cat Feeder, WHDPETS 4L WiFi Automatic Cat Food Dispenser with App Control Elevated Dog Feeder with Stainless Steel Bowl, Silicone Dog Bowl, Feeding Mat, 10s Voice Recorder(2.4G WiFi Only)
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars It's super convenient!", 'author': 'Darlene', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is actually a really good auto feeder for maybe someone who only has 1 cat or 1 dog. I purchased this for my ragdoll cat since I had to start going back to the office more often. This auto feeder uses the Smart Life app for the iphone and it is pretty easy to use! You can customize the feeding times almost instantly. However it is in military time, so keep that in mind. I did record my voice and the feeder used my recording every time a scheduled feeding went off. I like that there are portion sizes from 1 to 12. It does a surprisingly good job keeping the dry food quite fresh.But unfortunately I had to return it because I have another cat that always steals my ragdoll's food... She instantly comes when the feeder goes off and eats everything before my ragdoll comes to eat anything!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 19, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice size', 'author': 'Kelly Jane', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Itâ€™s made really nice. I donâ€™t use the pan bowl that comes with it because it was too big for my cat who needs the whole pm full for food or she thinks itâ€™s empty. But you can just place your own under neath the dispenser. Havenâ€™t recorded my voice yet. Works great with the app from my phone.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Monumental waste of time', 'author': 'T W', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Instructions could not even be included for all of the help they provided.
