Piece of junk!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Could be better', 'author': 'MH', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'It was great for the first few months! Now 6 months later it skips meals every other day and logs that it fed. Iâ€™ve had to manually feed her. I tried moving the food around in the bin and that didnâ€™t make a difference. I do like the look of it and the set up! But I canâ€™t have a feeder that skips meals. Iâ€™ll be looking for a different one.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Download Smart Life app', 'author': 'Minerva', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This is an AMAZING product. I ordered 5 of these for my kitty cats. The different leg heights are great for kittens all the way up to Maine Coons.Everything is configured in the app. You can name all the feeders and schedule multiple feedings and portions per day.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good but not very customoizable', 'author': 'shira', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'This is definitely for small animals only. IE; if you have a dog or cat that gets more than 1 cup of food at a time, this is not the right feeder for you. It is fine for multiple small animals, ONLY if they are grazers.The selling points of this are;raises up for better eating / digestionstainless steel bowl (plastic ones are bad for animals)dual plug in and battery operation (in case of power outage)The less positives are;you cannot customize the size of a "portion". You can elect more than 1 portion, but you cannot customize. Their portion sizes are set.There is no camera function that many other machines have now.No app notification that the food is getting low in the bin. So you just have to check it periodically.While you can drop food from the app, it would be a WHOLE portion vs just a few pieces (this would be a nice feature to sometimes just check that the machine is properly functioning).HOWEVER, for the price point, it is a good purchase. You can get all the above options with a machine 2-3x as expensive. This was fine for my needs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for our needs', 'author': 'ASP', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We have a feral cat that won't let us come near and lives in a field on our property. Although it is not recommended to use this feeder outside, we placed the feeder in a covered carport. We also have a security camera so we can see what is happening at the feeder. We are able to feed our feral cat remotely when we are out of town. Yes, we get racoons and opossums at the feeder, but they are only able to eat any leftover food in the bowl and have not been able to open the feeder. We did have to strap the feeder between two concrete blocks, so the wild animals would not be able to tip the feeder over. So pleased to be able to feed our feral cat and not have to hire someone to put food out for us. This WiFi feeder has paid for itself. Great product for our needs!UPDATE: The raccoons have figured out how to reach up the chute and dispense a portion at a time. They fed themselves 30 portions last night. I am not exaggerating!2nd UPDATE: When we returned home we set the lock button. The raccoons continued to reach up the chute but are not able to get any food.Problem solved!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for dogs.', 'author': 'Walter', 'rating': 5, 'content': '+Allows you to feed your pets throughout the day.+Still allows feeding without wifi if you lose wifi for awhile+Allows for wired & wireless power.-Can\'t change the "serving size": What I mean is, there is a preset "serving size" and your needs are met by how many times you serve a "serving"', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Tricky but works well', 'author': 'Lady', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I loved, loved that this product came with a mat & a portable feeder for the price i payed. It was a great deal. The portable feeder is one of those portable products you can take with you on walks with your dog or even take it with you when you take your cat for a trip to the vet. The feeder was quite easy to put together. However, connecting it to my phone was complicated. I had to reset my Bluetooth & the Feeder twice. Once it finally connected, it worked great. 2 days later I noticed the feeder didn\'t seem to feed my cat\'s lunchtime meal so i went to check it and had to move the food around a bit for the feeder to release the food. Currently it is working fine. I also like that you can control the portions on your phone via the "Smart Life" app.So overall it\'s a 4/5 for me simply because of the connectivity issues & that it skipped a meal once. Great product overall.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great product, with freebies', 'author': 'Holly Dent', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I love customizable it is with the different legs included. App is super easy to use. The only flaw is that the lid never locks on so if your cat figures out how to press the button they'll definitely get it off after a few tries. Idk if mines just defective or if it's an actaul product flaw.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great idea and wonderful to see a recognize brand name', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently purchased the RCA pet feeder for my beloved Milo, and it has been an absolute game-changer for our daily routine. Customizing portion sizes is a breeze, and the user-friendly interface makes the entire process straightforward â€“ a major win for someone who isn't tech-savvy like myself.I tested the battery backup to make sure it works in case there's an outage while I'm away and it worked flawlessly (not sure how long the battery lasts though).A few nice touches are the velcro strap that comes with it that ensures my pup cant knock the lid open and the bowl is dishwasher safe and that I recorded my voice to let my dog know when the food is coming so she knows and is ready.Really nice product.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars very good feeder', 'author': 'MD', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Highly recommend. I leave batteries in the feeder as a failsafe in case we lose power.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect fit', 'author': 'Malkovich', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ordered this with the feeder and it works perfect no issue saves from buying batteries all the time and way cheaper', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars have to purchase the power cord separate from the feeder', 'author': 'Marty', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'the power cord should be included with the product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars 2nd one in 7 years.', 'author': 'bmbranno', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great feeder but as everyone has said, complicated to program. That is our Biggest gripe. Also, the first one CAME with the adapter, and using batteries is a pain and short-lived. So not happy with this attempt on their behalf to sell unit for under $100 by taking the adaptor off and selling it separately. Find that to be a bit cheap on their behalf. Otherwise, it is very long-lived, durable, and we keep ours outside on the back porch and it does just fine. We get temps in single digits in the winter and it has never cracked. But our last one quit for no reason. We tore it apart and the mechanics simply gummed up and stopped working. Instead of attempting to clean piece by piece and tearing it completely apart we felt it was worth buying a new unit instead. Right now as my husband attempts to program it using our own miserable batteries (very unhappy not having the adaptor included and the last one was chewed partly through by mice) he is cursing it. They really need to simplify the programming, otherwise it is an outstanding unit, very reliable, and even when power went off then resumed the unit automatically continued to do its' job. So 4 stars for reliability and the fact that it holds lots of food for at least 2 weeks for our labrador, but one less due to complexity for programming and NO ADAPTOR. I think their fee is pretty steep already, let alone removing the adaptor and selling it separate. Kind of a cheap method of making more money in my opinion.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'MB', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this pet feeder. I bought this in November of 2018, it still works like a charm! The clock is a little slow, you may have to adjust it every now and then to correct the current time, but it doesn't stop the feeder from feeding your animals, it just may be 5 to 10 minutes off. Not a big deal.My only slightly negative is, it is a bit cumbersome to clean, but it's not horrible, I've had other pet feeders that were way worse to clean.I totally recommend this pet feeder. 2 years old and still going strong!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars As expected', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works as expected', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Proof that our cats don't just love us because we feed them", 'author': 'Elizabeth M', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I hoped my cats would stop nagging us to check their (not empty) food dish, and it worked. Once they learned that small quantities of food would appear at regular intervals throughout the day and night, they became a lot less stressed about food. Not only did they stop getting upset about a tiny spot of exposed dish at the bottom, they stopped crowding around the dish when the food arrives and gulping it down. Bonus...they're actually eating less and are finally the weights the vet recommended.It also gives us a little more peace of mind when we travel, knowing that if for some reason the person checking on them were to miss a day they'll still have food.And contrary to the popular axiom, of course the kitties still demand snuggles, sit on our laps, sleep on our feet, and are wonderful companions. If anything they're more cuddley because they don't spend any time fussing about food.If I could change anything, it would be for the dish to be a little farther away from the base. We propped up the back of the dish a bit so the food would slide to the front, giving them more whisker room.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Electrical cord short.', 'author': 'Betty', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have purchased two of these electrical cords both were different brands and both was shorter than the original cat litter box cord.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works great for us', 'author': 'Jane in the Midwest', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I have two cats and an erratic work schedule, which didn't sit well with the cats, who were never sure what time they would be fed. Initially, they were both a bit timid due to the mechanical noise it makes when preparing to dispense the food. However, they now both sprint towards it when they hear it as they know it's feeding time. It is a bit noisy when it dispenses food but has been fantastic. I felt a bit silly for spending so much on a cat feeder but it has provided a level of security and consistency which has helped relax the cats. And I no longer worry about getting home late from work to whiny cats begging for food nor am I awakened at 4 or 5 am by meowing from hungry cats. I do wish the programming could be simplified but overall, this has been worth the month. We've been using it over a year now without any issues and I would highly recommend it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars GREAT PRODUC!', 'author': 'BSD', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have had many pet dishes with holders. This definitely works better than the rest! Very pleased.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works for our Two Cats, with mods', 'author': 'Crys', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We had a double diner for our two cats, specifically using one bowl for free feeding dry food, and the other for wet food which we feed 2-3 times a day. Cats prefer to keep food and water separate (instinct is that killed prey would contaminate drinking water) so their water fountain is in another room.Our orange boy was never really food motivated, so was content in eating wet food after his sister, but lately his appetite had picked up and I had noticed them both crowding to eat from the small bowl at the same time. The it was time to find a triple diner so that they both could have their own serving space while still having the communal dry food.This server is nice in that it is rather compact, itâ€™s in foot print in our small kitchen, but also that it doesnâ€™t have a broad shelf which can impede access to the bowls and get messy. Generally our older black cat liked to access her bowl from the side, so also the kind that have feet on the sides were comfortable for her. This one leaves a nice open area for them to access at various angles.As far as quality, the drilled holes to make it adjustable in height are not made at the same angle at as the center arms, so even at the top most setting, they stick out further through the top and at a different angle that what is shown in the stock photos. They appear somewhat flush in the description, but theyâ€™re not. At the lower height Iâ€™d think theyâ€™d actually be more of a nuisance and look worse.No complaints on the strength nor quality of the bamboo sticks that these came with. The extras were nice just in case, but ours went in smoothly and hold just fine.My biggest complaint is about the bowls that this came with. We opted for the stainless steel version, and the bowls are just too deep to be whisker friendly. They are smaller in diameter than the standard cat food bowl, so I guess the depth was to allow for more volume of food, but this just doesnâ€™t work for my senior cats.Our previous double dinner had enough width to accommodate smaller ceramic fruit bowls which we could swap out which each serving for cleanliness, so I was really hoping to find a third-party dish to use in this particular triple diner. Finding shallow bowls approximately 12cm in width was a challenge to say the least.I ended up find that OurPets DuraPet 6oz cat food bowls that hold 3/4 cup fit well and are nice and shallow. Theyâ€™re more pricey each, but worth it for the convenience ad pet experience.Overall, this works for us, but I would probably recommend a different one with standard 5.5in bowls.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Wow! Impressed!', 'author': 'The Rolling Rook', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I'm on a mission to not buy plastic anymore. Bamboo is my go to choice, since it's pretty anti-bacterial, hydrophobic, easily/quickly grown and compostable. I wasn't sure about this purchase and when I got it, I was a bit aprehensive about it's construction, but it turns out to be great! Super easy to put together and the cats seem to be alright with eating out of the elevated bowls! I wish they made one with 4! That would be PERFECT!UPDATEAfter using these for a while now, I'm even more impressed! LESS MESS! The cats make much less mess on the floor with these. They eat over the bowl rather than taking the food out and chewing over other parts of the floor and they knock fewer kibbles out of these bowls too! Highly recommend!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Much smaller than you think', 'author': 'Ashleigh', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I wanted to get raised bowls for the cats but these bowls are very small. The amount they hold isn't the issue, it's the fact that I don't want my cats getting whisker fatigue just trying to eat", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My new kitties love it!', 'author': 'cca', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Stylish feeding bowls for multiple cats. I have two kittens and they each have their own food bowl with shared water. I love the look and that it is elevated and at an angle. Bowls are porcelain and easy to clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars Don't bother", 'author': 'Placeholder', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Unable to put bowl of water.. have to add every few hours. I threw it out', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Its as perfect as can be.', 'author': 'Tammie Eisloeffel', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have an extra large cat, His name is Shelly (short for Sheldon). He weighs 25 pounds maybe more, but not fat, he stretches out over 3feet. He is a big boy. these raised dishes are perfect at their highest level for Shelly, Shelly's water dish is a 2 gal. horse feed bucket that he drinks from sitting by the bucket. I love these new raised dishes. I did think they were going to be a little bit large, but they are still next to perfect. well made.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 14, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works great, wish there was a two-bowl stand option', 'author': 'LG', 'rating': 4, 'content': "My two senior cats are getting arthritic and one was throwing up his food right after eating a lot. I purchased this after learning that angling the bowls can help with the post-meal vomiting.Both cats really like not having to bend over as much; I know this because if I put the bowls on the floor, they look at me and wait for me to elevate them! My pukey cat is also not throwing up after eating now, which we are both probably thrilled about. The material is a solid, beautiful bamboo that wipes down easily, and I like that there are no screws involved, just pins.I got the stainless steel bowls, which are easy to clean, but I will say, a little deep for my cats to eat out of once the wet food gets smashed into the bottom of the bowl. I constantly have to go back and stir the food up so they can get to it more easily.I also wish there was a design that has only two bowls. My cats don't really eat well together: one is a gobbler and the other likes to graze throughout the day, so I generally have to feed them in separate rooms. I love this product so much and wish I could buy a 2-bowl option so my other cat can have a stand for his dry and wet food in another room.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for 3 Kitties!', 'author': 'bridarchrina', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is great. title: AsFrost Stainless Steel Cat Water Fountain: 2-in-1 3L/101oz Cat Water Fountain Food Bowl, Safe Pet Water Fountain for Cats Small Dogs with Ultra-Silent Pump, 2 Water Flow and 5 Filters Replacement
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great dish, but with caveats', 'author': 'genealogist Donna', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE - two days before the return period closed the pump stopped working. I am returning. Too much work with my cats. But it is an issue with all these water bowls with pumps that if the electricity fails or the pump fails there is no water accessible.ORIGINAL REVIEW - I do adore this cat dish, but wish it were slightly different.the good -- fabulous-looking, blends with kitchen appliances and hardware, keeps counter cleaner, love the aerated and filtered water and the two options (my cats prefer the bubbler)the bad -- one of my two cats (not this one) is messy, perhaps because she is a feral cat and she looks around while she eats. This bowl is an improvement over the last one in that she leaves less food on the counter, probably because this bowl is higher -- but it is not the food on the counter that bothers me; instead for some reason she drops food into the water side (a lot more than her old bowls). The dry food quickly turns to mush, clogging the filter. I took out the filter and it was better, as at least it did not clog up and stop running leaving them with no water, but I still have to clean it every few days. While the stainless steel is easy to clean, it is not so easy to clean the entire water bowl as the wire runs through the base. This probably would not be a problem with wet food, and would not be with all cats, but is for my cat. I just clean it more than I want but I like the water feature so much I am willing to do this. If I go away for a long weekend, I will just not put the dry in the other side but leave out a couple bowls of dry far away on the counter! A design improvement would be to run the electric wire through the lid so you could easily clean the base. Also beware that they will have no access to water in a power outage -- all the water will be in the base. So it is advisable if you are leaving for a few days to have another bowl for water.Despite these issues, I love this bowl for everyday and would recommend it highly.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect!!ðŸ¤©', 'author': 'Roxanne', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Purchase for my daughter Shihpoo it is perfect very easy to assemble does not cause a mess with the watering spout, and it comes with extra filters which made it even more worth the money spent', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars I love the fountain (with update)', 'author': 'Savannah Mitchell', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'The fountain is quiet and allows my kittens to drink without splashing them. The food bowl holds a decent amount and my 2 kittens take some time to go through the whole thing. On the downside one of my cats likes to play with his food and has a tendency to drop it in the water. This causes the fountain to overflow into the food side and ruin the food. Other then my own cats desire to cause chaos this fountain/feeder is fantastic!*UPDATE*My original post was made on July 18th, 2023 and now Iâ€™m updating on December 4th, 2023.So the bowl itself is easy to clean and holds a lot of water. However, the pump went out a month ago and was spotty for 2 months prior to that. I would not recommend this product!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent customer service but stopped working in 3 weeks', 'author': 'Karen A Gibson', 'rating': 4, 'content': "UPDATE (Dec 2023): Customer service reached out to me and then issued a refund. Happy customer.Nov 2023: This is my second kitty fountain. I didn't even put food in it so it is not clogged. The LED turned red one day and despite refilling the water has stopped working.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Motor faulty and stopped working within first weeks!', 'author': 'Rae', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I did get a replacement, and was charged for the faulty one also!!! Wouldn't purchase or recommend again!!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 11, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Stainless, good product and great price', 'author': 'Yaritza', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works great, space saver and no noise at all!! title: PETKIT Automatic Pet Feeder with Camera, 1080P HD Video with Night Vision, 2.4G WiFi Cat Dog Feeder with 2-Way Audio,Smart App Control Pet Dry Food Dispenser for Cats and Dogs with Non-Stick Food Bowl.
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Honestly? I'm Shocked How Good It Is!", 'author': 'Ryan A. Leemhuis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A little background first. We had previously used the Crown Majestic feeder for our cat. It worked fairly well although it was a bit ugly, would occasionally jam and the portion sizes were very hit and miss. We used it until its power connection internally broke and it would only run off batteries which was difficult to keep up with.So that led me on my search for a replacement. There are a lot more options now than there used to be. My main features I was looking for were wifi control and reliability.I found it difficult to narrow down my choice as I found varying reviews and some claimed that a model was terrible and some said it was amazing. I eventually settled on the Petkit mini feeder from a cost and design perspective. First of all, it looks great. I love the thought that went into the design from the magnetically attached bowl to the jumper that allows the DC adapter to easily disconnect from the wall should you need. I was a little nervous about how much food could be stored but upon seeing the compartment this is a good amount for a cat. I find we need to fill it once every 2 weeks or so.That brings us to the worst part of the product. Lets just be clear here...the app is decent...but there are some language oddities and the setup did not go according to design. I am a techy and I initially tried pairing the feeder with my phone. It got fairly far into the setup but kept failing out during the wifi pairing process. I then tried my wife\'s phone and it did the same. I then happened to notice that the feeder was already showing on the app\'s dashboard and sure enough it had been paired even though the app claimed it had failed. I don\'t know why this occurred but be prepared for some setup issues.Once setup, however, the app is great. The food portion sizes are accurate and on demand feeds occur nearly immediately. The schedule is easy to setup and food is distributed on time. We use prescription "disc-shaped" food and other feeders claimed they weren\'t compatible. We have had ZERO issues with this machine getting jammed or having any issue with our food. It is actually very fun to watch the little door open on the machine and then the food dump out.For the cost, this feeder is a steal. It is so much better than our previous feeder it makes me wonder why I didn\'t upgrade earlier. My only suggestions for improvement would be to further improve the app and instructions translations. There are some real English oddities (which you can see in the product\'s amazon page as well. In addition, the setup process obviously needs some improvement too as it failed twice for me and some how magically appeared on my apps dashboard after this fail. Other than that, the feeder is perfect. It feels very high quality and the mechanics seem sound. HIGHLY recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PetKit Mini - Small Pet Feeder - Review', 'author': 'AirplaneCatBlue', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The PetKit Mini feeder is attractively and elegantly designed. It looks like it belongs in an art museum.The PetKit Mini feeder is the ideal automatic feeder for my needs. What I like best is that it precisely delivers very small meals (as little as 1/20 of a cup or 5 grams) to my overweight cat up to 10 times per day. In my case I had been feeding my cat 20 grams of cat kibbles twice per day... or 40 grams. My cat was waking me up at 4 AM begging for more food. The PetKit Mini stopped the begging behavior! With the PetKit Mini I was able to schedule 8 feedings of 5 grams each... for a total of 40 grams per day... but spread out over the course of the day and night. This way my cat gets precisely fed her reduced ration and eliminates my tendency to give her a little extra when she begs.The PetKit Mini has improved my cat's relationship with me. She no longer relies on me for food. With the PetKit Mini she visits me often and regularly because she wants my company... not because she wants food. And it has improved my relationship with my cat since I am no longer irritated by her pestering behaviors at 4 AM when she gets hungry.The engineers who designed the PetKit Mini payed very close attention to critical details that separate this feeder from the pack. I studied them all before I made my purchase decision. The silicone rubber paddles that meter the kibbles into the rotary dosing cups are designed to flex so the kibbles donâ€™t jam in the mechanism.The engineers used silicone rubber gaskets to seal out moisture at the feeding door and food reservoir lid. Then they provide a replaceable desiccant pack (those little packs that you often find in a box of new shoes) that absorb any moisture that might otherwise accumulate in your dried food. You can imagine that if your kibbles absorbed moisture from the air and swelled up like a sponge that they wouldnâ€™t feed well in the mechanism. It also keeps the food fresher and prevents mold growth I would think.I found the PetKit Mini was easy to set up. It did help that I had an $8 electronic scale so I could better measure in grams how much I had been feeding my cat. I had been using a very small measuring cup. It was a lot easier to weigh the kibbles than to try to measure the volume of food.I measured the amount of food the PetKit Mini delivered with each feeding. I did this 8 times just to see how repeatable the feedings were. With my dry kibbles the average amount of each feeding was 4.97 grams. Pretty good if you were targeting 5 grams! (The standard deviation was 0.31 gramsâ€¦ who remembers what a standard deviation is???)Since I am only feeding my cat 40 grams per day the food reservoir is large enough for storing a 37 day supply. I can just check the food level once per month to be safeâ€¦ but the PetKit Mini is designed with a monitor that will alert me when the food is low. What a great feature! It will also remind me every 30 days to replace the desiccant pack. I found some after-market desiccant packs on EBay that will fit the PetKit Mini because I couldnâ€™t find any OEM packs online.This is a great automatic WiFI cat feeder! I liked it so much I bought a second PetKit Mini for my daughter for Christmas. She too has an overweight cat (though not for long). She loves the PekKit Mini too!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Life Saving!', 'author': 'Maureen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I bought this for my dog, she was recently diagnosed with an insulinoma, which is an insulin producing tumor in her pancreas. She needs to be fed small amounts every two hours to save her life that wouldâ€™ve been impossible without this feeder. I set it up to feed every two hours overnight, you can program your voice, so it whistles for her, and she comes and eats. I purchased a second one to take care of her needs during the day. The camera shows before and after and alerts when she has appeared to eat. The camera function also records to insure she gets the food she needs. Iâ€™m also able to feed her extra snacks if needed. This feeder as made it simple to insure quality of life while she battles cancer. Thank you PETKIT for making my dogs medical needs a real possibility!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Basic features work well, unnecessarily complex app makes setup a pain', 'author': 'Jessica', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I think my title basically says it all, but I'm not really a brief person so here goes...On the whole, I'm very pleased with the quality of the build of this product, and the ease of filling and cleaning, which are really paramount concerns for something like this. Unboxing and putting everything together is easy, and so far the feeder has been reliable. That said, I think the app is a lot more complex than it needs to be, and while that can be updated and changed over time, it's important to know what you're getting into.When you go through setup of the feeder and app for the first time, I think the experience is a bit all over the place. There are instruction stickers on the feeder itself, there is a booklet of instructions, there are QR codes and links within the booklet to scan to get to videos that you have to watch for further steps, and then there's setup within the app itself... etc. I think it's just a few too many layers of info and could be pared down significantly. Once everything is setup and you're trying to actually use the app, those same issues of unnecessary layers/ complications continue. The app tries to get you to schedule meals based on feeding recommendations for your pet, so you have to setup a profile for each of your pets first. This sounds minor, but it's quite detailed, and includes a whole lot of information that isn't truly necessary just to make a recommendation for feeding quantity. In the end, a truly informed recommendation would really require nutrition information about your pet food itself, so the whole exercise is a bit silly. I was left feeling a bit unsure of how much of this information I *really* needed or wanted to complete. Once you have been asked about various details for your pet, then you need to schedule fixed meals for each, and again I do appreciate that they tried to include a lot of options for customization, but it's just too much. For one, how do they propose that you make sure the right pet eats the right meal, etc? I think it would be much easier to remove those options, or hide them behind an advanced mode, and just let you set a very simple schedule with set times and quantities. K.I.S.S. you know? Given that the app doesn't interface with bluetooth trackers or smart catboxes or anything like that, I'm not sure I see any need for the pet profiles at all! It just adds complexity for no discernible reason.Beyond the actual cumbersome data entry requirements, I found the interface to be not very intuitive. I had difficulty finding the settings that I actually wanted to look for and find out more about, such as the Alexa integration, and kept getting lost in layers of social media integrations and gamification... which, why? I was looking into trying out the Smart Home integration options, but do I need a community and messaging platform for my smart feeder? Maybe this is more of a cultural thing, I believe the company is based in China, but I just don't need this kind of fluff cluttering up the basic functions of the app. I'd really enjoy it more if they could pull back on these added features, or again, maybe just hide them all in one area of the app called 'Social' or similar, but they seemed to be behind every corner. For me, again it just took away from the experience of feeling like I could find the basic information and functions quickly and easily. Thankfully, apps can be can be improved and refined over time, so I feel that most of those concerns are somewhat secondary. If you plan to use it in a way where you can sit down and get through it, then basically 'set it and forget it', I think it will work well for you. But if you would plan to regularly make any tweaks to your meal plans, I think it would be a not-minor annoyance. I'll also mention that this is something my partner and I considered setting up for aging parents, just as a little convenience item to make their lives easier. After working with it, I don't know if I can comfortably go that direction. I definitely don't feel confident that they would have gotten through any of the initial setup themselves, but I also don't think they could make any on-the-fly changes to the configuration even if the initial steps were done for them. My advice to the developers would be: pare down to the basics and make sure they are quick and intuitive. THEN add extras, but remember they are extras and not your primary functions.Ok, so it seems like I'm coming down kind of harsh. All that said, I do think this product will work just fine for use in my own home. The feeder itself is sturdy and has so far been reliable. While I don't have direct experience with a lot of competing products, I had been taking note of some other design issues I'd noted in some of those competitors and waited to try something that seemed to address them. For one, I don't just appreciate the option for plug-in power and battery backup, for me that's an absolute requirement on something like this. The food storage compartment also seems secure, which was a concern I had because I have one cat that will get into ANYTHING edible that is left out. I'm impressed because he hasn't even tried with this, which also tells me the seals are probably decent and he's not being tempted by the smell of kibble. That also leads me to believe that bugs shouldn't be an issue, though time will tell. I also appreciate that the actual food bowl portion is easily removable, as it just snaps into place with a magnet. Being plastic based, it's important to clean something like that regularly and you and I both know that won't happen if it's a pain point. Ideally, I would really like to see this component and the food storage bin being made out of stainless steel, but maybe that's something that could be incorporated in a future revision as well.Let's wrap this up...On the whole, if you are patient and technologically competent enough to get through the configuration of the app itself, it's a good product that I think you'll be happy with.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The PetKit app is nearly useless for this feeder! Portion size is randomly variable....', 'author': 'D', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The PETKIT app is poorly implemented and largely non-functional. I bought this Petkit Automatic Cat Feeder because it promised being able to identify my two cats and calculate their food requirements based on weight and metabolic needs. Using this info I wanted to program daily feedings customized for each cat. This product is another example of decent hardware with poor software implementation. Unfortunately, Petkit and Amazon failed to disclose that the app isn't ready for the hardware. I consider this failure to be a bait and switch scam and I'd return it but I already tossed the package because the delivery person left it in the rain without a plastic wrap for protection.Linking the app and feeder was easy. Connecting to my home router/wifi was easy. It even ran an automatic software upgrade so I know I have the latest, greatest app software. So far so good.Next task is to program my two cats into the Feeding Calculator. Entering the name is easy. Enter the weight? The app reverts to a default weight of 6.8 pounds every time. So it fails to update the cats's weights. FAIL! There isn't any obvious way to edit the cat information either. So another FAIL! Interesting is that I have the PetKit Puramax automatic litter box with my cats' weights entered correctly. The feeder links to the info but changes the weights without any input from me. Another FAIL?Next it asks me to enter their cat food. I feed Purina Indoor Cat Food, a very common dry cat food pellet available in any American grocery store. Instead of a simple-to-use barcode reader that searches online and enters the food analysis for me, I have to enter the analysis manually. Okay, needlessly complicated but okay.The app lets me program the feeding schedule but I'm unable to vary the portion size. I ran a few trials and the portion size isn't consistent. That's a definite FAIL!!I have two PetKit water dispensors that work very well. The Petkit Pure Max Litter box works well. I really want the food dispenser to work just as well but for now the software is a FAIL!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars accurate, precise, feeder. Requires 2.5GHz wifi, doesn't work on 5GHz", 'author': 'Yung Fang Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This review is for the PETKIT fresh element mini.It will not work on a 5GHz wifi, it has to be on 2.5GHz. The setup is really strange. First you have to connect your phone to your 2.5GHz wifi, then you connect your phone to this thing\'s "wifi", and somehow it uses that to get this thing connected to the 2.5GHz wifi that your phone was connected to. After you get it setup though, you have to contend with the really UN-intuitive software. Once you have overcome both of those headaches, the feeder works really well. I almost took off 1 star for the pain in the *** setup and user interface, bit in spite of the those annoyances, I like this feeder so much that I decided to give it the full 5. I\'m so happy that it can dispense portions in increments as small as 1/20th of a cup. I use this feeder to give my cat a small snack in between her normal meals, so that tiny portion size is greatly appreciated. It\'s so nice to be able to adjust the feeding from my phone. We used to go out to eat and hang out with friends until late at night all the time and we always worried about making our cat wait for dinner until we got home, but now (once we can finally go out again) we can just use our phone to give our cat some dinner as soon as we realize we won\'t be getting home until late.Another thing I like about this feeder is that the build quality is really nice. The food tray attaches magnetically so is easy to take off, clean, and re-attach. The food sits inside an inner basket within the feeder, so it keeps all the food crumbs contained. All the parts fit together very precisely so it feels sturdy and looks really nice. The door over the food chute is controlled by a little robotic arm, so my cat can\'t just push her paw up in there to steal more food.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfectï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼', 'author': 'yufei s.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This isn't the first time I've bought an automatic feeder. I used to use a different brand of automatic feeder, unfortunately, it did not workï¼ That feeder did not accurately control the amount of food each time, sometimes a lot and sometimes a little, and there was a blockage - the feeder did not give my cat any food for a whole day, so my poor cat kept barking after I came home.So I was very disappointed with the automatic feeder, but my friend recommended this brand to me, which is what her family is using. It works very well! The previous bad situation did not happen. And I love its camera and interactive features. I can watch my cat's every move when I'm at school. I can even stop my cat from scratching the couch with this automatic feeder! AWESOMEï¼ï¼ï¼My cat, a nine-pound German curly, has always had a good appetite, and usually three times a week I cook her a chicken breast or something next to the automatic feeder, so I don't need to add any more food to the automatic feeder for half a month (or longer, I'm not sure). I don't have much to say about the video recording function, because it is so sensitive, it captures a lot of cat activity moments, and I only occasionally turn on a few to see.In briefï¼Œ Recommendï¼ï¼ï¼", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not Smart at All', 'author': 'Shmoo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wanted to like this and originally did but now after using it for over a year it fails to connect to my WiFi. I know I\'m not doing something wrong on my end as I have a good 16+ other smart devices that I\'ve connected just fine. Along with working in IT and having custom router settings. So I like to think I know what I\'m doing.However, this POS refuses to connect and keeps coming up with "Network Error" everytime I follow the instructions and manually try to add the device (automatic simply doesn\'t work or show any devices). It\'s almost as if its trying to connect to the Petkit network and they have monkeys running they system (or company as a whole).Do not waste your money on this as I will never be purchasing anything PetKit ever again. Simply put they do not work and I can see a lawsuit coming as they sell faulty products.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cat proof', 'author': 'John Ruple', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was looking for a feeder that could withstand my crafty food motivated female cat. I previously owned a wopet feeder that ending up being too top heavy and my cat could knock it over or using her paw to turn the impeller that dispensed food. The wopet feeder even had a manual feed button on the front that my cat would headbutt to vend food.. whyyyy?! I'm pleased to report that this feeder has none of those problems. It's a stockier feeder so it's hard to knock over. It's feed buttons are on the side and requires you to hold them to dispense food manually. Also the cat can't reach a impeller to vend food. It even has a dessicant (oxygen absorber) you can add to keep food fresh in the feeder. I ended up buying some replacements that you can heat up to reuse as a cost saving measure. This pet kit feeder includes a HD camera and a speaker and microphone if you want to talk to your cats or set recorded messages during feeding times. You can set detailed feeding times and has an easy way to stop a feeding in case you want to feed them wet food. The app can be somewhat buggy at times but never for more than a minute since it fixes itself. It will bother you about signing up for the petkit+ service to see video recordings and make vlogs to music of their activities in front of the camera. This feature is not necessary to tap into the camera and see them however. At just over 100 dollars this feeder was a good purchase. I would highly recommend it over the other options listed on Amazon.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Overall good product.', 'author': 'Cheri Gravett', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Because Iâ€™m and out of the house all the time, I needed a feeder that I could program to feed my pug and precisely measured dinner. Yes, I weigh my dogâ€™s food when I feed her manually because well - pugs! They overeat and are not satisfied so how else to make sure Iâ€™m feeding her enough but not overfeeding her. This product was not as accurate as I would like but over several feedings, things seem to even out. As an extra precaution, I give an extra feeding mid-day using the feeder. Is it perfect? No. But Iâ€™ve been using it for several weeks, occasionally measuring the output, and it feel it is close enough. I also like the built-in camera so I can see the food going into the bowl. I would love for it to be more precise, but itâ€™s the best product I have tried so far.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

And it has improved my relationship with my cat since I am no longer irritated by her pestering behaviors at 4 AM when she gets hungry.The engineers who designed the PetKit Mini payed very close attention to critical details that separate this feeder from the pack. I studied them all before I made my purchase decision. The silicone rubber paddles that meter the kibbles into the rotary dosing cups are designed to flex so the kibbles donâ€™t jam in the mechanism.The engineers used silicone rubber gaskets to seal out moisture at the feeding door and food reservoir lid. Then they provide a replaceable desiccant pack (those little packs that you often find in a box of new shoes) that absorb any moisture that might otherwise accumulate in your dried food. You can imagine that if your kibbles absorbed moisture from the air and swelled up like a sponge that they wouldnâ€™t feed well in the mechanism. It also keeps the food fresher and prevents mold growth I would think.I found the PetKit Mini was easy to set up. It did help that I had an $8 electronic scale so I could better measure in grams how much I had been feeding my cat. I had been using a very small measuring cup. It was a lot easier to weigh the kibbles than to try to measure the volume of food.I measured the amount of food the PetKit Mini delivered with each feeding. I did this 8 times just to see how repeatable the feedings were. With my dry kibbles the average amount of each feeding was 4.97 grams. Pretty good if you were targeting 5 grams! (The standard deviation was 0.31 gramsâ€¦ who remembers what a standard deviation is???)Since I am only feeding my cat 40 grams per day the food reservoir is large enough for storing a 37 day supply. I can just check the food level once per month to be safeâ€¦ but the PetKit Mini is designed with a monitor that will alert me when the food is low. What a great feature! It will also remind me every 30 days to replace the desiccant pack. I found some after-market desiccant packs on EBay that will fit the PetKit Mini because I couldnâ€™t find any OEM packs online.This is a great automatic WiFI cat feeder! I liked it so much I bought a second PetKit Mini for my daughter for Christmas. She too has an overweight cat (though not for long). She loves the PekKit Mini too!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Life Saving!', 'author': 'Maureen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I bought this for my dog, she was recently diagnosed with an insulinoma, which is an insulin producing tumor in her pancreas. She needs to be fed small amounts every two hours to save her life that wouldâ€™ve been impossible without this feeder. I set it up to feed every two hours overnight, you can program your voice, so it whistles for her, and she comes and eats. I purchased a second one to take care of her needs during the day. The camera shows before and after and alerts when she has appeared to eat. The camera function also records to insure she gets the food she needs. Iâ€™m also able to feed her extra snacks if needed. This feeder as made it simple to insure quality of life while she battles cancer. Thank you PETKIT for making my dogs medical needs a real possibility!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Basic features work well, unnecessarily complex app makes setup a pain', 'author': 'Jessica', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I think my title basically says it all, but I'm not really a brief person so here goes...On the whole, I'm very pleased with the quality of the build of this product, and the ease of filling and cleaning, which are really paramount concerns for something like this. Unboxing and putting everything together is easy, and so far the feeder has been reliable. That said, I think the app is a lot more complex than it needs to be, and while that can be updated and changed over time, it's important to know what you're getting into.When you go through setup of the feeder and app for the first time, I think the experience is a bit all over the place. There are instruction stickers on the feeder itself, there is a booklet of instructions, there are QR codes and links within the booklet to scan to get to videos that you have to watch for further steps, and then there's setup within the app itself... etc. I think it's just a few too many layers of info and could be pared down significantly. Once everything is setup and you're trying to actually use the app, those same issues of unnecessary layers/ complications continue. The app tries to get you to schedule meals based on feeding recommendations for your pet, so you have to setup a profile for each of your pets first. This sounds minor, but it's quite detailed, and includes a whole lot of information that isn't truly necessary just to make a recommendation for feeding quantity. In the end, a truly informed recommendation would really require nutrition information about your pet food itself, so the whole exercise is a bit silly. I was left feeling a bit unsure of how much of this information I *really* needed or wanted to complete. Once you have been asked about various details for your pet, then you need to schedule fixed meals for each, and again I do appreciate that they tried to include a lot of options for customization, but it's just too much. For one, how do they propose that you make sure the right pet eats the right meal, etc? I think it would be much easier to remove those options, or hide them behind an advanced mode, and just let you set a very simple schedule with set times and quantities. K.I.S.S. you know? Given that the app doesn't interface with bluetooth trackers or smart catboxes or anything like that, I'm not sure I see any need for the pet profiles at all! It just adds complexity for no discernible reason.Beyond the actual cumbersome data entry requirements, I found the interface to be not very intuitive. I had difficulty finding the settings that I actually wanted to look for and find out more about, such as the Alexa integration, and kept getting lost in layers of social media integrations and gamification... which, why? I was looking into trying out the Smart Home integration options, but do I need a community and messaging platform for my smart feeder? Maybe this is more of a cultural thing, I believe the company is based in China, but I just don't need this kind of fluff cluttering up the basic functions of the app. I'd really enjoy it more if they could pull back on these added features, or again, maybe just hide them all in one area of the app called 'Social' or similar, but they seemed to be behind every corner. For me, again it just took away from the experience of feeling like I could find the basic information and functions quickly and easily. Thankfully, apps can be can be improved and refined over time, so I feel that most of those concerns are somewhat secondary. If you plan to use it in a way where you can sit down and get through it, then basically 'set it and forget it', I think it will work well for you. But if you would plan to regularly make any tweaks to your meal plans, I think it would be a not-minor annoyance. I'll also mention that this is something my partner and I considered setting up for aging parents, just as a little convenience item to make their lives easier. After working with it, I don't know if I can comfortably go that direction. I definitely don't feel confident that they would have gotten through any of the initial setup themselves, but I also don't think they could make any on-the-fly changes to the configuration even if the initial steps were done for them. My advice to the developers would be: pare down to the basics and make sure they are quick and intuitive. THEN add extras, but remember they are extras and not your primary functions.Ok, so it seems like I'm coming down kind of harsh. All that said, I do think this product will work just fine for use in my own home. The feeder itself is sturdy and has so far been reliable. While I don't have direct experience with a lot of competing products, I had been taking note of some other design issues I'd noted in some of those competitors and waited to try something that seemed to address them. For one, I don't just appreciate the option for plug-in power and battery backup, for me that's an absolute requirement on something like this. The food storage compartment also seems secure, which was a concern I had because I have one cat that will get into ANYTHING edible that is left out. I'm impressed because he hasn't even tried with this, which also tells me the seals are probably decent and he's not being tempted by the smell of kibble. That also leads me to believe that bugs shouldn't be an issue, though time will tell. I also appreciate that the actual food bowl portion is easily removable, as it just snaps into place with a magnet. Being plastic based, it's important to clean something like that regularly and you and I both know that won't happen if it's a pain point. Ideally, I would really like to see this component and the food storage bin being made out of stainless steel, but maybe that's something that could be incorporated in a future revision as well.Let's wrap this up...On the whole, if you are patient and technologically competent enough to get through the configuration of the app itself, it's a good product that I think you'll be happy with.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The PetKit app is nearly useless for this feeder! Portion size is randomly variable....', 'author': 'D', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The PETKIT app is poorly implemented and largely non-functional. I bought this Petkit Automatic Cat Feeder because it promised being able to identify my two cats and calculate their food requirements based on weight and metabolic needs. Using this info I wanted to program daily feedings customized for each cat. This product is another example of decent hardware with poor software implementation. Unfortunately, Petkit and Amazon failed to disclose that the app isn't ready for the hardware. I consider this failure to be a bait and switch scam and I'd return it but I already tossed the package because the delivery person left it in the rain without a plastic wrap for protection.Linking the app and feeder was easy. Connecting to my home router/wifi was easy. It even ran an automatic software upgrade so I know I have the latest, greatest app software. So far so good.Next task is to program my two cats into the Feeding Calculator. Entering the name is easy. Enter the weight? The app reverts to a default weight of 6.8 pounds every time. So it fails to update the cats's weights. FAIL! There isn't any obvious way to edit the cat information either. So another FAIL! Interesting is that I have the PetKit Puramax automatic litter box with my cats' weights entered correctly. The feeder links to the info but changes the weights without any input from me. Another FAIL?Next it asks me to enter their cat food. I feed Purina Indoor Cat Food, a very common dry cat food pellet available in any American grocery store. Instead of a simple-to-use barcode reader that searches online and enters the food analysis for me, I have to enter the analysis manually. Okay, needlessly complicated but okay.The app lets me program the feeding schedule but I'm unable to vary the portion size. I ran a few trials and the portion size isn't consistent. That's a definite FAIL!!I have two PetKit water dispensors that work very well. The Petkit Pure Max Litter box works well. I really want the food dispenser to work just as well but for now the software is a FAIL!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars accurate, precise, feeder. The setup is really strange. First you have to connect your phone to your 2.5GHz wifi, then you connect your phone to this thing\'s "wifi", and somehow it uses that to get this thing connected to the 2.5GHz wifi that your phone was connected to. After you get it setup though, you have to contend with the really UN-intuitive software. Once you have overcome both of those headaches, the feeder works really well. I almost took off 1 star for the pain in the *** setup and user interface, bit in spite of the those annoyances, I like this feeder so much that I decided to give it the full 5. We used to go out to eat and hang out with friends until late at night all the time and we always worried about making our cat wait for dinner until we got home, but now (once we can finally go out again) we can just use our phone to give our cat some dinner as soon as we realize we won\'t be getting home until late.Another thing I like about this feeder is that the build quality is really nice. The food tray attaches magnetically so is easy to take off, clean, and re-attach. The food sits inside an inner basket within the feeder, so it keeps all the food crumbs contained. All the parts fit together very precisely so it feels sturdy and looks really nice. The door over the food chute is controlled by a little robotic arm, so my cat can\'t just push her paw up in there to steal more food.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfectï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼', 'author': 'yufei s.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This isn't the first time I've bought an automatic feeder. AWESOMEï¼ï¼ï¼My cat, a nine-pound German curly, has always had a good appetite, and usually three times a week I cook her a chicken breast or something next to the automatic feeder, so I don't need to add any more food to the automatic feeder for half a month (or longer, I'm not sure). I don't have much to say about the video recording function, because it is so sensitive, it captures a lot of cat activity moments, and I only occasionally turn on a few to see.In briefï¼Œ Recommendï¼ï¼ï¼", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not Smart at All', 'author': 'Shmoo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wanted to like this and originally did but now after using it for over a year it fails to connect to my WiFi. So I like to think I know what I\'m doing.However, this POS refuses to connect and keeps coming up with "Network Error" everytime I follow the instructions and manually try to add the device (automatic simply doesn\'t work or show any devices). It\'s almost as if its trying to connect to the Petkit network and they have monkeys running they system (or company as a whole).Do not waste your money on this as I will never be purchasing anything PetKit ever again. Simply put they do not work and I can see a lawsuit coming as they sell faulty products.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cat proof', 'author': 'John Ruple', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was looking for a feeder that could withstand my crafty food motivated female cat. I previously owned a wopet feeder that ending up being too top heavy and my cat could knock it over or using her paw to turn the impeller that dispensed food. The wopet feeder even had a manual feed button on the front that my cat would headbutt to vend food.. whyyyy?! I'm pleased to report that this feeder has none of those problems. It's a stockier feeder so it's hard to knock over. It's feed buttons are on the side and requires you to hold them to dispense food manually. Also the cat can't reach a impeller to vend food. It even has a dessicant (oxygen absorber) you can add to keep food fresh in the feeder. I ended up buying some replacements that you can heat up to reuse as a cost saving measure. This pet kit feeder includes a HD camera and a speaker and microphone if you want to talk to your cats or set recorded messages during feeding times. You can set detailed feeding times and has an easy way to stop a feeding in case you want to feed them wet food. It will bother you about signing up for the petkit+ service to see video recordings and make vlogs to music of their activities in front of the camera. This feature is not necessary to tap into the camera and see them however. At just over 100 dollars this feeder was a good purchase. I would highly recommend it over the other options listed on Amazon.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Overall good product.', 'author': 'Cheri Gravett', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Because Iâ€™m and out of the house all the time, I needed a feeder that I could program to feed my pug and precisely measured dinner. I would love for it to be more precise, but itâ€™s the best product I have tried so far.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Join Prime to buy this item at $59.99
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better Than Competitors', 'author': 'Matthew Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Without naming any names (cough cough rhymes with BetWibro), we had purchased a couple of their automatic feeders (not WiFi enabled), one for our first cat, then about a year and a half later we bought the second. The big issue was that the two units, even though they were the same exact model, kept time differently. One was fast, the other was slow, so over the course of a week, we would have a gulf of about 2 1/2 minutes which resulted in hurt feelings and competition. Cue the third cat and we tried a different brand. That one kept time a little better, but we were still struggling with clocks that would never be synchronized and it was a chore to always update 3 feeders every few days just to ensure the cats were fed at their respective stations at the same time and no one had an opportunity to eat theirs and steal another's in the time it took for food to be dispensed.I had my eye on this, as it's WiFi enabled, and we already have the automatic litter box, so we were familiar with the brand. I bought a couple to trial and they have worked wonders so far, the internet connectivity ensures they are dispensing at almost identical times, rather than relying on an onboard clock. So, we purchased a third, and will purchase a fourth and fifth once the kittens are a bit bigger.Setting up the feeding plan is a breeze and refilling couldn't be easier. I also like the shallow bowl because it does keep whisker fatigue to a minimum as they don't have to bury their heads too deep to reach their food.Set up was a breeze as well. It was very easy to connect as the device was easily recognized and firmware updates took moments without any failures. The app works great with virtually no delays in input - want to give them a little snack? Tap the snack button, select your serving size and it dispenses as soon as you make your choice.For the price and the features, it's a no brainer. There's simply no reason reason to pay more for less with competitors, at least those who are respectable names in this market, and not just a random brand that has popped up trying to offer a cheap alternative with a janky app.5/5 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Super happy I risked this feeder!!', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'UPDATE**: still 5stars. Updating bc I donâ€™t want people to overlook this feeder bc of a few reviews that donâ€™t always apply.So this feeder only had 8 reviews when I ordered it which is way low for my usual trust with a new brand. however, MY CATS LOVE THIS FEEDER. Will update this if anything changes.The App really impressed me with how it logged my catsâ€™ weights and age etc to help with portion control. I needed this bc I wasnâ€™t sure how much to give my kitties after them being on an open bowl meal (but got too chunky hence the feeder & I am a student and not always home etc).Only Pros at this Point. Your cat will appreciate it and itâ€™s a lot easier to clean.The Green Color is exactly how the picture looks. Have already gotten compliments on it from my roommates. If I end up buying another automatic feeder (for both cats versus them just sharing this one), I will buy this brand and exact model again. Honestly one of my favorite Amazon purchases of all time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works as expected, so far (edit: mostly)', 'author': 'Christa N.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After reading the reviews, I think I was prepared for some kind of nightmare with this, but so far I\'ve been pleasantly suprised. I\'ll update if it stops working or something. The app isn\'t super sleek and displays my feeding history partially in Chinese, but it\'s not too confusing either, and the feeder quickly connected to my iPhone on a 2.4G network. Set up was really easy, 2-3 minutes, and mostly I just use the "extra feeding" button, although the recommended meal plan seemed appropriate if all my cat ate was dry food, and was easy to edit. I like the green color and the stainless steel bowl.I\'ve only had it for a few weeks, with no problems. My cat is underweight, not food-motivated, usually eats raw or wet food, and was recently diagnosed with kidney issues and maybe isn\'t really supposed to be eating dry food anyway. However, he often refuses to eat his wet food, especially prescription food, before I leave for work. It\'s better for him to eat dry food than not eat at all, so I use this to send him small amounts food throughout the day and give me some peace of mind that if he wants to eat, he can (and that the food isn\'t super stale). I do wish the feeder could tell me if the cat has eaten any of the food in the bowl, and how much, instead of just logging how much has been dispensed. This way I could track his eating and avoid adding more food when he hasn\'t eaten... but maybe that\'s a lot to ask from a feeder? Anyway, having a remotely controlled feeder also means that if I find I\'m not going to be home for scheduled feeding times, it\'s not such a big deal, which is good because I live in a city with unpredictable traffic. I\'m pretty satisfied.Edit: I\'ve had the feeder for a while now to feed two cats on a schedule. It does have some bugs. The main issue is that it will double-dispense food randomly, some 10-20% of the time. I always receive a notification that it\'s working normally and has released the scheduled amount of food, but if I am home, I can see/hear that it dispenses, and then after about 30 seconds dispenses the same amount again, this time without sending any notification. This isn\'t as bad as if it were not dispensing any food at all, but it\'s a pain because one of my cats will happily overeat and get sick if I\'m not home to intervene. The only solution seems to be making meals even smaller so that when it double dispenses, it\'s not so much extra. I also somewhat frequently receive notifications that the feeder is jammed or low on food when it is not (maybe twice a month). The feeder has only actually jammed once. So pretty good, still looks great, but not 100% reliable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sleek and modern design', 'author': 'Penny Lane', 'rating': 5, 'content': "â­â­â­â­â­The PETKIT Automatic WiFi Cat Feeder has been a lifesaver for me and my furry friend over the past year! Five stars all the way!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Overall great!', 'author': 'Andy & Cora Ray', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought two of these feeders for our two cats to keep them on a consistent feeding schedule when we are out of the house or have left town. Initially the feeding schedules in the app were difficult to set up, but the app offered an update within the settings which changed the configuration slightly and is super simple after the update. Our cats have even tried sticking their paws up into the chamber and have been unsuccessful in getting food out without a scheduled dispensation.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Frustrating as Hell', 'author': 'tomsvl', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'First, I am fairly literate with electronics. BTW there is a website for the 8 most common problems, Nice.This is going back today.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Set it & forget it', 'author': 'DIA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This made everything so much easier!You donâ€™t have to measure anymore; just set the serving size in the app. This is so helpful when your pet is still small and cat eat a full can/scoop of food just yet.
