It gave my cat more that it was supposed to for 2/3 cup measurement and I had to break it down into multiple smaller portions to get it to be the right amount of foodDonâ€™t have to wake up super early; if I want to sleep in I donâ€™t have to worry about if the cat will starve. Just set up a dispense time in the app.Donâ€™t have to call your pet for food; it essentially Pavlovâ€™s them with a beep indicator when food is coming out. lol - daylight savings was hard to get through when he knows itâ€™s food time but didnâ€™t get a beep yet. I just ended up moving the time by an hour to match his instincts.The app is finicky sometimes. But it always alerts when itâ€™s time to refill or when to change the desiccant. Also alerts when youâ€™re away from home if the food was dispensed. You can even set reminders for other things like changing the litter box, changing the water filter, nail clipping time, etc.The cat likes it as a stepping stool to the window lol', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price', 'author': 'J. Town', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for a colony of about a dozen feral cats (all but a couple TNR\'d) that live in the woods near my house. I set them up some beds and a big food bowl in a shed but raccoons and possums were stealing the food. (And I was tired if going out in the rain to fill the bowl.) So I got this feeder and set it up in the shed. So far, this has held up well. The raccoons and possums can only steal 1/2 cup at a time. The raccoons get pretty aggressive when the bowl is empty but they haven\'t managed to get the lid off the new feeder. I\'ve seen them tossing it around on the security camera but the feeder\'s held up fine. I eventually attached it to the floor of the shed.I haven\'t set up a schedule because feral cats are terrible at telling time. If it\'s empty when I check the security camera, I hit "Extra feeding" on my phone and dump 1/2 cup in the bowl. It took the cats about 2 days to figure out that the noise means food. Sometimes I\'ll see 3 or 4 of them sitting in a semi-circle around the bowl waiting for me to hit the button.I\'ve run several brands of cat food thru it (whatever\'s on sale in bulk) and it\'s pretty consistent with the portion despite the different sizes and shapes of the kibble. I\'ve never had it get stuck with food left in the hopper. It gets down to the last few pieces every time.It would be nice if it was easier to clean. You have to take out 4 screws to take the dispenser chamber off and really get in there with a brush to get the rotating part clean. If the chamber was a twist-lock and the rotating part came out easily, it\'d be much better.My only other real complaint is the AAA batteries. They should be AA. There\'s plenty of room, they hold twice the energy, and most stores charge the same amount for AAA and AA. There\'s really no reason for the small batteries.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Feeder dispenses only an APPROXIMATE amount of the portion of food you select', 'author': 'SoCalMissy', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I wish I had seen JESSICAâ€™S review from one of PETKITS other feeders prior to my purchase of the ELEMENT SOLO. Iâ€™ve spent an incredible amount of time researching Cat Feeders ever since 2020 when PetNet (feeders) went out of business. They were the best in the industry, hands-down! and now Iâ€™m stuck with TWO of their $150 paper weights, essentially. Iâ€™ve searched far and wide for replacements. So on Amazon Prime Day, July 12, I pulled the trigger on a deal for this ELEMENT SOLO feeder. Iâ€™ll be returning it promptly before my 30 day money-back guarantee runs out.1st - the amount of information that you MUST input just to set up a feeding schedule is by far very un necessary. You have to create a profile for your animal, you have to enter their height, their weight, their age their type, then you need to input their food brand, THEN verify if it fits in the feeder, and THEN enter the ingredients and what %percentage of moisture and ash etc. etc. None of that is necessary when youâ€™re using a measurement you already know and what type or amount of food youâ€™re going to dispense. You just want to set up a schedule to have it done. BTW the plug is quite large, so I youâ€™ll waste the space beside it, and above it, which is very unfortunate.2nd -my cat is on a strict food diet. His dry food portion of his diet he receives 1/4 (ONE QUARTER) cup of dry kibble (IAMS) TWICE a day to totaling 1/2 (ONE HALF) cup of food per day.By the third day, this feeder gave me issues, dispensing the incorrect amount of food. Sometimes it dispensed 16 kibbles. Sometimes it gave 48 kibbles. Sometimes it gave 62 kibbles. None of those equaled 1/4 cup as I tested it out for EACH of their dispensing measurements PRIOR to using it. The closest I could get to 1/4 cup of their measurements was 3/10 so I used that and set up a feeding plan per their requirements to automatically feed two times a day every 12 hours using the 3/10 dispensed amount. They use FIFTHS (1/5) measurements so itâ€™s a little confusing trying to find what worked for 1/4 cup dispensing amounts. Then within that problem lies another one thatâ€™s even bigger. After posting a question about an accurate amounts, dispensed, and then reaching out to their support team, I found an answer. This feeder will only feed an APPROXIMATE amount of their dispensed portion (of 3/10 cup). Let that soak in for a minute. Give it a second. Really let it soak in.Now, let me give you a scenario. â€¦ Dr tells you, based on your weight, height and the food intake you can eat (lets use RICE) 1 cup of Rice per meal for a total of 3 cups rice per day. Ok Doc, great. I can do that.So, on your first meal, I hand you â€¦ oh, letâ€™s say maybe 2/3 cup, and on your second meal, I hand you letâ€™s say maybe 3/4, on your third meal, I hand you oh maybe 7/8th. Youâ€™re an adult, a senior even, so you â€œunderstandâ€ what youâ€™re allowed to have per meal and your rice is right there, in that square thing that makes a noise and gives you your rice but itâ€™s not giving you what youâ€™re allowed to have each meal. Would you be happy? Or full? or satisfied? Or always thinking about food and how to get it out of that thing. Because if itâ€™s edible (& sometimes even if itâ€™s not edible) youâ€™ll attempt to get it and eat it. Because all you do is EAT, SLEEP, POOP/PEE, PLAY & PURRTo finish, I would like to quote the review of another Amazon verified purchase user, Jessica (3 years ago! man I SHOULDâ€™VE dug deeper)â€œ Jessica4.0 out of 5 starsVerified PurchaseBasic features work well, unnecessarily complex app makes setup a painReviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020I think my title basically says it all, but I'm not really a brief person so here goes...On the whole, I'm very pleased with the quality of the build of this product, and the ease of filling and cleaning, which are really paramount concerns for something like this. Unboxing and putting everything together is easy, and so far the feeder has been reliable.That said, I think the app is a lot more complex than it needs to be, and while that can be updated and changed over time, it's important to know what you're getting into.When you go through setup of the feeder and app for the first time, I think the experience is a bit all over the place. There are instruction stickers on the feeder itself, there is a booklet of instructions, there are QR codes and links within the booklet to scan to get to videos that you have to watch for further steps, and then there's setup within the app itself... etc. I think it's just a few too many layers of info and could be pared down significantly. Once everything is setup and you're trying to actually use the app, those same issues of unnecessary layers/ complications continue. The app tries to get you to schedule meals based on feeding recommendations for your pet, so you have to setup a profile for each of your pets first. This sounds minor, but it's quite detailed, and includes a whole lot of information that isn't truly necessary just to make a recommendation for feeding quantity. In the end, a truly informed recommendation would really require nutrition information about your pet food itself, so the whole exercise is a bit silly. I was left feeling a bit unsure of how much of this information I *really* needed or wanted to complete. Once you have been asked about various details for your pet, then you need to schedule fixed meals for each, and again I do appreciate that they tried to include a lot of options for customization, but it's just too much. For one, how do they propose that you make sure the right pet eats the right meal, etc? I think it would be much easier to remove those options, or hide them behind an advanced mode, and just let you set a very simple schedule with set times and quantities. K.I.S.S. you know? Given that the app doesn't interface with bluetooth trackers or smart catboxes or anything like that, I'm not sure I see any need for the pet profiles at all! It just adds complexity for no discernible reason.Beyond the actual cumbersome data entry requirements, I found the interface to be not very intuitive. I had difficulty finding the settings that I actually wanted to look for and find out more about, such as the Alexa integration, and kept getting lost in layers of social media integrations and gamification... which, why? I was looking into trying out the Smart Home integration options, but do I need a community and messaging platform for my smart feeder? Maybe this is more of a cultural thing, I believe the company is based in China, but I just don't need this kind of fluff cluttering up the basic functions of the app. I'd really enjoy it more if they could pull back on these added features, or again, maybe just hide them all in one area of the app called 'Social' or similar, but they seemed to be behind every corner. For me, again it just took away from the experience of feeling like I could find the basic information and functions quickly and easily. Thankfully, apps can be can be improved and refined over time, so I feel that most of those concerns are somewhat secondary. If you plan to use it in a way where you can sit down and get through it, then basically 'set it and forget it', I think it will work well for you. But if you would plan to regularly make any tweaks to your meal plans, I think it would be a not-minor annoyance. I'll also mention that this is something my partner and I considered setting up for aging parents, just as a little convenience item to make their lives easier. After working with it, I don't know if I can comfortably go that direction. I definitely don't feel confident that they would have gotten through any of the initial setup themselves, but I also don't think they could make any on-the-fly changes to the configuration even if the initial steps were done for them. My advice to the developers would be: pare down to the basics and make sure they are quick and intuitive. THEN add extras, but remember they are extras and not your primary functions.Ok, so it seems like I'm coming down kind of harsh. All that said, I do think this product will work just fine for use in my own home. The feeder itself is sturdy and has so far been reliable. While I don't have direct experience with a lot of competing products, I had been taking note of some other design issues I'd noted in some of those competitors and waited to try something that seemed to address them. For one, I don't just appreciate the option for plug-in power and battery backup, for me that's an absolute requirement on something like this. The food storage compartment also seems secure, which was a concern I had because I have one cat that will get into ANYTHING edible that is left out. I'm impressed because he hasn't even tried with this, which also tells me the seals are probably decent and he's not being tempted by the smell of kibble. That also leads me to believe that bugs shouldn't be an issue, though time will tell. I also appreciate that the actual food bowl portion is easily removable, as it just snaps into place with a magnet. Being plastic based, it's important to clean something like that regularly and you and I both know that won't happen if it's a pain point. Ideally, I would really like to see this component and the food storage bin being made out of stainless steel, but maybe that's something that could be incorporated in a future revision as well.Let's wrap this up...On the whole, if you are patient and technologically competent enough to get through the configuration of the app itself, it's a good product that I think you'll be happy with.9 people found this helpfulâ€â€ â€¦â€", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Must use your cellphone.', 'author': 'Connie M. Bush', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Just got the feeder; recommended by the vet; not much information in manual, just how to put together. That wasn't difficult. Still having problems making changes to the feeding schedule. The cat now gets breakfast 2 times one at 5:30 am and one at 6:30 am. Couldn't figure out how to delete one of them. Feeding the cat 5 times a day, 1/10 of a cup at a time for a total of 1/2 cup a day. What the vet recommended (not necessarily 5 times). If cat eats 1/4 cup 2 times a day, he is back before supper time. This helps a lot. I ignore the cat and I am trying to each a cat that I will not feed him, he must wait for the feeder. Ask me in a couple of weeks.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally found what I was looking for!', 'author': 'Stacie A Pierce', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This is the third slow-feeder I've purchased and it's exactly what I needed. title: Four Paws Healthy Promise Easy Feeder Pet Feeding Syringe 2 Count (Pack of 1)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great feeder!', 'author': 'Stefanie C', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I used for my Guinea pig when trying to feed him critico care. Easy to handle, easy to wash and it had the perfect size for his mouth. I would say you can use it with other animals since the size can be adjust it but clipping it with a scissor. After usage I was able to wash it and placed it away!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Helpful for Assist Feeding Ill Cats', 'author': 'Kelly G', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was referred to these easy feeding syringes by a friend. My cat had to be assist fed for about 1 week and these were a life saver, literally! I did have to cut the tip off one of the feeders but after that everything went smoothly. When my cat is stressed out by being assist fed and I'm stressed out by feeling bad for her I'm thankful for how easy these are to use.Note- always put the tip of the syringe in the side of your cat's mouth so your cat doesn't aspirate the food into his/her lungs. Push small amounts at a time.I love that the 'food' syringe lists both ml (same as cc) and teaspoon amounts!***Update, August 2013-I have had to (unfortunately) use the food syringe of this set 3-4x/day every day for the last 8 days. I never throw it in the dishwasher or wash with regular soaps. The most I do is put it in nearly boiling water, sometimes with a drop of white vinegar (kills bacteria from cat's mouths) and let sit until the water cools. The numbers and markings are beginning to lightly rub off but so far, so good. I'm posting a picture of the comparison between the syringe I've been using and the brand new one I got today.Sometimes the blue plunger sticks slightly which I thought was the food in the syringe but after testing my brand new syringe I realize it's actually the wearing of the syringe/plunger. I've read that you can use a tiny bit of oil (olive, coconut, etc) to lubricate the plunger.Also, if feeding exact increments of food is important know that there will be some food (if feeding pureed/mixed cat food) left on the 'bottom' of the blue plunger; I'd say it's about 0.5ml- 1ml of food. Also, there will be about 1ml of food left in the syringe tip that you can't possibly feed. So, in total you MAY lose roughly 2ml of food/meds when using these syringes.For now I'm leaving my review with 5 stars but depending on how worn the syringe becomes in the next few weeks I may have to downgrade to 4 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 19, 2012', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for very small pets', 'author': 'J. de la C', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Four Paws Pet Easy Feeder set was particularly helpful in feeding medicine to my ailing dog. As others have noted, using a tiny amount of olive oil to lubricate the stopper was helpful in providing smooth administration. I did find that using the syringes alone was very time consuming when attempting to feed my 9 pound dog. The syringes only hold a small amount, and refilling provided just enough distraction for my fragile dog to lose interest in his food. Thus, I ended up using the Lixit Feeding Syringe to administer food, and the Four Paws Syringe for medications. Still, a quality product!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Terrible Quality, Waste of Money', 'author': 'C.G.', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'There is no rubber on the plunger at all, itâ€™s completely made of plastic so air and liquid are able to bypass the plunger. What a mess. The plastic is poor quality and the printed numbers are not lined up properly and blurred. I ordered these because I thought these style tips to be used for liquid dog dewormer would be helpful. If the syringes were better quality, they might get a better review. Iâ€™d be returning these to get my money back but I had to use one to then find out how poorly they work. My opinion: buy better syringes (which arenâ€™t expensive).', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Disappointed...', 'author': 'Kimberly', 'rating': 3, 'content': "The syringes are well made plastic and a good size, but there is no rubber gasket like normal syringes to seal the plunger. It is just plastic, and the liquid (and even thicker substance) leaks up above the base of the plunger when you push it in instead of keeping it contained in the syringe. I already tried to use it, so I sadly can't return it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cut to the serving amount needed', 'author': 'Jenita Miller', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this to try pulling my cat. I tried crushing the pills and mixing it with baby food. It worked well but I ended up using a different method I ordered. You can clip the plastic to adjust for the type of meal your giving.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best hand syringe feeder for small animals, smooth one-handed operation, cleans up quickly.', 'author': 'Just a Corner of My Mind', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have recently purchased several syringe/feeder items here at amazon. I've got to say that this is the best for assisted feeding of a small pet. All of the other require brute force to push the plunger and while that may be okay for nasal tube or surgically inserted tube it's not very good for attempting to syringe feed by mouth as you cannot hold the animal still with one hand and maintain enough pressure to push the plunger with the other hand.Not only that, but the rubber or silicone seems to start to degrade in those other syringes within a week with bits breaking off and the point is health, not adding something into the system that may possibly cause trouble.This syringe has been easy to use one handed while gently holding my cat's head still with the other. Although you have to re-fill it to complete the feeding it is well worth it since it's a smooth operation and less stress and distress on the animal parent and the animal being fed. Depending on how long I will need to hand feed her I am contemplating ordering another set(s) so I can pre-load a couple and really cut down on the time it takes to feed, the small mess, and the delays that seem to signal to her that feeding time may be over.Because there are no extra parts it's a breeze to clean, swish-swish in hot soapy water, rinse and in the utensil drainer until next time.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 27, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So easy to use', 'author': 'Dodi Freel', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'After multiple failures with an ordinary syringe. This was so easy to get medicine into stubborn Taffy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Very hard to dispense, clogs', 'author': 'k buy', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'Needed these to administer food and medicine to my sick cat.Two stars are given because the nipple tip worked ok. However the tapered tip dispenser was horrible and if it was the only thing in the package I would have given a one star review. The tapered one was very difficult to use. It was hard to push through all the way even without anything in it. The food would not come out. Like other reviewers said this does not work with a cat !!! Thought I was doing something wrong until I went back and saw the lower rated reviews and the video. The reviewers are correct. I was wondering why some people rated it so hightly.I ended up cutting the narrow tip, thinking maybe I just needed the wider part (The 2nd part of the tube that is a little wider than the tip). Alas, I did not have anything to properly cut into the wider part so I ended up with a stump of the narrower tip. :-( However in doing this I did discover something. Where the narrow tip and the middle part of the dispenser join, there was a small piece of plastic partially blocking the hole. One would be unable to see this if it had not have been cut. We took a piece of metal and pushed it through to get rid of that small piece of plastic and make the hole a little wider. This helped a lot and we were able to dispense the food, albeit it was still messy as the plunger part is difficult to push at times.Additionally, the nipple tip dispenser had the writing coming off when I opened it. Did someone return this and the seller repackaged it to the next unsuspecting Amazon buyer?My disappointment is this: Where is quality control in the manufacturing of these? Are they selling this to us "sucker" Amazon buyers who cannot see what we are getting? Are sellers getting defective products cheaper and then selling them on Amazon? Once upon a time defective products would not be sold or if something was wrong it would be identified as that and sold for cheaper price. Or be trashed, never leaving the facility.It seems not everyone got a defective product, but many of us did unfortunately. If you are lucky and get a good one that works then great. I was not so fortunate.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It does the job but is not very air tight.', 'author': 'A Mozon consumer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like that there are two sizes included.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

IT WORKED PERFECTLY! ON THE FIRST TRY! Except...double the amount of kibble ðŸ˜ž. In a perfect world WOPET would offer an impeller with various feeding amounts (hint hint). By the way, this feeder is very easy to clean because the entire kibble hopper and dispensing mechanism is able to be disassembled. That is unlike the others that I have owned. I suppose that I'll be making a little modification to this otherwise excellent pet feeder. And finally, yes I can recommend this pet feeder.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Hard to program.', 'author': 'Lotamoxie', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I had to watch a Youtube video to figure out how to program the feeder. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great feeder', 'author': 'S. Montgomery', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works great great price', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A Pretty Good Upgrade From a Regular Side-By-Side Bowl', 'author': 'hootowldude', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This cat feeder is a pretty good product. She does most of her eating overnight for whatever reason. I like it, and the design is pretty good, especially the fact that the water bowlâ€™s rim is higher than the food bowlâ€™s, making it a little less likely that kibble will wind up in the water, which was a common occurrence with my catâ€™s last bowl, which was one of those cheapo plastic side-by-side numbers. I had to go back and peruse the rather lengthy Amazon copy for the item (which lacks clarity from a bit of a language gap) to learn that the blue thing in the water bowl is to keep the catâ€™s whiskers dry. I guess it minimizes splashing too. There was also a packet in the water bottle's nozzle assembly that I presume is some kind of charcoal filter. If so, it is very cheap, so much so that it's probably wholly ineffectual. On the off chance itâ€™s some sort of silica thingy to keep things fresh for shipping, I tossed it. Anyway, the assembly is otherwise self-explanatory.Secondly, the seal of the top doesnâ€™t seem very airtight, and the size of the food reservoir is pretty big. title: Cat Mate C300 Automatic Digital Pet Feeder for Dogs and Cats BPA and BHT Free with Ice Pack
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Been Using for Years - Recommended!', 'author': 'ChufferMama', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have four cats and these feeders are great. I set them to go off at 6:30 AM and 12:30 PM to feed my cats a dry food breakfast and lunch. Now they donâ€™t wake me up in the morning for breakfast. Also, since they all eat at the same time, no one cat goobles up all the food that might be left out in a bowl if you were to â€œfree feedâ€ (leaving kibble out all the time). The batteries last a long time, but they do get â€œout of syncâ€ every few times I fill them up. So, I simply re-sync them once a week or so. I put the trays in the dishwasher about 1-2 a week, and the rest of the time rinse them out by hand. These really are a must have if you donâ€™t want to be woken up in the morning by hungry kitties. It also helps with portion control and spreading their meals out through your work day.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I needed', 'author': 'Nat', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I got the 3 meal size and it took me a minute to understand why you can only schedule twice in the day vs three times. The â€œ3rdâ€ one is the grazing cup for dry food between wet food (I give wet food for breakfast, dry food for mid day, then wet for dinner). itâ€™s saved me a LOT of time having to get up and remember their meal times and it keeps the feeding area clean cause I donâ€™t have food bowls with crusty leftovers or dried out wet food since the ice packs keeps it fresh! My kitties had no issue adjusting to it as wellâ€¦the 3 meals size is perfect so itâ€™s not intimidating but interesting enough to keep the girls invested in wtf is happening and fun ðŸ˜ºHighly recommend the 3 meal size if you have less than 3 cats. I also purchased two so they donâ€™t fight over whoâ€™s eating first..definitely recommend for people who struggle to remember feeding times or you like to keep your space clean (cause cats do NOT care).I wonâ€™t take off any stars but that might be because I donâ€™t find the smallest thing possible to complain about, the price is reasonable, and I seem to understand youâ€™re not going to get every little feature you desireâ€¦all in all donâ€™t be afraid to pick one up!! I wish I knew about this earlier to be honest.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent for dry food use. Just so-so for wet food use.', 'author': 'PA', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Super easy to use, program, re-program, and wash. (For those reviewers that have issues with the trays not aligning, it\'s because you didn\'t read the simple instructions. There is a very easy fix that re-aligns them perfectly every time. This unit is extremely user friendly.)The unit is comprised of (i) a base that the freezer packs are inserted into, (ii) a bowl/plate that has 5 numbered compartments (numbered 0-4), which you lay on the base so that the compartment numbers on the bowl/plate match up with the corresponding numbers on the base, and (iii) a lid that has a hole cut out of it for one compartment only. The first compartment (number 0) is exposed, which you can consider the "starter" compartment (leaving it empty, or filling it with food if you want to); the other 4 compartments are covered by the lid. You can set the timer for one, two, three, or four compartments. It remembers your programs, so you don\'t have to reset again, or you can remove a timer (not using that compartment) or adjust a compartment\'s timer very easily. When the programmed time arrives, the bowl/plate rotates inside and exposes its corresponding compartment and your pet can eat the food from it. There is not a bell or an alarm. The pet hears the unit begin to rotate. They get used to the sound in a couple days, and then the rotating sound trains them that it\'s chow time. It\'s very simple and works great.However, for wet food, this unit is good up to about 5 hours as that\'s about as long as the thin freezer packs will keep the food cool (this review is written during the winter - I suspect the freezer packs will last a shorter time during summer months). Because I don\'t trust wet food sitting at room temperate for hours, I end up only using one or two of the compartments. For example, if I want to leave my house at noon and come home at 9pm, that means I can program feedings until only about 5pm, and as a result the cats don\'t get fed from about 5pm until I get home at 9pm. It is better to have one or two feedings while I\'m out than none though. If you feed your pet a combo of wet and dry food, the unit will be great for you because you can give them one or two wet feedings at the beginning and then follow with dry feedings and not have to worry about bacteria.The rest of this review is in regards to cats only:Initially, the cats are startled by the unit moving, and are, of course, curious cats but not sure what to do with the thing. If they don\'t get it, just kind of put their face by the food compartment and they\'ll realize it\'s food and eat up.They can smell the food in the other unexposed compartments and if they want it, they will try to get it - although they cannot break into the unit. One very determined kitty did scratch up the lid trying though - luckily, this is good, thick, quality plastic so their efforts were in vain other than cosmetically damaging the unit.The cat\'s head kind goes into the compartment when they eat, and their whiskers will smush against the sides of the compartment. Although the compartments are very easy to wash, there\'s a bit of a design flaw - the bottom edges of the compartments are too right-angled and food gets pushed up to the edges and is hard for the cats to get at. It would be better if the compartments were designed with scooped edges. So the cats end up eating as much as they can get to, and then literally have to walk around the unit to eat more, then walk around the unit again to eat more - so they have to "work" for their food. If they don\'t want to work so hard, there ends up being uneaten food at the edges.I don\'t see what happens because I\'m gone, but a few times the unit was moved a few feet away from where I placed it. I don\'t know if one of my cats is trying hard to get to the other compartment\'s foods before it\'s time, or if the unit is getting pushed around while they are trying hard to eat the food from the bottom edges. The unit has never been tipped over though.Overall, this is a great unit and I recommend it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome product!', 'author': 'Baguazhang', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought 2 Cat Mate C50s a couple years ago, after much online research that led me to the conclusion that wet food feeders are all garbage. The Cat Mate C50 model was the best that I had found at the time -- even with their many flaws.My cat sitter broke one feeder and then I broke the second. (It dropped my about 7 feet off a shelf.) I reassembled it\'s simple components and it worked fine. But then I bought the new Cat Mate C500 to replace the first feeder.It\'s a great product. Compared to everything else on the market for wet food pets, the old Cat Mate C50 was the best. Now the relatively new Car Mate C500 is much much better still.Basically, all of the pesky little faults were solved: no battery compartment cover, poor meal timing accuracy, timer cover easily removed by cat (he would screw up the timing and get all of his meal much sooner), my cat could cheat by advancing food tray one position, timing arm and cam had to be set up correctly for product to work properly, etc.I created workarounds for most of the Cat Mate C50\'s flaws. No big deal But that\'s not the case with the Cat Mate C500.All of the pesky little faults were solved except one: for my wet food cat, the tray depth and corners makes it awfully difficult for him to eat all of each meal. Even when I place the food in the middle of a tray, my cat inevitably nudges food into the corners as he eats.However, an additional problem was created with the digital timer: the Cat Mate C500 delivers 4 meals within a 24 hour period.The old Cat Mate C50 model allowed meals to be distributed over 4 days. Since my cat eats four meals a day, I would use two Cat Mate C50s. Which was great for 2-day weekend trips.1 or 2 Cat Mate C500s can be used for such a weekend scenario, depending how often your cat(s) eat.Being much less complicated to set up correctly, I feel much more confident that the CMC500 will deliver every intended meal when I\'m away. That\'s HUGE.According to instructions, three AA batteries last 12 months. Which is awesome; however, I wish the CMC500 included a battery strength display. (The instructions also show a "low battery indicator" [Image 2, #2], so maybe it will eventually show up once battery power declines to a certain point.)For a weekend trip, I recommend freezing almost all of the meals before setting up the feeder. Use the 2 freezer packs included with the product. I also fill a shallow, empty flower pot with other freezer packs that I have and place the CMC500 on top to give longer "refrigeration."', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 22, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Fine for dry food. Questionable for wet.', 'author': 'ITurnSides', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I bought this to feed a kitten on the weekends, as it lives in my office and not my home. The timed turntable works and setting it is simple; there is nothing complicated to the mechanism. If you're dispensing dry food, it's just fine. My interest was in keeping wet food cold. The unit by itself, with both cold packs installed, will keep pre-frozen wet food cold for around 12 hours. At 15 hours, everything is room temperature. I built a styrofoam enclosure that was able to stretch the window to around 36 hours maximum. The final version holds an extra three ice packs. I've attached my controlled test results, which were not stellar. If you don't want wet food sitting at room temperature for more than a few hours, I wouldn't recommend setting it's dispensal time at longer than 12 hours. Freezing it first can stretch it a bit, but not much. All told, the ice packs don't do much at all. So unless you absolutely need a set amount of food dispensed at set times, a regular gravity feeder is probably better. If you are using all five bowls within 24 hours, it might be ok for wet food. Just don't expect it to be a cooler. It's most certainly not that.And after all of this I realise, of course, that a cat that will happily eat garbage and drink from the toilet hardly cares about spoilage. So there's that.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars two feeders for 48 hour feeding', 'author': 'JR', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We've been using one of these for 4 meals a day, decided to test 8 meals over two days and it works perfectly. The ice packs are not cold at the end of the second day but the food is fine. We set two times on each feeder. One feeder is set to 4:00 and 8:00, the other feeder is set to 16:00 and 20:00. Now the feeders open 4 times a day over a two day period. Great for those impromptu overnights away from home.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great feeder!', 'author': 'Jesse Stoncius', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have 7 cats. 3 are adult males I adopted at various times (two as strays and one from a shelter), and 4 are a litter of kittens that some neighborhood feral cat brought to my garage who I caught and are now indoors. Suffice to say, I have a lot of cats for one dude. I occasionally have to leave them overnight, so I have 6 of these feeders, a couple hopper style ones, and the petsafe 5 meal feeder that is similar to this that apparently didnâ€™t work the last time I was gone overnight.These cat mate feeders work really well for the most part. Theyâ€™re easy to program and work reliably on AA batteries. I like that you can use the freezer packs to serve wet food although I probably wouldnâ€™t do that if I was planning on being gone more than a day. Even my smart 5 year old cat canâ€™t get them open, and he has definitely tried.One of these feeders had a button sensor quit working on the control pad and Iâ€™m not sure how to fix it without opening it up. Itâ€™s only one out of the six so I doubt itâ€™s an issue with the design or anything. I didnâ€™t check to see if thatâ€™s a common issue, though, and if I manage to figure out how to fix it, Iâ€™ll update here.I do wish there was a multipack of these so I could get a few more to space out feedings, since this is the only feeder model of the billion I own that Iâ€™m reliably sure feeds my cats on time and is the only one that works with wet food.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 6, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Seems to work great so far', 'author': 'SFromTX', 'rating': 4, 'content': "We bought this feeder in order to remove ourselves from the feeding process for our very-food-focused stray and teach her patience. So far, it's been great. We have enjoyed 3 days of not being yelled at for 10 straight minutes while we prep her food, and she is learning to wait quietly near the feeder. I looked up a lot of feeders before purchasing this one, and this seemed to be the best price/quality match for our price range. The plastic is not as high quality as I would have hoped for given the price (hence the 4 stars instead of 5), and I'm pretty sure our two medium/large dogs could bust into this thing within 30 seconds if they go ahold of it, but we just keep it out of their reach. The cat so far has not been able to get into it, despite several tentative to more aggressive attempts. She hasn't unleashed cat fury yet though, so we'll see. The programming is easy, though, and the 3 feed slots are perfect for our needs. Our cat does not care about the deeper dishes as some people's cats seem to. It's not too loud, but makes a buzzing noise loud enough to cue the cat. Three main points sell me on this feeder currently: 1) the gears lock between feeding sessions, so she can't push the chambers around to reach her next meal early, 2) there are holes built into the bottom of the feeder where you can either screw it into a piece of wood or (as we did) use zipties to lock it onto a larger object so the cat can't flip it (it's not heavy, so that's definitely a possibility), and 3) it comes with a freezer pack (though we haven't tested this out yet). Oh also the buttons are hidden behind the shield so she can't mess with the timing. So, solid design at least. We'll see if it holds up. At the very least it has taken feeding time down from pure noisy stress to something approaching calm.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "4.0 out of 5 stars Overall I'd Recommend", 'author': 'Rachel', 'rating': 4, 'content': '*See update at the end of this review* I\'ve only had this thing for less than 24 hours and so far my cat and beagle have no problems with it. Part of this review is my actual review of it and the other part is to call out another review that has completely misunderstood how this thing works.First off, I think it will take some time (maybe a few days) teaching them that they don\'t need to rely on us humans for food anymore and instead can go sit and wait by the feeder for food. That\'s why these feeders were purchased and that\'s why I\'ve got my fingers crossed since they like to wake my husband and I up starting at 6am every morning and don\'t get fed until at least 7am. So they\'re whiny, meowy, and restless for at least an hour each morning and it\'s just gotten to be too much. And then when they want dinner they again start meowing and whining and getting restless around 2:30pm but don\'t get fed until 4pm. I will try to remember to follow up with their progress in a few weeks.As for the review with inaccurate information: A Courtney from the UK (international review) wrote a review back in 2018. They were complaining about two things. Number one, they said it wasn\'t clear that you could schedule the same feeding time over multiple days (1 meal a day for 4 days). That\'s literally the first part of the instructions under the "meal time setting". Maybe instructions from 2 years ago were different but the ones I received were so blatantly clear that I don\'t understand how they could misinterpret that section.Number 2, they state the timing function is over-engineered, whatever that means. It\'s not. Important: The display screen automatically displays the meals in chronological order. This is simply so you know the schedule. This does not indicate when the next meal will come. What\'s listed as meal number 1 is not necessarily the time that the next meal will come. What determines when the next meal will come is the clock on the feeder. Let\'s say you feed your pet at 6:30am, 10am, 4pm, and 9pm. Assuming you set the clock to match your phone/watch/anything else that tells time and you fill all the compartments up and give your pet its first meal just after 4pm (because you just got the feeder delivered at 3:30) the next time the feeder will rotate is 9pm because that\'s the next time that will occur that day. Even though it\'s listed as meal number 4 (because it\'s the last one of the day) on the display screen, it\'ll be the next time the feeder rotates based on a 12 hour day (if you choose, you can change it to a 24 hour day). Again, if you read the instructions it\'s very clear. Meal 1 is not the first time the feeder will rotate it\'s just 1 meal out of a maximum of 4 that you can schedule. It doesn\'t matter the order that you enter the meals because it automatically displays the times into chronological order from AM to PM and this is stated in the instructions.So another example based on my timing above: if you enter all the times mentioned above and then first feed your pet at 10am, the next time it will rotate is NOT 6:30am but 4pm because that\'s the next time that will occur during the day because that\'s just how time works. They\'re like alarms you set on your phone.I can\'t believe I\'m getting this worked up over an automatic pet feeder. Maybe something should be changed about the scheduling if some people are having this hard of a time. Or maybe they just need to work on their reading and understanding skills.I just really hope my pets stop whining for food.***Update***It\'s been 11 days since we received the feeder and this is what I have to say: The cat realized pretty quickly that the feeder is what serves up the food each meal now and not the humans. Her whining as stopped HALLELUJAH. The dog does not whine either anymore for the most part, but she will still usually hop on and off the bed once or twice in the morning once she sees the cat approach her feeder down the hall (we live in a shotgun style condo, all one level with one hallway that goes from one end of the condo to the other). I think the dog does this for three reasons: 1) She knows her food is coming soon because the cat is on the move. 2) She is anxious because she knows the cat will try to eat her food if it is left unprotected. Luckily the cat\'s feeder turns like 15 seconds before the dog\'s so the cat is already eating by the time the dog\'s feeder turns. 3) She likes to be near us at all times. The back and forth between the bedroom and her feeder in the kitchen is part excitement, part protection, and part wanting to still be near her humans who are still sleeping. If my husband or I were to get up at 6am (they get fed at 6:30am), they would both still go nuts though and think that we were about to feed them because it\'s close enough to 6:30am and they can\'t tell time. The same happens in the afternoon. It\'s ingrained in their minds. Years and years of us humans feeding them will do that. I don\'t know if that habit will ever break but we completely ignore them if they do this. Overall, this setup is a huge improvement and makes mornings so much more pleasant for me.The ice packs. I think they are better than nothing. I wish the unit was made of a more insulating material. Luckily, since I bought two units and only one is needed for wet food, I use the two ice packs for the dry food unit as replacements for the wet food feeder. Ideally I\'d say the ice packs should be replaced every 4-5 hours. I usually change it every 6-8 hours, sometimes longer than that. The smell of the wet food has never been an issue and the cat has no issues with the temperature of the food either. Overall, I\'m not too concerned about the ice pack situation. The replacements are only like $17 for a pair so if you need an additional set that\'s not a bad price. Whenever I change out the ice packs, both animals freak out for a few minutes but then quickly chill out. I try to change out the ice packs within a few hours of them eating so that it\'s not close to the next feeding timing. If I changed them closer to the next feeding time (say 2pm and their next meal is at 4pm), they would remain anxious and restless for the next 2 HOURS until the feeder turns at 4pm.Restocking the feeders. My husband and I have a decent set up for this. Every other morning, the feeders need to be refilled. We scheduled it that way. I think we may eventually adjust to every other evening but we\'ll see. Anyways, husband takes the dog out for her morning walk, the cat is usually passed out on the bed again after inhaling her breakfast so now is my time to refill both of them. I lock the cat in the bedroom, lock myself in the second bathroom where her food bowl is kept (to keep the dog away, she\'ll eat it if we don\'t, side note - check out Door Buddy if your dog likes to eat cat poop or cat food) and fill up 4 out of the 5 compartments. Then I do the same for the dog food. Cleaning these things is easy. Water and a tiny bit of elbow grease get any wet food residue off. We decided not to use the exposed compartment so that we are never the ones actually placing the food down for the animals to eat. I want them to really get used to the feeder serving their food and not us. So after a refill, the feeders go back down with one empty compartment open and four full compartments covered. The dog comes back in from her walk and immediately knows that food has been dealt but can\'t access it (she\'s a beagle, everything she does revolves around what she smells and where her next meal is coming from. My husband thinks she can smell the fresh food from outside of our condo. I don\'t doubt it). She frantically sniffs around but then gives up shortly after. Sometimes the cat will hear me opening the cans and will be waiting by the bedroom door meowing like she\'s about to die (so dramatic) but once I come out and she sees there\'s no food out for her she\'ll go back to bed.Size of compartments. My beagle eats 1/2 cup of dry food each meal. This is the perfect size for that. You could probably fit 3/4 cup of dry food in there. Not sure about anything more than that. Cat gets half a can (size of the smaller tuna cans) and there is plenty of room in it - non issue.So, overall, the animals have figured it out and I am happy. Is this thing perfect, no? But it\'s a huge improvement on my situation. If you have animals that whine and meow and beg for food leading up to each meal, I strongly recommend this automatic feeder.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 17, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars A no-frills workhorse', 'author': 'Elizabeth James', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I love this feeder.I use the 3-meal version, in conjunction with a hopper style dry food feeder. My cat, bless his dumb little head, lived outside for 5 years and has what we politely call "food issues" which means he cannot self regulate. To prevent the dreaded scarf-n-barf, he gets 4 meals a day, 2 dry and 2 wet. I bought a second carousel (the grey part the food goes in) and two ice packs, and every evening before I go to bed, I fill two sections with his breakfast and tea for the next day, and put it in the feeder with just a treat in the open bowl, and the ice pack underneath to keep it cool. Then the prior ice pack goes in the freezer, and I wash the dirty carousel, so everything is ready for the next evening.This system has made it so the cat\'s food focused ire isn\'t directed at me, and there are no more 5am demands for an early breakfast. It is up to the feeder gods. Every few months the carousel comes out of alignment (I\'m pretty sure from the cat attempting to push it) but that is easily corrected. It doesn\'t have a million buttons or internet connectivity or a camera, which are pros in my book, but ymmv. I set this up in December 2022, and am still on the first set of batteries. It\'s clock runs about 5 minutes slow at the moment, but since I\'ll reset it at the time change, that doesn\'t both us at all.My only complaint is that my cat is a bit of a messy eater. He gets food on the sides of the bowl and cover on a regular basis, and it can end up smeared inside the cover (I\'m not even sure how, and I assume most people\'s cats aren\'t quite so ill mannered) and it can be a bit of a to-do to clean. It was also a disaster the one time we had ants. But to me, this is more of a user error, and as long as himself lacks table manners, we would have this issue with any feeder.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Elevated Cat Bowls, Raised Cat Bowl with 32 oz Stainless Steel Food Bowls Non-Slip Feeder for Cats and Puppy, 15Â° Tilted Raised Pet Bowls, Indoor Cat Dishes with Bamboo Stand Anti Vomiting
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great kitty feeding bowls.', 'author': 'Sandy P.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Glad to find this for my kitty to be able to feed without bending over too far. It is also tilted so that helps with digestion. title: Cat Slow Feeder Food Bowl - Melamine Slow Feeding Cat Bowls Anti Vomiting - Fun Interactive Cat Puzzle Feeder Dish Healthy Eating Diet - Small Cat Plate Maze Design - Dishwasher Safe - 6.1''W x 1.2''H
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars She likes to eat out of this and it slows her down', 'author': 'mo rris', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Not only does it slow her down, she will also be more likely to eat food off off this plate in the first place; she likes it', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 22, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great slower feeder bowls', 'author': 'Robin A Stursa', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. My rescue kittens were very food insecure so they gobbled there food. Perfect!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 20, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars 3 1/2 stars. They need to have an edge around the outside.', 'author': 'LAF', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I really liked this bowl. In fact I bought a half dozen of them, and then I realized there was a problem. For some reason it didn't show up initially. There is no outside edge around the bowl. It is sloped downward to direct the food toward the center of the bowl, but my cat pushed the food up the slope & off of the side of the bowl. Big mess. I'm not sure why it didn't happen at first, but the problem didn't start until several weeks later.I really loved these bowls. They're cleverly made with protruding fishes that act to slow a cat's eating as they work to get the food from between them. This is one of the few bowls I saw formulated just for cats & there are many positives to the way it's made. The fish are a big deal at slowing the rate of eating. I also think that because the bowl is made of hard material, it was easier for my cat to eat, by using the hard surface of the fish to get a good grip on the piece of food she was trying to eat. She pushed the food up against the fish, where it was stopped by the hard surface, allowing her to then get it in her mouth.But that ended up being the reason for the problem too. She pushed the food around the bowl, and partially because the surface was hard & slippery, the food that didn't get wedged up against a fish, eventually got pushed right off of the bowl. I was sad when I had to pack up all of the bowls I'd bought & return them because I also thought they were pretty cute. But the long time went on, the worse the pushing of food from the bowl got to be, so they weren't helpful anymore. If the manufacturers would put a raised edge around the outside edge of the bowl, that would prevent food from getting pushed off of it. I liked these so much...until I didn't. In spite of my experience, I'd still recommend others give them a try. Your pet may not do what my cat did & they may be a perfect success story for you. To the manufacturers I'd recommend that you consider putting an edge around the bowl. Even if someone else's cat doesn't push the food off of the bowl, it would be a preventative measure so that it couldn't happen. If you did that, then I would love your bowl again.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great for kittens!', 'author': 'isabella', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This slow feeder has worked great for my kitten! Sheâ€™s still very short, so having a raised bowl doesnâ€™t work for her just yet, but this has been nice! The material seems very durable, which is nice. It also has little rubber pieces on the bottom that keep it from moving around a whole lot. It is pretty small and holds about a 3oz can of food at a time, so this may not work great for older cats who are eating larger meals. But works good if you feed smaller meals!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Really works!', 'author': 'Ashley', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This resolved my catâ€™s binge-eating problem! Sheâ€™s always had problems throwing up around the house. Between 2-5 times a week was her norm. Vet found nothing wrong, but suggested that she may be binging kibble, which sits undigested in her stomach, then gets regurgitated. I looked online and was suggested slow feeder bowls.Well, it worked! Sheâ€™s only thrown up once in the three weeks weâ€™ve used this bowl, and as a bonus, sheâ€™s slimmed down a lot and has a lot more energy, making her playful as a kitten again. I can only imagine this can only bode well her as she ages. I guess she has enough time to feel full as she is forced to snuffle in the crevices for her kibble. So happy I gave this a try!I have two versions of this for her, one raised ceramic and this melamine one. She likes both, but the melamine is nice knowing it wonâ€™t get broken if it falls off the counter. The cute little fish design is a huge bonus.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 27, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cute! Careful of the sides', 'author': 'Fortheloveof', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Cute design for this feeder. It is easy to handle and wash with. The fish design is not only cute, but itâ€™s perfect for keeping the cat from eating too fast. It seems plenty stable and sturdy. And has little rubber grips to help keep it from sliding around too much. Itis easy to clean and can be put into the dishwasher.The feeder is not raised and sits low on the ground. The sides are shallow and not raised very tall, so if thereâ€™s any liquid, it can spill over the sides. I discovered this when I was adding some water to my cats wet food. It is better for dry foods, but even when using dry food, the food can still spill over the sides if not handled well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 1, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Attractive dish to help slow a quick eater', 'author': 'S. Very happy with this addition to slow down our budding chunk monster.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 26, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars It works', 'author': 'Kenya Mom', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The viral is not plastic and its dishwasher safe. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Set-Up Process', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Although the instruction manual states that the app can only be set-up on 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, it's easy to overlook that detail. To connect to to the wifi, it's easy to use mobile hotspots because they typically use 2.4 GHz so I recommend using another phone as a mobile hotspot to connect the app and feeder on your device. title: Automatic Dog Feeder with Adjustable Camera, 5G WiFi 6L Smart Cat Food Dispenser, 1080P HD Video with Night Vision, Pet Feeder with 2-Way Audio for Cats & Dogs, Food Blockage & Motion Alerts
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Finally! Smaller portion size for cats!!!', 'author': 'PorcupineMom', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Our biggest complaint about automatic pet feeders in the past is that the portion sizes are too big. With our older cat having a sensitive stomach, this has led to a lot of overeating and vomiting. This feeder has SOLVED that problem for us. We took out our scale and weighed out the portions between our old feeder and the Roilpet feeder. The Roilpet feeder came in about 2 grams less per serving! Yay! (And yes, our old boy has noticed.) As the video will tell you, we generally love everything about this feeder. When you initially set it up, do it closer to your router, but after that you can move it to a different location and it works perfectly. We love the fact that we control all of the settings from our phone. One of our biggest frustrations in the past was learning the button combinations to program other feeders. No more! This one is so easy! Our only feedback is we wish it had the capability to record video automatically every time they come to the feeder (you can manually record), but it does have a great feature where it will notify you on your phone when it senses motion at the feeder. For us this is important so we know that they are healthy and eating when we are not home. Weâ€™ve been using the feeder for over a week now and it has worked perfectly. I do like the fact that it has an alert system to not only let you know that the feeder executed the feeding function successfully but apparently it will also let you know if the feeder is jammed. We havenâ€™t had a problem with that and use pretty small diameter food, but itâ€™s nice to know the feature is there.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 16, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect.', 'author': 'Ariana', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It was easy to set up and is perfect if I'm not able to make it home for my pups dinner time. Works well, and the camera is a cool feature to make sure my dog has eaten. Just a great product", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars It is a well made feeder.', 'author': 'Chris Bukovsky', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I find this product to be well made, easy to use and convenient. I like that it has a camera and not only can you talk to your pet you can hear them as well. I feel having these features will be nice while on vacation since Iâ€™ll be able to see, hear and talk to my cats while Iâ€™m away.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars only works with WPA-2', 'author': 'Nzplatt', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'sadly this only works with WPA-2. once my settings were fixed the feeder worked fine it is the only one i have found that had an adjustable camera. i have a finicky pet so dont want to feed her unless iâ€™m sure she eats. this one allows you to see the actual food bowl.the WPa issue was a problem for me but the seller worked hard and was responsive to getting it resolved', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Excelente,', 'author': 'Eva', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Puedo dejar a mi perro una semana sin pagar a alguien para que lo cuide', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Works well as a feeder but...', 'author': 'crazytekkie', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The video quality is nothing like they show in the description. Even with decent network speed and signal it pixelates and distorts quite a bit. I use the camera just to see how much food is left in the dish but not that great of quality. The app however is reasonably self explanatory and it connects fairly quick. Allowing others to have access to it does not work tho. There may be better feeders out there for same price or close.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great way to feed and watch your fur baby', 'author': 'GA Patriot', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easy to set up and love the camera and other helpful features in the app. Holds an entire 3 lb bag of cat food, which my previous feeder could not. The camera is a great angle to see your animal throughout the lower half of the room and has an awesome night mode. There is a way to make a message to your pet when the food is dispensed, but it was not intuitive to me â€” luckily the food hitting the metal bowl is loud enough so my cat knows when to eat.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars What a fantastic idea', 'author': 'Tissues and Rainbows', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I work shift schedules and live alone. It is hard for me to keep my dog fed at the same time each night. I usually hire a dog sitter to come over and feed him dinner to keep his schedule. I ordered the automatic dog feeder from #Roilpet to see if this would help keep my dog on a schedule. It turned out to be a great solution. I can feed my dog the right amount of feed at the same time every night. The added bonus is from my phone I get to watch him face level to ensure he is eating. I can even speak to him. When I know he is done, I can go home during my short break to let him outside.It is really a great solution for when I am not at home. I highly recommend this product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works well. Pops apart a little too easily.', 'author': 'Boymom', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I got this for my small dogs' feeder. It works pretty well. It does seem to struggle if his food is in very large pieces. The auger compartments aren't very large.The bin snaps onto the base. I dint trike the way it snaps on. It's not very secure. My son bumped it with his leg one day and the entire bin popped up and let all the food fall out all over the floor. Then m, because the food was under the edges, it had to all be dumped, taken apart and cleaned our before it could be used again.The app it uses is the Tuya app, which I already used for other items. It was easy to set up and the settings are easy to adjust.The camera works fine. This unit will only feed when the power is on. If the power goes out, there's no way for your pet to get food. If only the internet goes out, it will continue to feed on the last settings.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 22, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Every pet owner needs this Super Smart feeding station!', 'author': 'Emma Langford', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is the first automatic pet feeder I have had and I am converted. Itâ€™s fantastic. The camera on this is high resolution and even comes with night vision. I can see and hear my pets day and night.I can talk to my pet, interact with it and even take photos. Is there anything it cant do!? If you download the app you can program it even further to do schedule feeding. I am still very new to this and just started to get used to all the alerts I get when it detects my pet-and will also de get any blockage within the feeder and it will alert me. I mean this is beyond smart! Iâ€™m excited to use this over the next few days and really get up to speed with all the controls and programs but so far itâ€™s amazing. Comes with a stainless steel bowl. Absolutely love this. Itâ€™s one of those things that you never knew you needed until you get it. Now I cant imagine not having one. Highly recommend. Worth the money.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 12, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

Very satisfied with our purchase', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 27, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Good but expensive', 'author': 'An', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Itâ€™s good for its use however almost 30$ for this is way too expensive', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars 2 major design flaws that could be improved', 'author': 'Elly', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I bought this attachment for my current feeder in preparation of adopting a second kitty soon. After assembling and attaching, the portion sizes no matter how many times I tested were not equal, way more than the 3% notice in their description. I made sure the divider was set all the way to the right until it couldn't move anymore, and it was still not equal. It was significantly more noticeable when larger portions were dispensed at once.Another design flaw is the part that attaches to the spout of the dispenser also causes kibble crumbs to fall into the crevices. Unlike their single bowl attachment which sits completely under the spout, this one does not. So for the single bowl attachment, all the kibble falls into the bowl including the crumbs. For the double bowl attachment, the crumbs constantly build up in the crevices because the bowls do not sit under the spout but rather in front of it.I feel these issues could easily be modified and improved. With the divider, I feel if it was a bit longer and had more flexibility to move more to the right, it could solve the issue with unequal portions. In addition to having us choose whether the right or left bowl gets more food as well. I'm not sure why they designed it in such a limited way. Regarding the kibble crumbs, I feel they could either modify the design for the bowls to sit closer to the spout or the part that attaches to the bottom of the spout actually sits underneath. Because of these design flaws, I had to return it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 24, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]
