title: Cat Feeder Automatic with APP - Easy to Clean 16cup/136oz 2.4GHz WiFi Automatic Cat Feeder for Remote Feeding, Cat Food Dispenser with Lock Feature and Suitable Portion Size, Easy to Use
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great feeder, exactly as advertised', 'author': 'L. Gonzalez', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. So after looking at tons of different feeders on amazon and extensively reading reviews we decided on this one, here's my long but detailed review with all the information i would've liked to find when I was searching for one. (if you already have one and can't figure out how to program it skip to the bottom)All in all its great for the price and so far so good, two months in and its doing its job.Upsides:We like that the lid locks perfectly smooth with the rest of the feeder, no way for the cats to unlock it, lift it, or take it off even if they managed to trip the whole thing, if youre trying to manage/limit the amount of food your cat has access to, I recommend itIt doesn't make an awful sound like other feeders that have scared me to death when they turn on, just a little whirring noise and the kibble hitting the metal dish isnt bad at allDoesn't make any mess, all the food stays inside the dishPerfect size, not huge or bothersome at all, doesn't take too much spaceHolds 13 cups, each cup is 105gr so it totals to 1.36 kgsI tested the feeding ratio with a scale time and time again to have peace of mind before we left for a few days and it does vary 1 or 1.5 grams per portion sometimes but it has a pretty consistent 6.4 grams average per portion, and all the feedings were delivered exactly on timeCats like it, they were wary at first but figured it out by the end of the day and they now love it. We used an empty cardboard box on the bottom to raise it a little bit since we couldn't find a raised automatic feeder that we liked and it works, they haven't thrown it down even once.You can put batteries in so it keeps working in case of an energy outage, we haven't put any batteries in yet but it works fine, we actually had an outage for a couple of seconds and I was happily surprised to find out it was still programmed as usualThe dish comes out easily if you need to wash it. It hasn't become discolored or anything.Downsides:Other comments say it might not be as easy to unlock the lid if you have super long nails or arthritis, I usually keep mine long and manage just fine.It would be nice if the inside could be disassembled to clean, but not quite , you can take the top part off (above the orange line) but not the mechanical part and the feeding tube.My only complaint is that if the food doesn't get completely eaten, it stacks up in a little mountain in front of the feeding tube, it doesn't get pushed to the rest of the dish, so even if there's always food available for my cat (which gives me peace of mind if we ever have to leave for a trip) I can't be sure how much she is really eating on the regular day to dayThat said...Package arrived on time and in perfect condition, it was pretty easy breezy setting it up, as for the comments complaining its hard to program, I disagreeFirst measure how much food you want it to deliver per day and divide the grams between how many times a day you want your cat to be fed. If your cat eats one cup (105gr) of kibble and you want it to dispense food say four times during the day, that comes to 4 portions (approx 25 gr) each time in our case.Click the left button for a few seconds to unlock the digital pad and it'll let you begin programming, applies too if you want to reset/reprogram your settings, the light will turn on and you'll see the lock image disappear, next click the right button for a few seconds until you see the number for setting the hour begins flashing, use the middle (- +) button to adjust, when done click the right button to continue and set the minutes on the clock, click right button to continue, continue to adjust the time you want the first feeding and the amount of portions for it, next the second and so on, if you don't want all six feedings you can just select zero portions for the ones left, don't take too long between clicking buttons or it'll lock itself and you'll have to start from the beginning of the cycle and circle through to were you left off.the button on the top for feeding one portion at a time works perfectly well too, you just have to unlock the pad first... (click left button for a few seconds until lock image disappears)Hope this helps!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice feeder without bells and whistles', 'author': 'C. Sadowski,', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought the larger size and I\'m glad I did. Even so, the unit is compact and doesn\'t take up much room at all. The instructions aren\'t that great and it was a little difficult to understand the portion sizes but once you start setting the times, you figure it out. You should have some idea how often your cats like to snack or eat when you schedule the portions out but the settings can always be adjusted. I\'ve had the unit for over a month and it\'s been nice. I had a "gravity" feeder before this one but it never worked right. I always had to help the food come out into the tray. This feeder spreads the food a bit into the tray without much help from me. Since the feeder is not near an outlet, I use batteries only. I bought rechargeable batteries for the unit and after a month of use, I haven\'t noticed any sluggishness. It\'s a nice little unit to have for those who want the convenience of an automatic feeder without the cost of one with all the bells & whistles like using an app or wifi. This is just fine and gets the job done.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars I wish I had bought this years ago!', 'author': 'C. Degifico', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It holds a lot of food and was easy to program (and reprogram when I decided to reduce the portions). Iâ€™ve had it about a month and it has been very reliable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Big dog alterations', 'author': 'JLO', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have two small dogs and a big dog, this works for the two small dogs perfectly, but needed some alterations to also work for the larger dog. Iâ€™m not using the bowl that came with it for several reasons. First, itâ€™s too small for my big dog and second, neither I nor my dogs like the sound of the metal. Luckily, the bowl is detachable and an 8 inch ceramic pasta bowl fit under the shoot just fine. The portions are tiny and limited to 16 portions per feeding. With the dog food size I use, 6 portions is about 1/4 cup. There are six programmable time-slots, so feeding my large dog four times a day, she needs to eat 24 portions twice a day (which takes up four slots), and 16 portions twice (last two slots) to equal the 3.5 cups she needs every day. For example, in order to get 24 portions in a single feeding, I set the timer for 2:00 to serve the maximum 16 portions and for 2:01 to serve the additional eight portions. There was quite a lot of math setting this up and unfortunately because dog and cat food sizes differ, you will have to do your own math. I suggest that you allow the machine to dispense one portion and work out how much that is and go from there. One of my little ones is overweight and ruining free feeding for everyone, Iâ€™m hoping that this helps him. So far so good.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars NO MESS, NO FUSS', 'author': 'Jean M. Green', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It took my husband and I a minute to figure out how to use the auto feeder as we're not real tech savvy but once we got the hang of it, the feeder works like a dream.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works well. Pet and I are Happier', 'author': 'Dee', 'rating': 5, 'content': "No more meowing to get up and feed the cat. Timed delivery delivers food on schedule with up to 6 feedings in 24 hours. Will fit anyone's schedule. Plugs in with battery backup. White reduces heat absorption from sun. Extremely please with purchase. Recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars The feeder button does not work', 'author': 'ashley d.', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Its nice, not very hard to program but the feeder button does not work so if my cat is cranky and needs food right away I have to scoop it because the feeder button just never wanted to work.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Iâ€™m impressed', 'author': 'BJ.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It works for my little Shih Tzu wonderfully. She gulps her food and I was concerned that there was nothing in the bowl to slow her down, as she had before. However, I found a tiny little stainless steal bowl that I turned upside down in the feederâ€™s bowl. It fit perfectly so I glued it in with some strong glue. It made a perfect little donut and the food falls around the little bowl. As Nina eats she pushes the food around therefor slowing herself down. This unit is a bit small. Perfect for a small to medium size dog (but maybe not with the small bowl). But Iâ€™m not sure it would suit a large dog unless you feed it often. You can program it up to 6 feedings a day.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Make some mods if you use this outdoors', 'author': 'James R. Steele', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Most or all auto feeders are made for indoor use. I bought this 16-cup model to use outdoors, on my porch, for a feral cat who has come to own me. There is no brand or model of these made truly for outdoor use that I could find, and I looked everywhere for quite a long time, but this one has the cleverest lid attachment latches I saw and an actual lid seal against ants, so I bought it. Most lid designs are to thwart a cat. I need to thwart raccoons.When I got it, I found that the lid attaches and seals very firmly as they had boasted, and you need two fingers to get it open. See the photo of the mud from raccoon paw prints as they tried unsuccessfully to get it open, so I was happy there. But then to my surprise, the food tank attaches very flimsily to the base with two side spring flip levers that a coon could easily figure out to break it open. So, as seen in photo #2, I drilled a small hole in the front and back and used two very short (about 3/8" long) sheet metal screws to firmly attach it. That works great so far.You can also see in photo #2 that I used a bungee cord to firmly attach it to the leg of a metal outdoor chair so the coons could not bash it off the porch and bat it around trying to open it. Coons are very strong!It remains to be seen if the tiny fire ants we have here will be able to get between the seam of the tank and the base to get at the food, or enter the distribution area to enter the tank. It has been too cold for them so far. I can seal the tank seam with silicone, but if they can get in through the impeller, not much can be done.What I wish for: 1.) A truly outdoor, sealed auto feeder (and I have ideas!). 2.) A feed tank that attaches to the base with an ant-proof gasket by screws. It would be easy and inexpensive to engineer threaded brass inserts and thumbscrews or better yet, knurled screws, so it would still come apart easily for cleaning. 3.) Some molded brackets, so there is a better spot to hook bungee cords and be sure they can\'t slide off. The slight lip between tank and base does a pretty good job, though. 3.) A more ant-proof tray design, though this one does a lot better than a plain bowl of food did.The cat learned it right away. We\'ll see how well it stands up longer term. But so far it seems to be working well with the modifications.UPDATE 12/16/23: The raccoons finally got into the lid. Cannot find it anywhere, lol. Now trying to find out how to contact the company to see if I can get another lid. I guess more mods are still ahead for me. But I will win! :) Thanks for reading!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cool little gadget', 'author': 'Kadie', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'It took a little bit of time to get the functions set up and to get it set how we wanted it, but once it was set up itâ€™s such a neat thing. It is a bit tricky at first and the instructions donâ€™t make a whole lot of sense but it just takes time to figure out the portions and how much your furbaby should eat and etc. it gives you the option to use batteries or plug in and come with a durable cord and the power adapter. Iâ€™d buy again without hesitation.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

You can also set how many portions it will feed at one time. The portions do seem kind of small but the app lets you do a bunch. The only down side about it is that the motor doesnâ€™t seem to be super strong. Weâ€™ve had it for a few months now and have to add food constantly because it wonâ€™t hold too much food. The weight of filling it up to the top seems to make the motor stop. We also had to get them smaller size kibble since the bigger one seemed to get caught on occasion. As long as you have small kibble and fill it up about halfway, it works wonders.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars CLOG CENTRAL', 'author': 'Jay Horrocks', 'rating': 2, 'content': "To start, we purchased this because we of course were going out of town, but not only that, while I work from home, I get really tired of getting up to feed my cats multiple times a day or listening to the hungry hippo cry for food whenever I am in the middle of something and can't take a break. I also hated having multiple alarms set on my phone to feed them as well, it was simply a hassle and I needed to simplify their feeding process.So I purchased this after doing research for a couple of weeks and while I love that I can set multiple feeding schedules and have them set for certain days only or every day, as well as being able to see the girls while we're gone and talk to them, this thing started clogging up almost immediately. At one time we did have 2 different sized foods in the machine but according to all the foods indicated, the larger pieces, still shouldn't have jammed it. Either way, we dumped it all, stopped putting the larger food in and after a couple of days, it once again jammed. I have dumped this feeder at least 3-4 times now, shaken the heck out of it, put my fingers up the dispensing area to also try to fix it but nothing works.All in all, while I love the camera, the portion sizes, and the scheduling, the way this dispenses food, is a real problem and the chute and dispenser area need to be redesigned. Thankfully we can still send it back but now I am back to reading bad reviews and shopping again for a new feeder.I do not recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Frequently gets food stuck', 'author': 'Aira', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I am extremely dissatisfied with my experience using this automatic feeder. This goes against the very reason I purchased this automatic feeder in the first place, as I expected it to alleviate my burden rather than add to my troubles.In addition to the food jamming problem, the performance of this product has been subpar. I find it to be relatively expensive for what it offers, and it simply does not justify its price tag.Overall, this automatic feeder is far from user-friendly and not worth the purchase. I strongly advise against wasting your time and money on this product and suggest exploring other, more reliable feeding solutions.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far, best buy of the year!!', 'author': 'Lara M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am going to be totally honest here, I LOVED THIS! My cats at the begging didn't understand but now when they hear the food drooping they run for it even in the early morning it's amazing because they don't come to me anymore asking for food haha, I am really loving this because as cat owners we know that our babies are very dependent and it just great to see they eating and checking if they are doing fine for those times that you are not home or even if you are home it's a great way to keep track on them. It was extremely easy to set it all up from the feeding machine to the camera, which I saw some people having problems setting it up so you basically you download the app called smart life (There is another app that works too) from there you make your account, tap on the plus button and add device, there you look for 'Small Home appliances` and select the pet feeder with camera (Wifi), important tho your must have a 2.4 Hg to connect the feeder to the app but it doesn't mean your phone need to be on 2.4 connection all the time you use the app with your own data or 5G wifi connection it's just for the setup of the feeder.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars White - Wifi/Cam&Mic', 'author': 'Erika Raposo', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'So, I gave it a 3 star because everything works well but I would say the volume on the camera is in and out. I also would like to note, Iâ€™m not sure if mine is defect but one side dispenses more food than the other, to be specified: the left side has more food than the right side. I bought this for two golden retrievers; although it shows this is for cats I couldnâ€™t find one specified for dogs. I also want to note that set up for the portions was not very easy, it took a lot of thinking and understanding along with a bit frustration. Also I think the bowls shouldâ€™ve been bigger or deeper but they do the job. I think if the company sees this review: you will get more pet owner customers if you would update some of my concerns. Especially the bowl size and feeder dispense because this can work for both cat and dog. I also wish the legs/height were a bit taller, but that is nothing a small little table stand wonâ€™t fix. Lots of upgrading and updating that can be fixed for future and better experience. Thank you. I am overall satisfied and it does the job for now. It also has a boujee look to it lol.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Camera works great - Broke at the 1 year warranty mark - No response from Customer service', 'author': 'Cherie', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Overall I really like the feeder. Has a great camera, good app, dispenses faithfully, never got stuck, and holds 2 weeks of food for 2 large cats. I really don't want to have to keep buying a new one every year though.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: PetSafe Healthy Pet Simply Feed Power Adaptor - Compatible with Simply Feed Cat and Dog Food Dispenser - Powers PetSafe Automatic Dog and Cat Feeder, Size: 1 Pack, Black
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works!', 'author': 'TheMoreYouKnow', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Should this be included with the pet feeder purchase? Yes. Does it save me from having to buy expensive batteries to run it? Also, yes. Works well, wish the price were a little lower, but still worth it.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works', 'author': 'Charles Allen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works for the cat feeder as stated. I leave batteries in the feeder as a failsafe in case we lose power.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect fit', 'author': 'Malkovich', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ordered this with the feeder and it works perfect no issue saves from buying batteries all the time and way cheaper', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars have to purchase the power cord separate from the feeder', 'author': 'Marty', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'the power cord should be included with the product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars 2nd one in 7 years.', 'author': 'bmbranno', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This is a great feeder but as everyone has said, complicated to program. That is our Biggest gripe. Also, the first one CAME with the adapter, and using batteries is a pain and short-lived. So not happy with this attempt on their behalf to sell unit for under $100 by taking the adaptor off and selling it separately. Find that to be a bit cheap on their behalf. Otherwise, it is very long-lived, durable, and we keep ours outside on the back porch and it does just fine. We get temps in single digits in the winter and it has never cracked. But our last one quit for no reason. We tore it apart and the mechanics simply gummed up and stopped working. Instead of attempting to clean piece by piece and tearing it completely apart we felt it was worth buying a new unit instead. Right now as my husband attempts to program it using our own miserable batteries (very unhappy not having the adaptor included and the last one was chewed partly through by mice) he is cursing it. They really need to simplify the programming, otherwise it is an outstanding unit, very reliable, and even when power went off then resumed the unit automatically continued to do its' job. So 4 stars for reliability and the fact that it holds lots of food for at least 2 weeks for our labrador, but one less due to complexity for programming and NO ADAPTOR. I think their fee is pretty steep already, let alone removing the adaptor and selling it separate. Kind of a cheap method of making more money in my opinion.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 22, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great product', 'author': 'MB', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love this pet feeder. I bought this in November of 2018, it still works like a charm! The clock is a little slow, you may have to adjust it every now and then to correct the current time, but it doesn't stop the feeder from feeding your animals, it just may be 5 to 10 minutes off. Not a big deal.My only slightly negative is, it is a bit cumbersome to clean, but it's not horrible, I've had other pet feeders that were way worse to clean.I totally recommend this pet feeder. 2 years old and still going strong!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars As expected', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works as expected', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Proof that our cats don't just love us because we feed them", 'author': 'Elizabeth M', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I hoped my cats would stop nagging us to check their (not empty) food dish, and it worked. Once they learned that small quantities of food would appear at regular intervals throughout the day and night, they became a lot less stressed about food. Not only did they stop getting upset about a tiny spot of exposed dish at the bottom, they stopped crowding around the dish when the food arrives and gulping it down. Bonus...they're actually eating less and are finally the weights the vet recommended.It also gives us a little more peace of mind when we travel, knowing that if for some reason the person checking on them were to miss a day they'll still have food.And contrary to the popular axiom, of course the kitties still demand snuggles, sit on our laps, sleep on our feet, and are wonderful companions. If anything they're more cuddley because they don't spend any time fussing about food.If I could change anything, it would be for the dish to be a little farther away from the base. We propped up the back of the dish a bit so the food would slide to the front, giving them more whisker room.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 5, 2018', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Electrical cord short.', 'author': 'Betty', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have purchased two of these electrical cords both were different brands and both was shorter than the original cat litter box cord.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works great for us', 'author': 'Jane in the Midwest', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I have two cats and an erratic work schedule, which didn't sit well with the cats, who were never sure what time they would be fed. Initially, they were both a bit timid due to the mechanical noise it makes when preparing to dispense the food. However, they now both sprint towards it when they hear it as they know it's feeding time. It is a bit noisy when it dispenses food but has been fantastic. I felt a bit silly for spending so much on a cat feeder but it has provided a level of security and consistency which has helped relax the cats. And I no longer worry about getting home late from work to whiny cats begging for food nor am I awakened at 4 or 5 am by meowing from hungry cats. I do wish the programming could be simplified but overall, this has been worth the month. We've been using it over a year now without any issues and I would highly recommend it.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2020', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Slow Feeder Cat Bowl, Fun Interactive Feeder, Slows Down Pets Eating, 100% BPA Free, Dog and Cat Puzzle Feeder Prevents Overeating, Healthy Eating Diet Cat Bowls (Pink)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good product', 'author': 'GSXR', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This seem like a good product, it was well-made, and did what it was designed to do. But unfortunately, I returned it because my kitty was not interested in it whatsoever.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Fun for dog. Fun for human. Needs more stability.', 'author': 'Amy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. The bowl is taller than my Doxie puppy, but that didn't stop her. You see her first attempt is to use brute force to gnaw the treat balls open. She wasn't as methodical as a feline, but she was determined. Within a few minutes, she figured out the game. Her small size meant she was jumping in the bowl, thus not pushing it around. But it isn't going to be great for a slightly larger pup (mine weighs 2 pounds). That pup would probably push it around and playing the game would be more difficult. It needs some sort of weight or rubber or suction cups or stabilizing structure on the bottom to keep it from becoming a soccer ball. I felt supervision on my part was necessary.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Clever Product!', 'author': 'Erika B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. As the "proud" owner of a superchonk I\'ve been in the market for a product like this. He literally eats so fast he wheezes and snorts. Think pig seeking truffle... I\'ve bought other versions that worked, but they were low to the ground. They also tended to be really difficult to clean because most didn\'t come apart. The first thing I did was take it apart and wash it. It\'s designed so the little sliders can actually pop out to be cleaned. It takes a little time to do this, but the fact that it\'s a possibility is awesome. I put it back together and filled it with treats. He figured out the first couple of cups quickly. He struggled more the further the cups were away from the drop slot. (Insanely amusing to watch f.y.i.) Though eventually, Chonk was victorious. I\'m also glad to report the base was wide enough that he didn\'t tip it. Though, he didn\'t aggressively attempt to. The only real recommendation I have to the maker would involve adding rubber or something on the bottom. He didn\'t tip it, but it did slide around on linoleum fairly easily. Overall, I am VERY happy with this product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: Automatic Cat Feeder with 1080P Camera, WiFi Pet Food Dispenser, App Control Programmable Meal Schedule Feeding & Voice Interaction, Motion & Alerts, 1-10 Meals Per Day 5L
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice quality', 'author': 'Evan', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Feels well built. The camera is very clear and HD. Holds a good amount of food, you can choose how much food you want to drop. You can also pre record your voice when you drop food. Pretty cool. I recommend it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works Great for Outdoor Kitties', 'author': 'Peekablue', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. Last summer, we had a mother cat move into our barn with three kittens. We had no barn cat at the time, so we decided to start feeding them & they stuck around. We had a vacation planned for the week of Christmas, so we decided to get an automatic feeder. We actually got two because I was worried that someone might get pushed away & not be able to eat as much. So, we got this feeder along with one from another brand. Due to a wildlife problem in our barn, we decided to bring the feeders up to our deck, since the cats like to hang out up here, anyway. This one seems to be working very well.The main food compartment has a lid that locks in place, so you have to have human sized hands to open it. You do have to download an app on your phone or tablet in order to work it. You can set as many feedings as you want (I have ours set to drop food every 4 hours during the day). You can also set how many portions you want to drop at each feeding. There is a camera, so you can see your cats when they are at the feeder & take pictures or record a video. There is also a microphone feature on the app, so you can talk to them through the feeder. I\'ve tried it a few times & they come running when I call.Overall, I think this feeder works great. It does send me notifications on my phone rather often to tell me that the "bucket is empty," which I think just means that there is no food in the bowl, which is fine. It can be a bit annoying but all the other features make up for it. It was very easy to set up & my cats accepted it readily. I\'m including a video taken from the feeder of one of my cats eating.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars D batteries not AAA batteries', 'author': 'Jim the Ohio guy', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The website shows a photo of the battery panel with five AAA batteries in it. Elsewhere the product description says it uses three D batteries but I missed seeing that and relied on the photo. The fact that I thought it uses AAA batteries was a key selling point for me because I have several rechargeable AAA batteries, but no rechargeable D batteries. I wish the website was more clear and correct.Overall itâ€™s a good product and fairly easy to set up manage feedings.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great for multi cat household and checking in with the kitties from afar', 'author': 'Emily TaargÃ¼s', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have three cats in our household so I ordered this feeder to help manage their diet intake as well as check in via camera from afar. So far, this auto feeder has been a big hit, time saver, as well as adorable addition to our home. It was easy to set up (but you do have to make an account), connects directly\xa0to the wifi, and it even allows us to communicate via intercom in real time from our phone anywhere, which is convenient.\xa0It holds a decent amount of food, and is ideal for a multi cat household. It was easy\xa0to calculate how much each of them should eat and set it up so that it automatically feeds them every few hours. They are much happier and yell at us less to be fed which is nice. We recently went on vacation for the holidays and being able to have peace of mind and check in on our kitties was invaluable. Overall, we are very happy with this\xa0product and would\xa0consider ordering another one as a gift in the future\xa0because these work so well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Do not waste your money.', 'author': 'Sabriya Alam', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'If I could give this zero stars, I would. Firstly, the power cord for the automated feeder does not work. Even when it is plugged in, the device does not turn on. When I put in batteries instead, the light turned on, but then there were software issues. The app to control this device is completely unusable. It cannot find the device, and when I tried to add the device manually, it refused to connect to bluetooth even though it is in pairing mode. The instructions provided were not only for the wrong product, but the customer service number provided routes to a random family in New York, not a real customer service line. title: Automatic Cat Feeder with 1080P Camera, 7L WiFi Cat Food Dispenser with Remote App Control, Voice & Video Record, Dual Power Supply, Automatic Dog Feeder Auto Pet Dry Food Feeders for Cats
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars 10/10!! There's many different portions size options and you can schedule it as often as you like. Even if you don't want it daily, you can set it to release x portions like M, W, F, Su, for example. Personally, I felt bad talking to her because it seemed to just confuse her but it's still a really cool feature.- Connection while you're gone is EXCELLENT. title: iPettie Hourglass Automatic Cat Food Dispenser, Wireless Cat Feeder Automatic Battery-Operated with 180-Day Battery Life, Voice Recording, Stainless Steel Bowl, Food-Grade BPA Free Tank, 3L/12 Cup
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Controls face the back yet mostly set and forget it.', 'author': 'Jack', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ive had this feeder since October and it is now the end of December. I own 4 brands of pet feeders. They all work about the same. This one was cheap enough I bought one for my momâ€™s cat as well. I like the east clean stainless steel bowl that sits in the plastic bowl for easy cleaning, not all come with a steel bowl. I wish it had two for swapping. It has a compartment for back up batteries. I like the ability to feed through out the day at set times and amounts. This one is easy to clean between fills.Two things I donâ€™t like as much is the front clean look is great unless you want to use the settings. It faces the wall so I have to pick it up to get to the controls. If I want to give a manual feed, I now just open the top to get some out. My other feeder has a button that allows me to feed manually easily. My one piece of advice is to make sure you use proper sized pebbles, if they are too big they can get stuck and not fall properly. It can be funny to watch the cats come running to an empty drop though, they are use to hearing its dinner time now. I have them set in different rooms and they make the rounds looking for food, getting more exercise and less pre filled bowls which is what the vet recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Size', 'author': 'Linda Metcalf', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was the right size my the room my cats are in.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Helpful, a few minor things are annoying.', 'author': 'Alex Denham', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like the idea of this a lot. I sometimes stay over at a friends, donâ€™t get home until late, or decide to sleep in one morning when I have a day off from work, and my cats will whine and complain so much about it because the food in their bowl is stale or they just know itâ€™s not fresh and they HAVE to have fresh food.. this is helpful in those times and it helps keep the food fresh for them because it has the lid that covers the air vent at the top.The programming is relatively easy once you understand how it functions, but I definitely needed to read the instructions first or I would not have understood how to use the lock/unlock feature or what button to hold and for how long. Also, I would be aware that If you plan to use the power cord to an outlet then you will be fine, but the cordless feature requires 6 D batteries! Those are the giant round ones, and they are not cheap. So I would not recommend this if you plan to use it without plugging it in. But the batteries can also just function as a backup power supply in the event that you have a power outage, which I guess is a good idea to have, just in case, and that wouldnâ€™t run thru those expensive batteries very fast.The one thing I do find really strange and a bit annoying is the way you set the amount of food to dispense is through â€œportionsâ€, but one portion is like 6-10 individual pieces of foodâ€¦ it doesnâ€™t seem accurate that one portion is 1/8 of a cup like it says. To get the amount I need for 2 cats I had to set it for 6 portions twice a day which just seems a bit odd, but now that itâ€™s set it works and is a great help.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars On time feedings every day', 'author': 'Jessica D.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently acquired this wireless automatic pet feeder, and let me tell you, it's been a total game-changer for my canine companion. Despite being marketed as a cat feeder, I seamlessly adapted it to suit my dog's feeding schedule. Managing two meals a day, each dispensing a precise 2 cups of kibble, has never been easier.What truly sets this feeder apart is the ability to record my own voice for feeding reminders. It's like a personal touch, even when I'm not around. This feeder allows you to record a personal message, and it will be played right before the meal is dispensed. Itâ€™s an adorable and personal touch. The initial setup was a breeze, thanks to straightforward instructions. However, disassembly for cleaning, which I undertake weekly (sometimes twice), is a tad more intricate.The packaging impressed me â€“ a box within a box ensured a secure delivery. Powering this feeder with three D alkaline batteries grants an impressive 180-day battery life. This makes feedings so much easier at my house. I just have to clean the batteries up to date, keep dog food around, and the machine clean.The scheduled meal feature has eradicated issues like overeating, vomiting, and esophagitis. I appreciate the thoughtful design, including a built-in desiccant box in the BPA-free tank that keeps the kibble fresh and crunchy. The stainless steel bowl is dishwasher-safe, and very hygienic eating space for my pup. Equipped with a torque motor, this feeder eliminates concerns about food jams and missed feedings. I only use this feeder with dry kibbles or freeze-dried food. This wireless automatic pet feeder has exceeded my expectations, providing a reliable, convenient, and safe solution to streamline my dog's mealtime routine. She has food allergies and need a strict diet with the same time schedule. This has made the diet scheduling and elimination a lot easier. The size of this feeder works well for my dog now, but she is a German shepherd so Iâ€™m not sure how long we will have it around. I purchased this product in white, again, itâ€™s very easy to clean, Iâ€™ve had a little over a month and no stains, still looks brand new. Im also still on my first set of batteries. They do not come with the product. Highly recommended for pet owners seeking a comprehensive feeding solution.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Use patience to program it, and you will not need to read the instructions', 'author': "The_Litter's_Full", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have other auto feeders in my house, but I wanted to have one that I could but in the basement, where one of my cats spends most of her time. By the time she makes it upstairs, all the food is gone so I wanted to make sure she has access to food when I go away on short weekend trips. I had no problem at all setting this unit up by myself and so far it has released food at the scheduled times. It can be plugged in, or else it can use batteries and be self sufficient for a while. I do recommend putting this unit on some sort of feeding mat so it can help to contain mis-fired pieces of kibble.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use but clogs', 'author': 'Chelsea Jones', 'rating': 2, 'content': "So this product was easy enough to assemble and program. The problem came when it was to dispense the food. I have cat food and it is very small bits. It didn't matter that the bowl was empty, the food would fill the hole and would go in the bowl? It would just stay there and make bad grinding noises and the feeder kept trying to get it out. I think it's because there is no slide for the food to fall in and go down. You know? Idk. The other feeder I bought from a different company has no problems. So I returned this one and got another of that.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great way to automatically feed kitty when i need to be away for an extended time', 'author': 'JN', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'this iPettie Hourglass Automatic Cat Food Dispenser was exactly what i needed - something to automatically feed kitty whenever i am away for a few days. In the past i have simply used a gravity self-feeding device but the idea of having exact control over the time and amount of feeding is best for keeping kitty at the right weight, etc.training me: the automatic feeder is pretty easy to put together. The programming of it is moderately easy too. But if you have trouble programming your microwave or your television remote, make sure to have a ten-year-old nearby to help you because there is a fair amount of complexity to getting the feeding schedule, the feeding amount and the timing all set up exactly as you would like it to be. On the positive side, i found the instructions to be clearly written and thatâ€™s always helpful.Oh and the automatic feeder can be used attached to a wall outlet. A wall adapter (a 100V AC to 5V DC adapter) comes with it along with a changing cable. But i decided to use the feeder remote by installing 3 alkaline D-bateries. In my situation the flexibility of being able to place the feeder â€œanywhereâ€ won outtraining the cat: Since kitty currently gets a mixture of wet and dry catfood, i had to come up with a training plan to teach her to eat all dry (since the machine cannot handle wet, canned catfood.) I decided to mix kittyâ€™s current dry kibble with small tuna-flavored treats that are equally dry but - according to kitty - are irresistible. That mixture got kitty to eat timidly out of the stainless steel bowl whenever the machine dispensed some food. kitty was quick to figure out what the sound of the food being dispensed was - no issues there. But she seemed spooked by the mirror-like stainless steel bowl. (Kitty was feral till she became an indoor cat some nine years ago. so she still retains some of those feral ways that kept her alive back then.) So - bottom line - it will likely take weeks for kitty to totally adapt to the new process but thatâ€™s OK. Your kitty might find it far easier to become acclimated to new things.i plan to use this automatic feeder as kittyâ€™s only source of food till she is 100% comfortable with it. title: APETDOLA Automatic Cat Feeder, 5G WiFi Cat Food Dispenser with APP Control, 3L/12 Cup Timed Cat Dry Food Dispenser, Auto Pet Feeder Programmable for Cats & Dogs, 10s Voice Recorder, Dual Power Supply
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good cat feeder with intuitive app', 'author': 'Mellow', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The Smart Life app is intuitive to set up and super responsive. This product worked well to feed my cat when I went away for a trip. I like that it could dispense even small portions and my cat took to it right away since he loves dry food.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent feeder that meets our & our cats needs', 'author': 'Darlene', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We got 2 of these because we mainly need to use this on the weekends so we can sleep past 5am because our cats wake us to be fed at the time they are during the work week and it will also come in handy when we can\'t be home for an evening feeding.We chose the units without Wi-Fi since the reviews on the Wi-Fi models were mixed. One of the units already had a recording of noise (not a voice) so I don\'t know if it was used previously or not. It was clean and packaged nicely though.The manual is easy to follow and I suggest that you read it through once first because it can be confusing. (Note: the "quick reference" set up guide is not easy to follow so go straight to the manual for instructions...it\'s more complete) Once you get the hang of programming, it\'s straightforward and a breeze.The manual states how to switch the military time off and it worked for us. The batteries needed are D size (some reviews say AA or C).The recording announces my call twice very clearly and loudly and sounds like me perfectly. The cats came immediately, they were a bit skittish at first but ate out of the dish, and a month in, are now used to this and come running as soon as they hear it.We have used the "manual" feed option a few times and it will play my recording and dispense 1 portion.The locking top seems secure however, when moving the dispenser a few pieces of food came out (I\'ve noticed if you tilt it FORWARD, that\'s when the food falls out), so as long as the cats don\'t tip this or move this somehow, we should be good. My Siberian kitty is extremely intelligent and has tried to put her paw where the food is dispensed to get more, but so far she hasn\'t been successful.Cons:1. There are no stainless dish inserts for sale separately.Overall we are very pleased with these! title: Raised Slow Feeder Cat Bowl, Fish Pool Design Elevated Slow Feeder Dog Bowls, Fun Interactive Bloat Stop Cat Slow Feeder Dry Food, Reduces Neck Burden Slow Down Eating Anti Vomiting Non-Slip No Spill
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works as advertised~ great results ~ very happy', 'author': 'Sunrise Circle', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect Solution for the scarf and barf problem my older and very overweight cat has started to do ever since I put her on a diet.This slow feeder bowl Works really well; to slow down the eating. Making her work for it and Filling her faster too~ It didnâ€™t take her long to get used to it either; only a couple of days or so.The bowl is a great size too~ The Food no longer spills over the sides making clean up minimal now..Weâ€™ve been using it about a month, sheâ€™s losing weight and sheâ€™s much healthier.The bowl is high-quality~ made of a thick, durable plastic that does just fine in the dishwasher.Iâ€™m sure we will get A couple years of use out of it.It works just as advertised, a terrific Concept and I am very happy!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 11, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Nice!', 'author': 'KittyMac', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am always getting food puzzles, to keep my cats from overeating and give them some amusement. This is one of my favourites. One thing I like is that it is melamine instead of plastic, so there\'s less worry about that vile "amazon stink" clinging to it and germs growing in microscopic scratches (plastic is notoriously a cause of feline acne, which you do not want to get! Whatever material your slow feeders are, be sure to clean them regularly). Another thing I love is the elevation, as two of the cats are getting old and I prefer they not have to crouch down with their arthritic old spines and hips. Actually the baby is a puker so I think it is great for her too, to eat with her mouth somewhat level with her stomach rather than leaning down. Third great thing is that rim around the base. Sure a couple crunchies escape each day but compared to all our other puzzles, which scatter a couple dozen crunchies a day each, this is very tidy! Another very important plus is that the cats actually started to use it almost right away. Some of the more elaborate puzzles they never would use after months, or only a few of the cats would use it and it took weeks to get them to try. Also I like that it comes in some bland colours. Most slow feeders are made in such loud colours so they may spoil the look of your room. Last detail I love is that it\'s so petite. Some of them are so big it is a pain to wash them, they don\'t even fit in a standard sink.Downsides are nothing major. The bumps stick up higher than the edge of the food dish so you can\'t submerge them by filling it with boiling water to sanitize the dish. But oh well, I just pour the water over and it seems to get it clean enough (so far no acne). I think they may be a bit annoying to the cats because of how high they are. But that\'s kinda the point. If it was easy to eat out of it would be useless. I had thought shark fins would have been cute but now that I see it in action I realise it\'s necessary the bumps be rounded so nobody loses an eye LOL. Another downside is that the rubber feet fall off easily. I intend to glue them in someday soon before they end up missing or worse, eaten. Be sure to use a non stinky glue so you don\'t put the pet off their food. I like the feet in general though because after washing you can put it down before it is perfectly dry, without worry that there\'ll be water trapped beneath. The feet elevate it just a hair so there\'s a little airflow underneath. They also keep it from clattering if the pet bumps the dish while they eat. So overall I am glad it comes with those feet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works but watch you pups', 'author': 'Taylor Newsome', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Amazing product! I love using it and itâ€™s super easy. The only thing to watch out for is how easy it is for a pup to chew through it. I would suggest freezing it longer so itâ€™s harder for them to chew and break pieces off.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cat loves it', 'author': 'Lauren A.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Really slows down her eating. No more vomittong. And itâ€™s cute!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 26, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Doesnt slow down with wet food', 'author': 'Grant', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I bought this for my cat because he always just scarfs his food and then goes to eat his brother's. I should mention that he is on a wet food only diet so we do not use this for dry food. I've tried spreading the food out as much as possible, mashing it down inside so it's harder to reach... nothing slows him down. Maybe he's just an Olympic champion of eating but he scarfs his food just as fast with or without this bowl. The only difference really is he spends more time trying to get the very last little bits of food from the bottom which does give his brother a bit more time to finish his own food. But overall I havent seen any change to make this all that worth while. I do also worry every time I hear his teeth tapping against the plastic fish as he moves around it. Im probably going to stop using it because I see no difference and dont want to risk him chipping a tooth on one of the fish which a very hardI will say when I tried putting a couple treats in it he and his brother were utterly confused about how to get them out. It was kind of amusing to watch them both trying to figure it out, give up, then come back and try again. So maybe it would work better with dry food but I'd still worry about him hitting his teeth on the plastic fish constantly. Not really worth risking him potentially chipping or even breaking a tooth", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 2, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars AWESOME ENRICHMENT TOY!', 'author': 'Deborah Mihalko', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I had originally intended to purchase the Lickimat Wobble but there's a lot about natural rubber that turns me off. I KNOW that rubber breaks down into chemical components that are toxic and I definitely don't want that in my dog's food. This isn't the case with food-grade silicone. For that reason, I chose to get this product instead for the peace of mind and the durability that it offers.Here are some photos of our first test drive! (The test driver is a 63LB Standard Poodle) I used the back of a metal spoon to press my dog's late evening snack onto the treat bowl. In this example, there is goat cheese, canned sardine, Huntaway Frozen Raw Venison (thawed), Stella & Chewy's Super Beef, & homemade Oat, Chicken, & Applesauce Cookies. It took him about 10 minutes to lick this clean. It wobbles well but did not collapse or tip over.There was very little left in this when my dog was done - just a little goat cheese and a few sardine bits. It rinsed out easily by putting a bit of hot soapy water into it and swishing it about. I ran a soapy scrub sponge over it for good measure and rinsed it with hot water again before dropping it face down in the dish drainer to dry. I'll toss it in the dishwasher every few uses like I do his food and water dishes.I would definitely recommend this! The textured surface holds food well, it's durable, safe, and a great anxiety and boredom reliever - just remember to always supervise your pet while using as it is NOT chew proof.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Doesnâ€™t keep cat from scarfing and barfing?', 'author': 'Tiffany', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This was bought to try to keep my piggy cat from scarfing and barfingâ€¦. it didnâ€™t work. He can still manage to stuff himself.The feeder is kind of hard to clean and stuff tends to stick to it.Well made though, and I appreciate the concept. The fish are a cute touch.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Waste of money', 'author': 'Martha', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'Not as effective asI hoped', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 18, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not cat-friendly', 'author': 'Mary Smith', 'rating': 3, 'content': '(Pros cons listed below ramble.) More geared towards dogs than cats. The way this is designed doesn\'t make it very feline friendly. The bowl is raised too high for a proper eating position, and the layout makes it hard for a cat to utilize. Dogs wouldn\'t face the same issues as they have longer tongues.Have three cats of different ages and eating styles. Even the playful one who likes "treat mats" couldn\'t use this.CONS:- Bowl has weird texture that makes it very difficult to clean.- Height of bowl is bad for cat eating posture.- Depth of bowl combined with the height of the ridges makes it hard on a cat\'s whiskers. Trying to eat by mouth irritates whiskers.- Wet food is very difficult to clean out, and too hard for cats to reach.- Dry food residue also sticks, and is too hard for cats to reach.- Food fished out by paw is supposed to collect in the little "trough." Pieces bounce out.- Pieces in trough are hard to reach, as it smooshed whiskers to get at.- Was missing rubber foot in bottom, making bowl wobbly. Had to make our own foot for it.Pros- Nice looking design.- Sturdy, would handle a drop or being played with by dogs.- True to picture', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome results!', 'author': 'Amanda', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My cat used to throw up daily. I thought it was the food, so every couple of months I\'d gently introduce a new kibble and she\'d enjoy it but still throw up.My vet suggested a raised bowl that had a "puzzle" or "slowing" feature, just to see if maybe my cat was eating too fast.It\'s been a couple months since I\'ve bought this and it\'s been amazing! She went from throwing up daily, to not throwing up at all (when used *correctly).I have noticed that if I heap the bowl with food then she does eat faster and this can cause her to throw up overnight.*If the food isn\'t heaped, it\'s a non-issue. ðŸ˜', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 24, 2023', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Get this - in COMBINATION with another feeder - IF your cat is like mine', 'author': 'Michael-Paul Rieth', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Here\'s the deal. She\'s a former stray and tends to scarf down her food so fast that she then barfs it back up. I\'d been told a puzzle feeder was a good solution. So, maybe my cat is a genius, but it only took her a moment to figure out how the egg works. Now she gets all excited every time I pick up the egg because she knows what\'s coming.For my purposes, this thing seems sturdy and durable but I can see that there could possibly be issues with breakage in situations where a cat might be very rambunctious, such as if it was likely to get rolled down a flight of hardwood stairs or knocked off a table. It\'s made of a hard plastic that feels like it could be a bit brittle. But all that\'s happening is that it\'s rolling around on the floor, this egg seems durable enough. Filling it, "dialing" the hole sizes and cleaning it are all very easy.My only real complaint is not entirely the fault of the product. I wish there was a little more precision in controlling the size of the holes. It happens that the food I feed my cat is too big to exit the holes easily on one setting. My little instant gratification princess gets annoyed and walks away if she\'s not rewarded pretty quickly. She left it sitting with treats for 2 full days because she was not going to give it the satisfaction of rolling it a million times to get out one piece of goodness. But if I adjust the hole size by just one click, the hole is so large that a bunch of pieces fall out all at once and the egg is empty within seconds, thereby defeating the whole "slow down the eating" thing I was trying to accomplish. (I\'m going to see if I can cover 1 or 2 of the too-big holes with tape to see if that will prevent the food from being dumped so quickly.)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars No more broken or dirty toys!', 'author': 'J', 'rating': 5, 'content': "We ordered this toy because the toy that came with our treats was lost for a few days. It took a day or so for my older cat to show interest. But leaving her a trail of treats up to this 'egg-cersizer' got her interest. She eats what she wants and then leaves it half full for another treat after another nap. It is so easy to fill, and even easier to clean. Right into to top shelf of the dishwasher. Now she comes every morning to request her 'egg-cersizer'. My kids love watching her play. Great product. Will buy again for other cat.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Not that great', 'author': 'Curtis Crismon', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Its a neat idea but my cats don't care for it because the treats/food are simply very hard to get out, or too easy. The notches for the difficulty levels go from barely open, to wide open. Me nor my cats are able to get food to come out of the bottom (highest difficulty supposedly).", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars This is a great tool!', 'author': 'MissCutiePatootie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have 2 cats. One is a glutton and the other is a puker.The glutton got really overweight and was unable to clean herself properly. I had to give her bathes to help her. The person I live with would feed her every time she meowed at them begging for food even though she was not starved and it was terrible for her. Before this I tried using a scheduled portion controlled automatic feeder for my cats to get them to stop begging people and told people to not feed them at all anymore. Sadly people continued feeding them so it really did not work out and that was a lot of money down the drain for me. Very frustrating!The puker would eat too fast and later throw up some food. Not often but it happened more than I want it to because I don't want it to happen AT ALL.As a result of this toy...My glutton has lost enough weight in one months time to be able to clean herself. Yay! She must have lost 1lb at least!? I didn't weigh her so I don't know but you can visibly see it regardless. I did supplement this with playing with her more as well so probably not all credit goes to the toy but it has definitely LARGELY contributed.My puker no longer throws up! Double yay!Some people just simply do not understand how this toy works so if you're considering it, please don't be discouraged by the people who think it doesn't work. Let me just clarify something... If you twist the settings at the top so that each hole is less than about a quarter inch open.... Your cat will have to work for it. The food does not just fall out. However, if you completely open one hole on the thing then obviously food is just going to fall out... It shouldn't be hard to figure out but for some, it is. My cat gets at most 3-4 kibbles to drop out of it in a single bat. That's being generous. Normally it's just 1-2. The kibble I feed my cats are very small as well. So they really have to keep batting the toy to get a full meal which is better than just scarfing it down out of a bowl which is effortless and requires no energy at all and contributes to eating too fast and/or gaining weight. And because it takes time for them to get a meals worth, they eat slower which is healthier for a puker. Because it requires work, THEY STOP either because it's empty or because they are no longer hungry enough to keep playing with it! This is good. Especially for a beggar. They can simply come back to the toy later when they're hungry enough to play with it again and work their food out. My cat took some time to get used to the new system but now she doesn't beg me for food unless the toy is empty so it really does help throughout the day if she isn't pestering me or people I live with for food because she ate it all at once. It's also very very easy to wash and clean! I don't think I'd trust it in the dishwasher even on the top rack... I'd suggest giving it a good scrub with soap and water by hand and letting it air dry.Literally the only con to this toy... I should have gotten 2. That way I only have to fill each one up once a day and each cat would have their own. My cats did develop some behavioral issues towards each other because they were forced to share. My puker is part feral and has always had attitude. She has attacked my glutton in frustration. Nothing damaging but enough to get the point across that she doesn't want to share lol. But I just ordered a second one so that issue will be mended soon.I highly suggest this toy for overweight cats! It's SO good!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 17, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars From rejecting to accepting to final disappointment', 'author': 'Ava', 'rating': 1, 'content': "1 star, because my cat hates the shaking noise of the dry treats in it.It will not touch it nor come near that toy, even if peace fals out my cat will not eat thinking it is dangerous to eat such noisy food. I am disappointed. Cats are very spooky animals, they investigate danger and once they determine danger, they will not approach again something that spooks them.Update after 6 months, from 1 to 4 stars. Now my kitten is 8 months and the noise does not bother him any more. I need to keep him from overeating and occupied, so I am glad I kept that dispenser, because now it actually works, I am not sure if my cat likes it, but it serves the purpose. At first he made big mess all over my floor and he rolled that dispenser into corner or under furniture being unable to eat. So I had to put that dispenser into flat pot, in order to keep it from rolling and spreading food all over the floors, - and it works.4 stars, because it is very messy, they should considered mess control in designing that and all the other dispensers. I have other useless dispensers, that are also huge mess making, and can't put the other in pot like this one. So out of all the other food dispensers, this is the best option for me.UPDATE:After using that dispenser for half a year my cat did not loose any weight. He was just eating longer and slower and would cry if The dispenser was empty. He was constantly hungry. So the dispenser did not help my cat loose any weight", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 24, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Kittens love it and it fits the perfect amount of food!!', 'author': 'Amanda Bond', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I've tried a few different types of these products and this is the best so far. It fits a perfect amount of food. It's big enough that it doesn't get stuck in hard to reach places but small enough that they love to bat it around my apartment. There are adjustable settings that allow you to control how much food to be released at once. It's easy to twist open and closed. It is sturdy enough to survive kittens swatting it around all day without breaking or busting open. I highly recommend this product!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Too big and a lot of flat surface', 'author': 'Ryan', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'The egg is made of a thin plastic and is constructed ok. The main issue is that the egg is huge and our cats have a difficult time getting it to roll. Additionally, the bottom of the egg is flat, so the cats just knock it over and the egg just lays on the side it fell over on. The cats basically just keep nudging it from that position for the food to fall out.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Love it, but hard to screw/unscrew + hard to clean', 'author': 'heraflan', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Love this thing. 2 points of improvement:- The â€œdifficulty chooserâ€ mechanism at the top gets water stuck in it whenever I wash it, so I have to rinse it very well and wait for it to dry completely for a few hours before I can use it again. Maybe the egg should come apart in 3 pieces instead for easy cleaning. Or maybe just make a food safe/bpa free/dishwasher safe one.- Difficult to screw on/off. It doesnâ€™t latch easily and I have to twist 3 times for it to fully seal. Catâ€™s not going to figure out how to unscrew it so Iâ€™m not sure why it has to be this thoroughly sealed...Otherwise great!! Remember to slowly introduce your cat to it so they have a good experience. :)', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A little exercise at mealtime', 'author': "the cat's meow", 'rating': 4, 'content': 'My cats enjoy batting this around at meal time. title: Automatic Cat Feeders with Camera - 5G WiFi App Control 1080 HD Video with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio 16cup/136oz Cat Food Dispenser Easy to Use and Clean, Timed Pet Feeder Also for Dogs
reviews: [{'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A bit tricky to set up, but works well', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This feeder is not perfect, but it\'s nicer than the others that I\'ve tried.Pros:It holds a good amount of foodIt seals well and has a desiccant holder so the food stays fresher longerOnce set up, it is easy to useCamera so you can see your kitty, and even talk to them (though it freaked my cat out when I tried it)A low, wide bowl which should avoid whisker fatigueConsRequires a special stand-alone app to useTricky to get set up (see below)I have already accidentally detached the tank while it was full, which just spills the food everywhereLid can be difficult to remove (broke a fingernail on it tonight)A "portion" is a very small amount, you\'ll need 10+ to fill the bowl.Battery backup is four C batteries, and it doesn\'t seem to workSetup troubles: It took me FOREVER to get this setup for wifi. The instructions are simple enough, but it just wouldn\'t connect. The troubleshooting kept saying to move it near the router if you had trouble, but I had 5 strong bars of wifi on my phone where it was. I eventually DID move it to the bedroom where the router is to try it again, and it DID work there. I was able to get it setup and then move it back to where it goes. The battery backup doesn\'t seem to work. It shuts down as soon as I unplug it, even with batteries in it. I have not tested the batteries, but they were unused batteries.It may seem like I\'m giving more negatives than positives, but I\'m still giving it 4 stars because it works for i\'s primary purpose, most of the additional features (camera, microphone, speaker) all work as advertised and are more useful than I thought, and it actually looks like it will keep the food fresh unlike the others I\'ve tried. That last one is huge because my cats get to the point they won\'t eat the food when It\'s getting near the end of the supply (and thus has sat a while). I\'m still tweaking getting the right amounts for the feedings, but so far I like it a lot.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Keeping Pets Fed and Monitored with Yuposl Automatic Cat Feeders', 'author': 'Dale Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This innovative cat feeder has been a game-changer in my household, especially when I need to be away for long hours. With its 5G WiFi app control and 1080 HD video with night vision, I can easily monitor my two cats and ensure they are well-fed and cared for, even when I'm not at home.One of the standout features of this feeder is its user-friendly design. Setting it up and using the app is incredibly easy, allowing me to schedule feedings and adjust portion sizes with just a few taps on my phone. The intuitive interface makes it a breeze to keep track of my pets' feeding schedule and ensure they receive the right amount of food every time.Cleaning the feeder is also a simple task, thanks to its easy-to-disassemble design. I appreciate how hassle-free it is to maintain, ensuring that my pets always have access to clean and fresh food.The portion size is just right for my cats, providing them with enough food to keep them satisfied throughout the day. I can rest assured knowing that they are getting the nutrition they need, even when I'm not around.In conclusion, the Yuposl Automatic Cat Feeder with Camera has exceeded my expectations with its ease of use, reliability, and functionality. It's a must-have for any pet owner who wants to keep their furry friends fed and monitored, even when life gets busy. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a convenient solution to pet feeding and monitoring.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 14, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Smart pet feeder: HD camera, 2-way audio, minor assembly issue.', 'author': 'Chi Ly', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This automatic cat feeder from Yuposl offers a convenient solution for pet owners, with its 1080P HD camera providing a clear view of your pet's mealtimes, even in low light conditions thanks to infrared night vision. The two-way audio feature allows for personalized meal calls, enhancing interaction with your pet while you're away. However, one minor assembly issue was noted during setup, requiring a bit of troubleshooting to ensure smooth operation. Despite this, the smart app control and easy WiFi connection make programming and monitoring feeding schedules a breeze, with notifications alerting you to any issues such as low food or battery levels, ensuring your pet's needs are always met. With efficient food preservation features, including insulation from air and desiccant to keep food fresh, this feeder provides both convenience and peace of mind, earning it a commendable 4 out of 5 stars.Yuposl's automatic cat feeder is a reliable choice for pet owners seeking to monitor and regulate their pet's feeding habits remotely. With its intuitive app control and multi-user accessibility, scheduling up to 15 meals per day with customizable serving sizes is effortless. While encountering a minor assembly issue during setup, the feeder's notifications system ensures timely alerts for any operational concerns, allowing for prompt resolution. Moreover, the feeder's efficient food preservation mechanisms maintain the freshness of your pet's food, further enhancing its value. Overall, despite the minor hiccup, its comprehensive features and reliable performance make it a worthwhile investment for pet owners, deserving of a solid 4 out of 5 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 17, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Solved nighttime wake ups', 'author': 'Lyra S.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "My cats eat multiple small meals a day. At night, even if I fed them later in the evening, one of them would wake me up at like 4 am. This feeder was a game changer. I placed a feeding mat below instead of bowl, so both cats could come and kind of scavenge. It gives them something to do and now they don't bother me at all anymore. The bowl is metal and scared them when food dispensed, so the mat is much more sound friendly. I had my husband set it up, but it seemed pretty straightforward. I can also feed them if I'm gone longer in the day than anticipated. The camera quality is better than I expected as well. Now I can also check in on the cats while I'm out. Really pleased with all the features! Definitely recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 7, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars No Privacy Setting', 'author': 'sprinklefriend', 'rating': 2, 'content': "In terms of dispensing food as scheduled, this is a good feeder. If I had known that I would never have even considered this feeder because I do not want something that offers a window into everything I say & do in the privacy of my own home. The app is NOT specific to this brand and when you click to use the privacy option, it says to give the manufacturer your feedback and express you'd like them to offer that feature in the future.Extremely disappointed and could not recommend at all. The only reason it's got two stars is that it does do the job it is designed to do - it feeds your cat. However, others can do the same while also offering privacy.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars A great feeder, but some setup issues', 'author': 'Jeff66', 'rating': 3, 'content': "We have used simple gravity fed pet feeders in the past when we were out of town. This seemed like a great upgrade so we could check on our pet and monitor the food in the bowl.Assembly was easy. I initially installed the D-cell NiCad batteries that I use in flashlights and high-drain toys, but it would not power up. So I tried the NiMH AA cells we use for just about everything else in D size adapters. It powered up briefly, but quickly shut down. I suspected the voltage was too low from either type of rechargeable batteries, so I tried AA alkaline cells in the D adapters. Still no go, so Iâ€™ll have to pick up some real D cells. But since we rarely have a power outage, and even then it only lasts an hour or so, we probably donâ€™t need battery backup anyway.I downloaded the Android app, and went through the registration process. Continuing to set up the unit, the step accepting the terms gave me a problem. After reading through some of that, Iâ€™m not sure I'm comfortable about giving this access to my router. But nothing I did accepting the terms would allow me to proceed. After a whole bunch of back and forth scanning through the documents, finally the green button lit up. Then after multiple attempts it was not able to establish the router connection.I packed it up and was just about to ask Amazon for a return authorization when I wondered about denying it my location. So I went through the process again with location enabled and the endless loop trying get past accepting the terms. This time it immediately linked up to the router. So apparently it needs to know where I am. I donâ€™t understand why that is necessary for a pet feeder.The camera feature is nice, and can be tilted down to monitor food in the bowl or up to watch for a nearby pet. Since resolution is not terribly important, it would be better if it was wider angle to do both at the same setting. With the feed button on the Android app, this will certainly be a handy feeder when we are away. But I donâ€™t know if I want to leave it tethered to my router when we are home due to the potential privacy implications. That, sensitivity to batteries, and the problem getting past the screen acknowledging terms caused it to lose two stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 2, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A pain to get set up, but works well once you get it set up!', 'author': 'Patrick Garon', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Although it was a pain to get set up, it does work well once it is setup. The portion size by default is way to small, it should be at least a cup in my opinion, but it seems to be a quarter cup. Nighttime is the best use for this because we have a nighttime snacker that always wakes us up to eat, so now all we need to do is either A. set it up for a particular time, or B. we don't have to get out of bed and can just open the app and dispense a feeding!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 15, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars I'm impressed!", 'author': 'Lisa Putman', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded.
