I took a few days then tried it again in another room and it connected easily.I love that you can check in at any time via app, you can schedule feedings or do an automatic feed and a really nice feature that I haven\'t seen elsewhere is the fact that you can "rotate" the camera. Just up or down. The camera has 3 different views. Straight ahead, down towards the bowl, and a view of the actual bowl. This feature isn\'t on the app but you do it manually by clicking it.The app allows you to switch between night and day vision as well so you go from black and white to color.Another great feature, to me, is the security of the locked lid. You have to squeeze to lock and unlock. If there\'s a tip over there won\'t be spillage.With all that being said my only con about this is within the app. I have a folder on my android of my security apps and I\'d like to include this app, but for some reason I can\'t drag it into the folder. title: PETKIT Automatic Pet Feeder with Camera, 1080P HD Video with Night Vision, 2.4G WiFi Cat Dog Feeder with 2-Way Audio,Smart App Control Pet Dry Food Dispenser for Cats and Dogs with Non-Stick Food Bowl.
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Honestly? I'm Shocked How Good It Is!", 'author': 'Ryan A. Leemhuis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A little background first. We had previously used the Crown Majestic feeder for our cat. It worked fairly well although it was a bit ugly, would occasionally jam and the portion sizes were very hit and miss. We used it until its power connection internally broke and it would only run off batteries which was difficult to keep up with.So that led me on my search for a replacement. There are a lot more options now than there used to be. My main features I was looking for were wifi control and reliability.I found it difficult to narrow down my choice as I found varying reviews and some claimed that a model was terrible and some said it was amazing. I eventually settled on the Petkit mini feeder from a cost and design perspective. First of all, it looks great. I love the thought that went into the design from the magnetically attached bowl to the jumper that allows the DC adapter to easily disconnect from the wall should you need. I was a little nervous about how much food could be stored but upon seeing the compartment this is a good amount for a cat. I find we need to fill it once every 2 weeks or so.That brings us to the worst part of the product. Lets just be clear here...the app is decent...but there are some language oddities and the setup did not go according to design. I am a techy and I initially tried pairing the feeder with my phone. It got fairly far into the setup but kept failing out during the wifi pairing process. I then tried my wife\'s phone and it did the same. I then happened to notice that the feeder was already showing on the app\'s dashboard and sure enough it had been paired even though the app claimed it had failed. I don\'t know why this occurred but be prepared for some setup issues.Once setup, however, the app is great. The food portion sizes are accurate and on demand feeds occur nearly immediately. The schedule is easy to setup and food is distributed on time. We use prescription "disc-shaped" food and other feeders claimed they weren\'t compatible. We have had ZERO issues with this machine getting jammed or having any issue with our food. It is actually very fun to watch the little door open on the machine and then the food dump out.For the cost, this feeder is a steal. It is so much better than our previous feeder it makes me wonder why I didn\'t upgrade earlier. My only suggestions for improvement would be to further improve the app and instructions translations. There are some real English oddities (which you can see in the product\'s amazon page as well. In addition, the setup process obviously needs some improvement too as it failed twice for me and some how magically appeared on my apps dashboard after this fail. Other than that, the feeder is perfect. It feels very high quality and the mechanics seem sound. HIGHLY recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PetKit Mini - Small Pet Feeder - Review', 'author': 'AirplaneCatBlue', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The PetKit Mini feeder is attractively and elegantly designed. It looks like it belongs in an art museum.The PetKit Mini feeder is the ideal automatic feeder for my needs. What I like best is that it precisely delivers very small meals (as little as 1/20 of a cup or 5 grams) to my overweight cat up to 10 times per day. In my case I had been feeding my cat 20 grams of cat kibbles twice per day... or 40 grams. My cat was waking me up at 4 AM begging for more food. The PetKit Mini stopped the begging behavior! With the PetKit Mini I was able to schedule 8 feedings of 5 grams each... for a total of 40 grams per day... but spread out over the course of the day and night. This way my cat gets precisely fed her reduced ration and eliminates my tendency to give her a little extra when she begs.The PetKit Mini has improved my cat's relationship with me. She no longer relies on me for food. With the PetKit Mini she visits me often and regularly because she wants my company... not because she wants food. And it has improved my relationship with my cat since I am no longer irritated by her pestering behaviors at 4 AM when she gets hungry.The engineers who designed the PetKit Mini payed very close attention to critical details that separate this feeder from the pack. I studied them all before I made my purchase decision. The silicone rubber paddles that meter the kibbles into the rotary dosing cups are designed to flex so the kibbles donâ€™t jam in the mechanism.The engineers used silicone rubber gaskets to seal out moisture at the feeding door and food reservoir lid. Then they provide a replaceable desiccant pack (those little packs that you often find in a box of new shoes) that absorb any moisture that might otherwise accumulate in your dried food. You can imagine that if your kibbles absorbed moisture from the air and swelled up like a sponge that they wouldnâ€™t feed well in the mechanism. It also keeps the food fresher and prevents mold growth I would think.I found the PetKit Mini was easy to set up. It did help that I had an $8 electronic scale so I could better measure in grams how much I had been feeding my cat. I had been using a very small measuring cup. It was a lot easier to weigh the kibbles than to try to measure the volume of food.I measured the amount of food the PetKit Mini delivered with each feeding. I did this 8 times just to see how repeatable the feedings were. With my dry kibbles the average amount of each feeding was 4.97 grams. Pretty good if you were targeting 5 grams! (The standard deviation was 0.31 gramsâ€¦ who remembers what a standard deviation is???)Since I am only feeding my cat 40 grams per day the food reservoir is large enough for storing a 37 day supply. I can just check the food level once per month to be safeâ€¦ but the PetKit Mini is designed with a monitor that will alert me when the food is low. What a great feature! It will also remind me every 30 days to replace the desiccant pack. I found some after-market desiccant packs on EBay that will fit the PetKit Mini because I couldnâ€™t find any OEM packs online.This is a great automatic WiFI cat feeder! I liked it so much I bought a second PetKit Mini for my daughter for Christmas. She too has an overweight cat (though not for long). She loves the PekKit Mini too!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Life Saving!', 'author': 'Maureen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. I bought this for my dog, she was recently diagnosed with an insulinoma, which is an insulin producing tumor in her pancreas. She needs to be fed small amounts every two hours to save her life that wouldâ€™ve been impossible without this feeder. I set it up to feed every two hours overnight, you can program your voice, so it whistles for her, and she comes and eats. I purchased a second one to take care of her needs during the day. The camera shows before and after and alerts when she has appeared to eat. The camera function also records to insure she gets the food she needs. Iâ€™m also able to feed her extra snacks if needed. This feeder as made it simple to insure quality of life while she battles cancer. Thank you PETKIT for making my dogs medical needs a real possibility!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Basic features work well, unnecessarily complex app makes setup a pain', 'author': 'Jessica', 'rating': 4, 'content': "I think my title basically says it all, but I'm not really a brief person so here goes...On the whole, I'm very pleased with the quality of the build of this product, and the ease of filling and cleaning, which are really paramount concerns for something like this. Unboxing and putting everything together is easy, and so far the feeder has been reliable. That said, I think the app is a lot more complex than it needs to be, and while that can be updated and changed over time, it's important to know what you're getting into.When you go through setup of the feeder and app for the first time, I think the experience is a bit all over the place. There are instruction stickers on the feeder itself, there is a booklet of instructions, there are QR codes and links within the booklet to scan to get to videos that you have to watch for further steps, and then there's setup within the app itself... etc. I think it's just a few too many layers of info and could be pared down significantly. Once everything is setup and you're trying to actually use the app, those same issues of unnecessary layers/ complications continue. The app tries to get you to schedule meals based on feeding recommendations for your pet, so you have to setup a profile for each of your pets first. This sounds minor, but it's quite detailed, and includes a whole lot of information that isn't truly necessary just to make a recommendation for feeding quantity. In the end, a truly informed recommendation would really require nutrition information about your pet food itself, so the whole exercise is a bit silly. I was left feeling a bit unsure of how much of this information I *really* needed or wanted to complete. Once you have been asked about various details for your pet, then you need to schedule fixed meals for each, and again I do appreciate that they tried to include a lot of options for customization, but it's just too much. For one, how do they propose that you make sure the right pet eats the right meal, etc? I think it would be much easier to remove those options, or hide them behind an advanced mode, and just let you set a very simple schedule with set times and quantities. K.I.S.S. you know? Given that the app doesn't interface with bluetooth trackers or smart catboxes or anything like that, I'm not sure I see any need for the pet profiles at all! It just adds complexity for no discernible reason.Beyond the actual cumbersome data entry requirements, I found the interface to be not very intuitive. I had difficulty finding the settings that I actually wanted to look for and find out more about, such as the Alexa integration, and kept getting lost in layers of social media integrations and gamification... which, why? I was looking into trying out the Smart Home integration options, but do I need a community and messaging platform for my smart feeder? Maybe this is more of a cultural thing, I believe the company is based in China, but I just don't need this kind of fluff cluttering up the basic functions of the app. I'd really enjoy it more if they could pull back on these added features, or again, maybe just hide them all in one area of the app called 'Social' or similar, but they seemed to be behind every corner. For me, again it just took away from the experience of feeling like I could find the basic information and functions quickly and easily. Thankfully, apps can be can be improved and refined over time, so I feel that most of those concerns are somewhat secondary. If you plan to use it in a way where you can sit down and get through it, then basically 'set it and forget it', I think it will work well for you. But if you would plan to regularly make any tweaks to your meal plans, I think it would be a not-minor annoyance. I'll also mention that this is something my partner and I considered setting up for aging parents, just as a little convenience item to make their lives easier. After working with it, I don't know if I can comfortably go that direction. I definitely don't feel confident that they would have gotten through any of the initial setup themselves, but I also don't think they could make any on-the-fly changes to the configuration even if the initial steps were done for them. My advice to the developers would be: pare down to the basics and make sure they are quick and intuitive. THEN add extras, but remember they are extras and not your primary functions.Ok, so it seems like I'm coming down kind of harsh. All that said, I do think this product will work just fine for use in my own home. The feeder itself is sturdy and has so far been reliable. While I don't have direct experience with a lot of competing products, I had been taking note of some other design issues I'd noted in some of those competitors and waited to try something that seemed to address them. For one, I don't just appreciate the option for plug-in power and battery backup, for me that's an absolute requirement on something like this. The food storage compartment also seems secure, which was a concern I had because I have one cat that will get into ANYTHING edible that is left out. I'm impressed because he hasn't even tried with this, which also tells me the seals are probably decent and he's not being tempted by the smell of kibble. That also leads me to believe that bugs shouldn't be an issue, though time will tell. I also appreciate that the actual food bowl portion is easily removable, as it just snaps into place with a magnet. Being plastic based, it's important to clean something like that regularly and you and I both know that won't happen if it's a pain point. Ideally, I would really like to see this component and the food storage bin being made out of stainless steel, but maybe that's something that could be incorporated in a future revision as well.Let's wrap this up...On the whole, if you are patient and technologically competent enough to get through the configuration of the app itself, it's a good product that I think you'll be happy with.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The PetKit app is nearly useless for this feeder! Portion size is randomly variable....', 'author': 'D', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The PETKIT app is poorly implemented and largely non-functional. I bought this Petkit Automatic Cat Feeder because it promised being able to identify my two cats and calculate their food requirements based on weight and metabolic needs. Using this info I wanted to program daily feedings customized for each cat. This product is another example of decent hardware with poor software implementation. Unfortunately, Petkit and Amazon failed to disclose that the app isn't ready for the hardware. I consider this failure to be a bait and switch scam and I'd return it but I already tossed the package because the delivery person left it in the rain without a plastic wrap for protection.Linking the app and feeder was easy. Connecting to my home router/wifi was easy. It even ran an automatic software upgrade so I know I have the latest, greatest app software. So far so good.Next task is to program my two cats into the Feeding Calculator. Entering the name is easy. Enter the weight? The app reverts to a default weight of 6.8 pounds every time. So it fails to update the cats's weights. FAIL! There isn't any obvious way to edit the cat information either. So another FAIL! Interesting is that I have the PetKit Puramax automatic litter box with my cats' weights entered correctly. The feeder links to the info but changes the weights without any input from me. Another FAIL?Next it asks me to enter their cat food. I feed Purina Indoor Cat Food, a very common dry cat food pellet available in any American grocery store. Instead of a simple-to-use barcode reader that searches online and enters the food analysis for me, I have to enter the analysis manually. Okay, needlessly complicated but okay.The app lets me program the feeding schedule but I'm unable to vary the portion size. I ran a few trials and the portion size isn't consistent. That's a definite FAIL!!I have two PetKit water dispensors that work very well. The Petkit Pure Max Litter box works well. I really want the food dispenser to work just as well but for now the software is a FAIL!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars accurate, precise, feeder. Requires 2.5GHz wifi, doesn't work on 5GHz", 'author': 'Yung Fang Smith', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This review is for the PETKIT fresh element mini.It will not work on a 5GHz wifi, it has to be on 2.5GHz. The setup is really strange. First you have to connect your phone to your 2.5GHz wifi, then you connect your phone to this thing\'s "wifi", and somehow it uses that to get this thing connected to the 2.5GHz wifi that your phone was connected to. After you get it setup though, you have to contend with the really UN-intuitive software. Once you have overcome both of those headaches, the feeder works really well. I almost took off 1 star for the pain in the *** setup and user interface, bit in spite of the those annoyances, I like this feeder so much that I decided to give it the full 5. I\'m so happy that it can dispense portions in increments as small as 1/20th of a cup. I use this feeder to give my cat a small snack in between her normal meals, so that tiny portion size is greatly appreciated. It\'s so nice to be able to adjust the feeding from my phone. We used to go out to eat and hang out with friends until late at night all the time and we always worried about making our cat wait for dinner until we got home, but now (once we can finally go out again) we can just use our phone to give our cat some dinner as soon as we realize we won\'t be getting home until late.Another thing I like about this feeder is that the build quality is really nice. The food tray attaches magnetically so is easy to take off, clean, and re-attach. The food sits inside an inner basket within the feeder, so it keeps all the food crumbs contained. All the parts fit together very precisely so it feels sturdy and looks really nice. The door over the food chute is controlled by a little robotic arm, so my cat can\'t just push her paw up in there to steal more food.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 7, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfectï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼', 'author': 'yufei s.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This isn't the first time I've bought an automatic feeder. I used to use a different brand of automatic feeder, unfortunately, it did not workï¼ That feeder did not accurately control the amount of food each time, sometimes a lot and sometimes a little, and there was a blockage - the feeder did not give my cat any food for a whole day, so my poor cat kept barking after I came home.So I was very disappointed with the automatic feeder, but my friend recommended this brand to me, which is what her family is using. It works very well! The previous bad situation did not happen. And I love its camera and interactive features. I can watch my cat's every move when I'm at school. I can even stop my cat from scratching the couch with this automatic feeder! AWESOMEï¼ï¼ï¼My cat, a nine-pound German curly, has always had a good appetite, and usually three times a week I cook her a chicken breast or something next to the automatic feeder, so I don't need to add any more food to the automatic feeder for half a month (or longer, I'm not sure). I don't have much to say about the video recording function, because it is so sensitive, it captures a lot of cat activity moments, and I only occasionally turn on a few to see.In briefï¼Œ Recommendï¼ï¼ï¼", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Not Smart at All', 'author': 'Shmoo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I wanted to like this and originally did but now after using it for over a year it fails to connect to my WiFi. I know I\'m not doing something wrong on my end as I have a good 16+ other smart devices that I\'ve connected just fine. Along with working in IT and having custom router settings. So I like to think I know what I\'m doing.However, this POS refuses to connect and keeps coming up with "Network Error" everytime I follow the instructions and manually try to add the device (automatic simply doesn\'t work or show any devices). It\'s almost as if its trying to connect to the Petkit network and they have monkeys running they system (or company as a whole).Do not waste your money on this as I will never be purchasing anything PetKit ever again. Simply put they do not work and I can see a lawsuit coming as they sell faulty products.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 23, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Cat proof', 'author': 'John Ruple', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I was looking for a feeder that could withstand my crafty food motivated female cat. I previously owned a wopet feeder that ending up being too top heavy and my cat could knock it over or using her paw to turn the impeller that dispensed food. The wopet feeder even had a manual feed button on the front that my cat would headbutt to vend food.. whyyyy?! I'm pleased to report that this feeder has none of those problems. It's a stockier feeder so it's hard to knock over. It's feed buttons are on the side and requires you to hold them to dispense food manually. Also the cat can't reach a impeller to vend food. It even has a dessicant (oxygen absorber) you can add to keep food fresh in the feeder. I ended up buying some replacements that you can heat up to reuse as a cost saving measure. This pet kit feeder includes a HD camera and a speaker and microphone if you want to talk to your cats or set recorded messages during feeding times. You can set detailed feeding times and has an easy way to stop a feeding in case you want to feed them wet food. The app can be somewhat buggy at times but never for more than a minute since it fixes itself. It will bother you about signing up for the petkit+ service to see video recordings and make vlogs to music of their activities in front of the camera. This feature is not necessary to tap into the camera and see them however. At just over 100 dollars this feeder was a good purchase. I would highly recommend it over the other options listed on Amazon.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Overall good product.', 'author': 'Cheri Gravett', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Because Iâ€™m and out of the house all the time, I needed a feeder that I could program to feed my pug and precisely measured dinner. Yes, I weigh my dogâ€™s food when I feed her manually because well - pugs! They overeat and are not satisfied so how else to make sure Iâ€™m feeding her enough but not overfeeding her. This product was not as accurate as I would like but over several feedings, things seem to even out. As an extra precaution, I give an extra feeding mid-day using the feeder. Is it perfect? No. But Iâ€™ve been using it for several weeks, occasionally measuring the output, and it feel it is close enough. I also like the built-in camera so I can see the food going into the bowl. I would love for it to be more precise, but itâ€™s the best product I have tried so far.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

I was looking into trying out the Smart Home integration options, but do I need a community and messaging platform for my smart feeder? Maybe this is more of a cultural thing, I believe the company is based in China, but I just don't need this kind of fluff cluttering up the basic functions of the app. I'd really enjoy it more if they could pull back on these added features, or again, maybe just hide them all in one area of the app called 'Social' or similar, but they seemed to be behind every corner. For me, again it just took away from the experience of feeling like I could find the basic information and functions quickly and easily. Thankfully, apps can be can be improved and refined over time, so I feel that most of those concerns are somewhat secondary. If you plan to use it in a way where you can sit down and get through it, then basically 'set it and forget it', I think it will work well for you. But if you would plan to regularly make any tweaks to your meal plans, I think it would be a not-minor annoyance. I'll also mention that this is something my partner and I considered setting up for aging parents, just as a little convenience item to make their lives easier. After working with it, I don't know if I can comfortably go that direction. I definitely don't feel confident that they would have gotten through any of the initial setup themselves, but I also don't think they could make any on-the-fly changes to the configuration even if the initial steps were done for them. My advice to the developers would be: pare down to the basics and make sure they are quick and intuitive. THEN add extras, but remember they are extras and not your primary functions.Ok, so it seems like I'm coming down kind of harsh. All that said, I do think this product will work just fine for use in my own home. The feeder itself is sturdy and has so far been reliable. While I don't have direct experience with a lot of competing products, I had been taking note of some other design issues I'd noted in some of those competitors and waited to try something that seemed to address them. For one, I don't just appreciate the option for plug-in power and battery backup, for me that's an absolute requirement on something like this. The food storage compartment also seems secure, which was a concern I had because I have one cat that will get into ANYTHING edible that is left out. I'm impressed because he hasn't even tried with this, which also tells me the seals are probably decent and he's not being tempted by the smell of kibble. That also leads me to believe that bugs shouldn't be an issue, though time will tell. I also appreciate that the actual food bowl portion is easily removable, as it just snaps into place with a magnet. Being plastic based, it's important to clean something like that regularly and you and I both know that won't happen if it's a pain point. Ideally, I would really like to see this component and the food storage bin being made out of stainless steel, but maybe that's something that could be incorporated in a future revision as well.Let's wrap this up...On the whole, if you are patient and technologically competent enough to get through the configuration of the app itself, it's a good product that I think you'll be happy with.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The PetKit app is nearly useless for this feeder! Portion size is randomly variable....', 'author': 'D', 'rating': 1, 'content': "The PETKIT app is poorly implemented and largely non-functional. I bought this Petkit Automatic Cat Feeder because it promised being able to identify my two cats and calculate their food requirements based on weight and metabolic needs. Using this info I wanted to program daily feedings customized for each cat. This product is another example of decent hardware with poor software implementation. Unfortunately, Petkit and Amazon failed to disclose that the app isn't ready for the hardware. So it fails to update the cats's weights. FAIL! There isn't any obvious way to edit the cat information either. So another FAIL! Interesting is that I have the PetKit Puramax automatic litter box with my cats' weights entered correctly. The feeder links to the info but changes the weights without any input from me. Another FAIL?Next it asks me to enter their cat food. I feed Purina Indoor Cat Food, a very common dry cat food pellet available in any American grocery store. Instead of a simple-to-use barcode reader that searches online and enters the food analysis for me, I have to enter the analysis manually. That's a definite FAIL!!I have two PetKit water dispensors that work very well. The Petkit Pure Max Litter box works well. I really want the food dispenser to work just as well but for now the software is a FAIL!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars accurate, precise, feeder. title: Join Prime to buy this item at $59.99
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better Than Competitors', 'author': 'Matthew Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Without naming any names (cough cough rhymes with BetWibro), we had purchased a couple of their automatic feeders (not WiFi enabled), one for our first cat, then about a year and a half later we bought the second. Cue the third cat and we tried a different brand. That one kept time a little better, but we were still struggling with clocks that would never be synchronized and it was a chore to always update 3 feeders every few days just to ensure the cats were fed at their respective stations at the same time and no one had an opportunity to eat theirs and steal another's in the time it took for food to be dispensed.I had my eye on this, as it's WiFi enabled, and we already have the automatic litter box, so we were familiar with the brand. The app works great with virtually no delays in input - want to give them a little snack? Tap the snack button, select your serving size and it dispenses as soon as you make your choice.For the price and the features, it's a no brainer. Honestly one of my favorite Amazon purchases of all time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works as expected, so far (edit: mostly)', 'author': 'Christa N.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After reading the reviews, I think I was prepared for some kind of nightmare with this, but so far I\'ve been pleasantly suprised. So pretty good, still looks great, but not 100% reliable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sleek and modern design', 'author': 'Penny Lane', 'rating': 5, 'content': "â­â­â­â­â­The PETKIT Automatic WiFi Cat Feeder has been a lifesaver for me and my furry friend over the past year! Town', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for a colony of about a dozen feral cats (all but a couple TNR\'d) that live in the woods near my house. This feeder will only feed an APPROXIMATE amount of their dispensed portion (of 3/10 cup). Let that soak in for a minute. Give it a second. Ok Doc, great. I can do that.So, on your first meal, I hand you â€¦ oh, letâ€™s say maybe 2/3 cup, and on your second meal, I hand you letâ€™s say maybe 3/4, on your third meal, I hand you oh maybe 7/8th. Youâ€™re an adult, a senior even, so you â€œunderstandâ€ what youâ€™re allowed to have per meal and your rice is right there, in that square thing that makes a noise and gives you your rice but itâ€™s not giving you what youâ€™re allowed to have each meal. Would you be happy? Or full? or satisfied? Or always thinking about food and how to get it out of that thing. Because if itâ€™s edible (& sometimes even if itâ€™s not edible) youâ€™ll attempt to get it and eat it. Because all you do is EAT, SLEEP, POOP/PEE, PLAY & PURRTo finish, I would like to quote the review of another Amazon verified purchase user, Jessica (3 years ago! man I SHOULDâ€™VE dug deeper)â€œ Jessica4.0 out of 5 starsVerified PurchaseBasic features work well, unnecessarily complex app makes setup a painReviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020I think my title basically says it all, but I'm not really a brief person so here goes...On the whole, I'm very pleased with the quality of the build of this product, and the ease of filling and cleaning, which are really paramount concerns for something like this. Unboxing and putting everything together is easy, and so far the feeder has been reliable.That said, I think the app is a lot more complex than it needs to be, and while that can be updated and changed over time, it's important to know what you're getting into.When you go through setup of the feeder and app for the first time, I think the experience is a bit all over the place. There are instruction stickers on the feeder itself, there is a booklet of instructions, there are QR codes and links within the booklet to scan to get to videos that you have to watch for further steps, and then there's setup within the app itself... etc. I think it's just a few too many layers of info and could be pared down significantly. Once everything is setup and you're trying to actually use the app, those same issues of unnecessary layers/ complications continue. The app tries to get you to schedule meals based on feeding recommendations for your pet, so you have to setup a profile for each of your pets first. This sounds minor, but it's quite detailed, and includes a whole lot of information that isn't truly necessary just to make a recommendation for feeding quantity. In the end, a truly informed recommendation would really require nutrition information about your pet food itself, so the whole exercise is a bit silly. I was left feeling a bit unsure of how much of this information I *really* needed or wanted to complete. Once you have been asked about various details for your pet, then you need to schedule fixed meals for each, and again I do appreciate that they tried to include a lot of options for customization, but it's just too much. For one, how do they propose that you make sure the right pet eats the right meal, etc? I think it would be much easier to remove those options, or hide them behind an advanced mode, and just let you set a very simple schedule with set times and quantities. K.I.S.S. you know? Given that the app doesn't interface with bluetooth trackers or smart catboxes or anything like that, I'm not sure I see any need for the pet profiles at all! It just adds complexity for no discernible reason.Beyond the actual cumbersome data entry requirements, I found the interface to be not very intuitive. I had difficulty finding the settings that I actually wanted to look for and find out more about, such as the Alexa integration, and kept getting lost in layers of social media integrations and gamification... which, why? I was looking into trying out the Smart Home integration options, but do I need a community and messaging platform for my smart feeder? Maybe this is more of a cultural thing, I believe the company is based in China, but I just don't need this kind of fluff cluttering up the basic functions of the app. I'd really enjoy it more if they could pull back on these added features, or again, maybe just hide them all in one area of the app called 'Social' or similar, but they seemed to be behind every corner. For me, again it just took away from the experience of feeling like I could find the basic information and functions quickly and easily. Thankfully, apps can be can be improved and refined over time, so I feel that most of those concerns are somewhat secondary. If you plan to use it in a way where you can sit down and get through it, then basically 'set it and forget it', I think it will work well for you. But if you would plan to regularly make any tweaks to your meal plans, I think it would be a not-minor annoyance. I'll also mention that this is something my partner and I considered setting up for aging parents, just as a little convenience item to make their lives easier. After working with it, I don't know if I can comfortably go that direction. I definitely don't feel confident that they would have gotten through any of the initial setup themselves, but I also don't think they could make any on-the-fly changes to the configuration even if the initial steps were done for them. My advice to the developers would be: pare down to the basics and make sure they are quick and intuitive. THEN add extras, but remember they are extras and not your primary functions.Ok, so it seems like I'm coming down kind of harsh. All that said, I do think this product will work just fine for use in my own home. The feeder itself is sturdy and has so far been reliable. While I don't have direct experience with a lot of competing products, I had been taking note of some other design issues I'd noted in some of those competitors and waited to try something that seemed to address them. For one, I don't just appreciate the option for plug-in power and battery backup, for me that's an absolute requirement on something like this. The food storage compartment also seems secure, which was a concern I had because I have one cat that will get into ANYTHING edible that is left out. I'm impressed because he hasn't even tried with this, which also tells me the seals are probably decent and he's not being tempted by the smell of kibble. That also leads me to believe that bugs shouldn't be an issue, though time will tell. I also appreciate that the actual food bowl portion is easily removable, as it just snaps into place with a magnet. Being plastic based, it's important to clean something like that regularly and you and I both know that won't happen if it's a pain point. Ideally, I would really like to see this component and the food storage bin being made out of stainless steel, but maybe that's something that could be incorporated in a future revision as well.Let's wrap this up...On the whole, if you are patient and technologically competent enough to get through the configuration of the app itself, it's a good product that I think you'll be happy with.9 people found this helpfulâ€â€ â€¦â€", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Must use your cellphone.', 'author': 'Connie M. Bush', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Just got the feeder; recommended by the vet; not much information in manual, just how to put together. That wasn't difficult. Still having problems making changes to the feeding schedule. The cat now gets breakfast 2 times one at 5:30 am and one at 6:30 am. Couldn't figure out how to delete one of them. Feeding the cat 5 times a day, 1/10 of a cup at a time for a total of 1/2 cup a day. What the vet recommended (not necessarily 5 times). If cat eats 1/4 cup 2 times a day, he is back before supper time. This helps a lot. I ignore the cat and I am trying to each a cat that I will not feed him, he must wait for the feeder. Ask me in a couple of weeks.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for cat owners with a hungry dog!', 'author': 'Taylor Barnes', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My dog loves to eat out of our catâ€™s food. We have low window sills, so the only place we could find to put the catâ€™s food was up on our kitchen counter! Ugh! Gross! So finally I went searching for something and found this! We stuck this to our glass window and even removed and adjusted the height several times at first and it has remained super suctioned to our window. No spills or accidents! I also bought a window suction cup cat bed and my cat absolutely loves basking in the sun all day and being up and away from the dog. Plus, this keeps my cat off my kitchen counters!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic idea!', 'author': 'SMW', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These bowls are fantastic at keeping my pup out of the cat food! She canâ€™t reach them up on the windows. Wonderful solution!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 28, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works for parrots too!', 'author': 'Bob Courtwright', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'She likes to hang out on the door, so this worked well as a treat holder. More pics OscarEclectus on FB', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars THESE ARE SO GREAT & AN AWESOME IDEA! DEFINITELY ENCOURAGES CAT'S TO DRINK UP BEING SO CONVENIENT NOW! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!", 'author': 'John 3:16', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Love these! My cat drinks from hers a lot since she naps a lot in her window seat & this makes it right there handy & convenient w/out much effort! I highly recommend getting one for your cat. Cats in particular (esp. indoor cats) stay in a perpetual dehydrated state due to their natural wild design. In the wild, cats get their hydration & water intake from prey almost exclusively; so they don't have a thirst drive like dogs, humans & other animals. If you feed your cat dry food, your cat is really hurting for water even if they don't seem like it or act like. PLEASE switch to wet food! It is so much better for them & saves their kidneys & bladder from stones, extremely painful cystitis & a lot of suffering in life. Cats also don't show pain like dogs; so they are not going to tell you or show it. Anything that helps my cat remember to drink I'm all for & this item helps in that endeavor w/out a doubt. Again, cats need the reminder & constant access b/c they do not have a natural thirst drive at all! They stick great on the window & knock on wood have not had any issues, falls or it coming unattached. It's very sturdy, nice size bowl & holds water well. One note, if the bowl sits in window that gets direct sunlight, PLEASE check it for temp.& replace the water DAILY in case it gets too hot & the water gets a funny metallic taste from the heated up stainless steal. I have not used it w/food but would not hesitate to. I don't have any dogs that require the food be kept up high or food separated. I bought this from an online store the first time & they sold out. I was so happy to find it on Amazon & at a similar price, just a few dollars more. I might get a third one since my senior kitty needs all the help, reminding, convenience these provide to drink being where she frequents most & sleeps, lays, rests, bird watches at a window. GET YOUR KITTY ONE!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 26, 2017', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Will not stick to ALL non-porous surfaces as in description.', 'author': 'JP Floyd', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'The description states it will stick to all non-porous smooth surfaces. title: iPettie Hourglass Automatic Cat Food Dispenser, Wireless Cat Feeder Automatic Battery-Operated with 180-Day Battery Life, Voice Recording, Stainless Steel Bowl, Food-Grade BPA Free Tank, 3L/12 Cup
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Controls face the back yet mostly set and forget it.', 'author': 'Jack', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Ive had this feeder since October and it is now the end of December. I own 4 brands of pet feeders. They all work about the same. This one was cheap enough I bought one for my momâ€™s cat as well. I like the east clean stainless steel bowl that sits in the plastic bowl for easy cleaning, not all come with a steel bowl. I wish it had two for swapping. It has a compartment for back up batteries. I like the ability to feed through out the day at set times and amounts. This one is easy to clean between fills.Two things I donâ€™t like as much is the front clean look is great unless you want to use the settings. It faces the wall so I have to pick it up to get to the controls. If I want to give a manual feed, I now just open the top to get some out. My other feeder has a button that allows me to feed manually easily. My one piece of advice is to make sure you use proper sized pebbles, if they are too big they can get stuck and not fall properly. It can be funny to watch the cats come running to an empty drop though, they are use to hearing its dinner time now. I have them set in different rooms and they make the rounds looking for food, getting more exercise and less pre filled bowls which is what the vet recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 21, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Size', 'author': 'Linda Metcalf', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Was the right size my the room my cats are in.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 25, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Helpful, a few minor things are annoying.', 'author': 'Alex Denham', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I like the idea of this a lot. I sometimes stay over at a friends, donâ€™t get home until late, or decide to sleep in one morning when I have a day off from work, and my cats will whine and complain so much about it because the food in their bowl is stale or they just know itâ€™s not fresh and they HAVE to have fresh food.. this is helpful in those times and it helps keep the food fresh for them because it has the lid that covers the air vent at the top.The programming is relatively easy once you understand how it functions, but I definitely needed to read the instructions first or I would not have understood how to use the lock/unlock feature or what button to hold and for how long. Also, I would be aware that If you plan to use the power cord to an outlet then you will be fine, but the cordless feature requires 6 D batteries! Those are the giant round ones, and they are not cheap. So I would not recommend this if you plan to use it without plugging it in. But the batteries can also just function as a backup power supply in the event that you have a power outage, which I guess is a good idea to have, just in case, and that wouldnâ€™t run thru those expensive batteries very fast.The one thing I do find really strange and a bit annoying is the way you set the amount of food to dispense is through â€œportionsâ€, but one portion is like 6-10 individual pieces of foodâ€¦ it doesnâ€™t seem accurate that one portion is 1/8 of a cup like it says. To get the amount I need for 2 cats I had to set it for 6 portions twice a day which just seems a bit odd, but now that itâ€™s set it works and is a great help.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 9, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars On time feedings every day', 'author': 'Jessica D.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I recently acquired this wireless automatic pet feeder, and let me tell you, it's been a total game-changer for my canine companion. Despite being marketed as a cat feeder, I seamlessly adapted it to suit my dog's feeding schedule. Managing two meals a day, each dispensing a precise 2 cups of kibble, has never been easier.What truly sets this feeder apart is the ability to record my own voice for feeding reminders. It's like a personal touch, even when I'm not around. This feeder allows you to record a personal message, and it will be played right before the meal is dispensed. Itâ€™s an adorable and personal touch. The initial setup was a breeze, thanks to straightforward instructions. However, disassembly for cleaning, which I undertake weekly (sometimes twice), is a tad more intricate.The packaging impressed me â€“ a box within a box ensured a secure delivery. Powering this feeder with three D alkaline batteries grants an impressive 180-day battery life. This makes feedings so much easier at my house. I just have to clean the batteries up to date, keep dog food around, and the machine clean.The scheduled meal feature has eradicated issues like overeating, vomiting, and esophagitis. I appreciate the thoughtful design, including a built-in desiccant box in the BPA-free tank that keeps the kibble fresh and crunchy. The stainless steel bowl is dishwasher-safe, and very hygienic eating space for my pup. Equipped with a torque motor, this feeder eliminates concerns about food jams and missed feedings. I only use this feeder with dry kibbles or freeze-dried food. This wireless automatic pet feeder has exceeded my expectations, providing a reliable, convenient, and safe solution to streamline my dog's mealtime routine. She has food allergies and need a strict diet with the same time schedule. This has made the diet scheduling and elimination a lot easier. The size of this feeder works well for my dog now, but she is a German shepherd so Iâ€™m not sure how long we will have it around. I purchased this product in white, again, itâ€™s very easy to clean, Iâ€™ve had a little over a month and no stains, still looks brand new. Im also still on my first set of batteries. They do not come with the product. Highly recommended for pet owners seeking a comprehensive feeding solution.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 15, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Use patience to program it, and you will not need to read the instructions', 'author': "The_Litter's_Full", 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I have other auto feeders in my house, but I wanted to have one that I could but in the basement, where one of my cats spends most of her time. By the time she makes it upstairs, all the food is gone so I wanted to make sure she has access to food when I go away on short weekend trips. I had no problem at all setting this unit up by myself and so far it has released food at the scheduled times. It can be plugged in, or else it can use batteries and be self sufficient for a while. I do recommend putting this unit on some sort of feeding mat so it can help to contain mis-fired pieces of kibble.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use but clogs', 'author': 'Chelsea Jones', 'rating': 2, 'content': "So this product was easy enough to assemble and program. The problem came when it was to dispense the food. I have cat food and it is very small bits. It didn't matter that the bowl was empty, the food would fill the hole and would go in the bowl? It would just stay there and make bad grinding noises and the feeder kept trying to get it out. I think it's because there is no slide for the food to fall in and go down. You know? Idk. The other feeder I bought from a different company has no problems. So I returned this one and got another of that.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 17, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars great way to automatically feed kitty when i need to be away for an extended time', 'author': 'JN', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'this iPettie Hourglass Automatic Cat Food Dispenser was exactly what i needed - something to automatically feed kitty whenever i am away for a few days. In the past i have simply used a gravity self-feeding device but the idea of having exact control over the time and amount of feeding is best for keeping kitty at the right weight, etc.training me: the automatic feeder is pretty easy to put together. The programming of it is moderately easy too. But if you have trouble programming your microwave or your television remote, make sure to have a ten-year-old nearby to help you because there is a fair amount of complexity to getting the feeding schedule, the feeding amount and the timing all set up exactly as you would like it to be. On the positive side, i found the instructions to be clearly written and thatâ€™s always helpful.Oh and the automatic feeder can be used attached to a wall outlet. A wall adapter (a 100V AC to 5V DC adapter) comes with it along with a changing cable. But i decided to use the feeder remote by installing 3 alkaline D-bateries. In my situation the flexibility of being able to place the feeder â€œanywhereâ€ won outtraining the cat: Since kitty currently gets a mixture of wet and dry catfood, i had to come up with a training plan to teach her to eat all dry (since the machine cannot handle wet, canned catfood.) I decided to mix kittyâ€™s current dry kibble with small tuna-flavored treats that are equally dry but - according to kitty - are irresistible. That mixture got kitty to eat timidly out of the stainless steel bowl whenever the machine dispensed some food. kitty was quick to figure out what the sound of the food being dispensed was - no issues there. But she seemed spooked by the mirror-like stainless steel bowl. (Kitty was feral till she became an indoor cat some nine years ago. so she still retains some of those feral ways that kept her alive back then.) So - bottom line - it will likely take weeks for kitty to totally adapt to the new process but thatâ€™s OK. Your kitty might find it far easier to become acclimated to new things.i plan to use this automatic feeder as kittyâ€™s only source of food till she is 100% comfortable with it. At that point i will feel confident that i can depend on it for the next trip out of town.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars kittens enjoy the dispenser!', 'author': 'xingou', 'rating': 5, 'content': "this automatic food dispenser is great! I set it up to four feedings a day although it was kind tricky setting up the schedule. I initially was annoyed thinking why does it keep resetting the time. But it was actually setting up the time first and then the feeding schedule after. I was kinda confused with the instructions in the manual but I was also running on a few hours of sleep when I set it up.My kittens love this dispenser will watch in awe when the food dispenses out when they're around. that's really cute to watch. When the food is out, our more aggressive kitten will push the other kitten out of the way each and every time until he's had his fill. Then the gentler kitten will eat the leftovers although I do refill it to make sure he's full. With this in mind, I may need to get another automatic feeder. I also love it comes with a stainless steel bowl which makes it easy to wash.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 10, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars The iPettie Automatic Cat Food Dispenser is a Great Buy', 'author': 'Old Coyote', 'rating': 4, 'content': "For nine years, our cat Squeakie has been pestering us at meal times demanding to be fed. Like clockwork, at 5:00 am, 5:00 pm, and 10:30 pm, Squeakie must be fed, or else! The iPettie automatic cat (or small dog) food dispenser is the perfect solution to our problems and has finally given us independence from our cat's craving's.This food dispenser allows you to program from one to four feedings a day at any time specified, with portion sizes ranging from 1/8 cup up to 1 1/4 cups, in eighth-cup intervals. This allows us to give our cat a larger meal portion in the morning, and smaller portions later on.This product seems to be well designed and manufactured and works quite well, so far. One negative, was that our cat was quickly able to find a way to disengage the plastic bowl holder and bowl from the disperser, and one of his early meals went on to the floor. He ate it anyway. We were able to find an easy workaround by placing the feeder on a small tray with a slight rim.If your cat is driving you crazy with his or her food cravings then an automatic food dispenser might be exactly what you need. Squeakie and his human companions recommend this automatic cat food dispenser from iPettie. Two thumbs and one paw up.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 8, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars A Reliable Feeder with Minor Quirksâ€”Great for Busy Cat Owners', 'author': 'Mictom', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The iPettie Hourglass Automatic Cat Food Dispenser is a well-designed product that offers a blend of convenience and functionality, making it a solid choice for cat owners who are often on the go.Benefits:Long Battery Life: One of the standout features is its 180-day battery life. This is particularly useful for those who don't want the hassle of frequent battery changes.Voice Recording: The voice recording feature allows you to call your cat when it's mealtime, adding a personal touch that many pets will find comforting.Quality Materials: The stainless steel bowl and food-grade BPA-free tank ensure that your cat's food stays fresh and free from harmful chemicals.Ease of Use: The interface is user-friendly, making it easy to set up feeding schedules. The 3L/12 cup capacity is also a plus, reducing the frequency of refills.Flaws:Wireless Issues: While the product is advertised as wireless, it's worth noting that the wireless functionality is somewhat limited. It doesn't connect to a mobile app, which some might find inconvenient for remote adjustments.Price Point: The iPettie Hourglass is on the higher end of the price spectrum for automatic cat feeders. While its features justify the cost to an extent, budget-conscious buyers may hesitate.Noise Level: The mechanism that dispenses the food is a bit noisy, which could be startling for more skittish cats.In summary, the iPettie Hourglass Automatic Cat Food Dispenser offers a robust set of features that will satisfy most needs. Its long battery life and quality materials make it a reliable choice, although it does come with a few minor drawbacks. Overall, it earns a well-deserved 4 out of 5 stars.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 7, 2023', 'is_verified': False}]

Overall a great auto feeder with alot of features at a great price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Could work well for some people', 'author': 'EALong19', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'First, I want to reiterate what some of the other reviews are saying about the potentially confusing setup process. The first time I set it up (on not a so strong 2.4 ghz WiFi) it spun and spun. I finally hit the back button and it showed that it was already connected. So thereâ€™s some glitch there (but it DID connect). Additionally, when I connected it to the 5ghz network it didnâ€™t do that. So who knows. Just watch for it when youâ€™re trying to add it and if it seems like it wonâ€™t pair.This would have been our second feeder so Iâ€™m familiar with the concept. It has a sound bite thatâ€™s about 20x the volume of our previous one. I actually had to turn it off because it scared me and the cats (and would have woken us up to my shrill â€œkittyâ€¦ come here kitty â€¦. Time to eatâ€¦. Smooch smooch smoochâ€. ðŸ˜–)Also, it was a little wobbly and felt cheaply made. I wound up trying it with none of the legs though as my cats like to plop like loaves on the floor when they eat. The lid just felt like thin plastic compared to the lid I was used to with my other dispenser.Ultimately what did it in was the design of dispensation. We use freeze dried chicken that I cut up and it wasnâ€™t steep enough for the chicken to actually come out of the shoot. I tried it with actual kibble (which my cats wouldnâ€™t eat- they donâ€™t like kibble) and it worked like a charm. But with the lighter, oddly shaped freeze dried chicken bits, it just wasnâ€™t a match. (I know it CAN work from the previous dispenser which is finally getting old after 3 years).I think if you use kibble, you donâ€™t work from home (so youâ€™re not being scared by your voice and you think your cat will enjoy it), and you have carpet or a way to help with the potential wobble of the legs, this could be a really great dispenser. It has great camera quality, you can choose to set up notifications when thereâ€™s movement in front of it, thereâ€™s two way audio on it, and you can remotely dispense treats from it. It has pretty much everything you could want.As long as youâ€™re using a small projectile food.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Canâ€™t fill it with a lot', 'author': 'Pablo', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I use this for my two doggos. Theyâ€™re mini poodles and love hearing this go off since itâ€™s pretty loud. You can schedule feeding time and the camera is on all the time. You can also set how many portions it will feed at one time. The portions do seem kind of small but the app lets you do a bunch. The only down side about it is that the motor doesnâ€™t seem to be super strong. Weâ€™ve had it for a few months now and have to add food constantly because it wonâ€™t hold too much food. The weight of filling it up to the top seems to make the motor stop. We also had to get them smaller size kibble since the bigger one seemed to get caught on occasion. As long as you have small kibble and fill it up about halfway, it works wonders.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars CLOG CENTRAL', 'author': 'Jay Horrocks', 'rating': 2, 'content': "To start, we purchased this because we of course were going out of town, but not only that, while I work from home, I get really tired of getting up to feed my cats multiple times a day or listening to the hungry hippo cry for food whenever I am in the middle of something and can't take a break. I also hated having multiple alarms set on my phone to feed them as well, it was simply a hassle and I needed to simplify their feeding process.So I purchased this after doing research for a couple of weeks and while I love that I can set multiple feeding schedules and have them set for certain days only or every day, as well as being able to see the girls while we're gone and talk to them, this thing started clogging up almost immediately. At one time we did have 2 different sized foods in the machine but according to all the foods indicated, the larger pieces, still shouldn't have jammed it. Either way, we dumped it all, stopped putting the larger food in and after a couple of days, it once again jammed. I have dumped this feeder at least 3-4 times now, shaken the heck out of it, put my fingers up the dispensing area to also try to fix it but nothing works.All in all, while I love the camera, the portion sizes, and the scheduling, the way this dispenses food, is a real problem and the chute and dispenser area need to be redesigned. Thankfully we can still send it back but now I am back to reading bad reviews and shopping again for a new feeder.I do not recommend.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Frequently gets food stuck', 'author': 'Aira', 'rating': 1, 'content': "I am extremely dissatisfied with my experience using this automatic feeder. I purchased this product with the intention of ensuring that my cat would have access to fresh cat food when I am away on trips, but the performance of this automatic feeder has left me sorely disappointed. It frequently gets stuck, preventing my cat from accessing food. On average, it gets jammed every 2 to 3 days, which has me very concerned about my cat's well-being.The food jamming issue not only leaves my cat hungry but also forces me to spend additional time and money on having someone come over to feed my cat. This goes against the very reason I purchased this automatic feeder in the first place, as I expected it to alleviate my burden rather than add to my troubles.In addition to the food jamming problem, the performance of this product has been subpar. I find it to be relatively expensive for what it offers, and it simply does not justify its price tag.Overall, this automatic feeder is far from user-friendly and not worth the purchase. I strongly advise against wasting your time and money on this product and suggest exploring other, more reliable feeding solutions.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars So far, best buy of the year!!', 'author': 'Lara M.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I am going to be totally honest here, I LOVED THIS! My cats at the begging didn't understand but now when they hear the food drooping they run for it even in the early morning it's amazing because they don't come to me anymore asking for food haha, I am really loving this because as cat owners we know that our babies are very dependent and it just great to see they eating and checking if they are doing fine for those times that you are not home or even if you are home it's a great way to keep track on them. It was extremely easy to set it all up from the feeding machine to the camera, which I saw some people having problems setting it up so you basically you download the app called smart life (There is another app that works too) from there you make your account, tap on the plus button and add device, there you look for 'Small Home appliances` and select the pet feeder with camera (Wifi), important tho your must have a 2.4 Hg to connect the feeder to the app but it doesn't mean your phone need to be on 2.4 connection all the time you use the app with your own data or 5G wifi connection it's just for the setup of the feeder.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 31, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars White - Wifi/Cam&Mic', 'author': 'Erika Raposo', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'So, I gave it a 3 star because everything works well but I would say the volume on the camera is in and out. They can hear me on the other end of the camera but I canâ€™t hear on my cellphone on my end anything (tested it out with them barking & my bf talking). I also would like to note, Iâ€™m not sure if mine is defect but one side dispenses more food than the other, to be specified: the left side has more food than the right side. I bought this for two golden retrievers; although it shows this is for cats I couldnâ€™t find one specified for dogs. I also want to note that set up for the portions was not very easy, it took a lot of thinking and understanding along with a bit frustration. Also I think the bowls shouldâ€™ve been bigger or deeper but they do the job. I think if the company sees this review: you will get more pet owner customers if you would update some of my concerns. Especially the bowl size and feeder dispense because this can work for both cat and dog. I also wish the legs/height were a bit taller, but that is nothing a small little table stand wonâ€™t fix. Lots of upgrading and updating that can be fixed for future and better experience. Thank you. I am overall satisfied and it does the job for now. It also has a boujee look to it lol.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Camera works great - Broke at the 1 year warranty mark - No response from Customer service', 'author': 'Cherie', 'rating': 3, 'content': "Overall I really like the feeder. However, 2 weeks before the 1 year mark the motor is dying so it no longer dispenses food and customer service will not respond for a warranty claim. If it hadn't broken and need replacement so quickly I would have rated this product much higher. Has a great camera, good app, dispenses faithfully, never got stuck, and holds 2 weeks of food for 2 large cats. I really don't want to have to keep buying a new one every year though.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 3, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Elevated Cat Bowls, 15Â° Tilted Glass Raised Cat Food Bowl with Stainless Steel Stand, 2 Large Capacity Glass Cat Bowls and 4 Anti Slip Feet, Suitable for Cats and Little Dogs
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Classy food bowls', 'author': 'Joseph C.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I have 1 cat and she absolutely loves her new glass bowls! It looks much nicer than a regular food bowl and it's easy to clean because the glass bowls can be removed from the stainless steel stand. The stand's legs have rubber grips on them so the bowls don't slide on the ground. The heaviness of the bowls also makes it great for pets that tend to push their bowls around. Also, the bowls make it easier for my cat to eat and drink because they are elevated and tilted towards her. Overall, for the price this product is a great option I'd you're looking for a high quality set of food bowls that you and your cat will enjoy!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome product!', 'author': 'Rishabh Bajpai', 'rating': 5, 'content': "After purchasing the Hannadepot Elevated Cat Bowls for my cat, I'm delighted to share my experience with this fantastic product. Let me start by saying, these bowls have truly exceeded my expectations!The 15Â° tilt provided by the stand makes a noticeable difference in my cats' eating posture. They now dine in a much more natural position, with less strain on their necks and backs. I've observed them eating more comfortably and efficiently, and I'm hopeful that it may even help reduce any digestive issues they may have.The glass bowls are a game-changer. Not only are they incredibly durable (thick and heavey), but they're also dishwasher safe, making cleanup a breeze. I love how easy it is to see if any food residue remains, ensuring thorough cleaning every time.As for the stainless steel stand, it's both sturdy and stylish. Even my most rambunctious kitten couldn't knock it over! The rubber feet add an extra layer of stability, preventing any sliding or spills during mealtime.I appreciate the dual-bowl design, allowing me to keep dry and wet food separate.Overall, I couldn't be happier with the Hannadepot Elevated Cat Bowls. They've not only improved my cats' dining experience but also added a touch of sophistication to their feeding area. If you're looking for a practical and stylish solution to enhance your pet's mealtime routine, I highly recommend giving these elevated bowls a try. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to use and good for my cats', 'author': 'Dave87fez', 'rating': 5, 'content': "A nice, simple set up that works well for my cats. In particular, I had to retrain one of my cats away from an old area to a new one, and she's taken very well to the new arrangement using these new bowls. They're slightly raised to the correct height for her, and the small incline seems to suit her nicely. Two bowls means I can use one for food and one for water, or what I do is when she's finished eating, I stack the empty bowl in the used one, so my other greedy cat can't get to the food that's still in there. For me, they're easy to clean, have a nice neutral look and have a good capacity.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 29, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars My cats really like these feeding bowls', 'author': 'Lawrence M Hufty', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have four (4) cats and we feed them all at the same time. They know exactly what I mean when I yell out "time to eat". And lately, they have been very particular about who they eat with. So, I decided on buying a dual bowl set up to help with the eating arrangements. The first one I bought was nice, had a plastic base and stainless bowls that sort of screwed into the base. But, they would occasionally fall out, making a mess of the cat food. So on to the search. That\'s when I found this Hannadepot Elevated Cat Bowls, 15Â° Tilted Glass Raised Cat Food Bowl with Stainless Steel Stand, 2 Glass Cat Bowls and 4 Anti Slip Feet, Suitable for Cats and Little Dogs (that\'s a mouth full!!). I really like the 15Â° tilt that the stand provides. It makes for an easier angle for the cats to eat. And I LOVE the glass bowls. My only complaint is I wish the bowls had less of a sharp angle from the bottom to the sides. It seems to me that the kitties have a bit of a hard time getting that extra bit of food. On the other hand, they don\'t give up and maybe it slows them down a bit.The stainless steel stand is sturdy, and easy to clean. Everything is dishwasher safe. And back to the glass bowls, they are heavier than the thin Stainless Steel bowls, which is a real plus. No cat can pull it out of the stand.The bottom line is that the unit is well made, dishwasher safe, heavy enough to avoid cat attack and for the price, a really good deal. And as you can see from the pictures, the whole thing was really packaged well.I highly recommend this.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice and Tidy', 'author': 'R. WOOD', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Perfect feeding unit for cats or small dogs. It was well designed for me, as I feed several types of dry cat food. I will be getting another unit. The front is slightly tilted in its design making it easier for you pet to eat out of. Easy to clean and compact size. I highly recommend this product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Sleek and well made', 'author': 'Kimberly', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This product is great for the natural height at which a cat should be eating! I would say if your cat eats wet food the bowl may be too deep for a cat to comfortably eat without irritating their whiskers! Hope your cats enjoy this cool and sleek bowl set!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 28, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Made to last!', 'author': 'Singleton', 'rating': 5, 'content': "These are way better than expected for the price. title: HoneyGuaridan Automatic Cat Feeder, 2 Cats, 6.5L, 2.4G WiFi Smart Pet Feeder with APP Control, Stainless Steel Bowl, Desiccant Bag, 10s Voice Recorder
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Set-Up Process', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Although the instruction manual states that the app can only be set-up on 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi, it's easy to overlook that detail. To connect to to the wifi, it's easy to use mobile hotspots because they typically use 2.4 GHz so I recommend using another phone as a mobile hotspot to connect the app and feeder on your device. title: Automatic Cat Feeders
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Reliable', 'author': 'MGK', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's best to spin the bowl around because the food in the back near the dispenser output can be difficult for cats to reach. Reliably dispenses food and is simple to program. The audio message plays loud for cats to hear and they enjoy the sound of the food hitting the bottom of the bowl. Portion sizing can be judged by measuring how much comes out in each increment and comparing it to what a manual portion would measure out to be. The food reservoir does not seal and is not air tight so we do not fill it up all the way.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect! Easy to use', 'author': 'jamie anne', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I use this every day for my cat and she has no issues with it. Works very well, directions were clear. Even has a battery backup option in case your power goes out, you don't have to worry about your pet missing meals.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "1.0 out of 5 stars Edited - already stopped working. Works well - could be better. Can't see food levels.", 'author': 'Kyra', 'rating': 1, 'content': "Edited 10-7-22. I purchased these in July. They have a 90 day return policy. Just after the 90 days, one of the two I purchased started jamming up. Three times now, I've noticed it didn't dispense. How many times did I not notice?! I'm waiting on an Amazon response now for how to contact the manufacturer.These work well for my dogs however, they need two major improvements. First, the bin isn't clear. Since obviously I'm feeding animals with it, I've got the dispensers sitting down on the floor and they are covered with a black lid. It is impossible to see in at a glance as I'm walking by. In order to see what's left in the bin I have to get down on my hands and knees to try to see through the smoky grey sides, or I have to take the lid off. I'm afraid they will run out one day because I can't see into the bin. Second, all the controls are at the very bottom, right above the bowl. In order to change anything with the settings, or to dispense an extra portion, I have to get down on my hands and knees to read the display. This display should be on the top facing up! Other than that, they work well.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 18, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works well; portion sizes are very small', 'author': 'Kaleigh Reed', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have a 7lbs sphynx cat, and anyone who is a fellow naked cat parent knows they are RAVENOUS. She would eat an entire BAG of cat food if she had access to it. Iâ€™ve been using auto feeders for a while, but had only been using feeders that have rotating dishes where you manually fill each dish with a measured amount of food.This feeder will not hold the contents of a full bag, but certainly cuts down on the maintenance of having to check a smaller feeder so frequently. It works well and is easy to operate. You do have to set the machine to feed a set number of â€œportionsâ€ per feeding, and my cat normally gets a little less than 1/4 cup at each meal, which, more or less amounts to FIVE portion sizes when measured out. I would recommend comparing the amount dispensed per portion size when programming how many portions the feeder will drop for your pet per feeding, to make sure they are getting enough at each mealtime.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ease of use', 'author': 'WenJin Yu', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Our dog\'s name is Dahei, he is a 1.5 years old GSD.We work a 9-5 job and sometimes we had to rush home to feed this big boy. This meal feeder has saved us at least 2 trips per week when we are just too busy.Function: can set 4 meals by different portions. Because we only need to feed one time when we aren\'t home, we set a 2 minitue interval of max portions. So the tray gets filled. Our dog can easily finish that portion.It allows a recording before feeding the trap, we just simply make a loud noise of "Dahei, come eat."Tips:-train your dog to eat from this machine first otherwise they might not know it is ok to eat from there. Ours just stared at the feeder finish the portions and walked away on our first day of use.- if you unplug it, remember to redo all the settings so your dog doesn\'t miss a mealOverall, this saved us a lot of time and our doggy definitely loves to eat on time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 19, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Best cat babysitter', 'author': 'Denise Allen', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Easily set up, 4 different set ups for the feeding amount and times to be fed which was perfect!
