Kitty and I love it!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Mostly works, sometimes iffy', 'author': 'Kwells620', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'Overall we havenâ€™t had too many issues with it. Worked great for awhile and then sometimes would say the voice activation we recorded and sometimes would not. Only had a couple missed feedings but works 95% of the time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 19, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Didnâ€™t follow through with warranty', 'author': 'renee', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'This feeder stopped working less than a year after purchase (warranty up to a year). I followed up a few times, and they stopped answering. Super bummed cause it worked well until it didnâ€™t work at all.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Snacking cats', 'author': 'Chanda Callaway', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Ideal as a supplemental feeder for my kitties.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 21, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Recommended only for cats', 'author': 'Weekly Shopper', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I have 2 cats. One lives upstairs and the other lives downstairs (idk). They are both foodies who fight over food. Ultimately this product makes it easier to feed them without choosing who eats first. With that said, the only drawbacks personally are the size of the bowls and the price (4 stars). It holds enough for feeding cats for a while, but only if you choose your portions wisely. There are only 4 feeding times available, so I only did 12 portions every 12 hours. That left extra food in the bowls all day long (stinky). Serving size 06 is about the same amount as a small pouch of wet cat food. I currently have both of them set for 4 servings at 6a.m, noon, 6p.m, and midnight. There is no extra food sitting out, and neither of them beg me for food in-between those hours. No more fights or thievery, so it works for my household.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 6, 2022', 'is_verified': True}]

title: Slow Feeder Cat Bowl, Fun Interactive Feeder, Slows Down Pets Eating, 100% BPA Free, Dog and Cat Puzzle Feeder Prevents Overeating, Healthy Eating Diet Cat Bowls (Pink)
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good product', 'author': 'GSXR', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This seem like a good product, it was well-made, and did what it was designed to do. But unfortunately, I returned it because my kitty was not interested in it whatsoever.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 19, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Fun for dog. Fun for human. Needs more stability.', 'author': 'Amy', 'rating': 4, 'content': "The media could not be loaded. The bowl is taller than my Doxie puppy, but that didn't stop her. You see her first attempt is to use brute force to gnaw the treat balls open. She wasn't as methodical as a feline, but she was determined. Within a few minutes, she figured out the game. Her small size meant she was jumping in the bowl, thus not pushing it around. But it isn't going to be great for a slightly larger pup (mine weighs 2 pounds). That pup would probably push it around and playing the game would be more difficult. It needs some sort of weight or rubber or suction cups or stabilizing structure on the bottom to keep it from becoming a soccer ball. I felt supervision on my part was necessary.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 19, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Very Clever Product!', 'author': 'Erika B.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. As the "proud" owner of a superchonk I\'ve been in the market for a product like this. He literally eats so fast he wheezes and snorts. Think pig seeking truffle... I\'ve bought other versions that worked, but they were low to the ground. They also tended to be really difficult to clean because most didn\'t come apart. The first thing I did was take it apart and wash it. It\'s designed so the little sliders can actually pop out to be cleaned. It takes a little time to do this, but the fact that it\'s a possibility is awesome. I put it back together and filled it with treats. He figured out the first couple of cups quickly. He struggled more the further the cups were away from the drop slot. (Insanely amusing to watch f.y.i.) Though eventually, Chonk was victorious. I\'m also glad to report the base was wide enough that he didn\'t tip it. Though, he didn\'t aggressively attempt to. The only real recommendation I have to the maker would involve adding rubber or something on the bottom. He didn\'t tip it, but it did slide around on linoleum fairly easily. Overall, I am VERY happy with this product.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

If there was a removable bowl for the water side to wash instead of having to wash the entire base that would be even better. The feeder side of the set does have a cover for the food storage bin that way you can only have small amounts of food dispensed out at one time instead of a constant flow of feed, that way you can watch your pets diet.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 8, 2023', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Doesnâ€™t work', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'The door to hold the food doesnâ€™t stay in place. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great slow feeder!', 'author': 'jodie', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I love the design of the bowl. I bought it to use for my yorkipoo. Leo, my apparently starving kitty, was not thrilled the first couple days, but has adjusted and has quit glaring at me.They're a good height for a cat to eat more upright. Of course, this results in vomiting. Ive been through a number of slow feeder bowls with him to find what slows him the most and the bumps in the middle have to be similar in size and closeness to what are in the bowl. Fast forward to recently when the other cat, my senior 14 year old, needed to use an elevated bowl due to arthritis, so I searched for elevated bowls with slow feeder feature and here we are. So far so good. I ordered 3 bowlsâ€”one for each cat and a third for extra food for during the day (I thought they were smaller but they are a very nice size actually). They arrived 5 days ago, we have yet to have a vomiting incident which is unheard of with the younger one, both cats are totally into them, and they are heavy enough that no one has managed to knock one over, me included. I was never big into letting the cats free feed before but they donâ€™t overdo it with these bowls and with the older cat needing to gain weight and me being at work a lot, these bowls are a godsend.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 2, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Slows down the gobbling', 'author': 'JH', 'rating': 5, 'content': "It's very sturdy and most pleasing to look at--in fact, quite artistic in appearance. He hasn't thrown up once since. Well...correction: the other day, I added some dry food to the bowl I use for his wet food; he gobbled and vomited.Sometimes, he has to move some bits of food around with his paw to get them, so the dish becomes a bit interactive, tooâ€”makes him use his brain if he wants his nuggets!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 30, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

Easy to clean, easy to move around, and these two laid back catsters don\'t have to make much effort to bend over and eat! Well worth a purchase, in my opinion, if you don\'t have one. reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works great', 'author': 'Emily Schatz', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Makes it easy to feed my cat on a diet. Very easy to use timer dial and my cat can't open it. The only downside is it constantly ticks, which is usually fine because I have other sounds drowning it out.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 7, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great for short-term traveling!', 'author': 'Jasmin', 'rating': 4, 'content': "This feeder worked as described. Each little tick mark equates to 30 minutes. Honestly, I'm not sure what the other reviews are complaining about regarding the noise. I had to put my ear to the feeder to hear the ticking and make sure it was working, and it made a small sound when the lids popped open that my husband and I didn't even notice. Dropping a wand cat toy on the floor was louder than this. I wouldn't recommend leaving wet food in for longer than 12 hours as the ice packs won't stay cold that long, but that's just how ice packs work if you really think about it. If you need to leave food for longer than 12 hours, you can put dry food in no problem. I also saw someone suggest in another product's reviews that you could probably freeze your wet food before placing it in the feeder to keep it fresh for longer than 12 hours, although I have not tried this. I love how shallow the bowls are as it provides whisker relief for the cats. We use this when we aren't going to be home in time to feed our cat dinner, so that he can eat at his normal time. It also works for if you're going on an overnight trip to give dinner and breakfast as needed. Make sure to use new or fully charged batteries. I love the battery component as it lets us put this anywhere in our apartment without needing to worry about access to an outlet (which is very limited in our apartment). Just make sure to replace the batteries as needed. The bowls clean very easily in the dishwasher and everything else can be wiped down. This is honestly a lifesaver for our busy lives so we don't have to keep asking friends to visit our apartment to feed our cat if we won't make it home by dinner time/breakfast. This probably wouldn't be practical for everyday use, but this really isn't designed for that unless you want to fill it up and reset the timers every day. It is perfect for short-term traveling, and our cat adjusted to this immediately.The only issue we had was that the little red line for one of the timers came off? It's like a sticker or something, but there is a little indent where it is supposed to be so we just used a marker to fill in that indent. Just a minor inconvenience, but otherwise no other complaints!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 16, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Unreliable', 'author': 'Chunky Kitty', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'I returned the first one received because it simply did not work.The second worked, sometimes. The timing indicators are not true. For example a one hour setting can be anywhere from 40 to 120 minutes.Furthermore the ice packs are tiny. If they had not built the ice pack holder with a divider you could double the ice pack or use a substitute ice pack.Do yourself a favor and get a Cat Mate c20 instead. The Cat Mate C500 has precise timing but if you just need to provide two meals itâ€™ll do.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 27, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love it!!', 'author': 'k', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This thing is great. Easy to use and donâ€™t have to stress about feedings if your day runs long. I bought a similar one before thatâ€™s the same concept but this one is sturdier and easier clean.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Works, timer is loud', 'author': 'Megan Pattison', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'First, and most importantly- it works as expected for opening/closing/setting the timerSecond- the timer is way louder than I expected. Think of the old clock in your grannyâ€™s kitchen in the 70s and 80s. Not a bad noise, but you can absolutely hear it.Third- even though there is an ice pack for each side, itâ€™s not a big one and the rest of the unit isnâ€™t insulated at all, so I would probably hesitate to use this for longer than 24hrs if keeping the food chilled is important', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 4, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Low tech feeder works best!', 'author': 'smedheat', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'My pets love the two-sided, wide openings.This feeder is easy to use because it runs on batteries. There is no digital programming. Just spin the dial.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 14, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great option for wet food', 'author': 'Jeena116', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'We switched to wet food and need to measure out the food and feed her twice a day. Love that I have the freedom to go out without worrying about feeding my dog. I also set the food out at night on the weekends so she doesnâ€™t wake me up with her whining and I can sleep in. The only negative comment would be that the container ticks all day, but I donâ€™t hear it unless I am close by. Would recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 1, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Been using this for several months now and it's going strong", 'author': 'Shelby', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Works perfectly. I never have to worry about it going off at the wrong time or skipping a meal. I have used it for food and for dosing medication for my dog. The portion size works great for her (she is a 10 lb small dog) but I could easily see it fitting 1 cup of food per serving. I highly recommend this feeder!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 6, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Ice package damaged', 'author': 'Lea', 'rating': 3, 'content': 'The product is good overall. The ice pack broke after just one use. Blue liquid was over the whole bottom of the unit. Just hope it isnâ€™t hazardous to animals.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States November 25, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars .', 'author': 'LK', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'I generally plan to use only one side of the two slots. title: Hepper 360 Cat Feeder, Stainless Steel, Anti-Chew Material, Dishwasher Safe, 2-Pack
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Works well', 'author': 'John Fowler', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'No more ants in the cat food! What more can you ask of an anti-ant feeder? Stainless steel dishes for easy cleaning, sturdy plastic surround.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 10, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Great Design for Multiple Reasons!', 'author': 'Scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Super easy to clean, perfect for cats.My cats love making a mess with their wet food. They flick it around, get it all over their faces and used to make a mess of their dishes. Luckily, this food dish solves my issues on several fronts:EASY TO CLEAN: The U-channel all the way around + the fact that the dish structure is a single material make this super easy to clean! Just wipe and done!My old dish was more of the standard variety you can get everywhere - Small deep bowls, metal construction, rubber gaskets everywhere. But I was sick of pulling those gaskets off to clean & they always seemed to be collecting food in crevices immediately, potential for the metal to rust was always a concern.... (Some reviewers say that they don't like that there isn't some sort of grippy material to keep these dishes from moving. I can see that they would, but I counter-act this by simply having the bowls up against a wall - the design keeps the dishes far enough away from the wall, so no mess there either.)WIDE, SHALLOW DISHES: Great feature - Cats used to bang their teeth against their tiny deep food bowls trying to eat. Now they can lick everything up with potentially damaging themselves.EXTENDED BOWL RIMS: Nice that these bowls have rims that extend outward to the edge of the channel, my cats make much less of a mess as food doesn't seem to find it's way under the edges and simply falls into the channels to be licked away.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States July 20, 2015', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Easy to clean, design good but could be better, probably still overpriced.', 'author': 'Justin Simonson', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'Ease of cleaning is huge here. The plastic wipes down very easily and it\'s good to know that if the grime ever builds up I can throw that in the dishwasher\'s top shelf, too.The pans are _also_ easy to hand clean, but I try to replace the food dish every day (and the water dish eventually in case food gets in it or other bacteria might build up; I replace the water every day).They are too close together, so kibble can get into the water easily, but luckily our kitten is not a messy eater. She\'s little and has to stand in the "moat" area, but doesn\'t mind.With shallow dishes, it\'s _really_ easy to spill when replacing the water. If you move the whole thing, the moat will catch most of the spills, and can be wiped out with a rag or paper towel.As others have noted, there\'s empty space under the pans. If that had more plastic under it, it would make it really hard for ants to get in, and would even allow you to add water to create a true ant moat. (Haven\'t had to deal with it yet, but where we live the ants mostly come in looking for water in the summer anyway, so not sure even that would keep them away.)To be clear, the manufacturer makes no claims that this will keep ants away. The moat is primarily for catching your kitty\'s mess. But they\'re so close to helping with that problem that it seems worth it for them to try.I would not be at all surprised if the company puts out a redesign in a year or two that addresses ants better and spreads the two dishes apart by an inch.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 24, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality', 'author': 'Val', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This has some heft to it. I like it and it really helps my cats eating area to be cleaner and easily cleaned.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 8, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and Cat Approved', 'author': 'BL', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I am very pleased with these. Easy to clean, pets like them, and the design catches excess water and food. I had occasion to contact customer service and the company was amazingly helpful. Highly recommend!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 10, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Good concept poorly executed', 'author': 'Mr. O', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'With the dishes so close together the kibble kept getting into the waterâ€¦ not ideal. Looks good and great concept but just poorly executed', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Dual cat feeder', 'author': 'Skolly', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Good quality and easy to clean . Have a second set of bowls too', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States December 9, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic', 'author': 'scott', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The stainless steel dishes fit snugly in the holder. I used 2 of my own washers and put them on the outside (the knob side) which then allowed the bowls to drop all the way in and sit flat.Then I noticed that the whole platform that held the bowls would rotate back and forth. The audio works like a charm, easy peasy to handle. They threw in a velcro latch, which is a smart move to keep my dog from turning it into a 'knock it over and take however much food you want dispenser' . And just in case the power takes a break, there's a backup battery.The app is pretty slick with a bunch of useful features. You can manage schedules, put out food manually, control how much gets served, drop a recorded message (because who doesn't love a talking food bowl?), and of course, keep an eye on things with the live camera and audio.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 9, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars High quality material', 'author': 'Breezy in Georgia', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Bowls are wide to prevent whisker fatigue. Nice height. Not too tall. Bowls slant as well.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for naughty cats', 'author': 'Corey', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The cat my girlfriend and I consider our child is a spoiled brat full of spite!Her favorite move is a start pawing at her food dishes, until the point that she puts enough force to flip them over spilling water and food all over the carpet which is absolutely terrible and has becoming a big pain as I think she knows it gets us mad.with this food and water bowl combo, there is no more floor mask, everything ends up making it into the convenient little holding caddy, which makes cleaning easy, albeit a little messy sometimes when she gets water and food in there.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Great size for a smaller animal', 'author': 'Phil M', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Overall this is a pretty good product, and it's the perfect size for our pup and offers her a more comfortable eating position. The tilt is a nice feature so she can stand more upright to eat, and since it's raised off the floor, it meets her almost exactly at the level of her back. It has one weird problem though that prevents it from getting a 5 star in my book, and that's the issue of the water dish. The two dishes are moderately small and are the same size. One is fine for dry kibble (or even wet food), but the other one doesn't hold a whole lot of water. And this might not be an especially big problem, but the issue comes when you enable the tilt feature - the dish already doesn't hold a whole lot of water, but when you tilt it 30 degrees (or whatever the angle of the tilt), then the bowl can hold even less water... so we're refilling our dog's water dish a WHOLE LOT more often now than we used to, and sometimes she'll be out of water for possibly more than a day without us realizing.Overall it's still a pretty good product and fits our dog's size nicely, and we're still using it, but I wish the water dish had a different design to accommodate for the tilt, so that it could hold more water.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 6, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Love the thought put into these bowls!', 'author': 'Christi L.', 'rating': 5, 'content': "I got these bowls for my 17 lb kitty, because I noticed that her food would spill into her water with her other feeder, and I wanted something that I could just devote to her water and keep it clean. Honestly, set up was not at all a worry which was really nice. The basic base for the feeder is already set up. It is very simple to change the angle of the bowls. I really appreciate the simplicity of it. In my opinion, they are appear to be only two options: flat or angled. I do know the water can spill out a little when it is at an angle so I don't normally keep it that way. It is minor, but still. I was very surprised by the design of this to prevent spilling of food or water on the floor. I guess I wasn't seeing the vision when I looked at the pictures but I can see it right away at home. Basically, if dry food spills out it will get caught by the plastic lining so no food gets wasted. Awesome! Size: I think that if your pet is smaller than mine, like a 10 lb dog cat, I would say these would be good sized bowls for both food and water. I would think you might need to replace the dry food out once per day. However, if you have a smaller pet, like a ferret, then I don't see a need to replace the food out but once a day. I love that these bowls are ceramic because I have read that cats prefer to drink their water from ceramic bowls vs plastic or metal, and may even be inclined to drink more. Nice.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Large and keeps food off floor - Pain to clean', 'author': 'MarkinPhoenix', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I do like the idea of raising the bowls off the floor, and so does my catIt does keep the mess contained, however I kinda think it's easier to rinse off a mat than it is to clean out this plastic trayThere is value in keeping things off the floor, but given its large size, cleaning is more of a chore over floor matsNot a great value", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Ergonomic for cats and great for messy eaters', 'author': 'Paul and Wendy', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'Elevated feeders are said to be best for cats, and specifically those with a 15 degree angle, and this fits that bill fine. The biggest thing for me is the plastic lipped tray that the feeding bowls are in! This took a fairly messy area (because my cat is a little fuzzy slob) and made a huge difference in the amount of food that is wasted because she gets a little too excited at feeding time. We went from having kibble in about a 30 cm radius of her food dish to almost nothing scattered around, and that makes her human caretakers very happy. The ceramic bowls are heavy enough to stay put, and look great. The elevated feeder is easy to clean and looks good, but the star of this is the fact that it tames the mess of owning a cat that loves food so much she gets it everywhere. If you have an exuberant eater, this will definitely make the feeding area a much cleaner place.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 28, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Easy and excellent', 'author': 'Roger Bryant', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This set comes fully assembled which is always nice. Just pull it out, remove packing materials, rinse, and put it to use. I was pleasantly surprised with the product. I had been a bit concerned it'd be roo big, but its not. They're perfect size for a cat or small dog. The holder and spill tray is made out of some tough plastic, bit the bowls themselves are ceramic. That means they'll pretty much last forever. No scratches or stains like you get with plastic. The ceramic bowls are superior to plastic. Yes,there is concern with dropping/breaking but these are pretty hefty. It seems like it would take quite a fall to damage. I'm not going to test that though, I want to keep this. The spill tray ensures that even messy eaters won't leave kibble all over the floor. Works great for my cat who's flat face makes it hard to reach food at the bottom of a dish. It is a bit grippy on the bottom to discourage the unit from sliding around. Its been great. Overall I'm very happy with this set up and have zero complaints. Gizmo likes it too.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 18, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars May be good for some dogs or cats.', 'author': 'Margo', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a nice elevated ceramic bowl set. The bowls are solid and heavy, nicely coated and will last a long time. However, I feel you should consult your veterinarian about whether a raised bowl is ideal for your pet. Elevated bowls may not be suitable for some cats or dogs because they are not like us to chew up food. My dog mostly swallows food right up then chews. Some dogs may get more bloating from eating from elevated bowls because they are eating at a faster pace and could cause more bloating. I do see this elevated bowl set as a cleaner way of feeding your dog by eliminating spills by accidentally collecting on the floor since the floor carries a lot of dirt and germs. But his could have been done without the bowl being elevated with just a tray around the bowls. Also, it may not be good for some cats because their chins may rest on the edge of the bowl leading to irritation and bacteria buildup that can result in acne. feline acne that causes discomfort and even pain for some cats may not benefit from raised bowls. Megaesophagus- a condition of enlarged and weakened esophagus â€“the raised bowl could cause the food to move too quickly into the esophagus increasing the risk of regurgitation and aspiration pneumonia. Cats and dogs with dental and medical conditions that affect their ability to eat I would check with your vet first. However, these bowls are nice, and you can just take them out of the trays if you do not want to use the tray. The plastic is strong and sturdy that surrounds the bowls and it is an easy cleanup for the bowls and the tray. This still may be beneficial for some dogs and cats I think it all depends on the size of your pet. Their medical condition and their weight and how they eat their food, that is why I say consult your veterinarian.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars So far so good', 'author': 'Cat Lady', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This review is for the "Oneluck 100% Waterproof Cat and Dog Bowls Plastic Feeding Set, Ceramic Bowl Slip Resistant Raised Edges, Catch Water, Food Mess, No Spills, Pet Accessories." The cats are eating and drinking fine out of these. I would have liked to tilt the bowls, but we decided to use one of them for their water. If the tilt was split so that you could tilt one bowl and keep the other level, that would be perfect. These will work for grown cats. Kittens wouldn\'t be able to reach over the edge of the enclosure.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars good intention with design', 'author': 'Allison Burns', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'i love the intended design of these tilted dog bowls. its made well, sturdy and nice appearance. the flaw however, is that the two bowls need to be obtuse/more organic shaped. when even at a very slight tilt, the water spills. instead of a normal level-top bowl being on an angle, i may look for a weird shaped bowl with uneven walls to prevent spillage.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 11, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

title: PETKIT Automatic Pet Feeder with Camera, 1080P HD Video with Night Vision, 2.4G WiFi Cat Dog Feeder with 2-Way Audio,Smart App Control Pet Dry Food Dispenser for Cats and Dogs with Non-Stick Food Bowl.
reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Honestly? I'm Shocked How Good It Is!", 'author': 'Ryan A. Leemhuis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A little background first. We had previously used the Crown Majestic feeder for our cat. It worked fairly well although it was a bit ugly, would occasionally jam and the portion sizes were very hit and miss. We used it until its power connection internally broke and it would only run off batteries which was difficult to keep up with.So that led me on my search for a replacement. There are a lot more options now than there used to be. My main features I was looking for were wifi control and reliability.I found it difficult to narrow down my choice as I found varying reviews and some claimed that a model was terrible and some said it was amazing. I eventually settled on the Petkit mini feeder from a cost and design perspective. First of all, it looks great. I love the thought that went into the design from the magnetically attached bowl to the jumper that allows the DC adapter to easily disconnect from the wall should you need. I was a little nervous about how much food could be stored but upon seeing the compartment this is a good amount for a cat. I find we need to fill it once every 2 weeks or so.That brings us to the worst part of the product. Lets just be clear here...the app is decent...but there are some language oddities and the setup did not go according to design. I am a techy and I initially tried pairing the feeder with my phone. It got fairly far into the setup but kept failing out during the wifi pairing process. I then tried my wife\'s phone and it did the same. I then happened to notice that the feeder was already showing on the app\'s dashboard and sure enough it had been paired even though the app claimed it had failed. I don\'t know why this occurred but be prepared for some setup issues.Once setup, however, the app is great. The food portion sizes are accurate and on demand feeds occur nearly immediately. The schedule is easy to setup and food is distributed on time. We use prescription "disc-shaped" food and other feeders claimed they weren\'t compatible. We have had ZERO issues with this machine getting jammed or having any issue with our food. It is actually very fun to watch the little door open on the machine and then the food dump out.For the cost, this feeder is a steal. It is so much better than our previous feeder it makes me wonder why I didn\'t upgrade earlier. My only suggestions for improvement would be to further improve the app and instructions translations. There are some real English oddities (which you can see in the product\'s amazon page as well. In addition, the setup process obviously needs some improvement too as it failed twice for me and some how magically appeared on my apps dashboard after this fail. Other than that, the feeder is perfect. It feels very high quality and the mechanics seem sound. HIGHLY recommended.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 29, 2019', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars PetKit Mini - Small Pet Feeder - Review', 'author': 'AirplaneCatBlue', 'rating': 5, 'content': "The PetKit Mini feeder is attractively and elegantly designed. It looks like it belongs in an art museum.The PetKit Mini feeder is the ideal automatic feeder for my needs. What I like best is that it precisely delivers very small meals (as little as 1/20 of a cup or 5 grams) to my overweight cat up to 10 times per day. In my case I had been feeding my cat 20 grams of cat kibbles twice per day... or 40 grams. My cat was waking me up at 4 AM begging for more food. The PetKit Mini stopped the begging behavior! With the PetKit Mini I was able to schedule 8 feedings of 5 grams each... for a total of 40 grams per day... but spread out over the course of the day and night. This way my cat gets precisely fed her reduced ration and eliminates my tendency to give her a little extra when she begs.The PetKit Mini has improved my cat's relationship with me. She no longer relies on me for food. With the PetKit Mini she visits me often and regularly because she wants my company... not because she wants food. Unboxing and putting everything together is easy, and so far the feeder has been reliable. That said, I think the app is a lot more complex than it needs to be, and while that can be updated and changed over time, it's important to know what you're getting into.When you go through setup of the feeder and app for the first time, I think the experience is a bit all over the place. There are instruction stickers on the feeder itself, there is a booklet of instructions, there are QR codes and links within the booklet to scan to get to videos that you have to watch for further steps, and then there's setup within the app itself... etc. I think it's just a few too many layers of info and could be pared down significantly. Once everything is setup and you're trying to actually use the app, those same issues of unnecessary layers/ complications continue. The app tries to get you to schedule meals based on feeding recommendations for your pet, so you have to setup a profile for each of your pets first. This sounds minor, but it's quite detailed, and includes a whole lot of information that isn't truly necessary just to make a recommendation for feeding quantity. In the end, a truly informed recommendation would really require nutrition information about your pet food itself, so the whole exercise is a bit silly. I was left feeling a bit unsure of how much of this information I *really* needed or wanted to complete. Once you have been asked about various details for your pet, then you need to schedule fixed meals for each, and again I do appreciate that they tried to include a lot of options for customization, but it's just too much. For one, how do they propose that you make sure the right pet eats the right meal, etc? I think it would be much easier to remove those options, or hide them behind an advanced mode, and just let you set a very simple schedule with set times and quantities. K.I.S.S. you know? Given that the app doesn't interface with bluetooth trackers or smart catboxes or anything like that, I'm not sure I see any need for the pet profiles at all! It just adds complexity for no discernible reason.Beyond the actual cumbersome data entry requirements, I found the interface to be not very intuitive. I had difficulty finding the settings that I actually wanted to look for and find out more about, such as the Alexa integration, and kept getting lost in layers of social media integrations and gamification... which, why? I was looking into trying out the Smart Home integration options, but do I need a community and messaging platform for my smart feeder? Maybe this is more of a cultural thing, I believe the company is based in China, but I just don't need this kind of fluff cluttering up the basic functions of the app. I'd really enjoy it more if they could pull back on these added features, or again, maybe just hide them all in one area of the app called 'Social' or similar, but they seemed to be behind every corner. For me, again it just took away from the experience of feeling like I could find the basic information and functions quickly and easily. Thankfully, apps can be can be improved and refined over time, so I feel that most of those concerns are somewhat secondary. If you plan to use it in a way where you can sit down and get through it, then basically 'set it and forget it', I think it will work well for you. But if you would plan to regularly make any tweaks to your meal plans, I think it would be a not-minor annoyance. I'll also mention that this is something my partner and I considered setting up for aging parents, just as a little convenience item to make their lives easier. After working with it, I don't know if I can comfortably go that direction. I definitely don't feel confident that they would have gotten through any of the initial setup themselves, but I also don't think they could make any on-the-fly changes to the configuration even if the initial steps were done for them. My advice to the developers would be: pare down to the basics and make sure they are quick and intuitive. THEN add extras, but remember they are extras and not your primary functions.Ok, so it seems like I'm coming down kind of harsh. All that said, I do think this product will work just fine for use in my own home. The feeder itself is sturdy and has so far been reliable. While I don't have direct experience with a lot of competing products, I had been taking note of some other design issues I'd noted in some of those competitors and waited to try something that seemed to address them. For one, I don't just appreciate the option for plug-in power and battery backup, for me that's an absolute requirement on something like this. The food storage compartment also seems secure, which was a concern I had because I have one cat that will get into ANYTHING edible that is left out. I'm impressed because he hasn't even tried with this, which also tells me the seals are probably decent and he's not being tempted by the smell of kibble. That also leads me to believe that bugs shouldn't be an issue, though time will tell. I also appreciate that the actual food bowl portion is easily removable, as it just snaps into place with a magnet. Being plastic based, it's important to clean something like that regularly and you and I both know that won't happen if it's a pain point. Ideally, I would really like to see this component and the food storage bin being made out of stainless steel, but maybe that's something that could be incorporated in a future revision as well.Let's wrap this up...On the whole, if you are patient and technologically competent enough to get through the configuration of the app itself, it's a good product that I think you'll be happy with.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States May 12, 2020', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars The PetKit app is nearly useless for this feeder! So far so good.Next task is to program my two cats into the Feeding Calculator. Entering the name is easy. Enter the weight? The app reverts to a default weight of 6.8 pounds every time. So it fails to update the cats's weights. FAIL! There isn't any obvious way to edit the cat information either. So another FAIL! Interesting is that I have the PetKit Puramax automatic litter box with my cats' weights entered correctly. The feeder links to the info but changes the weights without any input from me. Another FAIL?Next it asks me to enter their cat food. I feed Purina Indoor Cat Food, a very common dry cat food pellet available in any American grocery store. Instead of a simple-to-use barcode reader that searches online and enters the food analysis for me, I have to enter the analysis manually. That's a definite FAIL!!I have two PetKit water dispensors that work very well. The Petkit Pure Max Litter box works well. I really want the food dispenser to work just as well but for now the software is a FAIL!!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 13, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars accurate, precise, feeder. reviews: [{'title': "5.0 out of 5 stars Honestly? I'm Shocked How Good It Is!", 'author': 'Ryan A. Leemhuis', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'A little background first. title: Join Prime to buy this item at $59.99
reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Better Than Competitors', 'author': 'Matthew Johnson', 'rating': 5, 'content': "Without naming any names (cough cough rhymes with BetWibro), we had purchased a couple of their automatic feeders (not WiFi enabled), one for our first cat, then about a year and a half later we bought the second. Cue the third cat and we tried a different brand. That one kept time a little better, but we were still struggling with clocks that would never be synchronized and it was a chore to always update 3 feeders every few days just to ensure the cats were fed at their respective stations at the same time and no one had an opportunity to eat theirs and steal another's in the time it took for food to be dispensed.I had my eye on this, as it's WiFi enabled, and we already have the automatic litter box, so we were familiar with the brand. If I end up buying another automatic feeder (for both cats versus them just sharing this one), I will buy this brand and exact model again. Honestly one of my favorite Amazon purchases of all time.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States June 30, 2021', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Works as expected, so far (edit: mostly)', 'author': 'Christa N.', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'After reading the reviews, I think I was prepared for some kind of nightmare with this, but so far I\'ve been pleasantly suprised. The app isn\'t super sleek and displays my feeding history partially in Chinese, but it\'s not too confusing either, and the feeder quickly connected to my iPhone on a 2.4G network. Set up was really easy, 2-3 minutes, and mostly I just use the "extra feeding" button, although the recommended meal plan seemed appropriate if all my cat ate was dry food, and was easy to edit. So pretty good, still looks great, but not 100% reliable.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 29, 2022', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Sleek and modern design', 'author': 'Penny Lane', 'rating': 5, 'content': "â­â­â­â­â­The PETKIT Automatic WiFi Cat Feeder has been a lifesaver for me and my furry friend over the past year! Five stars all the way!", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 12, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Overall great!', 'author': 'Andy & Cora Ray', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought two of these feeders for our two cats to keep them on a consistent feeding schedule when we are out of the house or have left town. Our cats have even tried sticking their paws up into the chamber and have been unsuccessful in getting food out without a scheduled dispensation.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States April 3, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '1.0 out of 5 stars Frustrating as Hell', 'author': 'tomsvl', 'rating': 1, 'content': 'First, I am fairly literate with electronics. I usually feed her less as she gobbles and then throws it up, but I tried it.So I set up 4 feeds a day. This is tedious with scrolling wheels for times for each feeding. After that you are to hit "start plan". I get message "request incorrect". what\'s that mean? If you go back a page it erases your plan and you have to start over.Start over. Same thing. 4 times 16 entries. I guess I wasn\'t smart enough to just try one time! Finally I figured out it had lost internet connection. On the settings page it will show "online", why not have it on the home page??? Why not notify you lost connection??. The hopper was half full, but kept getting empty message till I turned that off.So now waiting for morning to check feeding. First time is 6:15. Times are military, so I know I\'m doing "am" morning. Get up at 5:30 and there is food in the bowl. Go to app and it dispensed 2 feedings already. 7 hours ahead of scedule which means it\'s on GMT. There is nowhere to set local time that I can find. Now waiting for the next feeding to see. 9am should be my 4pm feeding. Easy UPDATE: My 4pm feeding happened at 9am 7 hours ahead. Am I supposed to adjust my times to coincide to the time zone the app is using???All I needed was a timer to work 4 times a day to dispense food. Just like an analog lamp timer you pull the tabs for it to work. BTW there is a website for the 8 most common problems, Nice.This is going back today.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States September 13, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Set it & forget it', 'author': 'DIA', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'The media could not be loaded. This made everything so much easier!You donâ€™t have to measure anymore; just set the serving size in the app. This is so helpful when your pet is still small and cat eat a full can/scoop of food just yet. Just be sure to double check and measure it yourself as well. It gave my cat more that it was supposed to for 2/3 cup measurement and I had to break it down into multiple smaller portions to get it to be the right amount of foodDonâ€™t have to wake up super early; if I want to sleep in I donâ€™t have to worry about if the cat will starve. Just set up a dispense time in the app.Donâ€™t have to call your pet for food; it essentially Pavlovâ€™s them with a beep indicator when food is coming out. lol - daylight savings was hard to get through when he knows itâ€™s food time but didnâ€™t get a beep yet. I just ended up moving the time by an hour to match his instincts.The app is finicky sometimes. But it always alerts when itâ€™s time to refill or when to change the desiccant. Also alerts when youâ€™re away from home if the food was dispensed. You can even set reminders for other things like changing the litter box, changing the water filter, nail clipping time, etc.The cat likes it as a stepping stool to the window lol', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States January 6, 2024', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Good for the price', 'author': 'J. Town', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I bought this for a colony of about a dozen feral cats (all but a couple TNR\'d) that live in the woods near my house. I set them up some beds and a big food bowl in a shed but raccoons and possums were stealing the food. (And I was tired if going out in the rain to fill the bowl.) So I got this feeder and set it up in the shed. So far, this has held up well. The raccoons and possums can only steal 1/2 cup at a time. The raccoons get pretty aggressive when the bowl is empty but they haven\'t managed to get the lid off the new feeder. I\'ve seen them tossing it around on the security camera but the feeder\'s held up fine. I eventually attached it to the floor of the shed.I haven\'t set up a schedule because feral cats are terrible at telling time. If it\'s empty when I check the security camera, I hit "Extra feeding" on my phone and dump 1/2 cup in the bowl. It took the cats about 2 days to figure out that the noise means food. Sometimes I\'ll see 3 or 4 of them sitting in a semi-circle around the bowl waiting for me to hit the button.I\'ve run several brands of cat food thru it (whatever\'s on sale in bulk) and it\'s pretty consistent with the portion despite the different sizes and shapes of the kibble. I\'ve never had it get stuck with food left in the hopper. It gets down to the last few pieces every time.It would be nice if it was easier to clean. You have to take out 4 screws to take the dispenser chamber off and really get in there with a brush to get the rotating part clean. If the chamber was a twist-lock and the rotating part came out easily, it\'d be much better.My only other real complaint is the AAA batteries. They should be AA. There\'s plenty of room, they hold twice the energy, and most stores charge the same amount for AAA and AA. There\'s really no reason for the small batteries.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States October 4, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Feeder dispenses only an APPROXIMATE amount of the portion of food you select', 'author': 'SoCalMissy', 'rating': 3, 'content': "I wish I had seen JESSICAâ€™S review from one of PETKITS other feeders prior to my purchase of the ELEMENT SOLO. Iâ€™ve spent an incredible amount of time researching Cat Feeders ever since 2020 when PetNet (feeders) went out of business. They were the best in the industry, hands-down! and now Iâ€™m stuck with TWO of their $150 paper weights, essentially. Iâ€™ve searched far and wide for replacements. So on Amazon Prime Day, July 12, I pulled the trigger on a deal for this ELEMENT SOLO feeder. Iâ€™ll be returning it promptly before my 30 day money-back guarantee runs out.1st - the amount of information that you MUST input just to set up a feeding schedule is by far very un necessary. You have to create a profile for your animal, you have to enter their height, their weight, their age their type, then you need to input their food brand, THEN verify if it fits in the feeder, and THEN enter the ingredients and what %percentage of moisture and ash etc. etc. None of that is necessary when youâ€™re using a measurement you already know and what type or amount of food youâ€™re going to dispense. You just want to set up a schedule to have it done. BTW the plug is quite large, so I youâ€™ll waste the space beside it, and above it, which is very unfortunate.2nd -my cat is on a strict food diet. His dry food portion of his diet he receives 1/4 (ONE QUARTER) cup of dry kibble (IAMS) TWICE a day to totaling 1/2 (ONE HALF) cup of food per day.By the third day, this feeder gave me issues, dispensing the incorrect amount of food. Sometimes it dispensed 16 kibbles. Sometimes it gave 48 kibbles. Sometimes it gave 62 kibbles. None of those equaled 1/4 cup as I tested it out for EACH of their dispensing measurements PRIOR to using it. The closest I could get to 1/4 cup of their measurements was 3/10 so I used that and set up a feeding plan per their requirements to automatically feed two times a day every 12 hours using the 3/10 dispensed amount. They use FIFTHS (1/5) measurements so itâ€™s a little confusing trying to find what worked for 1/4 cup dispensing amounts. Then within that problem lies another one thatâ€™s even bigger. After posting a question about an accurate amounts, dispensed, and then reaching out to their support team, I found an answer. This feeder will only feed an APPROXIMATE amount of their dispensed portion (of 3/10 cup). Let that soak in for a minute. Give it a second. Really let it soak in.Now, let me give you a scenario. â€¦ Dr tells you, based on your weight, height and the food intake you can eat (lets use RICE) 1 cup of Rice per meal for a total of 3 cups rice per day. Ok Doc, great. I can do that.So, on your first meal, I hand you â€¦ oh, letâ€™s say maybe 2/3 cup, and on your second meal, I hand you letâ€™s say maybe 3/4, on your third meal, I hand you oh maybe 7/8th. Youâ€™re an adult, a senior even, so you â€œunderstandâ€ what youâ€™re allowed to have per meal and your rice is right there, in that square thing that makes a noise and gives you your rice but itâ€™s not giving you what youâ€™re allowed to have each meal. Would you be happy? Or full? or satisfied? Or always thinking about food and how to get it out of that thing. Because if itâ€™s edible (& sometimes even if itâ€™s not edible) youâ€™ll attempt to get it and eat it. Because all you do is EAT, SLEEP, POOP/PEE, PLAY & PURRTo finish, I would like to quote the review of another Amazon verified purchase user, Jessica (3 years ago! man I SHOULDâ€™VE dug deeper)â€œ Jessica4.0 out of 5 starsVerified PurchaseBasic features work well, unnecessarily complex app makes setup a painReviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020I think my title basically says it all, but I'm not really a brief person so here goes...On the whole, I'm very pleased with the quality of the build of this product, and the ease of filling and cleaning, which are really paramount concerns for something like this. Unboxing and putting everything together is easy, and so far the feeder has been reliable.That said, I think the app is a lot more complex than it needs to be, and while that can be updated and changed over time, it's important to know what you're getting into.When you go through setup of the feeder and app for the first time, I think the experience is a bit all over the place. There are instruction stickers on the feeder itself, there is a booklet of instructions, there are QR codes and links within the booklet to scan to get to videos that you have to watch for further steps, and then there's setup within the app itself... etc. I think it's just a few too many layers of info and could be pared down significantly. Once everything is setup and you're trying to actually use the app, those same issues of unnecessary layers/ complications continue. The app tries to get you to schedule meals based on feeding recommendations for your pet, so you have to setup a profile for each of your pets first. This sounds minor, but it's quite detailed, and includes a whole lot of information that isn't truly necessary just to make a recommendation for feeding quantity. In the end, a truly informed recommendation would really require nutrition information about your pet food itself, so the whole exercise is a bit silly. I was left feeling a bit unsure of how much of this information I *really* needed or wanted to complete. Once you have been asked about various details for your pet, then you need to schedule fixed meals for each, and again I do appreciate that they tried to include a lot of options for customization, but it's just too much. For one, how do they propose that you make sure the right pet eats the right meal, etc? I think it would be much easier to remove those options, or hide them behind an advanced mode, and just let you set a very simple schedule with set times and quantities. K.I.S.S. you know? Given that the app doesn't interface with bluetooth trackers or smart catboxes or anything like that, I'm not sure I see any need for the pet profiles at all! It just adds complexity for no discernible reason.Beyond the actual cumbersome data entry requirements, I found the interface to be not very intuitive. I had difficulty finding the settings that I actually wanted to look for and find out more about, such as the Alexa integration, and kept getting lost in layers of social media integrations and gamification... which, why? I was looking into trying out the Smart Home integration options, but do I need a community and messaging platform for my smart feeder? Maybe this is more of a cultural thing, I believe the company is based in China, but I just don't need this kind of fluff cluttering up the basic functions of the app. I'd really enjoy it more if they could pull back on these added features, or again, maybe just hide them all in one area of the app called 'Social' or similar, but they seemed to be behind every corner. For me, again it just took away from the experience of feeling like I could find the basic information and functions quickly and easily. Thankfully, apps can be can be improved and refined over time, so I feel that most of those concerns are somewhat secondary. If you plan to use it in a way where you can sit down and get through it, then basically 'set it and forget it', I think it will work well for you. But if you would plan to regularly make any tweaks to your meal plans, I think it would be a not-minor annoyance. I'll also mention that this is something my partner and I considered setting up for aging parents, just as a little convenience item to make their lives easier. After working with it, I don't know if I can comfortably go that direction. I definitely don't feel confident that they would have gotten through any of the initial setup themselves, but I also don't think they could make any on-the-fly changes to the configuration even if the initial steps were done for them. My advice to the developers would be: pare down to the basics and make sure they are quick and intuitive. THEN add extras, but remember they are extras and not your primary functions.Ok, so it seems like I'm coming down kind of harsh. All that said, I do think this product will work just fine for use in my own home. The feeder itself is sturdy and has so far been reliable. While I don't have direct experience with a lot of competing products, I had been taking note of some other design issues I'd noted in some of those competitors and waited to try something that seemed to address them. For one, I don't just appreciate the option for plug-in power and battery backup, for me that's an absolute requirement on something like this. The food storage compartment also seems secure, which was a concern I had because I have one cat that will get into ANYTHING edible that is left out. I'm impressed because he hasn't even tried with this, which also tells me the seals are probably decent and he's not being tempted by the smell of kibble. That also leads me to believe that bugs shouldn't be an issue, though time will tell. I also appreciate that the actual food bowl portion is easily removable, as it just snaps into place with a magnet. Being plastic based, it's important to clean something like that regularly and you and I both know that won't happen if it's a pain point. Ideally, I would really like to see this component and the food storage bin being made out of stainless steel, but maybe that's something that could be incorporated in a future revision as well.Let's wrap this up...On the whole, if you are patient and technologically competent enough to get through the configuration of the app itself, it's a good product that I think you'll be happy with.9 people found this helpfulâ€â€ â€¦â€", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States August 8, 2023', 'is_verified': True}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Must use your cellphone.', 'author': 'Connie M. Bush', 'rating': 4, 'content': "Just got the feeder; recommended by the vet; not much information in manual, just how to put together. That wasn't difficult. Still having problems making changes to the feeding schedule. The cat now gets breakfast 2 times one at 5:30 am and one at 6:30 am. Couldn't figure out how to delete one of them. Feeding the cat 5 times a day, 1/10 of a cup at a time for a total of 1/2 cup a day. What the vet recommended (not necessarily 5 times). If cat eats 1/4 cup 2 times a day, he is back before supper time. This helps a lot. I ignore the cat and I am trying to each a cat that I will not feed him, he must wait for the feeder. Ask me in a couple of weeks.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': True}]

reviews: [{'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty and easy', 'author': 'Amazon Customer', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'I like the simple look of it, and it was easy to put together even without directions. The bowls are wide and shallow which is a nice plus. My messy boy isnâ€™t so messy with these either, which is amazing. We both love them.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 4, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice looking, good materials', 'author': 'B Jones', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a set of two elevated cat bowls from Petmolico. They arrive needing assembly, which is just a matter of attaching the legs with a total of four screws per unit. The bowl holder part is lightweight attractive wood that seems durable. The legs are sturdy black metal. The stainless steel bowls are of good quality and typical of other stainless cat bowls. Also included are adhesive felt pads if you need them for the bottoms of the legs, which is a nice touch. However, I do wish it came with one of those little "L" shaped screwdrivers, because I don\'t actually have a screwdriver short enough to access where the legs attach and have the screws go in straight. The screws are quite short, and I wasn\'t able to keep them straight because I needed a much shorter screwdriver, so they are crooked and I\'m hoping they\'re in far enough. The only other thing is if you place the bowl down for your cat with the legs straight, one of the pointy parts of the bowl holder is facing the cat. I have put it on my cat\'s placemat at an angle so she is facing one of the flat sides. This isn\'t a big deal at all, it\'s just a function of the hexagon shape of the bowl holder, but just something to be aware of. All in all, this seems well made and sturdy, as long as the screws are in far enough. Time will tell, but I wouldn\'t have had to worry about it if a little screwdriver had been included.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 23, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Nice set', 'author': 'Renee', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'This is a nice feeding dish set. Super easy to assemble. 8 screws and your are done. Comes with little padding stickers for the bottom so no scratching of floors or sliding. The dishes are a little shallow but will work for my needs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '2.0 out of 5 stars Too Tippy', 'author': 'Amy Russ', 'rating': 2, 'content': 'This bowl looks good, but it is way too easy to tip over. My kitten likes to knock the water out of his dish (fun new game!), so I got this bowl thinking it would be better. Definitely not. It rocks forward and back with barely any effort.In addition, you do need to attach the legs when the bowl arrives. There is no included screwdriver, so you will need either a very short or very long on to get the tiny screws installed inside the little square legs.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 1, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '3.0 out of 5 stars Helpful but a bit Flimsy', 'author': 'D. A. Lindsey', 'rating': 3, 'content': "We got this Petmolico brand Raised Cat Bowl 2 pack to help alleviate some digestive issues with our senior cat.The legs and wooden holder are sturdy and well-made. Assembly is pretty straightforward though it can be a challenge to get the tiny screws in without a right angle screwdriver.There are adhesive-backed felt pads to put on the bottom of the legs to help prevent it from sliding, but I feel that rubber ones would have been better. It's a minor complaint but that along with the difficult screw placement caused me to deduct one star.The bowls, however, are where this product falls short. They are thin, VERY thin. They have some small dings in them just from packing and shipping, so I can't imagine they'll survive for a very long time. Deducted one star for the flimsy bowls.PROS:- helps pets eat and digest their food more easily- wood frame and metal legs are solid and strongCONS:- difficult screw installation- very lightweight/flimsy bowls- a little expensive (currently $20) given how thin the bowls areRecommended if you can get them for a lower price.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Decent Set of Pet Bowls', 'author': 'Micheala', 'rating': 4, 'content': "These bowls are ok. Not the worst set of bowls I've ever had, but certainly not the best either. You do have to assemble the legs to the part that holds the bowls. Usually these type of items include an allen wrench or something to aid in the assembly. You will need a very small Phillips head screwdriver.. The size that is suitable for a watch to assemble this product, so keep that in mind. Both bowls are pretty stable with one being more stable than the other. One bowl has a slight wobble to it despite it being put together perfectly. My other issue is that for a smaller cat, they might have a hard time getting to the bottom of the bowl. They are raised slightly higher than my other elevated pet bowls. They would work great for a small dog as well. Overall they are an okay value.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly What I Needed!', 'author': 'A.V.', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'These bowls are awesome. They are aesthetically pleasing in my house and if you have more than one pet, you can configure multiple bowls into cool configurations! They are the perfect height for my smaller dog. Definitely an upgrade from what we had before - highly recommended!', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 24, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect little bowl', 'author': 'Reid Holbert', 'rating': 5, 'content': "This was very easy to assemble and it's definitely tough enough for use by a cat. Looks great too and has the perfect height for my housecat to eat comfortably. The metal bowl cleans up super quick.", 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 26, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Small but Good', 'author': 'Kindle Customer', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These were smaller than I expected, but my cats love them. The legs are squares of metal, about 3" square. One side of each square has 2 holes for screws, to be attached to the wooden piece. They legs were kind of hard to attach. My shortest screw driver was small enough to fit inside the 3" square, but it was too small to get a good grip. I ended up using a larger screw driver and turned the screws at an angle. The screws ended up slightly crooked, but stable. The stands are level, not wobbly. If you have a good screw driver for small spaces, you shouldn\'t have any trouble with these.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 5, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Nice height and good looking bowls', 'author': 'Maryland Amazoner', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'These cat bowls are nice looking, with their hexagon-shaped wood frames and shiny stainless steel bowls. I also like that they are just the right height for typical cats. Upon arrival, they required minor assembly, by attaching each leg with 2 screws. Because the screws are so tiny, I dropped them a couple of times before getting them in place. Regardless, the legs attached quickly. I thought these bowls might work well for 2 cats because they can be placed any distance apart. In my case though, one of the cats is so enthusiastic about food that she sometimes tips these bowls over. So, we are using these bowls for water, and for that they have been fine.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 29, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]

For the price, though, itâ€™s pretty decent.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States February 27, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '5.0 out of 5 stars REALLY CUTE CAT FOOD BOWL â€“ RAISED FOR EASIER EATING â€“ CAT TESTED CAT APPROVED', 'author': 'Thomas', 'rating': 5, 'content': 'We have always had cats around the house and love cat-oriented products. This high, wide bowl received instant approval, not only by my wife and myself but by our very old cat. Our cats normally eat from small, LOW-sided, stainless-steel bowls. But our very old cat has demonstrated some trouble bending her head down recently â€“ age. We put her normal food in the new cat bowl, set it on the floor and she immediately started eating out of it â€“ no hesitation. The wide bowl also helps relieve whisker fatigue, which can cause stress over time. A catâ€™s whiskers are very sensitive and can be over-stimulated from the sides of bowls and it can affect their nervous system. This wide cat bowl solves that problem. A bonus is that the cat bowl is dishwasher and microwave safe. Cats prefer room temperature food, so being able to nuke refrigerated food for few seconds is handy. I am pleased with this order.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 8, 2024', 'is_verified': False}, {'title': '4.0 out of 5 stars Cute, I wish it was a set', 'author': 'Late Adopter', 'rating': 4, 'content': 'This is a cute bowl for cat food, and I like the bright yellow, anime character sort of style. I think it is shallow enough for most cats to avoid whisker stress, but perhaps not all. I always hand wash pet bowls, and feel like the hollow base would collect a ton of water if put in the dishwasher. If this is your style, I do recommend it as itâ€™s unique, but thereâ€™s a wide assortment to choose from out in the world that have matching styles for both food and water.', 'timestamp': 'Reviewed in the United States March 3, 2024', 'is_verified': False}]
